response: Preheat oven to 350f. Combine flour, sugar and salt. Cut in butter with a pastry blender until crumbly. Add egg and mix with fork until dough forms. Press dough into bottom of 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and pour in coffee granules. Stir until mixed well and spread evenly over crust. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake for 20 minutes longer or until top is set and crust is lightly browned. Cool completely before cutting into 1 1/2 inch bars. Dust with powdered sugar and drizzle with milk.

Cook sausage in skillet until browned. Remove with slotted spoon& drain. In same skillet, saute celery& onion in drippings until tender. Add bread cubes and mix well. Add sausage mixture and mushroom stems and cook for 2 minutes longer. Add chicken broth and mix well. Spread in a shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered at 400f for about 45 minutes until lightly browned. Yields 6 servings.

Mix bread cubes, turkey, cheese and onion. Add eggs, milk, salt, pepper and poultry seasoning. Mix well. Bake in a ring mold at 325 for about an hour or until done. Turn out onto a serving plate. Serve immediately.
Cook pasta according to directions. In a separate bowl, combine broccoli with remaining ingredients and let marinate while pasta cooks. Drain pasta and toss with broccoli mixture. Serve hot.

Boil water in a large saucepan. Add the macaroni. Cook according to the manufacturers directions. Drain the macaroni and place in a bowl. Stir in the vegan mayonnaise and nutritional yeast. Add the non-dairy milk substitute. Stir until completely blended. Salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for about 20 minutes.

Brown the sausages and drain. Set aside. Sauté the onion and bacon until bacon is crisp. Stir in soup mix and water until smooth. Add vegetables and simmer until cooked. Add sausages and parsley. Bake uncovered in a 2 quart casserole at 350 for 30 minutes until heated through.

Cut 4 slices of white bread into 1-inch squares. Spread each square with 1 tablespoon of crunchy peanut butterplace a grape jelly-dipped goldfish cracker in the center of each piece of bread. Press a square of whole wheat bread on top of each piece of peanut butter-covered bread. In a heavy skillet or a deep-fryer set at 350 degrees F., fry 6 or 7 pieces of the checkerboard sandwich at a time until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 18 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large shallow bowl combine flour, sugar and soy sauce. Add chicken halves to flour mixturetoss to coat. Arrange half of the chicken in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 of pineapple and 1/2 of parsley. Top with remaining chickensprinkle with remaining pineapple and parsley. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. In a 2-quart saucepan combine water and rice. Bring to a boilcover tightly. Reduce heat to lowcook for 15 minutes. Remove from heatlet stand, covered for 10 minutes. Fluff with fork. Serve chicken and rice mixture together. Sprinkle with parsley sprig.

In large bowl combine butter and sugars. Beat until well blended. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until light and creamy. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture. Beat until well blended. Add water, chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes or until lightly golden.

In a blender, combine white sugar, lime and maraschino cherries. Pulse until smooth. In another blender jar combine grapefruit juice and vodka. Add contents from first blender jar to second blender jar. Blend until slushy and pour into prepared glasses. Top each glass with 1/4 inch grapefruit slice and lime wedge.

Combine first five ingredients and bring to boil. Boil gently for 2 minutes and remove from heat. Add orange slices and lemon slices. Let stand for about an hour or until cool. Add allspice and cinnamon and serve hot or cold. Makes about six servings.
Separate eggs. Beat eggs. Add milk. Add cheese. Beat until well blended. Cook over medium-low heat. Stir often. Add onions & jalapenos. Cook until done. Add salt & pepper to taste.
Puree strawberries. Add ginger ale and milk. Bring to boil and cook for 5 minutes. Add sugar, lemon juice and vanilla extract. Chill and serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place salmon fillets on a greased baking pan. Brush with orange juice and sprinkle with hoisin sauce and honeybake until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 12 minutes. Serve immediately.

Place chicken breasts on skewer. In a small bowl mix together the remaining ingredients, adding enough oil to make a smooth paste-like mixture. Brush both sides of the chicken breasts with the pesto mixture. Grill over medium heat turning occasionally until the chicken breasts are cooked through. Remove from heat and serve warm.

Preheat grill to high. Lightly oil grates. Combine first 4 ingredients in small bowlmix well. Divide vegetables evenly among 4 skewers. Place skewers on grill rack coated with cooking spray, and brush with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Grill vegetable skewers, turning often and brushing often with blue cheese butter mixture, 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with basil before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut pork loin into 1-inch strips. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 2 teaspoons oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Add strips and cook until browned on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside. Place remaining butter and oil in another skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Place meat and onions on baking sheet. Drizzle with butter mixture. Bake until cooked through, about 30 minutes.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Pour into the unbaked pie shell. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray 9x13 pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar together until smooth. Add the vanilla and mix well. Add the flour and mix just until it comes together. Press half of the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan and set aside. In a medium bowl, stir together the graham cracker crumbs, mini marshmallows and nuts. Spread this over the dough in the pan and top it with the remaining dough. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes and then cut into squares. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. In a large bowl combine the oats, almonds, wheat germ, and salt. In a saucepan over low heat combine the honey, cinnamon and nutmeg. Cook until smooth and remove from heat. Add the vanilla and stir to combine. Pour the mixture over the dry ingredients and stir until evenly combined. Spread the mixture on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, stirring once every 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir in the craisins and raisins. Let cool on the baking sheet and then break into chunks. Store in an airtight container.

Peel and section the oranges. Place the sugar in a small saucepan and stir over low heat until it is completely melted and has a syrupy consistency. Place the oranges and vanilla bean in a large bowl. Pour in the sugar syrup and stir to coat evenly. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for about an hour. Pour the oranges and syrup into a large nonreactive bowl. Add the liqueur and brandy and stir well to combine. Serve immediately or chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Makes about 4 cups.
name: mandarin orange dessertingredients: orange gelatin, boiling water, mandarin orange, orange sherbetpreparation:Dissolve the orange jell-o gelatin powder in the 2 cups of boiling water. Stir in orange sections with the juice. Add the sherbet icecream by spoonfuls. Stir until melted. Pour into serving size dessert cups. Chill well.
name: orange spiced mexican chocolateingredients: milk, water,

Beat together margarine and sugar until light and creamy. Add eggs and vanillabeat until well blended. Combine cocoa and flouradd to margarine mixture. Mix until smooth and add nuts and mini chip. Pour into greased 9x13 pan and bake at 350 for 35-45 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

Mix together butter and sugar. Add egg substitute and pineapple, mix well. Add in flours, soda, and salt, blend together. Add vanilla. Pour into greased & floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9x13x2-inch baking pan with foil. Butter the foil. Combine the butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until combined. Add the cocoa powder and salt. Beat until blended. Beat in the vanilla. Beat in the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Add the baking powder and beat until combined. Add the flour and beat just until blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Bake 25-30 minutes, or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached. Cool the brownies in the pan on a wire rack. To remove the brownies from the pan, lift the foil and transfer the brownies to a cutting board. Cut the brownies into squares. Serve warm. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. Or, store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Combine sugar, vinegar, and miracle whip. Add cheddar cheese. Add in bacon, cut in small pieces. Mix together. Add in onions, cut up. Add in broccoli florets. Mix together all ingredients. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.
Pour Bacardi Limon, lemonade concentrate, lime juice, and lime wedges into a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve over ice. Garnish with lime wedges and a sprig of mint.
Place berries in a shallow dish. Combine jelly, port wine, and rind. Spread over berries. Coverrefrigerate. Serve chilled.

Cut the mangoes in half. Scoop out the flesh with a spoon. Discard the seeds. Mix together the mango flesh, orange juice, lime juice and club soda in a pitcher. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses. Garnish with a slice of orange.

In large bowl, combine cereal and sunflower seeds. In small saucepan, combine condensed milk and honey. Stir until honey is dissolved. Pour over cereal mixture and stir until all dry ingredients are coated. Stir in remaining ingredients. Spread on wax paper. Refrigerate. Store in air-tight container. Yield: about 12 cups. Makes 24 servings.

Mix yellow cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt in bowl. Add eggs and mix well. Add onion and jalapeno pepper and mix well. Stir in beer until batter is smooth and free of lumps. Fill cupcake wrappers 3/4 full and place on cookie sheet or large plate. Chill for at least one hour. Heat oil in deep pan until hot and then place small amount of batter in hot oil (use slotted spoon). Fry until golden brown (3-5 minutes) and then remove and place on paper towel to absorb oil. Serve immediately or at room temperature with dipping sauce or ketchup.

Place challah in the bottom of an 8x8x8 pan. Spread brie over the bottom slice of challah and place the next slice over it. Continue with the other slices, placing brie in between the layers and sprinkling basil in between each layer. Add the final slice and sprinkle with basil. Pour melted butter over the top and bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until the brie is melted and bubbling.

In a large bowl, combine the vinegar and the olive oil. Add the lemon juice and the rosemary. Add the lamb chops and coat with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to three hours, turning the chops occasionally. Preheat the broiler. Arrange the chops on a broiling pan. Broil for about four minutes on each side for medium rare. Yield:4 servings

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss zucchini with salt. Put zucchini pieces into a baking dish and bake until tender and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Toast the garlic cloves by placing them cut side down on a baking sheet. Broil until lightly browned. Combine broth, lime juice, garlic, pepper, oregano and parsley together. Toss zucchini with broth mixture.

Combine sugar, olive oil and mayonnaise in small bowl. Add stone ground and prepared mustards and mix thoroughly. Stir in garlic powder and dill weed. Serve with fresh or toasted pretzels. Great for a party snack.

Cut the pears in half and remove the seeds. Wrap a half of a pear in a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Place the wrapped pears on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for about 15 minutes or until the bacon is crisp. Remove the pears from the oven and set aside to cool. To make the salad dressing, combine all the salad dressing ingredients in a small bowl. Toss the salad greens with the salad dressing. Arrange the salad greens on a serving plate or bowl. Crumble the bacon and scatter it over the salad greens along with the pears and pecans. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine bread cubes, cheeses, bacon & milk. Let soak for about 3 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a greased baking dish, spread bread mixture evenly. Beat together the eggs & seasonings & pour over the bread mixture. Bake for about 45 to 55 minutes or till firm. Serve hot or cold.

Season the fish fillets with lemon rind. Melt the butter in a pan and place the fish fillets in the pan. Brown on both sides. Add the green peppercorn and the lemon juice. Simmer the fish fillets and the green peppercorn until the fish is cooked. Add the scallops and cook until the scallops are cooked. Add the lemon rind and salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium size mixing bowl combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream together butter, sugars and egg yolks until light and fluffy. Mix in the vanilla. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Stir just until combined. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 30 minutes or more. In the meantime, line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on the baking sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are light golden. Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes then transfer to wire racks. Sprinkle with additional chocolate chips if desired.

Beat cream cheese and sugar with electric mixer until well blended. Add frozen dessert toppingbeat until smooth. Spread in crust. Top with cherry pie filling. Cover and chill 2 hours or until set.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add orzo pasta. Cook according to package directions, or until pasta is tender but firm, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta and return to pan. Combine butter, bouillon powder, garlic powder, onion powder, rice, lemon juice, and warm water in a large bowl until smooth. Stir mixture into pasta, tossing well. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine cabbage, carrot, onion, mayonnaise, vinegar, and pepper. Combine well. Spread evenly in a 9×13 baking dish. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar with cayenne and black pepper. Spread evenly over slaw. Refrigerate 2-3 hours.

Combine brown sugar, soy sauce, mirin, sesame oil, garlic cloves in a small bowl or measuring cup. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice potatoes thinly. In a small saucepan bring glaze to a boil. Add the sliced potatoes to the saucepan and boil for 30 seconds or until they begin to get tender. Remove from heat. Spray a shallow dish with cooking spray. Pour the glazed potatoes onto the dish. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and nori. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes until the potatoes are cooked through. Serve warm or at room temperature

Place a 12-inch nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil and swirl to coat. Add the cherry tomatoes, season generously with salt and pepper. Cook until the tomatoes begin to burst, 5 to 6 minutes. Add the clams. Cook until they begin to open, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Add 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan. Add the garlic cloves and cook until lightly browned, 1 minute. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of wine. Stir well. Return the clams to pan. Add lemon juice. Cook until the clams are just opene, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve with french bread.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a shallow dish. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dip chicken pieces into flour mixtureshake off excess. Fry 5 to 6 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place raisins in a small bowl. Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a saucepan over medium heatstir in raisins and cook 1 minute. Drain the raisins, reserving the liquidset aside for later use. Slice pears lengthwise into quartersdiscard cores and seeds. Place the cut sides of the pears in the bottom of a greased shallow 1-quart baking dish. Pour the raisins over the pearssprinkle with the reserved raisin liquid, maple syrup, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Dot with the butter. Bake in the preheated oven until the pears are tender, about 1 hour. Drizzle with the reserved raisin liquid if desired before serving.

Peel and cut the carrots into 1/4 inch slices. Heat the olive oil in a large pan. Add the carrot slices. Cook for 5-7 minutes over medium heat until tender. Remove from the heat and set aside. Mash the cooked carrots. Add the cooking liquid and the remaining ingredients. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut biscuit into wedges. Place in an ungreased baking dish. Combine cream cheese and sugar in a small bowl. Beat in egg and flour. Stir in cinnamon and pour over biscuits. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Peel the potatoes and slice them in half. Place 1/2 inch deep in a greased casserole dish. Layer with 1/2 the onion and the taco seasoning. Top with the remaining potatoes. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with remaining onion. Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 40 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with mexican blend cheese and return to the oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Combine dry ingredients in a bowl and add water slowly. Heat in microwave 1 minute or until ready. Serve with cinnamon cereal.
I have been making this for breakfast for about 10 years now and we still love it! My kids beg for it every morning.
I used the food processor method for this recipe - very easy! It was delicious!
These were pretty good but they could have been more moist. I had a little trouble getting the peanut butter into the oats, but I'm sure there's a better way than what I did.
My daughter loves these! I have made them numerous times with various additions (chocolate chips, nuts, etc.).
These cookies were a little dry for my tastes but are fairly easy to make.
I used vanilla instead of cinnamon & walnuts instead of pecans. They were delicious!

In large skillet over medium heat, heat oil and add onions. Saut onions until softened then add turkey. Cook turkey until almost done then add remaining ingredients. Cook until turkey is done then serve with cheese and/or sour cream.

Wash and dry potatoes and pierce several times with fork. Cook potatoes in large saucepan of boiling water 10 minutes or until tenderdrain. Meanwhile melt butter in small saucepan over medium heatadd flour and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add milk and bring to a boilcook 1 minute or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add sour cream and seasoning. In large mixing bowl, toss together potatoes and saucemix well. Spoon into shallow 2 quart baking dishtop with chives and sprinkle with cheddar cheese and cornflake crumbs. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large saucepan over medium heat bring 5 cups of water to a boil. Add lentils and bay leaves. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until lentils are tender but not mushy, about 25 minutes. Drain lentils but reserve the cooking liquid. Set aside lentils for 10 minutes. Discard bay leaves. Stir lentils into 1/4 cup of cooking liquid in a large bowl. Stir in remaining cooking liquid by teaspoonfuls until lentils are moist but not soupy. Stir in oranges, onion, and 3 tablespoons of olive oil. Season with black pepper and let stand for 10 minutes. Add parsleytoss gently. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Grease 9x13 inch pan. Mix together 1 cup flour, 1/4 tsp. Baking powder, 1/2 tsp. Salt. Set aside. Cream together 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup white sugar. Beat in 2 eggs. Add in 1 tsp. Vanilla. Sift together 3 cups flour, 1 tsp. Baking powder, 1/4 tsp. Salt. Mix in 1/2 cup chopped walnuts. Mix together 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1/4 cup peanut butter. Spread evenly over batter in pan. Bake at 350 for 25 - 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk with the sour cream until smooth. Add 1 cup of the shredded cheese, the enchilada sauce, onion powder, cumin, and garlic powder. Combine all of the ingredients. Let the mixture sit while you assemble the enchiladas. Spray a 9×13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spoon 2 tablespoons of enchilada sauce on each tortilla. Sprinkle each tortilla with a little of the shredded cheese. Roll up tightly. Place the enchiladas in the baking dish. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over them. Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven until bubbly. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut a large piece of heavy duty foil. Spread the hamburger evenly over the foil. Sprinkle with the soup mix. Place the potatoes and carrots around the edges of the hamburger. Drizzle with the oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Fold the sides of the foil over the hamburger. Fold the top and bottom of the foil over. You are done. Bake for about an hour. When you are ready to serve, open the foil. Let the family add the condiments of their choice.

Place bacon in a skilletcook and crumble. Add onions and cook until onions are wilteddrain on paper towel. In a large mixing bowl beat the eggsadd creamseasoning saltcheddar cheeseonionbacon and green onions. Pour into a greased 13 x 9" pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve with toast.

Combine margarine and sugar. Add eggs and cocoa. Mix well. Add flour and mix until smooth. Fold in white chocolate chips. Spread in greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool. Melt white chocolate chips. Drizzle over top. Cool. Cut in squares.
Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain. In a skillet combine potatoes, beans, pesto sauce and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add pasta. Toss. Garnish with chopped parsley.

In a large bowl, combine elbow macaroni and egg. Add flour and salt. Stir in enough milk to make a stiff dough. Divide the dough in half. Place one piece on a lightly floured surface. Roll the dough into a 12-inch circle. Cut into eight 4-inch squares. Place 2 tablespoons shredded cheddar cheese in each square. Fold dough over to form a triangle and pinch edges closed. Place on a baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough and cheese. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Brown ground beef in large pot. Add onion, carrots, potatoes. Cook until tender. Add corn. Add water. Add bouillon. Cook for 20 minutes. Add tomato paste. Add garlic. Cook 10 more minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Soak beans overnight in bowl of cold water. Drain well and rinse with fresh cold water. Put in crock pot. Add in diced onion, garlic, and chili powder. Add enough boiling water to cover beans by 1 inch. Add a bit of salt. Cook for about 5 hours on low. About 2 hours before you eat, add tvp and cumin. When ready to serve, add more salt, if desired. Serve over rice with green onion, if desired. Serves 8-10.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain pasta. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil. Add onion and cook until softened. Add bacon. Cook until crispy. Remove bacon from pan. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add frozen peas. Add pasta to pan. Add ricotta, cream, parmesan cheese, and bacon. Serve with parsley.

Peal potatoes and parsnips, slice them thinly and cook in boiling water for about 15-20 minutes until soft. Drain the potatoes and parsnips when done and add them back into the pot along with the chicken thighs. Add 1/3 cup of the vegetable broth, the onion and a pinch of thyme. Place this mixture into a casserole dish or saucepan. Preheat the broiler (grill) on high. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard, honey and a small amount of broth until you have a thick creamy sauce. Spoon this over the chicken and potatoes. Sprinkle with the remaining thyme and parsley. Place under the broiler for about 2-3 minutes until bubbling hot and lightly golden brown on top. Serve immediately.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens to soft ball stage (240f-250f) on candy thermometer. Remove from heatstir in oats and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax papercool completely.

I have been making these oatmeal cookies for years now. They are easy to make and are a very good cookie for a diabetic to eat because they have no white sugar in them. They are also great for a dieter. They are not high in calories like many other cookies are. They are a good size cookie and are not crunchy like some cookies are. They are a good cookie to have with coffee in the morning or afternoon. I like to sprinkle them with a little cinnamon instead of using the

Combine all ingredients except the grenadine and ice cubes in a large punch bowl or pitcher. Chill thoroughly before serving. Add ice and grenadine to bowl. Garnish each glass with a cherry and slice of orange or lemon.
name: tuna surpriseingredients: canned tuna, mayonnaise, sour cream, green onionpreparation:Combine all ingredients except the green onion. Chill for a few hours. Garnish with the green onion.
name: zesty potato saladingredients: red potato cubes, dill relish, diced carrot, diced green onion, mayonnaisepreparation:In a small bowl combine the relish and dill weed. In a large bowl combine all remaining ingredients except the dill relish and dill weed mixture. Stir the relish and dill weed mixture into the potato salad and serve at once.
name: strawberry pretzel saladingredients: jello, strawberries, pretzelspreparation:In

Cook carrots in boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. In the same pan, combine butter and brown sugar and heat until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in cider and stock. Add mustard and bring to a boil. Add carrots and cook for about 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens and the carrots are heated through. Sprinkle with the parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add mushrooms to the pan. Cook for 1 minute. Add salt, pepper, onion powder and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add 4 cups of water to the pan and bring to a boil. Add penne pasta to the pan. Cook for 8-10 minutes until pasta is tender. Drain the pasta from the pan. Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan with the penne pasta. Add the roasted red peppers and mix well. Serve with parmesan cheese.

In a 2 1/2 quart baking dish, place 1/4 of the sausage over the bottom of the dish. Top with 1/4 of the beef, 1/4 cup of the cheese, 1/4 of the onion and 1/4 of the garlic powder. Repeat layers once. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the beef is no longer pink and the cheese is melted. Stir well. Top with remaining 1/4 of the onion. Serve with rye rounds. Note : recipe can be made up to one day in advance

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Cut the eggplant into 1/4 inch slices, and lay on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes on each side, or until tender. Cut onion into 1/4 inch slices, and place on baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes on each side, or until tender. Wash tomatoes, then cut into quarters. Combine all vegetables in a large bowl. Sprinkle with chopped garlic, and stir to mix well.
Mix all ingredients together except nuts. Shape into balls and roll in mixed nuts. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Prepare beef as directed on packagedrain and set aside. Combine taco seasoning mix and water in medium bowlstir well. Add refried beans and 1/3 cup watermix well. Heat tortillas in microwave oven for 30 secondsplace 2 tortillas in each of 4 shallow bowls. Top each tortilla with 1/4 of the refried bean mixture and 1/3 of the cooked ground beefsprinkle each serving with 2 tablespoons of the cheese and 1 tablespoon of the taco sauce. Microwave on High 2 minutestop with 1/4 of the sour cream and 1 tablespoon of the onion.

Steam or boil the carrots and onions until tender crisp, cool slightly. Mash or chop well with the mayonnaise and seasonings. Beat the egg with the water and add to the mixture. Add the dry breadcrumbs and form into small balls and roll in the melted butter and then in the cheddar cheese. Place on a greased baking sheet and bake in a moderate oven 425 degrees F. or Gas Mark 7 until the cheese is golden brown about 25 minutes. Serve hot or cold with the mayonnaise or cream cheese as a sauce. Makes 48 pieces.

Melt butter in a medium sauce pan over medium heat. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Add in rice krispies and stir until all of the krispies are evenly coated with the cheese mixture. Remove from heat and pour into a large mixing bowl. Cool for a few minutes. Mix in the rice krispies and add a little more of the worcestershire sauce and tabasco sauce if you like a spicier cookie (the more of the sauces you add the spicier it gets). Drop by spoonful onto a greased cookie sheet and bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes or until just starting to brown around the edges and set. Cool on wire racks.

Cook and drain the angel hair. Slice the avocado into slices. In a skillet or saucepan heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and saute until golden brown. Add the avocado and saute until hot. Add the slices of tomato and cook until heated through. Remove from the heat. Add the cooked angel hair to the skillet and mix in the avocado mixture. Toss to coat and season to taste.

In a small bowl combine the butter, dijon, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Mix until smooth. Arrange the fish in an 11x7x2 inch baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the fish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine all the ingredients except for the frozen carrots in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Cook until it comes to a boil. Once it has boiled, reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until it has thickened about 5 minutes. Drain the frozen carrots and add them to the syrup. Mix thoroughly and refrigerate overnight. This can also be made the day before and then heated when you are ready to serve them.

Place potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water. Boil until tender. Meanwhile, heat a saucepan of boiling salted water for the peas. Add bay leaves to boiling water. Add peas. Cook 1 minute or until bright green. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add bay leaves. Add potatoes. Season with marjoram, thyme, and pepper. Cook over medium-low heat 2 minutes. Add peas. Cook 1 minute. Remove bay leaves. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Saute sausage until lightly browned. Remove from pan. In the same pan add the butter and flour. Stir until smooth. Add milk, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and sausage. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over omelets or french toast.

In a large bowl, cream together butter, sugar and egg until light and creamy. Stir in the dry ingredients just till blended. Fit a cookie press with the desired shape. Fill press with dough, press out onto an ungreased cookie sheet, space about one inch apart. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 8-10 minutes or until very lightly browned on the edges. Remove to cool on wire racks. Dip the bottoms of the cookies in the chocolate confectionary coating, and return to wire racks to set the chocolate. If desired, sprinkle the tops of the cookies with the nuts before the chocolate is set.

Boil the water in a large pot. Pour it into a large teapot, add the tea bag, cloves, cinnamon sticks and orange slices. Steep for 5 minutes. Remove the tea bags, cloves, cinnamon sticks and orange slices from the pot. Stir in the sugar. Heat the orange juice and lemon juice until the sugar dissolves completely. Stir in the Splenda sweetened cranberry juice. Stir in the orange slices. Serve hot or cold.

Peel potatoes and slice into thin rounds. In a bowl, combine butter, coarse salt and cajun seasoning. Place slices in a single layer in a greased baking pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees until crisp. Turn once or twice during cooking time. Cool in pan for at least one hour. Store in an airtight container.
It is a very good recipe but I did have to add some additional seasonings. I used about a teaspoon of garlic salt. It is very crispy but not burnt.
This is an excellent recipe. I have made it several times and it is delicious and healthy.
I LOVE this recipe!! I am a fan of potato chips and this is a great healthier alternative. I have made them several times and every time they are delicious. The first time I made them I didn't have enough seasoning so I added a little extra. I will definitely make this recipe again.
These were good. I'm not a huge fan of potato chips and didn't think I would like these but I

Cut the ends off the asparagus. Trim the woody ends off each spear. Cut into thirds and set aside in a large bowl. Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about a minute, stirring constantly. Add the bacon and cook until it is crisp. Add the Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and salt. Stir until the sugar has melted and the mixture is thickened. Pour the mixture over the asparagus and toss until the spears are coated. Serve immediately.

In the top of a double boiler, combine 1 cup of the sugar, the light corn syrup, milk and vanilla. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil over medium heat (about 5 minutes). In a small bowl, combine 1/3 cup of the sugar with the cocoa. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the remaining 1 cup sugar with the chocolate, butter and saltstir over medium heat until smooth (about 5 minutes). Add the remaining milk to the top of the double boilerstir until the mixture comes to a boil (about 1 minute). Pour the hot milk mixture over the chocolate mixturestir until smooth. Cool 5 minutes. Add the cocoa mixture to the bowlstir until the frosting is smooth. (Icing is slightly thick.) Cool completely before using. Reportedly this icing tastes best if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.
I love frosting. I am so glad that there is something that can make all the frosting I want to eat

Plump the raisins by soaking them in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the spinach and cook until just wilted. Stir in the drained raisins. Remove from heat and stir in the pine nuts. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Place ice cream in a blender along with the milk and coffee. Blend well. Pour into glasses, add chocolate syrup to taste, serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Place potatoes in a greased microwave-safe 1-quart casserole dish. Cover with foil. Microwave 8 minutes. In a small bowl, combine ham and soup until smooth. Add cheddar cheese. Stir. Pour over potatoes. Bake 12 minutes or until heated through.

In a mixing bowl combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar and salt. Stir in the baking powder. In a separate bowl combine the buttermilk, egg and butter. Stir the buttermilk mixture into the dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in the bacon bits and jalapenos. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Peel the eggplant, cut off the stem and slice in half lengthwise. Using a spoon, scoop out the pulp and seeds. Salt the flesh lightly. Dip the flesh in the beaten eggs and coat with the seasoned crumbs. Fry in hot oil. Drain and place on paper towels to absorb the excess oil. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese and serve.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until golden brown. Add crushed tomatoes and continue cooking until slightly thickened. Add sugar and season with salt and pepper. Stir in kalamata olives, basil and feta cheese. Serve over cooked pasta.

In a small saucepan, stir together the marmalade, soy sauce and garlic. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce the heat to low. Simmer the sauce until it thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 20 minutes. Place the fish in a shallow baking dish and season with the salt. Spread the marmalade mixture evenly on the fish. Bake uncovered until the fish flakes easily with a fork when tested in the thickest part (about 10 minutes for a 1 inch thick fish). Serve immediately or at room temperature with rice and steamed vegetables. Serves 4.

Remove sweetbreads from pan and place in a bowl. Set aside. Add bacon and cook for 4 minutes. Add flour and cook for 3 minutes. Add vinegar and water. Cook for 3 minutes. Add sweetbreads and cook for 3 minutes. Add butter and oil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut pork chops into 1-inch slices. In a small bowl, mix maple syrup, apple juice, and spices. Arrange acorn squash cubes in a baking dish. Top with pork slices. Pour apple juice mixture over the top. Bake covered for 40 minutes. Serve with cooking apple slices on the side.

Melt the butter in a 10-inch nonstick frying pan over low heat. Add the ham and stir for 1 minute. Add the peppers to the pan. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir in the eggs. Cook until the bottom is set. Increase the heat to medium-high. Continue cooking and stirring until the eggs are almost set. Sprinkle with the seasonings. Cook and stir until the eggs are set. Sprinkle with the cheese. Cook just until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Sift flour into a bowl. Add oats and mix. Add muscovado sugar, honey and salt. Add melted butter and beat together until you have a soft dough. Place in a lined baking tray. Bake for about 35-45 minutes until it starts to go brown on top. Take it out of the oven. Once cool sprinkle with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cookie mix with egg, oil and water. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine chips and milk. Microwave for 1 minute or until melted. Spread over cooled cookies. Drizzle with frosting. Top with jam. Store in refrigerator. Yield: 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease 2 loaf pansset aside. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, salt, orange peel, and juice. In a separate bowl, mix together the eggs and butter. Blend into dry mixture. Fold in the cranberries. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 2 loaves.
