Cranberry Fudge Recipes
Cranberry Soup Recipes
Cranberry Relish Recipes
Cranberry Sauce Recipes
Cranberry Chicken Recipes
Cranberry Chutney Recipes
Cranberry Biscotti Recipes
Cranberry Cookies Recipes
Cranberry Salad Recipes
Cranberry

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9x13 inch baking dishes. In a large bowl, combine the chocolate chips and pecan pieces. Stir in the cake mix. Add half-and-half and kahluastir until well-combined. Spread into the prepared baking dishes. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool for 30 minutes in pan. In a small bowl, combine egg, egg substitute and kahluastir until well-blended. Pour over the top of each cake. Sprinkle with the sweetened flaked coconut. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely before serving. Store in refrigerator.
name: tropical coconut cakeingredients: cream of coconut, sweetened condensed milk, crushed pineapple, yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, water, whipped topping, shredded

Toast almonds in a small skillet over medium heat until lightly browned. Cool. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook asparagus in olive oil until lightly browned. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss in almonds. Serve at once.

Bake granny s rice pudding at 325 degrees for 45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cut into squares or squares after cooling.
Wine tasting event to benefit P.E.O. Scholarship Fund
By: Martha R. Pittenger The P.E.O. Chapter BM will host a wine tasting event at the P.E.O. Home, 1512 24th St., on Saturday, Feb. 20 at 6 p.m. The evening will benefit the P.E.O. Scholarship Fund. The tasting will feature a wide range of wines from all over the world. The event will be limited to 40 people to ensure the best possible experience for all who attend. Tickets are $30 each and must be purchased by Feb. 14. They can be purchased at the P.E.O. Home or by calling 620-275-2075. The P.E.O. Scholarship Fund was established by P.E.O. in 1907 as

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Shake breadcrumb mixture onto plate. Coat each chicken piece in mixture. Place chicken in greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn and baste with margarine. Bake 30 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large ovenproof skillet over high heat. Season pork on both sides with salt and pepper. Add the remaining oil to the pan and brown the pork on all sides. Add the onion to the pan and saute until softened. Add the port and wine to the pan and bring to a boil. Cook until reduced by half. Add the honey and rosemary. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the fresh cranberries and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Transfer the pork to a cutting board. Spoon some of the cranberry sauce over the top of the meat and serve.

Place the chicken breasts into the bottom of the slow cooker. Add the long grain and wild rice blend. Add the water and stir well to combine. Season with the salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle the garlic over the top of the rice mixture. Add the vegetables to the top of the rice mixture and stir to combine. Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until the chicken is tender and the vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss apples with maple syrup and vinegar in a large roasting pan. Sprinkle with dried cherries. Roast for 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven. Toss with greens. Place in a large bowl. Add blue cheese, pecans, dill weed, and remaining ingredients. Toss to mix well. Serve on bed of greens.

In a blender puree 1/4 cup of the basil, marjoram, rosemary and chives with the garlic and 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice until smooth and well blended. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of basil leaves and the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Whisk in the remaining 1/4 cup butter in a small batches, blending until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. To serve: spread a generous amount of the butter on a slice of sourdough bread and sprinkle with coarse salt and ground pepper.

Prepare cavatappi pasta according to the box directions. In a large pot over medium heat, melt butter and add in heavy cream. Bring mixture to a simmer and stir in garlic salt and pepper. Add in the shredded Pecorino Romano cheese and Parmesan Cheese and stir until combined. Add in the shredded Cheddar Cheese and continue stirring until melted. Remove from heat and add in the cooked cavatappi pasta. Serve and enjoy.
Cut onion soup mix into small pieces. Place stew meat and soup mix in crockpot. Add carrots, potatoes and water. Cook on low for 10-12 hours. Serve with hot rolls and salad.

Cut each breast half in half lengthwise to make 4 halves. Sprinkle with garlic powder and white pepper. Lay each half flat and sprinkle with goat cheese. Roll halves up and secure with toothpicks. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake another 10 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and cheese melted. Serve hot.

Cook beans according to package directions. Drain well. Chop celery. In large bowl, combine all other ingredients. Add beans. Stir until blended. Serve at room temperature. Top with lettuce leaf. If desired, garnish with egg. Serve with crusty bread.
Name: Tuna with Corn Salad
1 6-oz. can of water packed tuna
2 cups of cooked corn
Mix everything together. Serve chilled.
Name: Tuna with Cucumber Salad
1 6-oz. can of water packed tuna drained
Mix everything together. Serve chilled. Garnish with sliced cucumbers.
Name: Tuna with Peas Salad
1 6-oz. can of water packed tuna drained
1 cup of frozen peas thawed
Mix everything together. Serve chilled. Garnish with chopped cilantro.
Name: Tuna with Red Onions Salad
1 6-oz. can of water packed tuna drained
1/4 cup of red onions

Brown turkey with onion and celery in a large skillet. Drain fat. Combine the meat mixture with the barley in a large saucepan. Add the tomato paste and tomato soup. Heat through. Add the water, broth and seasonings. Simmer until barley is tender. Serves 4.

Place chickpeas, garlic, olive oil and sesame oil in the bowl of a food processor. Process until smooth. Add lemon juice, turmeric and chili powder and process until well combined. Transfer to a bowl and stir in cilantro and paprika. Season with salt to taste. Serve with pita bread. Makes 2 cups.

Preheat a gas or charcoal grill to medium. Whisk together garlic oil, vinegar, herbs, pepper and salt in a medium bowl. Place the thighs in a nonreactive dish (plastic is good) big enough to hold them in a single layer. Pour the marinade over them and turn to make sure they are all covered. Marinate at room temperature for 1 hour. Grill the thighs over direct medium heat 6 to 7 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with cayenne before serving.

In a blender, process watermelon and strawberries. Strain through sieve into large bowl, reserving the puree in the sieve for another use. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in lemonade and lemon juice. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Serve over ice and garnish with lemon slice if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with foil. Prepare seasoning mixture by combining the flour, seasonings, 1/4 teaspoon of the thyme, the poultry seasoning, salt and 1/2 cup of the butter. Put the remaining butter in a shallow dish. In a large resealable plastic bag or in a large bowl combine the remaining thyme with the rice cereal. Set aside. Heat 1 inch of oil to 350 degrees F in a large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. While the oil is heating, dip each piece of chicken first into the seasoned flour mixture to coat lightly and shake off the excess flour. Dip each piece into the butter and then into the cereal mixture. Working with one piece at a time, coat well on both sides and place on one of the prepared baking sheets. Repeat with the remaining pieces. Spray the tops of the chicken pieces with cooking spray or brush with the melted butter. Bake until lightly browned and

Preheat oven to 400. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and peppersaute for 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. In a large bowl, combine eggs and sour cream. Stir in vegetable mixture. Spread evenly in a lightly greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 35 minutes or until eggs are set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 10" round pan. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the extract and then the eggs one at a time. Alternately beat in the flour and the milk. Pour into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the almonds on top. Bake for about 40 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Brown turkey with onion. Add cream of mushroom soup. Add milk. Add drained canned green beans. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for additional 5 minutes or until bubbly.

Mix together ground beef, barbecue sauce and teriyaki sauce. Form into 4 patties. Grill or broil patties until desired doneness. Spread 1/2 of chipotle chile in adobo sauce over the top of each patty. Serve on hoagie rolls.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Combine the butter and the sugar in the bowl of an electric mixercream until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and the almond extract. Gradually add the flour, baking powder and saltmix well. Divide the dough in halfwrap each portion in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Roll each portion of dough into a ballflatten into a disc. Place an almond in the center of each discfold the dough over the nut and seal the edges together. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on the sheets for 1 minute before removing to wire racks. For icing, combine the powdered sugar and the water in a bowlstir well. Drizzle over the cookies. Makes about 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Arrange bread in single layer in bottom of prepared casserole dish. Layer with half the tomato mixture, half the mozzarella cheese, half the green onions, half the eggs, half the milk, half the butter, half the basil, half the garlic salt, and half the pepper. Repeat layers once more. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes. Allow strata to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve warm.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the rice pilaf mix. Cook 8 minutes over low heat. Stir in tomatoes, bell peppers and parsley. Set aside. Combine capers and lemon juicelet stand for 2 minutes. Combine caper mixture with lemon rind and sugar. Pour over rice pilaf mixturetoss. Let stand 10 minutes. Garnish with artichoke hearts. Serve at room temperature.

To make the rub for the chicken, in a bowl combine the salt, sweet paprika, dark brown sugar, black pepper, and celery seed. Stir until well blended. Cut the chicken breasts into 1/4-inch strips and toss in the rub. Mix well to coat the meat with the rub. Lay the strips on a tray and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. After the meat has marinated in the rub, preheat the grill to medium. Lay the strips of meat on the grill and cook for 8-10 minutes per side or until the meat is cooked through, turning the meat once. Remove the meat from the grill and serve warm.
The main problem is that these recipes are not for bbq grill but for barbecue cooker (charcoal and electric). So, I guess you have to convert them for bbq grill.
I like the last one. Looks like it'll go well with a glass of red wine.
I like the look of the last one too.
I'm a huge fan of recipes like this one! It

Place sugar, salt and cinnamon in a large heavy saucepan. Heat over medium heat until the mixture is melted and boiling. Boil for 2 minutes. Beat the egg white in a glass bowl until foamy and stiff. Add the hot syrup a teaspoon at a time until the syrup is cooled to room temperature and is mixed well. Add the nuts and mix well. Pour mixture onto a greased jelly roll pan or cookie sheet. Spread to a single layer and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Drain pineapple reserving juice. Combine pineapple juice, orange juice, and sugar in small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil for 1 minute. Add gelatin and stir until dissolved. Set aside. Beat neufchatel with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually add the gelatin mixture, beating until well blended. Beat in eggs. Stir in orange zest. Pour filling into pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn off oven. Let cheesecake cool in the oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Chill for at least 4 hours.

Combine cream cheese and imitation crab in small bowl until blended. Add garlic powder and pepper. Place 1 teaspoonful filling in center of each wonton wrapper. Brush edges with water and fold in half to form triangles. In skillet combine 1 teaspoonful butter and 1 tablespoonful vegetable oil. Add 6 wontons at a time and cook 10-12 minutes. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Grease a 10-inch springform pan. In a food processor, combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and splenda until well mixed. Press into the bottom of prepared pan. Bake for 5 minutes, then remove to cool. In a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, mix together cream cheese, fat free cream cheese, lime juice, salt, and 3 cups splenda until well blended. Add 4 eggs, one at a time, mixing until well blended after each addition. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool to room temperature before refrigerating. Chill at least 4 hours before removing from springform pan.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 2 quart baking dish with butter. Mix cooked wild rice, fresh corn kernels, eggs, heavy cream, kosher salt and cayenne pepper in large bowl. Pour into baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Sprinkle with additional kosher salt and ground black pepper. Serve.

Cut the ends of the peppers off so they can stand upright. Rub them with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder and seasoning. Microwave at 100% power for 5-6 minutes. Rotate the trays and continue cooking for another 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and serve.
Bell pepper is a good source of vitamin C. The nutritional value of the vegetable is similar to that of the other sweet peppers. It is also a good source of Vitamin A. It is a good source of dietary fiber. The nutritional value of the vegetable is similar to that of the other sweet peppers. It is also a good source of Vitamin A. It is a good source of dietary fiber. The nutritional value of the vegetable is similar to that of the other sweet peppers. It is also a good source of Vitamin A. It is a good source of dietary fiber. It is also a good source of Vitamin A. It is a good source of dietary fiber.
Combine first 6 ingredients and toss to coat. Cool 1 hour. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowladd to cabbage mixture and toss to coat. Refrigerate 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.
Blend sugar, dry mustard, salt and cider vinegar. Blend in the onion juice. Add canola oil in a steady stream while blending. Add the poppy seeds. Refrigerate for several hours.

In a medium bowl combine the first four ingredientscut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Pat into a 9-inch pie pan. Arrange the peaches in the pie pan. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour the mixture over the fruit. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 50 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Saute garlic in butter until golden brown. Add green chilies and cook 2-3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and cook until heated through. Spoon into a baking dish. Sprinkle with colby-monterey jack cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.
I have made this recipe for years. It is excellent.
I have made this recipe for years. It is excellent. I have tried others and always come back to this one. The only change I have made is to use a can of whole green chilies.
I make this every year for our Christmas party. It is always a big hit.
This is very good. I have used canned green enchilada sauce.
This is so easy to make. We love this recipe.
I have made this for years. I have never had a problem with it. I use a can of green chiles and no diced tomatoes.

In a large bowl combine the spinach with 1/4 cup of the ricotta. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of the black pepper. Divide the spinach mixture evenly among the wrappers. Moisten edges with water. Fold in half to form a triangle. Press edges with a fork to seal. Lightly spray 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Place the pillows on the prepared sheets, about 1 inch apart. Lightly spray the tops with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of the ricotta over the top of each pillow. Sprinkle with the remaining black pepper. Bake for an additional 2 to 3 minutes or until the tops are golden. Serve warm.

Place fillets in a shallow glass pan and cover evenly with dressing. Let stand for 30 minutes in refrigerator. Preheat oven broiler. Spread lemon juice over both sides of fish. Sprinkle with garlic and paprika. Broil 5 inches from heat 4-5 minutes per inch of thickness until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle evenly with capers and serve.

Preheat oven to 275f or 130c. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Wash potatoes well and rub with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Bake potatoes in oven for about 2 hours or until tender. Meanwhile, halve the potato lengthwise. Remove the skins and mash with a fork. Heat a grill pan over medium-low heat or heat a frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for about 6 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove from pan and slice into strips. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add the onion, olives and tomatoes. Cook for about 5 minutes until the onion is translucent and softened. Add the garlic and cook for another minute or until fragrant. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the potato mash, lemon juice, zest and season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken and mix well to combine. Divide among the ramekins and bake in the oven until the top is lightly golden brown

In a large skillet, fry the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove from skillet with slotted spoon. Set aside. In skillet used for cooking bacon, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic. Cook for about 1 minute or until the onions are translucent. Add the black beans, salt, pepper, and cumin. Cook for about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the bacon and hot sauce. Spoon into a serving bowl and sprinkle with sour cream.

In a large skillet over med-high heat brown the ground beef and onions. Add the salsa and simmer for about 15 mins. Stir in the prepared polenta and cook for about another 15 mins. Add the beans and the cheese. Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish. Cover with the second crust and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 30 mins. Cut slits in the top of the pie. Serve with additional salsa if desired.

Peel and quarter yukon gold potatoes and place in a pot with cold salted water. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until potatoes are fork-tender (about 15-20 minutes). Drain and return to the hot pot. Mash with a potato masher or a fork to desired consistency. Add the half-and-half and butter and continue to mash until creamy and smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the goat cheese and the basil. Serve immediately, or cover and store in a warm place for up to an hour.

In a small bowl combine soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and green onions. In another bowl combine oysters, teriyaki sauce, cornstarch, and olive oil. Marinate strip steaks overnight in soy sauce mixture. Thread oysters on skewers and marinate in teriyaki mixture. Grill steaks to desired doneness over medium heat. Grill oyster skewers over medium heat for about 2 minutes on each side or until oysters are plump. Serve over hot rice and top with teriyaki sauce.

Combine first 4 ingredients in medium saucepan. Bring to boil over medium heat. Boil 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Beat in half-and-half and vanilla. Stir in walnuts. Chill. Serve over ice cream. Makes about 1-1/2 cups.

Mix together frozen lemonade concentrate and honey in medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour to blend flavors. Chill all fruit in refrigerator. Drain fruit, reserving liquid. Toss fruit with lemonade mixture. Garnish with fruit liquid and poppyseed.

In a large bowl, combine the plain and self raising flours and set aside. In another bowl, combine the brown sugar and cocoa until well combined and set aside. In another bowl, combine the dark chocolate and unsalted butter until smooth and set aside. In a large bowl combine the eggs and the milk and beat until light and fluffy. Add the plain and self raising flours and the dark chocolate mixture and beat until well combined and the mixture is smooth. Add the milk chocolate and white chocolate chips and beat until well combined and smooth. Drop by tablespoons onto a greased baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack and store in an airtight container.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Put the cut side of the potatoes down on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle the cajun seasoning and salt and pepper. Bake for 45 minutes.

In a medium bowl mix artichoke hearts and parmesan cheese. Stir in thyme leaves. Stuff chicken breasts with the artichoke mixture. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat the chicken breasts with olive oil. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve with vegetables or potatoes.
I don't think you can do a better job than this one.
These recipes look so good! I'm so happy to have found your blog!
I'm trying the Parmesan breaded chicken tonight. Can't wait to eat it!
I'm trying the Parmesan breaded chicken tonight. Can't wait to eat it! My husband and I are going to be eating like kings for the next few days!
I'm going to try this recipe tonight. I hope it turns out great. I'm not a very good cook, so we'll see how it goes. I'll let you know how it turned out.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in mushrooms and lemon juice. Cook for another minute. Stir in salad dressing. Continue cooking for another minute or until mixture is heated through. Remove from heat. Add almonds. Serve immediately.

Mix together all dry ingredients except raisins and dried cranberries and set aside. In a saucepan, melt together honey and butter and pour over dry mix and mix well. Spread in a greased 13x9x2 pan and bake at 350 degrees for about an hour or until it is lightly browned and is very fragrant. Cool and stir in raisins and dried cranberries. Store in an air-tight container.

Boil edamame beans for 3 minutes until just tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Cut beans in half and add to a bowl. Squeeze lemon juice over beans and toss to combine. Sprinkle cajun seasoning over beans and toss to combine. Add cayenne and toss to combine.
In a food processor, add all the ingredients and mix well. Form into a ball and chill for 24 hours before serving. Serve on crackers with chives as a topping.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a small bowl mix together thyme, black pepper, and salt. Sprinkle both sides of fish. Place fish into an oiled baking dish. Drizzle fish with olive oil and bake fish for 10 minutes. Meanwhile in a small pan combine chicken broth and portabella mushrooms. Boil until mushrooms are soft. In a small bowl combine mustard and whipping cream. Mix well. Pour mustard sauce over fish and top with mushrooms. Bake fish for another 10 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg until smooth. Sift together the flour, baking soda, ground ginger, cloves and cinnamonstir into the creamed mixture just until blended. Drop by level tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Drizzle with barbecue sauce. Yield: about 2 1/2 dozen.

Melt gruyere and swiss cheese in a double boiler over hot water. Stir in cornstarch with nutmeg. Pour in brie cheese and stir until cheese has melted. Stir in champagne. Add almond extract. Heat over a low flame for 5 minutes. Place over a candle or canned heat burner to keep warm. Serve with bread cubes. Serve with sliced apples. Dip with breadstick.

Cook the beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and rinse under cold water. Chop the beans. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Add the garlic and oregano and cook until the garlic is golden. Add the beans and cook for 1 minute until warmed through. Add the spinach and cook for 1 minute. Add the eggs and cook for 1-2 minutes until set. Sprinkle with pecorino and serve immediately.

Brush both sides of the bread with some of the oil. Grill the bread on one side until brown, then place it in a small baking pan that will fit under the grill. Grill the eggplants until tender all over and golden brown on both sides, about 8 minutes. Cut each half in half on the diagonal and spoon 2 tablespoons of sauce on each half. Place 2 tomato slices on top of each half. Top with 2 slices of mozzarella, then drizzle with some more of the oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and the basil leaves. Top with the other half of each sandwich and serve with coarse sea salt.

Combine cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add frozen orange juice concentrate and eggs one at a timemix well after each addition. Fold in mandarin oranges and juice. Pour into shortbread crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely before removing from pan.
Asking prices for real estate in California have continued to increase each month for over a year now. As a result, more home owners are beginning to wonder whether refinancing their property could be a good idea for them.
There are several advantages to refinancing your home loan. One of the most obvious is that you will usually be able to lower your monthly repayments by getting a lower interest rate on your mortgage.
Even if you have a good deal on your current home loan, there are a number of reasons why you may want to refinance your mortgage.
For example, you may want to convert your current interest only home loan to a repayment type mortgage or vice versa.
You may also want to take out a second mortgage in order to fund other

Combine carrots, pears, pineapple, lemon juice and spices in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often. Reduce heat to medium low and cook, stirring often, until mixture is thick. Stir in sugar and pectin. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Makes about 4 cups.

Cook onion and garlic in oil in a large skillet until onion is translucent. Add chicken and cook until browned and no longer pink. Add remaining ingredients except for cheese. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes. Spread half the mixture in a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Top with half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. In a separate bowl combine the flour, cornstarch and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture and beat until combined. Add the raspberry jam and salt and mix well. Drop by teaspoonful on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minute on pan. Remove from pan and cool.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half. In a large bowl combine the oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, and the garlic. Add the potatoes and toss to coat. Arrange the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt to the potatoes. Bake for 20 minutes longer or until lightly golden. Sprinkle with fresh rosemary and serve.

Preheat a large saut pan over medium-high heat. Add in your oil. Once hot, add in your Brussels Sprouts. Season generously with salt & pepper. Sear until golden brown. Remove from pan & add to a bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together your sriracha sauce & honey. Whisk in your lime juice until incorporated. Pour over your Brussel Sprouts & toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Mix together icing sugar, kirsch, aniseed and salt. Beat in eggs. Add flour gradually. Roll into small balls and place on greased tray. Flatten slightly with a fork. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven when cookies are a pale golden colour. Allow to cool. Dust with icing sugar.

Boil 1 cup of water, add sugar and cream of tartar. Continue boiling until it reaches 240 degrees F. Turn off heat and let stand for 5-10 minutes. Skim off any scum that appears on top of mixture, then strain. You can now add a pinch of salt to taste or use it right away in recipes requiring corn syrup. Store in a sealed container until ready to use.
Wow, what a great way to make your own corn syrup at home!
I love that you can make this so simply!
I always wondered how to make corn syrup at home! I love that you can make this so simply!
I didn’t know that you could make your own corn syrup! Thanks so much for sharing this!
I didn’t know you could make your own corn syrup! Thanks so much for sharing this!

Grease and flour three 9-inch round pans and line with wax paper and spray with cooking spray. Beat together the bananas, oil and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer. Add the eggs and beat until smooth. Add the dry ingredients and beat until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Divide batter evenly among prepared pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 22 minutes or until a wooden skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes in pans on a wire rack and remove from pans. Cool completely on wire rack. Frost with desired frosting. Makes 18 servings.

Season roast with onion soup mix and place in a baking dish. Add enough water to cover bottom of baking dish and place in a preheated 300 degree F oven for two hours. Check water level after an hour of cookingif necessary add more water to keep roast covered with water for the entire two hours of cooking. Remove roast from baking dishadd enough water to cover bottom of baking dish and place roast on top of water. Cover with aluminum foil and refrigerate overnight. Remove roast from baking dishadd enough water to cover bottom of baking dish and place roast on top of water. Cover with aluminum foil and place in a preheated 300 degree F oven for three hours or until done. Add more water as necessary during cooking process if roast is not covered with water. Serve roast with cream of mushroom soup.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Heat oil in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Season veal with salt and pepper and brown on both sides. Add butter and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add oregano, white wine, and parsley. Cover and cook 20-30 minutes until veal is tender.

Melt margarine and saute onions and mushrooms until almost tender. Stir in garlic powder and flour to make a roux. Cook for 30 seconds or until brown. Stir in soymilk and let simmer until thick and bubbly. Add salt and pepper to taste. Drain green beans and add to sauce. Mix and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Top with french-fried onions and return to oven for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Remove stems from broccoli and cut into 2 inch florets. Place florets into a 13 x 9 baking pan. Add the garlic cloves. In a small bowl combine the teriyaki sauce and the black pepper and spray over the broccoli. Roast for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the broccoli with the cooking spray and roast for 10 minutes more or until tender.

Combine the rice and pineapple in a large saucepan. Add the mini marshmallows and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Add the almonds and maraschino cherry. Stir in the heavy cream and sugar. Add the vanilla and bring back to a simmer. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook onion and bell peppers in oil until tender. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Pour in chicken broth and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Cook for 20 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Drain chicken mixture and reserve 1/2 cup of liquid. In a 2-quart casserole dish, combine chicken, reserved liquid, cooked spaghetti and half of the chicken broth. Stir in cooked chicken, diced tomatoes and half of the cheddar cheese. Top with remaining chicken broth. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar and cover with lid or foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with the spinach. Bake for 30 minutes longer. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with a green salad.

Melt 1 Tablespoon butter in a large pot over medium heatadd onion and potato and cook 10 minutes until tenderadd Brussels sprouts and bay leafcover with water and bring to boilreduce heat to simmercover pot and cook 10 minutesremove bay leafstir in sweet red pepper and chicken stockcook uncovered 10 minutes or until Brussels sprouts are tenderstir in parsley. Serve over rice or potato.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray 13-by-9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In small bowl, combine brown sugar and vinegar. Heat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, toss beets, parsnips, carrots, mushrooms and oil. Spread evenly in baking dish. Pour vinegar mixture over vegetables. Cover with foil. Bake 30 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 20 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.In a bowl combine the soy sauce, green onions, sesame oil and honey. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Spread the chicken in one layer in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 40-45 minutes until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Transfer the chicken to a serving plate. Garnish with chopped green onion and serve immediately.
Tip: Use bone in chicken thighs for extra flavor and moisture.
Tip: For easier clean up, line the baking sheet with parchment paper.
Tip: Cook the chicken to an internal temperature of 165 degrees.

Cook sausage patties in skillet on medium heat until done--approximately 10 minutes. Warm english muffins in oven for 5 minutes. Toast bread on both sides in toaster. On one half of bread, place sausage patty, 1 slice of cheese and 1 cooked egg. Top with the other half of bread and toast in toaster until cheese is melting. Serve with hash browns and orange juice.

Place steak in shallow baking dish. In a large skillet, saute mushrooms and onions in oil over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Stir in soup and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Sprinkle with mustard and simmer 2-3 minutes. Spoon over steak. Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until done to your liking. Serve over rice and garnish with parsley.

In a small bowl, combine flour with 2 tablespoons of water. Add cider vinegar to remaining 2 cups of water in a saucepan. Heat until boiling. Add flour mixture. Add chopped onion, cucumber, radishes. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in cooked potatoes. Add salt and ground pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Serve lukewarm or cold. Serve with cooked German sausage or cold cuts.

In a food processor or blender combine garlic powder, basil and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Rub the mixture over the skinless, boneless thighs. Heat olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Brown the chicken thighs for 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from heat. In a crock-pot, combine the balsamic vinegar, minced onion and garlic. Add the browned chicken thighs. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours. Transfer the thighs to a platter. Stir the parsley into the sauce and pour over the thighs. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease bottom of 10x15 inch pan. Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add the candied cherries and walnuts. Mix thoroughly. Set aside. Beat together the eggs, oil, vanilla extract, and dates. Add the dry mixture and mix well. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until a wooden pick comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Let it cool on the pan for 15 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack. Store in a tightly covered container for up to 6 weeks.
Name: Date Cake
Ingredients: Flour, Sugar, Egg, Baking Powder, Butter, Pitted Dates, Boiling Water, Baking Soda, Salt, Milk
Preparation: Put dates in boiling water with baking soda and leave to cool. Cream sugar, butter and vanilla extract. Add egg and dates and mix in well. Add all dry ingredients. Place in prepared baking pan and ake at 180c for 45 minutes.

Cook bacon, cool and crumble. On one side of each slice of bread place a slice of tomato. Spread on 1/2 of the bacon then lay a slice of cheese on each tomato. Top with other slice of bread with bacon side down. Cook on a hot skillet or in a microwave for 2 minutes or until the cheese melts. Cut in half.

In large bowl, mix all-purpose flour, ground nutmeg, salt and 1/4 cup of the sugar. Add eggs. Beat until smooth. Add rhubarb. Mix well. Pour into uncooked pie crust. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup sugar over rhubarb mixture. Bake at 375 degrees until rhubarb is tender and mixture is set. Cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In saucepan, combine soup, corn and chicken. Stir in muffin mix and milk. Heat over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in egg and salt. Pour into greased 9 inch pie plate. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Cook chicken breast in skillet with 1 tbsp. of olive oil until no longer pink. Cut into bite size pieces. Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water. Drain. Heat 2 tbsp. of oil in skillet. Saute garlic until golden. Add broccoli florets. Cook until tender. Stir in cooked chicken. Season with pepper. Add basil leaves. Add chicken stock. Simmer 2 minutes. Drain pasta. Toss with chicken mixture. Sprinkle with tomatoes and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano.

Combine lemongrass, peanut oil, lime rind, and coriander leaves in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Transfer to a shallow bowl or large resealable plastic bag. Add chicken to mixture and work mixture into flesh using your hands, and allow to marinate for 6 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 400f. Roast chicken in a pan with a drainage rack for 40-45 minutes or until juices run clear. Remove from oven. Heat macadamia nut oil in a large skillet over medium high heat and fry chiles for 1 minute. Remove from skillet with a slotted spoon and discard seeds. Return to skillet and add garlic and sugar. Fry until sugar is dissolved and bubbling, about 2 minutes, then add lime juice to taste. Place a few tablespoons of the hot sugar mixture on a plate. Serve roasted chicken skewers garnished with a slice of lime and a sprig of coriander, if desired, and pass the sweet hot sauce at

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add kielbasa and cook until browned. Remove from pan. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Cook pasta according to package directions. Stir in tomato mixture and kielbasa. Spoon into a 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and cheese. Bake in 350 degrees F oven for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a kettle. Let cool and place in a large pitcher. Add the tea bags and let steep until cool (about an hour). Remove the teabags and stir in the honey until dissolved. Add the orange and lemon juices and stir until well combined. Taste and add more honey if needed. Serve over ice with ginger ale added, if desired.
Place ingredients in the pan of a bread machine in the order suggested by manufacturer. Select basic bread setting and crust color if available. Bake according to manufacturers instructions.

Put roast into crock pot. Sprinkle onions over top. Pour 1/2 bottle of ginger ale over top of roast. Cook for 16 hours on low. Shred roast with fork. Stir in barbecue sauce. Cook for another hour on low. Serve on bun.

Mix together all ingredients except for marshmallows and nuts and press into mini muffin pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 12 minutes. Cool, then sprinkle with nuts and marshmallows. Makes about 2 dozen.

Place meat and onions in crockpot. Add bouillon cubes and stir well. Pour red wine over all. Cover and cook for 6-7 hours on low heat setting. Remove meat to serving platter. Combine cornstarch and water to form slurry. Add to juices in the crockpot. Heat for 1 minute over low heat setting, stirring constantly until gravy thickens. Serve over noodles or mashed potatoes.

Combine sugar, corn syrup, butter and cream in a medium pan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil until mixture reaches 260 degrees f on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in blanched almonds. Quickly pour mixture into a 9x13 inch pan coated with cooking spray. Let cool to room temperature and then break into pieces. Store candies in an airtight container at room temperature.

Place 1/2 pound romaine lettuce on a large platter. Arrange in the center a few strips of bacon. Whisk together remaining 3 ingredients and drizzle over the lettuce. Tear 1 egg yolk over the top, sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Lightly oil grill rack. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Heat grill. Thread chicken onto 4 skewers. Brush with half the lemon juice mixture. Cook for 3 minutes per side. Grill green onions 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Grill jalapeno for 1 minute per side. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Serve chicken with green onions and jalapeno. Drizzle with remaining lemon juice mixture. Makes 4 servings.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan and stir in the sugar and the salt. Add the egg and milk and stir until the mixture is smooth. Sift together the dry ingredients and then stir into the wet mixture until a smooth batter is formed. Spoon the mixture into paper muffin cases and place in a pre-heated oven for 15-20 minutes. These muffins can be made with or without a filling. To make them with a filling, add a dessertspoon of jam or marmalade to the wet mixture and stir until the filling is well dispersed. To make them without a filling, leave the jam out and add 1 dessertspoon of ground ginger and the same amount of chopped almonds when stirring in the dry ingredients.

Pour tomato paste into the bottom of the slow cooker. Add the beef. In a small bowl combine the Marsala and the vinegar. Pour over beef. Add the onion soup mix, brown sugar, onion, garlic, and thyme. Stir to combine. Add the warm water. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Remove the beef and cut into small pieces. Return the meat to the sauce and stir well. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at medium speed with a mixer until well mixed. Add flour mixture to creamed mixture and mix at low speed until just blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by level tablespoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Yield : About 3 dozen.
Mix together banana and eggs. Add salt and sugar. Add potato flour. Pour into greased cake pan and bake at 325 degrees for an hour and a half.

Combine the first two ingredients in a crock pot and heat on low until the cheeses are melted together. Add the rotel and sausage to the crock pot and heat on low until everything is mixed together. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the garlic and saut over low heat for 1 minute. Add the yellow onions and cook until golden brown. Add the beet leaves. Cook for another minute. Add the white wine. Stir in the bacon bits. Bring to the boil. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the salt and fresh ground black pepper. Stir. Serve hot.

Mix ice cream topping and milk in a saucepan and heat until it starts to boil. Remove from heat and add pudding mix and beat with a whisk until thickened. Fold in Cool Whip and spread over pie crust. Top with toffee bars. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cut chicken into strips. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken. Cook until done. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

Rinse barley under cold water. In a pot bring water to a boil. Add barley, stirring occasionally. Boil for 40 minutes. Drain and rinse in cool water. Drain again. In a bowl combine basil leaves, vinegar and olive oil. Add in barley. Season to taste with salt. Add in the corn kernels and cherry tomatoes. Toss to combine. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl, combine onions and brisket. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the garlic salt, lemon pepper and brown sugar. Add the onion mixture, seal the bag and turn to coat. Place in a shallow pan. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Pour in the barbecue sauce. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour more. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine the bourbon with the brown sugar. Pour over the brisket. Cover. Bake 1 hour more. Uncover. Bake 1 hour more. Let stand 10 minutes. Slice thinly.
name: crock pot honey mustard bbq short ribs or pot roastingredients: short rib of beef, dijon-style mustard, garlic, honey, salt and pepper, hickory flavored barbecue sauce, cornstarch, cold waterpreparation:Season ribs with salt and pepper, if desired. Place in slow cooker. In a bowl, combine must

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine rolled oats, walnuts, golden raisins, ground flax seed and brown sugar in a large bowl. Stir in olive oil and honey. Spoon mixture onto two cookie sheets lined with parchment paper. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Store in an air tight container. Serving suggestions: serve with fresh fruit and milk. Or eat by the handful!

Beat margarine and powdered sugar in a large bowl until creamy. Add the lemon juice. Beat in the egg. Add the dry ingredients. Stir in the flaked coconut. Press into a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares.
I have 2 recipes for cocunut bars.
Sift together the flour and the powdered sugar. Cut in the butter until crumbly. Add the water, the vanilla and the egg. Mix well. Stir in the coconut. Press the dough into a 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 15 minutes. Melt the chocolate and drizzle over the cake. Cool.
Combine the cake mix and the water until crumbly. Press into the bottom of an 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes. Let cool completely. Mix the ic

In food processor slightly chop the 6 cups of blueberries. Add to a large pan and add the sugar and lime juice. Bring to a rolling boil that cannot be stirred down. Add the dry pectin and bring back to a boil again for 1 minute. Ladle the hot berry mixture into jars. Wipe tops and place lids on jars and screw caps into place. Place in water bath canner with 1 inch of water covering jars. Bring to a full boil and cover for 10 minutes. Remove jars from water bath after 10 minutes and place on counter to cool. Listen for tops of jars to pop and seal. Cool completely. Jam should be good in jars for up to 1 year.

Slice off the top of each strawberry leaving a flat bottom. Remove the seeds from the middle of each strawberry with a melon baller or small spoon. Combine the cream cheese and splenda substitute with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add the orange extract and mix until well blended. Spoon the filling into the strawberry hollows. Sprinkle with the walnuts and place on a serving plate. Serve immediately.
I've been doing a lot of "strawberry searching" lately as well! I can't wait to try these recipes. I've been looking for a good stuffed strawberry recipe for awhile now!
In a large skillet cook ground beef with onions, garlic, peppers, butter and tomato sauce. Add tomatoes, rotel, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until cabbage is tender and serve.

In a blender or food processor, combine ancho chiles and 4 cups water. Blend to a smooth puree. In a bowl combine the puree, pepper, cumin and oregano. Reserve 1/2 cup for later use. Set the remainder aside. In a heavy skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add the garlic and red onion and saute 1 to 2 minutes. Add the puree mixture and cook until slightly thickened. Add the chicken and cook 5 minutes. Turn and cook 5 more minutes or until done. Spoon some of the sauce over the chicken and serve. For later use, store the reserved puree in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 months or freeze for up to 6 months.

Place romaine lettuce hearts in a large bowl. Add baby spinach and hearts of palm. Add 1/2 the cucumber sliced into thin rounds. Add 1/4 cup frozen green peas, thawed. Add 3 tablespoons carrot shavings. Add 3 tablespoons of diced red onion. Add 3 capers. Toss with dressing. Add 1/2 of the dressing to the salad. Toss well to distribute. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat the olive oil and sautee the onions until they are golden. Add the ginger and continue sauteing until tender. Add the carrots and broth. Bring to a simmer, then add the honey. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Purée with an immersion blender. Serve hot or cold.

Peel and cut acorn squash into halves. Cut out the seeds and place cut side up in a pan. In a small bowl combine butter and brown sugar. Brush the cut side of the acorn squash with the mixture and sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake in the preheated oven until tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm.

Season beef with salt & pepper. Dust with flour. Heat butter in large pan. Add beef & brown on all sides. Add stock. Cover & simmer 1 hour. Stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes, prepared mustard, onion & white mushrooms. Simmer 10 minutes. Season to taste. Remove from heat. Garnish with sour cream just before serving.

In a 3-quart baking pan combine the sliced Canadian bacon and the chicken breasts. Season with salt and pepper. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in the flour to make a paste and cook until golden. Add the milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Add the cream and cook until thickened. Stir in the oregano and the cheese. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and the juices run clear when the meat is pierced.

Saut? butter in skillet over medium heat until melted. Add celery and onioncook for 3 minutes or until tender. Add rice and saut? for 1 minute. Stir in orange juice, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heatcover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 18 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in almonds and oranges. Serve warm.

Combine beef with onion and taco seasoning and water. Add sweet corn, condensed soup and water. Simmer 10 minutes. Combine macaroni with pepper, black olives and taco soup mixture. Spoon mixture into a greased casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Butter 2 9×5 loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter until light and creamy. Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add the lemon juice and beat. Add one third of the flour mixture and beat. Add the egg yolks one at a time beating well after each addition. Repeat with the remaining two thirds of the flour mixture. Add the vanilla and beat until just combined. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the batter. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared loaf pans. Bake until firm and golden on top 1 hour. Cool completely before removing from pans. Dust with confectioners’ sugar.
Cut mushroom into bite-size pieces. Put into a bowl with shallots, drizzle with the oil and vinegar. Add the thyme and mix well.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tuna and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for 1 minute. Add the parsley and cayenne pepper. Serve immediately.

Combine lemon juice and mustard in large bowlwhisk in oil. Add remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and chill 2 hours or overnight.
name: cucumber tomato saladingredients: tomatoes, cucumber, green onion, italian salad dressing, vinegar, fresh basil, salt, pepper, garlic saltpreparation:In a serving bowl, layer half of the tomatoes, all of the cucumber, then remaining tomatoes. Sprinkle with onion. Combine remaining ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting lid and shake well. Pour over salad. Cover and chill for 25 to 30 minutes or until ready to serve.
name: cucumber tomato saladingredients: olive oil, lemon juice, dijon mustard, salt, sliced ripe olives, tomatoes, cucumber, lettuce leafpreparation:Combine first 4 ingredients, stirring well with fork or small whisk. Combine olives, tomato, and
Place all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 12 muffin cups. In a large bowl combine the flour, sugar and baking powder. In another bowl beat the egg and add the milk and oil. Stir into the flour mixture just until combined. Fold in the rhubarb and strawberries. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake at 375f. for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes in the pan. Serve warm.

Brown bread in microwave 1 minute on each side or until toasted. Drain on paper towel. In blender container process bread and milk until smooth. Stir in eggs and seasonings. Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until puffed and browned. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare the stuffing according to package directions, except add parmesan cheese as well as butter and garlic. Place stuffing into a greased baking dish. Cover and bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Meanwhile butterfly the chicken breast halves and place them over the top of the stuffing. Bake uncovered at 400 for an additional 20 minutes. Serve with your favorite vegetable and dressing.
Combine miracle whip, herbs and garlic and mix well. Place fish fillet on grill and cover with miracle whip mixture. Cook until fish is done.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Cut the stem ends off the pears and peel away any tough outer skin (if you have a melon baller, this is a great tool for doing this). Cut each pear in half from stem to tip so that you have two long halves. Arrange the pear halves cut side down in an 8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle the butter over the pear halves and drizzle a little bit of the honey over them as well. Sprinkle the pumpkin pie spice over top. Bake until tender and golden, about 35-40 minutes, basting occasionally with the liquid in the baking dish. Serve warm or cool as desired. Sprinkle with almonds for garnish.

In large skillet sauté onions in butter over medium heat until lightly browned. Add sausage and brown. Stir in apples. Add sweet potatoes and water and cook on low for about 30 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place salmon fillets in a lightly greased 13-inch-by-9-inch baking pan. In a bowl, combine italian dressing with tomatoes. Spread over the top of the fish. Arrange sliced mushrooms and green onions over the top. Cover. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Serve fish with the sauce spooned over top.

In a large skillet, saute onion in 1 tablespoon of the oil until tender-crisp. Remove from the heat. Stir in shrimp, the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, and the lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper. Divide the shrimp mixture between two platessprinkle with the green onions and the Parmesan cheese. Garnish with the parsley.

Slice the leeks thinly. Melt the butter in a non-stick skillet. Add the leeks. Saute over low heat until the leeks are soft. Beat the eggs lightly in a bowl and add the flour, nutmeg and the milk. Pour this mixture over the leeks. Stir well over medium heat. Add the paprika and season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Serve at once while hot.

Peel fresh ginger with a spoon or paring knife and chop or slice into matchsticks or julienne. Put into non-reactive bowl or jar with 1-2 tablespoons of rice vinegar, 1 tsp of salt and 1 tsp of sugar. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let flavors blend. Store covered for up to 2 weeks.

Place the dried dates and crystallized ginger in a bowl with the soft brown sugar. Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat, then add the sugar mixture, stirring to dissolve. Allow the mixture to cool. Stir in the bicarbonate of soda. Sift the self-raising flour into a bowl, then add the date mixture. Mix together well. Grease a 22cm square cake tin. Line the base and sides of the tin with non-stick paper and pour the mixture into the tin. Bake the cake for 40-50 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean when removed. Leave the cake to cool in the tin. When the cake is cold, remove from the tin and spread the top of the cake with lemon butter icing. The cake can be stored in an airtight container for up to a week. Lemon Butter Icing: 175g softened unsalted butter 3 tablespoons lemon juice 120g icing sugar Combine all the ingredients together until smooth

Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Stir in onion and saute until tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in bell pepper and mushrooms and saute until tender. Stir in tomatoes and water and cook until liquid is almost gone, 30-60 minutes. Stir in rice and garlic powder and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, 15-20 minutes.

Cook bacon and onions in a skillet. Drain fat. Add in spinach. Add jalapenos. Stir and let cook about 3-4 minutes. Add vinegar and brown sugar. Add in garlic and cook until garlic is cooked but not browned. Add in water and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until bacon is cooked. Serve hot.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Add garlic and onions and cook until lightly browned. Add brussels sprouts and saute until lightly browned and crisp-tender. Add balsamic vinegar and stir. Add butter and stir until melted. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

In a food processor or blender, pulse sunflower seeds for a few minutes until they look like ground up seeds. Add the sunflower oil and sugar. Process the sunflower seed mixture until the seeds are smooth. Add the sea salt and process until the sunflower seed mixture is smooth. Store in the refrigerator. Sunflower seed butter is delicious on sandwiches, in smoothies and in cakes.

Microwave popcorn. Add sugar, vanilla and corn syrup to melted butter. Pour over the popcorn and mix well. Add the nuts and mix well. Spread on a greased cookie sheet and cook in 225 oven for 2 hours. Cool completely before storing in an air tight container.

In a large bowl combine flour, eggs, milk and pepper until smooth. Stir in ham and half the cheddar. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar. Bake at 425 degrees for 45-60 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Let cool and serve.
This is the best quiche I have ever made. I usually get my quiche from the bakery but I decided to make my own and this recipe did not disappoint! The only thing I changed was I used a mix of sharp cheddar and swiss cheeses. I will definitely be using this recipe again.
This is a very tasty and easy quiche recipe that I have made many times!
This was delicious! I used a regular pie crust that I made and baked the quiche in a glass baking dish. I added diced ham and mushrooms and used a mix of sharp cheddar and swiss cheeses. This recipe is a keeper!
This was easy and delicious! I added diced ham and mushrooms. This recipe is a keeper!
I
Pour all liquids into blender in the order given. Process until smooth. Pour into two glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish each with a lime wedge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish. In a food processor or blender combine the beans, eggs, and garlic. Blend until smooth. Stir in oil, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and baking powder. Stir in oats. Stir in the salt and cinnamon. Fold in the chocolate. Pour into the baking dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until edges begin to pull away from the side of the pan. Cool completely before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350F. Lightly spray a baking tray with cooking spray. Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the cutlets. Brown them on both sides. Take out of pan and set aside. Place the remaining sauce in a small bowl. Add the jam. Cook the cutlets in the oven for 45 minutes or until cooked through. Cool slightly. Mix the breadcrumbs, parsley and stock together to make a paste. Spread each cutlet with the apricot mixture. Roll in the paste. Place on the baking tray. Bake for a further 10-15 minutes or until the paste is golden and crisp. Serve with steamed corn.

In a large pot, bring broth to simmer. Whisk in pumpkin puree. Stir in brown sugar. Add spices. Season with salt and pepper. Heat through. Serve with a dollop of whipping cream and sprinkle with cheese. Garnish with cilantro.

In a medium skillet saute the chicken over medium heat until cooked through about 10 minutes. Remove the chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, saute the green pepper and onion in butter over medium heat until tender but not brown about 5 minutes. Transfer to a blender along with the milk and the chicken broth. Blend until smooth and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the cream cheese and blend until smooth. Place 2 tortillas in each of 4 bowls and spoon the chicken mixture over the tortillas. Top with some cheese and the sauce. Repeat the layering of tortillas, cheese and sauce to form 4 casseroles. Top the casseroles with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes until the cheese is melted and the casseroles are heated through. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

Beat egg substitute with skim milk and spices. Cut bread into 1-inch cubes. Dip cubes into egg mixture. Arrange cubes on baking sheet with parchment paper. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Turn cubes once with a spatula or spoon, and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cereal and serve with syrup or jam.

Take a large stuffed green olive and gently press it open. Press a small amount of the cream cheese spread into the opening. Replace the top of the olive and press it closed. Repeat with the remaining olives. In a shallow bowl, combine the remaining stuffed olives and Italian dressing. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetable crudite.

Grease two 9 inch square pans. In a large bowl combine graham cracker crumbs, flour, baking powder and salt. Add condensed milk and margarinemix well. Stir in raisins and coconut. Spread in pans. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks. Cut into squares or squares. Store in air tight container.

In a small bowl combine garlic salt and pepper. Rub into both sides of meat and allow to stand for 10 minutes. In a heavy 12-inch skillet heat oil over medium-high heat and brown meat well on both sides. Add 1/2 cup water and cover tightly and cook over low heat until meat is tender. Remove meat and slice thinly. In a bowl combine mayonnaise and parsley and spread over both sides of rolls. Top with meat and garnish with lettuce and sliced tomato.
Turkey Chili Con Carne : I was inspired by the chili we had at the Chisolm Trail Museum last year for their annual fall festival. I wanted to try and make it at home so I did a little experimenting and came up with this recipe that I think is really close to theirs.
Carne Adovada Marinated Pork : This is the first time I've cooked meat this way and I'm amazed at the tender juicy pork.
Shortcut Chili Con Carne : This is a recipe I found many years ago and I just love it.
Braz

Cut the tops off of bell peppers. Remove seeds and membranes. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef to skilletcook until browned. Add salt, beef broth, garlic salt, Tabasco sauce, lemon juice, bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese to skillet. Stir wellcook until thickened. Divide beef mixture evenly among bell pepper halves. Place tops on filled bell peppers. Place filled bell peppers in shallow baking dish. Pour melted butter over bell peppers. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until bell pepper skins are crispy and brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine beans with oil, shrimp, paste, and stock. Pour into 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake 15 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 450 degrees. Bake 20 minutes or until crisp. Combine sauce ingredients. Pour over hot beans. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve with pork.

Cut slits in each breast and stuff with bacon and cheese. Brush with garlic salt and wrap tightly in aluminum foil. Grill over medium heat for about 1 hour or until done. Remove from aluminum foil and garnish with parsley if desired.
stuffed chicken is a food that is eaten in the United States, Mexico, and Canada. It is usually served at restaurants and in homes as an appetizer or main course.
stuffed chicken is a dish that is popular in the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It is made from ground meat, usually beef or pork, that is stuffed into the cavity of a whole chicken and then baked. The meat is usually cooked until it is well-done and the chicken is baked until it is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.
Stuffed Chicken is a dish that is popular in the United States. It is made with chicken, stuffing, and gravy. The chicken is typically cooked until it is golden brown and the stuffing is cooked until it is fluffy and mo

Mix limeade and lemonade together in a large bowl. Add extract and water. Stir to combine. Pour into an ice chest and stir in 7-Up. Let set in fridge overnight. Add tequila before serving.

I'm going to start drinking just so I can make margaritas. I can't wait to try all those recipes.

I have been waiting for this post.
I've been waiting for this post!

I've been waiting for this post. I need to try some of these recipes out.
