Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Line a 9-inch pie plate with 1 pie crust. Blend together the eggs and the whipping cream in a large bowlstir in the swiss cheese and dried dill weed. Layer the broccoli and the salmon over the bottom pie crustsprinkle with the chives and the pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the filling. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the remaining 1 pie crust over the top of the quichereturn to the oven and bake until the crust is browned, 10 to 15 minutes. Allow to cool 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine milk, eggs and vanilla extract in a bowl and beat well. Add cream cheese and beat until smooth. In a shallow bowl, combine the cream cheese mixture with 1/2 cup of the sugar and 1/2 tsp of the cinnamon. Arrange fruit slices in a single layer on a plate and sprinkle with remaining sugar and remaining 1/2 tsp cinnamon. Spread cream cheese mixture on bread slices and top with fruit slices. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until set and lightly golden. Serve with sweet cream for dipping.

Melt 1 Tbs. unsalted butter in a small bowl in the microwave or a small skillet over medium heat. Whisk in the lemon juice and parsley and season to taste with black pepper and a few grinds of red pepper flakes. Preheat the broiler and line a baking sheet with foil. Lay the shrimp on the foil and brush both sides with the butter mixture. Broil for 2 minutes and flipcontinue to broil until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 1 minute more. Serve the shrimp with the remaining butter mixture on the side for dipping.

To make the crust, place flour in medium bowl. Add butter or shortening and use hands or pastry blender to cut in until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle with ice water and stir until dough holds together. Roll dough out and fit it into a 9-inch pie plate. Flute edges. Place in freezer for 20 minutes or until firm. To make filling, combine thawed raspberries in heavy saucepan. Add sugar and tapioca and cook over low heat until mixture thickens and is clear, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice. Pour filling into crust. Bake in preheated 400 degrees f. Oven for 50 minutes or until filling bubbles. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. In small saucepan, combine sour cream and cinnamon and heat until warm. Spread over top of cooled pie. Serves 8.

Melt butter and golden syrup together and add copha and condensed milk, stirring well. Stir in crushed biscuits and mix well. Press into a 20cm square tin lined with baking paper. Bake at 180c for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely. Melt chocolate and spread over bars and then sprinkle with slivered almonds. Set aside for chocolate to set. Cut into 24 pieces.

Combine the first eight ingredients in a bowl. Add the zucchini and onions and mix well. Add the breadcrumbs and mix to incorporate. Form into 4 patties and pan-fry or broil until golden brown. Serve with your favorite sauce or dip.

In a saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add sugar and cook until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat, cool slightly. In a bowl of an electric mixer, beat together egg, flour and vanilla until smooth. Add cooled butter mixture, beating until combined well. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface and knead lightly. Roll dough out to 1/4-inch thickness. Using a floured 2-inch biscuit cutter, cut rounds from dough and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until light brown. Cool completely on wire racks. In a small bowl, mix together sugar and 1 tbsp of the water until sugar dissolves. Gradually whisk in remaining water until desired consistency is reached. Drizzle over cooled biscuits. In a small bowl, beat together butter, powdered sugar, orange zest and juice. Spread onto bottom of serving dishset aside. Place a layer of wafers in bottom of dishtop with a layer of bisc

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add sugarcook and stir until mixture boils. Remove from heatstir in milk and cocoa until smooth. Stir in oats and coconut. Press mixture into a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely. Crumble oatmeal mixture. Mix walnuts and vanilla. Sprinkle over oatmeal mixture. Let stand 30 minutes or until cool. Makes 24.

Pre-heat the oven to gas mark 4. Cream the butter and brown sugar together and beat in the treacle, eggs and spices. Sift the flours together and then mix into the mixture until well blended. Chill for at least 2 hours before cooking. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to approx. 4mm thick and cut into shapes with a gingerbread cutter. Bake in the pre-heated oven for about 12-15 minutes until well risen and golden brown on the edges. Cool on a wire rack before storing in an airtight box. These are best when freshly baked and will keep for a few days.
This recipe has been viewed 2114 times.

Heat 1/2 of the vegetable oil in a 12-inch saute pan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the other 1/2 cup oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the corn and cook until the kernels are lightly browned and tender, about 10 minutes. Season with the salt and black pepper. Add the nutmeg. Combine the eggs and milk in a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until frothy. Fold the cooked onions and the corn into the eggs. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and bake until the top is golden brown and the center is firm to the touch, 30 to 40 minutes. Crumble the cheese on top and bake until golden brown and the center is firm to the touch, 5 minutes more. Let stand at room temperature until cool enough to handle. Cut into squares and serve.

Steam all vegetables until tender. In a small bowl combine margarine, lemon juice and seasonings. Melt margarine in small saucepan. Add lemon juice mixture. Stir until well blended. Pour over vegetables and serve.

Combine milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan and heat until the mixture just comes to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and set aside until the mixture is room temperature. Put the cream in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment (or in a large bowl if you don't have an electric mixer). Whisk the cream on medium speed until soft peaks form. Combine the gingerroot, honey and egg yolks in a small bowl and whisk until well combined. Gradually whisk the hot milk mixture into the yolk mixture. (The milk mixture may be hot enough that the yolks will scramble if you whisk too quickly). When the mixture is well combined, gradually whisk the mixture back into the cream. Pour the mixture through a sieve into a large bowl. Cover the bowl tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate until very cold (at least 8 hours). Churn the mixture according to the manufacturer's instructions. The gingerroot will turn the ice cream a pale yellow color.

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the skim milk, honey and ginger. Cook until it is warm but not boiling. Add the cloves and red pepper and cook for 1 more minute. Stir in the unsweetened cocoa and the vanilla until smooth. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of ground ginger on top.

Cook spaghetti according to package directionsdrainset aside.In a large skillet heat butter over medium heat. Add mushroomscook 5 minutes, or until tenderset aside.In a large bowl combine spaghetti, turkey, mushrooms, soup, sour cream, parsley, salt and pepper.Toss until well blended.Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dishtop with additional parsley.Bake for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

In a large bowl combine cereal, pretzel nuggets and spaghetti sauce mix. Set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add oil and garlic powder. Stir constantly until garlic is lightly browned. Remove from heat and pour over cereal mixture. Mix well. Spread onto wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container.
I like to make a large batch of these and freeze them.
I have been making this for years but add chopped green olives.
I make these for my 3 yr. old. She loves them. I don't put them in the oven. I put them in a glass pie plate. I also add a couple of canned diced tomatoes.
I like to use the crumb crust to make them more like a "real" pizza. I add garlic to the crust before adding the sauce, and I also add some garlic to the sauce.
I like to use a crumb crust. I use a little extra sauce and topping than the recipe calls for. I also add garlic to the crust before adding

Brown the chops in oil in a Dutch oven or large skillet. Add onion soup mix and vegetables. Stir together. Add broth. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Add rice. Stir well. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until meat is tender. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce salad.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat until it begins to smoke. Add mushrooms and saute for 5 minutes. Add butter and garlic to skilletsaute for another 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and golden brown. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or keep warm for serving later.
In a small saucepan bring milk to boil. Stir in tea and cinnamon. Reduce heat to low and cook for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve hot in a bowl. Dust with cinnamon. Serve hot.

Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan, add the onions and fry gently for 10 minutes. Add the garlic and fry for a further 1 minute. Stir in the passata and turmeric powder and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the garam masala powder and green cardamom seeds and simmer for a further 10 minutes. Add the salt. Serve with meat or vegetables.

Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add butter, shallot and saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook until tomatoes are tender about 10 minutes. In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook potatoes for about 15 minutes until tender. Drain them and mash them with butter and sour cream. Add chicken stock and mash some more. Add tomatoes and their cooking liquid and stir to combine with mashed potatoes. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
name: paprika potato wedges
ingredients: baking potatoes, vegetable oil, paprika, salt
preparation:Heat the oven to 425.
Scrub the potatoes, rinse, and pat dry.
Cut each potato length ways into 8 wedges.
Put the wedges in a roasting tin, drizzle over the oil and toss well to coat the potatoes.
Sprinkle with the paprika and salt.
Roast potatoes for 35-

Place the tortillas in the bottom of a 2 qt baking dish and top with a layer of refried beans and a layer of enchilada sauce. Repeat this procedure twice. Sprinkle with onion and cheese and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Chop broccoli into florets. Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a wok. Stir-fry garlic, red chili peppers for 15 seconds. Add broccoli florets. Stir-fry for 10-15 seconds. Pour in the dark soy sauce. Stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes. Transfer onto a serving dish.
I am a very big fan of your website.
I made the Spicy Broccoli today. It is so delicious. My family loved it! Thank you for all the recipes.
I love your website!! I just made the lemon-broccoli/peppers recipe today. It was soooo good. I had never added lemon to it before. It was really really yummy. Thanks for all the great recipes.

Pound chicken breast halves with a heavy rolling pin or meat mallet to about 1/2-inch thick. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 5 minutes, turning once. Remove and set aside. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in soup. Add garlic salt and paprika. Cook for 1 minute. Lay chicken breasts on top of mushroom mixture. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve over hot rice.

Beat together the cream and the lemon juice until the cream is slightly thickened. Beat in the cream cheese and then the lemon zest. Spoon into serving glasses and refrigerate overnight. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

In skillet over medium high heat melt the butter and add the garlic and parsley. Saute until garlic is fragrant and golden. Add the white wine and let it boil until reduced by half. Add the cream and salt and pepper to taste. Add the scallops and saute until they are cooked through. Remove from heat and stir in the scallions. Serve over linguine.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine first four ingredients until blended. Add cake mix and blend until just mixed together. Drop onto ungreased baking sheet by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart. Bake 10 minutes until firm to the touch. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat the oven to 190 degrees c/375 degrees f. Butter a baking pan. Cut tomatoes into 1/2-inch slices, discarding seeds. Put the bread crumbs in a large bowl, add the basil and chives, and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. In another bowl, beat the butter with the egg until smooth. Put the flour in a shallow bowl. Dip the tomato slices first in the flour, then dip in the egg mixture, and finally into the bread-crumb mixture. Place the bread-crumb-coated slices on the buttered baking pan, brush with a little more butter if desired, sprinkle with the parmesan cheese, and bake for 15-20 minutes, until the cheese is lightly browned and the slices are tender. Makes 8 servings.

Combine fruit and marshmallows in a large bowl. Gently stir in sour cream. Divide fruit mixture evenly into four bowls. Sprinkle evenly with coconut. Place a lettuce leaf on the bottom of the bowl and top with maraschino cherry. Place the bowl of fruit on top of the lettuce leaf. Garnish with the cherry. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a wok over a high flame. Add the pork and stir-fry until lightly browned. Add the soy sauce and pepper. Add the ginger, broth and cabbage. Bring to a boil. Add the noodles. Cook for about 1 minute, or until the pork is done. Stir well. Remove from heat. Serve hot.

Heat the oil in a 10-inch saute pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion, garlic and baby spinach. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the creme fraiche and feta, season with salt & pepper. Serve with pita chips or vegetable crudites.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a large roasting pan. Melt 2 Tbsp. Butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown chicken on both sides. Transfer to prepared pan. In a bowl mix remaining melted butter with dry bread crumbs and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Spread evenly over top of the chicken. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake in preheated 350 degrees f. Oven until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear, about 45 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve with lemon slices and hot cooked rice.

Cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain and rinse under cold running water until cold. Combine pasta, ham, cheese and olives in a large bowl. Add broccoli florets and celery and toss gently. Add mayonnaise and toss again. Chill thoroughly before serving. Serve with additional ham and/or olives, if desired.

Spread each side of the bread with the margarine. Sprinkle both sides of the bread generously with the onion salt and garlic salt. Place the bread pieces on the baking sheet. Bake for 5-7 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle both sides of the bread generously with the corn flakes. Return the bread to the oven for another 3-4 minutes or until the corn flakes turn golden. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese on top of the bread. Serve warm.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the whole milk, salt, maple syrup and egg yolks until well combined. Turn off the heat. Whisk in the heavy cream and egg whites until smooth. Return the pan over medium heat. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-low heat and cook, stirring constantly until the mixture is thickened slightly, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from the heat and whisk in the vanilla extract and maple extract. Pour the mixture into ramekins or custard cups. Top each with a few grates of nutmeg. Refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving.
The word "custard" comes from the latin "crust" (meaning curd) via "custare" (meaning to take care of) - this is because the original custards were made from curdled milk or cream.
The ancient Greeks knew custards made of egg yolks and honey.
Eggs were first added to custards in the Middle Ages in England.
Custards made with egg yolks became known as "crumbles" in

Brown ground beef with onion and green peppers. Drain. Add mushrooms. Pour in ketchup and relish. Stir. Add cheese. Simmer until cheese is melted. Serve over prepared mustard. Spread on hot dog buns. Serve with pickle chips.
Combine all of the ingredients and form into patties. Heat the oil and deep fry in batches until golden brown.

Combine the soy sauce, cider vinegar, and sugar and bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. While the glaze is cooking, heat the oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add the chilies to the skillet and cook for 1 minute or until crisp. Drain the oil from the skillet. Add the chicken to the skillet. Add the glaze to the skillet, cover, and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side or until the chicken is cooked through. Spread the glaze on the bottom halves of the rolls. Top with the cheese, and add the chicken to the rolls. Top the sandwiches with the tops of the rolls. Serve with the crisp chilies.

Cook the penne in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Meanwhile heat the butter and garlic in a large skillet over medium heat until the butter melts. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook until thickened. Season with the parsley, salt and pepper. Add the milk and cook until thickened. Stir in the cooked penne and parmesan cheese. Toss well. Serve immediately.

In a heavy skillet heat the bacon drippings until hot and sizzling. Add the onion and the garlic. Stir in the cayenne pepper. Cook until onions are soft and clear. Add the oysters and bacon. Cook until the juices are thick. Add the dry bread crumbs. Cook until they are soft and moist. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve.

Melt butter in a large pot and saute the onion until they are a little brown. Add the flour and stir for a minute or two. Add the milk and stir until blended. Stir in the broth and seasonings and let simmer for 30 minutes over medium heat. Stir in the egg yolks and remove from heat. Serve hot in bowls and top with a sprinkling of parsley.
French Onion Soup was first introduced as an appetizer in Paris in 1761 by a chef named Antoine Beauvilliers at the famous restaurant La Grande Taverne de Londres. French Onion Soup is a tasty, rich soup made with caramelized onions and aromatic broth or beef stock and is usually served with a piece of french bread and cheese baked on top.
I am not a big fan of the French Onion Soup served in restaurants because they usually add too much salt and/or MSG and the broth is not thick enough for me.
But I love to make it at home because I can control the amount of seasoning and I like to use a thick

In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in orange rind and liqueur. Simmer until liquid is reduced by half, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Stir in nuts until coated. Place on baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees f until toasted and fragrant. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt to taste. Cool completely on wire rack. Store in an airtight container.

In a small bowl combine brown sugar, vinegar, and cumin. Rub the mixture evenly over the pork loin chops. Grill over medium heat until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 160 degrees. Let the meat rest for about 5 minutes. Serve with a side of rice or potatoes.
I am thinking of making some ribs tonight. I've been looking through the forums here and I am not sure what to do. I've made ribs before but they weren't baby back ribs. I've also been looking in my cookbooks and I'm not sure what to do. I've heard of smoking them but I don't know what to do. I also was thinking of making the ribs in the crockpot and then just finishing them on the grill. What do you guys think? Thanks for the help.
I'm having a grilling party next week and I'd like to make something that is a little different. I've made steaks on the grill before but I don't think it would really fit the theme of this party. Does anyone know how to make pizza on the gr

Melt margarine over medium heat in a frying pan. Place bread slices face down into the margarine. Sprinkle the swiss cheese onto the first slice of bread. Top the swiss cheese with the tomato and yellow bell pepper slices. Top the vegetables with the sliced olives. Place the second piece of bread on top and close the sandwich. Cook until both sides are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Cut the sandwich into halves and serve.

In a large saucepan combine all the filling ingredients and cook over medium heat until the mixture is smooth and the onions are tender. In a 1 1/2 qt. Casseroles or baking dish layer half the mixture with the carrots and top with the remaining mixture. Cover the casseroles and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until hot throughout and the cheese is melted and golden brown. Uncover and sprinkle with the bread crumbs. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until the bread crumbs are browned and the top is bubbly. Serve immediately.

Combine garlic powder, salt and pepper in a resealable plastic bag. Add the roasting chickens and shake until evenly coated on all sides. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. To prepare the glaze, combine apricot preserves, sweet chili sauce and soy sauce in a small bowl and set aside. Preheat the grill to medium high heat. Cook chickens on grill for about 8 minutes per side (total of about 16 minutes) until cooked through and well charred on the outside (remember they will continue cooking after removed from the heat). During the last several minutes of cooking, brush the glaze over the top of the roasting chickens. Remove from heat and let rest for at least 2 minutes before serving with scallions and ginger. Serve with steamed rice and a side salad.

Mix the first six ingredients together in a bowl. Form into small meatballs and place in a lightly greased casserole dish. Beat the eggs in a small bowl and stir in the tomato sauce and water. Pour over the meatballs and cover the dish. Bake for 45 minutes at 375f until cooked through. Serve over spaghetti or other pasta and garnished with parmesan cheese if desired.

Combine the first five ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Place the pheasants in a glass baking dish and cover with the marinade mixture. Turn the pheasants over and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove the pheasants from the baking dish and let rest for at least 10 minutes before carving and serving.

In a small skillet over medium-low heat, cook the corn and the red onion in the butter and the olive oil until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Add the edamame and the sherry wine and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large stainless steel saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the lemon rind and ginger. Simmer 3 minutes longer. Ladle the mixture into hot sterilized jars and seal with 2 piece lids. Process in hot water bath for 10 minutes.

Spray 9" x 13" pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine peanuts and butter until blended. Press mixture into prepared pan. Bake at 400° for 10 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes. Stir in chocolate chips until melted and smooth. Spread over peanut mixture and press down slightly with back of spoon. Bake 3 minutes longer or until set. Remove from oven and stir in marshmallows and salt. Press down slightly with back of spoon and spread evenly. Bake an additional 2 minutes or until marshmallows begin to brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet. Mix egg white and 3 teaspoons of water together in a bowl until frothy. Add brown sugar and stir until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir until well blended. Place pecans, almonds and cashews into the mixture and stir to coat evenly. Spread out onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and stir occasionally until completely cooled. Store at room temperature.

Put the chicken legs into a saucepan with enough water for them to cover. Add onion, carrot and pepper. Bring to a boil and simmer for about half hour until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the legs from the water and shred them. Return the meat to the pan with the liquid and bring it to a boil. Add the sour cream and the milk and cook for a few more minutes, until the sauce is thickened. Serve the chicken and sauce over boiled rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In medium bowl, combine crackers, egg and milk until smooth. Press into 9-inch square pan coated with cooking spray. Bake 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine brown sugar and baking powder. Add eggbeat until smooth. Stir in milk and vanilla until smooth. Pour over baked cracker mixturespread evenly. Bake 12-14 minutes or until light golden brown. Sprinkle with coconut and cherries. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into squares.
name: strawberry cheesecakeingredients: graham cracker pie crust, sweetened condensed milk, cream cheese, whipped cream, strawberry pie fillingpreparation: In a medium saucepan combine the cream cheese, condensed milk and vanilla extract over medium heat until melted and well blended. Remove from heat and pour into prepared pie shell. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Remove from fridge and top with whipped cream and strawberry pie filling. Sprinkle with graham cra

Cut tops off each pepper. Remove seeds. Stuff each pepper with 1 ounce of potatoes and 1 tablespoon of sausage. Replace tops. Secure with toothpicks. Grill over medium heat for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cut tops off each pepper. Remove seeds. Stuff each pepper with 1 ounce of potatoes and 1 tablespoon of sausage. Replace tops. Secure with toothpicks. Grill over medium heat for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Melt butter in a large frying pan and add mushrooms. Sprinkle with some salt & freshly ground black pepper and fry until mushrooms have softened. Add white wine and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add salmon and cover pan. Cook for a further 3 minutes. Turn off heat. Drain salmon and set aside. Bring cream to a boil and then pour it over the mushrooms. Add fresh tarragon and some fresh lemon juice. Season to taste. To serve: Heat up the mushrooms and pour over a bed of your favourite greens. Place the salmon on top and serve immediately. Serves 1.

Arrange half of the potato slices in slow cooker. Top with remaining slices. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup mushroom soup mix and 1/2 cup skim milk. Repeat layers once. Sprinkle top with 2 tablespoons pimento and remaining 1/4 cup mushroom soup mix and 1/4 cup skim milk. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 6 to 8 hours. Stir before serving. Sprinkle with shredded low-fat cheddar cheese if desired. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 180C. Butter an 8-inch square cake pan or a round one with a diameter of around 8 inches (20 cm). Blend butter with sugar and vanilla until creamy. Beat in egg yolks, one at a time. Combine flour and baking powder in a separate bowl. Beat in a bit of flour mixture at a time until you have a smooth batter. Fold in whole almonds and jam. Pour into your prepared pan. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy. Beat in salt. Continue beating until stiff peaks form. Spoon meringue in dollops over batter. Bake for around 40 minutes or until meringue is golden and cooked through. Remove from oven and cool.
name: frazipan danish almond cakeingredients: almond paste, sugar, butter, eggs, cake flourpreparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grate the almond paste. Add butter and sugar, mix well. Add eggs gradually, stir with whisk until fully incorpor

Cook potatoes in large pan with boiling water until tender. Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion, green pepper, and soup mix until tender. Stir in the potatoes. Cook over low heat 15 to 20 minutes.
Boil peas until just tenderdrain. Cool, then combine in a large bowl with remaining ingredients. Mix well and refrigerate until serving time. Serve over lettuce leaves or in a lettuce bowl.

In a medium skillet, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the condensed cream of potato soup and the condensed cream of celery soup and 4 cups of the milk. Heat through and pour into a 1 1/2 quart casserole. In a medium bowl combine the remaining 1 1/2 cup milk, the half-and-half, and the dry sherry. Add the crab and mix well. Pour the mixture over the soup in the casserole. Sprinkle with paprika and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

I have a feeling that the crabby appetizer is going to be a huge hit.
I love seafood of all kinds but I’m not a big fan of seafood salads. I don’t know why.
The other hot crab dip recipe looks so good. I want to try that one out.
I’m not really a huge fan of seafood

Halve the oranges and squeeze out juice. Cut strawberries into pieces. In a glass jug or pitcher, place pomegranates and add orange juice. Stir. Add sugar and lemon juice. Add strawberries to jug. Stir. Serve cold. Garnish with mint leaf. Makes 8, 8 oz. servings.
name: pomegranate and poppy seed salad
ingredients: romaine lettuce, red onion, pomegranate seeds, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, white vinegar, poppy seeds
preparation:In a large bowl, mix the romaine, onion and pomegranate seeds. In a small bowl, mix the remaining ingredients until well blended. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.
name: pomegranate banana salad
ingredients: pomegranate seeds, banana, sugar, bell pepper, sweet onion, vinegar, olive oil, pomegranate molasses, salt
prepar
Pour whiskey and lime juice in a shaker filled with ice and shake until the outside of the shaker becomes frosted. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Mix all together in small bowl. Set aside for at least 1 hour for flavors to marry. Serve with roasted vegetables or steamed rice.

Heat oven to 375. Beat together eggs and milk. Lay hamburgers in bottom of greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Pour egg mixture over top. Sprinkle with chilies. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and set.
The most difficult part of this recipe is waiting for it to be ready. I love this recipe because it is so easy to throw together and the flavors just blend so well together. My husband loves it too!
I have made this recipe many times. It is quick and easy and it's a crowd pleaser. I have tried making it with different types of sausage and they all work out well. My family loves it and I have a feeling yours will too.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8x8 baking dish with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. In another bowl, combine the sugar, egg, orange juice, orange zest and extract. Mix together the melted butter and cream cheese. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Spread evenly into the baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Cool completely before removing from the pan. Drizzle with powdered sugar.

Chop the tomatoes. Boil the water and sugar. Add the tomatoes. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Leave to cool. Squeeze out the excess water from the mixture. Add the onion. Season with the salt and the pepper. Add the flour. Mix well. Form small patties. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Pan-fry the patties until golden brown. Garnish with mint. Serve hot.

Combine oil and spices in bowl and whisk well. Add lime juice and whisk again. Add shrimp and toss to coat evenly with marinade. Refrigerate covered for 1 hour. Grill or broil until pink and opaque inside. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over top.
I'm not sure what they would be like since I've never eaten them. They look like they would be delicious though. I'm sure if you google them you would find some good recipes.

Bring water to boil in large pot over high heat. Add baby carrotscook 8-10 minutes or until just tender. Drain well on paper towelscool slightly. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heatadd sugar and cook 2-3 minutes or until mixture begins to boil. Stir in bourbon and saltcook 1 minute. Add carrotstoss to coat with sauce. Sprinkle with brown sugarcook over medium-low heat just until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heatadd parsley. Serve immediately.

Cut prosciutto into 6 inch lengths. Lay a slice of prosciutto on a flat work surface. Place a ball of mozzarella on the prosciutto. Fold the prosciutto around the cheese and twist to form a roll. Secure the prosciutto around the mozzarella using toothpicks. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the oil. Place the rolls in the skillet and brown well on both sides. Sprinkle with the pepper and serve with salad greens.

Steam cauliflower until just barely crisp-tender. Drain. In a bowl combine margarine, crumbs, garlic powder, basil and oregano. Mix well. Spread mixture over cauliflower. Bake at 400 degrees for about 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Trim ends from radishes. Peel radishes. Slice into matchsticks. Combine radishes, yellow bell peppers, carrots, next 3 ingredients (vinegar through dill), mustard oil and next 2 ingredients (salt through pepper), tossing well. Refrigerate up to 1 hour.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add sausage and brown. Add onion and carrot. Saute for about 3 minutes. Add seasoning. Add chicken broth and bring to boil. Add kale to soup. Lower heat and simmer covered for 10 minutes. Add ditalini pasta. Simmer for about 2 minutes or until pasta is tender but not mushy. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Place couscous in a large heatproof bowl. Add 400 ml of the stock and stir to combine. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and leave in a warm place for 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in apricots, sultanas and mint. Add chicken and dressing and toss gently to combine. Serve sprinkled with nuts and toasted seeds.
I'm a big fan of the Mediterranean food. This looks great!
I've never heard of cous-cous before. I'm going to try it out! Thanks!
I love this stuff. I have a recipe that I love.
It's a great side. It's a bit like rice, but a little bit crunchy.
This looks great. I love the Mediterranean flavors. I love the way you have the dish broken down into easy to follow steps.
I love all these dishes.
This looks really great. I have never tried it.
I'd love to try this. It looks delicious!

Combine first 3 ingredients in a sauce pan. Heat to boiling and simmer for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and simmer for another 5 minutes. Place salmon in an ungreased 13 inch x 9 inch baking dish. Pour dressing mixture over fish. Bake at 350 f for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Peel honeydew rinds & cut fruit into bite-size pieces. In a food processor or blender, puree honeydews & lime juice. Add honey & honeydew balls, if desired. Stir in yogurt. Cover & refrigerate until chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Cut fish into 1cm cubes. Heat 2 tbsp oil in wok over high heat. Cook fish in batches for 1-2 minutes or until cooked through. Remove and set aside. Add remaining oil. Stir-fry vegetables until just tender-crisp. Add broccoli and fish to wok. Toss to combine. Cook for a further minute until heated through. Serve with hokkien noodles and teriyaki marinade.
Cook shallots with margarine until shallots are translucent. Add green beans and chicken broth. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add salt to taste. Sprinkle with grated parmesan.

Rinse catfish fillets and soak in buttermilk 2 hours or overnight. Drain off buttermilkpat dry. Dredge in cornmealremove excess cornmeal by shaking off excess meal over a large plate or baking sheet. Dip in flourremove excess meal by shaking off excess meal over a large plate or baking sheet. Place in a large skilletadd enough vegetable oil to cover bottom of pan about 1/4 inch deep. Over medium heat fry the catfish until crispy on both sidesdrain excess oil on paper towelssprinkle lightly with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Hull and slice strawberries. In a medium bowl, combine strawberries and sugar. Set aside for 1 hour to marinate. In a large bowl combine sour cream and whipped topping. Fold in marinated strawberries. Spoon into a 1 quart serving bowl and chill. Garnish with whole strawberries and serve.

In a heavy saucepan combine water and salt. Cook over medium heat until salt is dissolved. Stir in long grain rice and cook uncovered over medium heat for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in mushrooms, onion and butter. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Melt cream cheese in microwave. Add eggs and milk and mix well. Pour mixture over rice and stir gently. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Uncover and bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a small saucepan, combine first 4 ingredients with 1/4 cup watermix well. Stir in milkbring to a boil over medium heatcook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in remaining 1/2 cup water and vanilla. Pour into mugssprinkle with cinnamon stickserve with whipped cream.

Cook spaghetti until al dente. Meanwhile cook bacon in olive oil until crispy. Slice zucchini into 1/4 inch rounds and slice tomatoes in half. Heat up pesto in the microwave until warm. Drain pasta and stir in pesto, bacon and zucchini and tomatoes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve warm.

In a medium skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels. Drain fat from pan. In the pan, saute onion and red and green peppers. Remove from pan. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs. Stir in sauteed vegetables. Stir in bacon. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with toast or biscuits.

Place the chickpeas in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped. Add the remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Serve with pita chips or sliced baguette bread. Makes 4 cups.

Prepare a pot of brewed coffee in a coffee maker, using one level scoop of coffee for every cup of water. To each cup of brewed coffee add a teaspoon of honey and two teaspoons of coconut milk. The milk can be warmed first if desired but it is not necessary. Add a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes and a whole clove for each cup of brewed coffee.

Place the potatoes in a large saucepan. Add enough water to cover them by about an inch. Bring to boil, reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Let cool slightly. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon to paper towel to drain. Discard all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease. In a medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, chicken broth, dijon mustard, vinegar, salt and pepper. Add the potatoes and toss to coat. Add the bacon, green onions and parsley. Toss to combine. Serve at room temperature.

In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, salt and set aside. In another large bowl beat together butter, both sugars and vanilla until light and creamy. Add egg and beat until incorporated. Add dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in chips and nuts and spread in prepared pan. Bake for about 30 minutes or until set and golden brown around edges. Remove from oven and sprinkle with toffee bits if desired. Cool completely on a wire rack before cutting.
I hope you have a chance to try these recipes out. I know I will!

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and saute 6 minutes or until browned. Remove from pan. Add broth and curry powder to skilletstir until smooth. Add couscous. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Spray 13 x 9 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Pour in chicken mixturecover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 5 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.
1. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in vegetables and cook 2 minutes.
2. Combine remaining ingredients except lettuce in a small bowl. Stir until well blended. Pour over chicken mixturecover and simmer 2 minutes.
3. Spray 2 8-inch round pizza pans with cooking spray. Spoon 1/2 mixture into each pan

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Spread 1 tablespoon of the olive salad on the top halves and bottom halves of the bread. Layer 1 slice of ham on the bottom half and 1 slice of mortadella on the top half. Top the bottom half with 1 slice of salami and top with the other half. Flip the sandwich over and top with the other halves. Grill the sandwiches over medium heat until the bread is browned and the cheeses melted. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan combine the almond oil, honey, water, sugar and salt. Cook over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the almonds and stir until well coated. Spread them in an ungreased jelly roll pan and bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Let cool completely. Store in an airtight container in a cool dry place or freeze for up to 1 month.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 4 individual 6-oz ramekins with melted butter or olive oil. Sprinkle bottom and sides evenly with 1 tbsp amaretti crumbs to coattap out any excess. Divide rice among ramekinsset aside.In a small saucepan, bring milk to a simmerremove from heat. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, remaining amaretti crumbs, and a pinch of saltmix well. Add milkwhisk to combine. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heatcook until thickened and bubbling, about 2 minutes (do not boil). Divide mixture evenly among ramekinstop with a small piece (1/2-inch square) white chocolate (if desired). Transfer to ovenbake until tops are golden brown and set, about 20 minutes. Let cool slightlyserve warm or at room temperature.

Brown ground beef, onions in large skillet until browned. Drain off fat. Add pasta sauce. Stir. Add pasta. Bring to a boil. Simmer covered for 12-15 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in mushrooms. Heat through. Sprinkle with cheese.

Melt butter in 5-6 quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat until foaming. Add beef cubescook and stir until brown on all sides. Stir in onioncook 2-3 minutes longer or until onion is tender. Add carrot slices and potatoescover and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Add green peppercook 3-4 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in beef broth, gravy mix, soy sauce, garlic powder and pepper until smooth. Cover and simmer 10-15 minutes longer or until beef is tender. Makes 6 servings.

Sauté bacon in large saucepan until crisp. Add onion and celerysauté until onion is golden. Add rice and stir until all grains are coated with fat. Add broth. Bring to a boilcover tightly and simmer 15 minutes. Add chervil and pepperstir. Add cornstir. Cover. Simmer 5 minutes more or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand, covered, 15 minutes. Stir in parsley.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with wax paper. Combine sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla in a bowlset aside. Place egg white in a small bowlbeat until frothy. Fold in nuts until well coated in egg white, then roll in cinnamon sugar mixture to coat. Spread nuts out on baking sheetsbake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring every 5 minutes. Cool completelystore in an airtight container.
name: Cinnamon Sugar Almonds
preparation: In a large, heavy bottomed, skillet place the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring constantly, until almost all the water has evaporated. About 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon and salt and cook until the sugar has dried on the almonds. About 2 minutes. Pour onto a large sheet pan and let cool.
name: Candied Almonds
preparation:B

Cut red peppers into 1/4-inch diceset aside. Heat 1 Tbs. oil in small skillet over medium heatadd garliccook until light golden brown. Immediately add spinachtoss with hot garlic for 30 seconds. Add red peppers, hot pepper flakes, and 2 Tbs. watercook until mixture is softened but still crisp (about 1 minute). Remove from heattoss with 1 Tbs. olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet brown the ziti in the butter for about 15 minutes. Add the garlic powder to the skillet. Add the cream cheese to the skillet. Melt the cream cheese while stirring. Add the milk to the skillet. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the Parmesan cheese and the ground black pepper. Cook until the Parmesan cheese is melted. Remove the mixture from the heat. Stir in the Parsley flakes. Toss the ziti with the sauce.
I really like your blog. I’m very impressed. I’m going to check out your other posts.
I am a big fan of Alfredo sauce…the best is to get a good quality of pasta to go with it.

Preheat oven to 400F. Scrape the corn from 3 cobs into a blender. Add 1/2 cup water and 1 chipotle. Cover and blend until smooth. Place the corn mixture in an 8-cup casserole. Stir in 1 1/2 cups water. Bake until slightly thickened, about 30 minutes. Season with salt. Spoon into bowls. Sprinkle with feta.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine refried beans and onion in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Transfer mixture to a 12-inch oven-safe platter. Top with half the white corn tortilla chips. Bake for 3 minutes or until heated. Sprinkle the jalapeno over the beans. Top with remaining chips. Spread the chili over the top of the chips. Top with the cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Garnish the platter with the remaining toppings and serve immediately.

In skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add pork loin chops. Cook for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and onion. Continue cooking for 2 minutes. Add salt. Place a lid on skillet. Cook until meat is done. Add red wine. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley. Serve with noodles or rice.

Peel the okra and cut it lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips. Slice the onion. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the okra and fry it for 3 minutes. Add the onion and ginger and fry for 2 minutes more. Add the spices, water, and salt to taste. Cover the pan tightly and simmer for 10 minutes more. Add the lemon juice, turn off the heat, and serve.
green chili recipes -- green chili recipes - great recipes for green chili on epicurious.com.

In a small bowl, beat egg yolks until thick and lemon yellow. Beat in sweetened condensed milk, then squeeze in juice from half a lemon. Stir until well blended. Pour into a baked pie shell. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. To serve, top each slice with a dollop of whipped cream and a slice of lemon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. Sift together 1 1/2 cup of the flour and the baking powder and set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the vegetable oil and white sugar. Add the eggs and beat well. Stir in the remaining 1 1/2 cup of flour alternately with the buttermilk. Fold in the rhubarb and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and the quick cooking oats. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining 3 tablespoons of flour and the cinnamon. Dip the rhubarb pieces into the melted butter and roll in the brown sugar and oats mixture. Alternately place a layer of rhubarb and a layer of batter in the prepared pan. Sprinkle with the cinnamon mixture. Bake for 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes on a wire rack. Serve warm with a dusting of powdered

In a large mixing bowl beat together the butter, sugar, eggnog and vanilla. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon and nutmegstir into the egg mixture. Cover and refrigerate for about one hour. Preheat oven to 350. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough 1/8 inch thick. Cut with a floured 3 inch cookie cutter. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove to wire racks to cool. Yield: About 3 dozen.

Melt butter in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add the flour and stir constantly. Cook for a few minutes and then add the evaporated milk. Stir until mixture is thick. Add the milk and the cheeses, stirring constantly. Add the cayenne pepper and the salt. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add the macaroni. Cook for a few minutes longer. Put in a casserole dish and bake uncovered in a preheated 350 degree oven until the cheese is golden. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large frying pan. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, soy sauce, and gingerroot. Remove the giblets from the chicken, and cut the back off of the neck. Slice the breast meat from the fryers. Pound the cutlets to 1/4 to 1/2-inch thickness. Combine the lemon juice mixture and the marinade ingredients. Add the chicken to the marinade and mix well. Place the chicken into a large zip-lock bag or into a bowl if you don't have a bag. Chill the marinated chicken overnight. Heat the frying pan over medium-high heat until hot. Add the oil to the pan. Add the marinated cutlets. Cook until the meat is browned. Turn and cook the other side. When the meat is browned and the juices are running clear, remove from the pan. Remove the giblets from the neck and cut the meat away from the bones. Serve the chicken over a bed of rice.

Heat a large cast iron skillet over high heat. Add a bit of oil. Brown the sausage. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add another bit of oil to the pan. Brown the ground beef. Add the cayenne and black pepper. Cook, stirring frequently for 2-3 minutes. Add the onion, celery, and peppers. Cook until the veggies are softened. Add the sausage. Stir to combine. Add the uncooked long grain rice. Stir to combine. Add 1 tsp salt. Stir to combine. Add 1 cup water. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cover the pan with a lid. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir. Add the remaining 1/2 cup water. Cook until the water is absorbed. Remove the lid. Fluff the rice with a fork. Cook for 1 more minute. Remove from the heat. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9 inch baking pan with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cardamom and baking powder. Add butter and cut in using a pastry blender until mixture is crumbly. In a small bowl combine egg and milk. Add to flour mixture and combine. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes. While the cake is baking combine oatmeal, butter and vanilla in a small bowl. Spread over the top of the warm cake. Spoon lingonberry preserves on top of the streusel topping. Serve at room temperature.

Drain and slice the kosher dills. Mix all the other ingredients together and pour over the dill pickles. Leave the dills in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours. Refrigerate.

Peel potatoes and boil them till soft. Mash them till smooth. Cool them down for a few hours. Then add the cream and the butter. Beat them well together. Add the flour little by little till it is the right consistency to roll out thin. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes. Roll it out very thin on a floured board. Then place it in a large cast iron skillet or in a heavy skillet with oil on the bottom. Heat it on both sides on a low heat for 10-15 minutes. Then carefully remove it from the skillet, flip it over a couple of times to get all the oil out of it. Place it on a towel and let it cool down for a few minutes before cutting it into squares with a pizza cutter. Then place each square on a baking sheet lined with waxed paper. Bake them at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until they turn a golden brown color. Serve them with butter or jam or both.

In 2-cup microwave-safe container combine 3/4 cup evaporated skim milk, 1/4 cup light-brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon each ground cinnamon, ground ginger, ground nutmeg and 1/8 teaspoon saltstir well. Beat 1 egg with 1/4 cup cold water with wire whisk. Pour mixture over sugar-spice mixturestir well to blend. Beat 1 egg white until frothyfold into mixture. Microwave on high 4 minutes to 5 minutes or until mixture is set when gently shakenstir after 2 minutes or until almost set. Cool slightly. Pour mixture into 4 greased 3/4-cup microwave-safe custard cups. Microwave on high 15 minutes to 16 minutes or until center is set when gently shakenstir after 10 minutes or until set. Let stand 5 minutesunmold onto serving plates. Serve warm or cool to room temperaturesprinkle with gingerbread crumbs, if desired. Store leftovers

Preheat oven to 350. In medium bowl combine soup, sour cream and flourmix well. Place breasts in shallow baking pan. Spoon mixture over breastssprinkle with seasoning salt and paprika. Bake uncovered 45-50 minutes or until no longer pink in center (170). Top with green onions and serve with liquid browner.

In a 12 inch non stick skillet heat 1 tsp of the olive oil over medium high heat until hot. Add zucchini, onions and garlic and cook, stirring frequently for 1 minute. Add the remaining 1 tsp of the olive oil, the salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently for 1 minute longer or until vegetables are tender crisp. Add the tomatoes and roasted red pepper, cook for 1 minute. Arrange the fish in a single layer over the vegetables in the skillet. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a large bowlbeat with a mixer at medium speed until smooth. Stir in the marshmallows. Pour into an ungreased 13x9-inch baking pancover and freeze for 2 hours. Place the graham crackers in a food processorprocess until finely ground. Combine the graham cracker crumbs, butter, and 1/4 teaspoon of the cocoa in a bowltoss to coat. Spread the graham cracker mixture evenly over the bottom of the pan. Freeze for 1 hour longer. Cut into 4 rows by 4 rows. Garnish with the chocolate bars and miniature marshmallows. Store in the freezer in an airtight container. Makes 16 servings.

In a 3-quart pot saute butter and worcestershire sauce on low heat. Add canned oysters and stir. Add water and russet potato. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Add nutmeg and season with salt and white pepper. Pour in low-fat milk and cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot with crusty bread.

In a large frying pan, combine the squash and garlic cloves and saute for five minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for five to ten more minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce is thick and bubbly. Stir in the basil and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Snap off ends of string beans. Cut into 2-inch pieces. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the onion in butter for 3 minutes. Add the sugar, seasoning salt and garlic powder. Saute for 1 minute more. Stir in the mushrooms and continue cooking until the mushrooms are soft and the liquid evaporates. Add the string beans and stir well. Cook for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in the whipping cream and heat through. Serve hot.

Pour boiling water over the tea bags (2 per quart) in a pitcher. Let stand 5 minutes. Remove the tea bags and stir in the sugar. Add the soda, stirring to dissolve it. Stir in ice cubes or cold water to taste. Makes about 5 quarts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a shallow 2-quart baking panset aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boiladd cabbage, cook for 2 minutes. Drainrinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. Cut the cabbage into bite-sized piecestransfer to prepared pan. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butteradd apples and brown sugarsaute for about 10 minutes or until apples are tender. Remove from heatstir in cinnamon until well mixed. Spread apples evenly over cabbage in pansprinkle evenly with breadcrumbs. Bake for about 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned.

Whisk together the eggs and light cream in a bowl. Add the salt and pepper and Worcestershire sauce and mix well. Heat the butter and oil in a skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Pour in the egg mixture and cook over low heat until almost set - the mixture will not be liquid but it will still be wet and look like slightly scrambled egg. Stir the mixture with a spatula and cook until it has just set. Turn off the heat and let the eggs set for about 1 minute and then stir well again. Serve hot with toast or biscuits.

Put white wine in a large skillet. Add 1/2 tsp. salt to the wine. Heat to boiling and then reduce the heat. Put the fillets in the white wine and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the fillets and let them cool. Make the bread crumbs. In a food processor pulse the breadcrumbs and paprika until the breadcrumbs are fine and evenly colored. In a separate bowl beat the mayonnaise and sour cream together. Put the fish in a baking dish and pour the mayonnaise mixture over the fish. Sprinkle the fish with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow the fish to set for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with lemon wedges and parsley.

Place garlic cloves and chilies in food processor. Puree. Add cheese and pine nuts and puree until smooth. Add parsley and cilantro and puree until combined. With machine running, slowly drizzle in oil until thick and smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Rinse and dry shrimp. Thread shrimp onto skewers and brush with oil. Grill over medium heat until lightly browned and opaque. Remove from grill and brush with pesto. Serve with lime wedges.
Categories: Seafood
