What is the origin of Shrimp?
Shrimp are crustaceans which belong to the decapoda order of marine arthropods. Most of the shrimps are small and are found on the continental shelves of every ocean on Earth. They are widely distributed in the seas of Japan and China.
What are the common varieties of Shrimp?
Shrimps are found in all varieties from tiny to large sizes. Some of the common varieties of Shrimps are the Atlantic Brown S

In a large wok or large skillet over high heat, combine the soy sauce, vinegar and chili sauce. Stir in the oil and ginger and heat for 1 minute. Add the vegetables and cashews and toss until heated through. Transfer to a serving dish and serve hot.
I have always been a fan of cashews and it is probably my favorite nut. I love the sweet and salty combination of the nuts and their creamy texture. Cashews are very versatile and I have found many ways to incorporate them into my diet.
Cashews are very nutritious and contain a lot of health benefits. They are a great source of protein and contain a lot of essential vitamins and minerals.
Cashews are also very low in calories and fat and contain a lot of fiber. They are also a good source of magnesium and potassium.
Cashews are a great snack food and are perfect for on-the-go. They are also a great addition to salads and can be used in many recipes.
Cashews are a delicious and healthy sn

Preheat oven to 400f. Place the breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Pat the salmon dry and dip it in the breadcrumbs. Melt the butter and stir in the cranberries. Place the salmon in a baking pan and sprinkle the cranberry mixture on top. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and top with the green onions and the lemon peel. Let stand for 2 minutes before serving.

To make dressing, combine mayonnaise, lemon rind and fresh lemon juice in small bowlmix well. Combine apples, celery, radishes, onion and cranberries in large bowladd dressing and toss well to coat. Add nutstoss to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve on romaine lettuce leaves or in a pita pocket.

1. Prepare the marzipan and let it rest in the fridge for an hour or so2. Roll out thinly and cut with a fluted pastry cutter or cookie cutters3. Spread with a thin layer of jam and top with a few currants4. Sprinkle with some poppy seeds and a bit of flour5. Bake in a low oven until the edges turn golden brown6. Allow to cool on a wire rack before icing them with royal icing7. If you want to make the royal icing ahead of time then you can make it a day before and store in the fridge8. Once it has hardened it can be placed in a plastic container to store for a few days9. If you make the icing the same day then allow it to come to room temperature before icing the biscuits10. Once the biscuits are coated with icing then place on a cooling rack to dry for a few hours.
Poppy Seed Cakes Recipes. Find your favorite simple and easy homemade Poppy Seed Cakes Recipes here.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Grease 2 shallow baking trays. Bring creamed corn to simmering point in small saucepan. Add fresh ginger and thyme. Cover and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add sweet potato to pan and cook until soft. Allow to cool. Sift dry ingredients into large bowl. Add the cooled creamed corn mixture and combine. Add beaten eggs and combine. Add milk to desired consistency. Stir in melted butter. Spoon mixture into a piping bag fitted with plain nozzle. Pipe out 3cm/1in balls on prepared trays. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden. Makes 20 balls.

Cut the fennel bulbs into small dice and cook them in a large pot of boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain the fennel and put it into a bowl. Cut the anchovies into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the anchovies to the pan and saute them for 1 minute. Add the fennel to the pan and saute for 2 minutes. Add the bucatini to the pan and saute for 2 minutes more. Add the garlic to the pan. Add the red pepper flakes to the pan. Cook for 1 minute. Add the fennel seeds. Toss. Season the pasta with the sea salt and the pepper. Serve.

Mix cheddar cheese, cream cheese and mayonnaise together in a bowl. Add garlic, pimento pepper, onion powder, tabasco sauce, salt and pepper. Mix until blended. Spread on crackers. Garnish with stuffed olive. Serve immediately.

Make mayonnaise. Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until well blended. Toast or lightly grill the tortillas. Divide romaine among tortillas. Top with turkey and mayonnaise. Fold and serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cool water. Meanwhile, combine tuna, frozen peas, cucumber, and onion in a large bowl. In a smaller bowl combine mayonnaise, roasted red pepper, vinegar, and parsley. When pasta is drained and cooled, stir into the tuna mixture. Add mayo mixture and stir until well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature. This is a great picnic or potluck dish. You can use a regular sized mayonnaise container to transport it.

Heat a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add oil and saute beans until crisp tender. Add the onion and saute for 2 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper. Remove from heat and add parsley. Toss well.

Bake or boil chicken until done. Cube or shred and combine with fat-free mayonnaise, paprika, dried cranberries, celery, green onions and green bell pepper. Stir in pecans and seasoning salt and black pepper to taste.

Rinse lentils and add to a 6-quart Dutch oven. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 1 hour. Add the celery ribs and onion and cook, uncovered, for 1 hour more, until the vegetables are tender. Add the garlic and pork hocks and cook, uncovered, 15 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the brown sugar and serve hot.
The best way to get started is to read the labels of food packaging you already have at home.
The following list of food packaging is a good place to start.
Because of the high demand for plastic packaging, many different types have been introduced.
The following list is a good place to start.
This list can be used to identify the packaging of the products you already have at home.
The list is sorted by product category.
There are a few different types of plastic packaging, but most are similar.
There are a few different types of plastic packaging.
The packaging is used to package food and other products.
The list

Boil the potato in lightly salted water until soft. Drain and mash with the tomatoes and onions. Add the herbs and margarine. Season to taste. Mix the milk with the flour and add to the potato. Stir well and bring to the boil. Add the cheese and stir until it has melted. Pour into a greased oven-proof dish. Sprinkle with more cheese and bake in a preheated oven at gas mark 7 (450 degrees f) for about 40 minutes until golden brown.

In a heavy saucepan, bring the sugar to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute or until sugar begins to caramelize around the edges of the saucepan. Add the hot water slowly, whisking constantly to dissolve the sugar completely. Whisk the egg whites with the salt. Stir into the caramel mixture gradually. Whisk constantly until the mixture is smooth. Continue to cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until it becomes a soft ball when dropped into cold water. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla. Let cool for a few minutes. Stir the mixture into the mayonnaise with the orange rind. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Use as a topping on fruit or ice-cream.
In a small bowl beat together cream cheese, lemon juice and garlic salt. Add milk, one tablespoon at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in black olives. Serve with crackers or pita chips.

Mix together the marmalade and the water and set aside. In a medium bowl, stir together the bisquick and the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the marmalade mixture until dough forms a ball. Press or roll dough into a 6-inch square, about 1/2-inch thick. Cut dough into 12 strips and place strips side by side on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.

1. In a large bowl cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. 2. Mix baking soda into hot water. 3. Add to butter mixture. 4. Beat well until combined. 5. Add rolled oats. 6. Roll into balls and press with a fork. 7. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned.
Place chicken breasts in slow cooker. In a small bowl, mix together marmalade and lime juice. Pour over chicken. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours. Serve with cooked rice.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Melt the butter in an ovenproof casserole dish or large bowl. Peel and slice the apples and add them to the melted butter. Stir in the sugar and wine and cook until the apples are softened and the wine is reduced by half. Cut the bread into cubes and place them in the casserole with the apples and butter mixture. Pour the light cream over the apples and stir until the cubes of bread are soaked with the cream. In a large bowl beat the eggs with the zest and season with the nutmeg and the cinnamon. Pour the egg mixture over the apples and bread and stir well. Bake for 25 minutes or until set in the middle and golden brown on the top. Serve warm or cold with ice cream or whipped cream and caramel sauce on the side.

In a large skillet brown meat and drain. Add salt, worcestershire sauce, mixes, milk, and hot water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Turn heat off and stir in remaining milk. Transfer to a greased casserole dish and bake at 350 for about an hour. Serve with biscuits or mashed potatoes.
name: hot sandwichingredients: mayonnaise, lettuce leaves, tomato slicespreparation:Spread mayonnaise between two slices of bread. Add lettuce and tomato slices.
name: hot sandwich with ham & cheeseingredients: ham, mayonnaise, tomato slices, lettuce leavespreparation:Spread mayonnaise between two slices of bread. Add ham slices and tomato slices. Top with lettuce leaves.
name: hot sandwich with cheeseingredients: cheese slices, mayonnaise, tomato slicespreparation:Spread mayonnaise between two slices of bread. Add cheese slices and

Combine corn starch and water in small bowl. Set aside. In medium saucepan stir together ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, wine vinegar and sugar. Heat over medium heat until boiling. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in cornstarch mixture. Return to heat and cook until slightly thickened. Cool. Serve warm or cold.

Combine flour, meal and baking powder in a large bowl. Stir in egg and oil until smoothstir in water. Turn into greased 9-in square pan. Bake at 400 for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack.
name: corn spoon breadingredients: whole milk, fresh corn kernels, cornmeal, butter, fresh thyme leave, kosher salt, black pepper, eggspreparation:Heat oven to 350 f. In a large saucepan, over medium heat, bring 2 cups of the milk and the corn to a boil. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining milk and the cornmeal. Whisking constantly, slowly add the mixture to the boiling milk. Reduce heat and simmer gently, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the butter, thyme, salt, pepper and eggs. Transfer to a buttered casserole or cast-iron skillet. B

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine fresh blueberries, 2/3 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons of flour, and 1 teaspoon of cinnamon. Pour mixture into unbaked deep dish pie shell. In another bowl, combine 1/2 cup of sugar and 1/3 cup of flour. Cut in 2 tablespoons of cold butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle over berry filling. Bake for 45-55 minutes.

Combine first four ingredients. Beat on low speed for two minutes. Increase speed to medium for two more minutes. In a separate bowl combine nutmeg and sugar substitute and sprinkle over the egg mixture. Pour mixture into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until the knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool slightly and cut into squares or triangles. Serve warm. Makes about 2 dozen servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl, combine oats and flourset aside. In a large mixing bowl combine sugar, cocoa powder and baking powdermix well. Add salt and egg whitesmix well. Beat until smooth and thick. Stir in corn syrup and vanillamix well. Fold in oats mixturemix well. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until set. Remove from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely.

In a medium skillet, heat olive oil. Add garlic and saute. Add bell peppers and onions. Stir until tender. Season with cumin, oregano and red pepper flakes. Add chicken and stir to coat. Cook until lightly browned. Add water or chicken broth to skillet. Bring to a boil. Add lemon juice. Cover skillet and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve over hot cooked pasta. Serves 4.

In saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to boil with 1 cup basmati rice and 1 cup of green lentils. Cook about 20 minutes, or until rice is tender. When the rice is cooked, add 1 teaspoon of cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Mix well and pour into serving dishes. Cook onions in 2 tablespoons olive oil until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with remaining black pepper and cumin. Serve onions over the mujadarah.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425. Beat egg. Add milk and blend. Add sausage and cook till light brown. Crumble in cheese. Combine flour, garlic powder and salt. Separate the crescents into individual triangles. Press each into a 9x12 pan. Fill with sausage mixture. Pour egg mixture over. Bake for 1 hour. Makes 9 servings.

Combine cooked rice with whole milk in a medium saucepan. Heat to a simmer over medium heat. Stir constantly until thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Add coconut extract and stir until incorporated. Add sugar to taste, stirring to dissolve. Add coconut flakes and stir until incorporated. Serve warm or cool to room temperature. Top with sweetened coconut flakes if desired.

Preheat oven to 325f. Crush graham crackers in a food processor. Mix together margarine and crackers in a small bowl. Press mixture into bottom of 9 inch pie pan. Bake for about 5 minutes. Cool completely. Mix together the cheese, pumpkin, sugar, vanilla, rum and spices. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Cool completely. Refrigerate at least 4 hours.
Mix eggs, water and biscuit mix. Add onions and cheddar cheese. Salt and cayenne to taste. Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with butter.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Place 4 center-cut pork chops in a 9-inch square glass baking dish. Stir together pure maple syrup, dijon mustard, molasses, cider vinegar, ground cumin, and 1 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl until blended. Spread mixture over top of pork chops in baking dish. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in preheated oven until a thermometer reads 155f degrees in center of the thickest part of the meat. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper before serving.

Peel and cook the potatoes until done. Drain and mash. Let cool. Add coconut and almonds and mix well. Add vanilla and mix again. Form into small balls or patties and roll in powdered sugar and chocolate. Refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Cut the chicken breast into bite sized pieces. Cook and shred the chicken. Mix the chicken with the soup and milk. Divide the mixture into 4 equal parts. Roll each part of the mixture into a crescent roll. Place the rolls into a greased 9x13 baking pan and bake at 375 for 15 minutes. Let cool and serve.

Cook the pasta in boiling water until it is al dente. Fry the onion and courgettes in the butter until soft. Stir in the walnuts. Add the cream and bring to the boil. Simmer until thickened. Season to taste with black pepper. Drain the cooked pasta. Add the sauce. Stir in the Parmesan and the parsley. Serve immediately.
In a food processor, puree the coffee, brown sugar, and vanilla bean. Add the bananas and puree until smooth. Add the ice cubes and almonds and puree until blended.
Combine all ingredients except for parsley and parmesan. Mix well. Form into loaves and sprinkle with parsley and parmesan. Bake for 50 minutes at 325.

Bring to a boil the beans, mexicorn and rice according to package directions. Drain the beans and rice mixtureset aside. Heat the olive oil over medium heatadd the garlic and saut for 1 minute. Stir in the rice mixture. Combine the salsa with the water and stir into the rice mixturecook for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in the meatcook 2-3 minutes more. Serve warm. Serves 4 to 6.

Place ham in the bottom of the pot. Add water to just cover the ham and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to maintain a low boil, cover pot and cook for 10 minutes per pound of ham. Remove ham from pot and set aside to cool. Add potatoes to the liquid in the pot. Cook for 10 minutes. Add carrots, cabbage, onion and pepper and cook for 10 minutes more. Add ham back to pot, season to taste and serve. Serves 4-6.

Boil water. Drain potatoes. Mash potatoes in large bowl. Add egg yolks. Add cheese & salt. Add enough flour to form dough. Knead dough lightly. Let stand 5 minutes. Roll dough out 1/4 inch thick. Cut with 1 inch cutter. Bring boiling water to a boil. Add dumplings 5 at a time. Boil 4 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon. Melt butter in pan. Add dumplings & spinach. Cook 1 minute. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve with butter & parmesan cheese.

Mix together white sugar, peanuts and rice flour. Slowly add corn syrup until the mixture has the right consistency, not too dry or too sticky. Place on wax paper on a flat surface. Dust with sugar. Cut into long strands, roll around your hand until it is like hair. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375° F. Lightly grease an 8 cup muffin tin or a popover pan with melted butter or margarine. In a large bowl combine the flour, salt and baking powder. In another bowl beat egg whites until stiff. In another bowl beat egg yolks and add water and milk. Fold egg whites into egg yolk mixture. Add melted butter and stir until smooth. Gently stir into flour mixture. Spoon batter into muffin cups or popover pan filling almost to top. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 6 servings.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions, pepper, and beefcook 3 minutes or until beef is brown. Add tomatoes, kidney beans, and paprikabring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 5 minutes or until beans are tender. Sprinkle with cheesecover until cheese is melted. Serve with crackers or on toasted garlic bread.

Cook ground turkey with onion until done. Drain off fat, set aside. In a crock pot add salsa, refried beans, broth, chili powder, and cumin. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add ground turkey mixture, cook for 10 minutes more. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add garliccook until lightly browned. Stir in chicken broth. Add pine nuts and cook until they begin to brown. Stir in chardcook until wilted. Stir in pasta. Season to taste with salt. Stir in sun-dried tomatoe and vinegar. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

In a bowl, toss together the first 6 ingredients. Add the chickenturn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours, turning once. Grill the chicken over medium-low heat (350f to 400f) until no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear when the thigh is pierced with a knife. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Cut off any damaged or wilted leaves. Cut each sprout in half through the stem. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add sprouts to pan. Cook for 3 minutes or until browned. Add 1/4 cup water to pan. Cover skillet. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Cook uncovered for 7 minutes or until tender. Stir in lemon juice, sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Heat through. Serve.

In blender container with cover, combine first 5 ingredients. Coverblend until smooth. Heat oil in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add shrimpsaute 2 minutes. Add brothheat to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Add buttermilk mixture. Heat through. Ladle into serving bowls. Garnish with cucumber and onions. Serve hot.

Heat dried apples in a saucepan with water. Simmer on low heat for about 20 minutes. Add orange juice and zest. Mix in the rest of the ingredients and simmer for another 20 minutes. Turn off the heat. Let the mixture cool and thicken slightly. Pour into a greased pie dish and top with your favorite pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour or until the crust is golden. Let cool and serve.
Combine all ingredients and toss.

Prepare gelatin as directed on the package. Blend in 1/2 cup of the boiling water and 1/2 cup sugar until dissolved. Add remaining boiling water and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the milk, 1 tbsp at a time until well combined. Stir in the lime juice and green food coloring until well combined. Stir in the lime rind. Chill until partially set, then fold in the whipped topping. Pour into the prepared crust. Freeze until firm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Grease 9x13 inch pan. In large bowl combine butter and sugar. Beat until smooth. Add 2 eggs and 2 teaspoons vanilla. Beat well. Sift together 1 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Add 1 teaspoon cocoa and 1 cup chopped nuts. Stir just to combine. Spread into prepared pan and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting. Yield 4 dozen.

Bring water and lavender to a boil. Turn off heat and add sugar, stirring until dissolved. Remove lavender and allow tea to cool completely. Add fresh lemon juice and slice. Serve hot or cold with a few ice cubes and a slice of fresh lemon.
Recipe #24211 25 Dec 14 @ 23:40 by Mary-Ellen I make a very similar drink but add sliced strawberries and a shot of raspberry vodka. Delicious.
Recipe #24210 18 Dec 14 @ 02:47 by Patrice I am not a big fan of sweet drinks but this is really good! I used half a bag of regular tea and half a bag of orange pekoe. I also used 1/4 c of sugar and 1/4 c of honey and no artificial sweetener. I didn't add the orange peel or the zest. It came out great!
Combine crackers and margarine. Add brown sugar and nuts. Press into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Cool.

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Spray large cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine raw carrots, onion, salt and pepper. Drain carrot mixturereturn to large bowl. Spray with cooking spray or oil, and toss to coat with spray or oil. Spread mixture evenly on cookie sheet. Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until crispy.
Sweet potatoes are one of my favorite vegetables. I love the taste and texture of them. I've eaten them baked, boiled, roasted and mashed but I'd never had them as a soup before now. I'm happy to report that I will be making them this way again as I found them to be delicious!

1. Mix together 1 cup of bread crumbs with 1 tsp. kosher salt. 2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. 3. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. 4. Dip each chicken breast in the beaten egg white, then roll in the breadcrumb mixture until coated. 5. Arrange the breaded chicken in the skillet. 6. Bake for 30 minutes or until browned and cooked through. 7. Place the chicken on a serving plate. 8. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup bread crumbs with the parsley and 1/8 tsp. salt. 9. Sprinkle over the top of the chicken. 10. Drizzle with the lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling waterset aside. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually beat in frozen lemonade concentrate and gelatin mixture. Beat until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Spoon into dessert dishes and garnish with additional frozen whipped topping and mint leaves.
I think I'll make the chocolate one. Looks great.
Wow. These look delicious. I think I will make one of them this weekend. I know which one I will make.
I love the look of these. I think I'll try the chocolate one.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, kosher salt and black pepper. Toss the potatoes in the seasoned oil and spread evenly on the prepared baking sheet. Bake the potatoes for about an hour, turning once and tossing them every 20 minutes or so. The potatoes are done when they are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the minced garlic on top of the potatoes. Serve immediately.

Cream together butter and granulated sugar. Add molasses and beat until blended. Add egg and beat well. Sift together flour, baking soda, spices and salt. Add to first mixture. Mix well. Form into 1-inch balls and roll in granulated sugar. Place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack.

Cook the orzo in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain the orzo. In a large skillet, combine the spinach, lemon juice and zest, butter, garlic, onion powder, salt and pepper. Cook over moderate heat until the spinach is just wilted. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Stir the spinach into the cooked orzo. Stir in the parmesan.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine sour cream with onion and oregano. Spread half the butter on each of 4 bread slices. Arrange 2 bread slices on a baking sheet. Top with half the sour cream mixture, half of the bacon, half the tomatoes and half the mozzarella. Repeat layers. Bake until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Cut sandwiches in half diagonally. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowlstir well. Pour into a 10-cup bowl. Float ice cream in centercover and chill 30 minutes. Top with rum just before serving. Garnish with pineapple chunk and melon ball. Serve immediately.

How much is 19 + 11?

Heat 1/2 inch of canola oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the eggs. Use a fork or a spatula to break the eggs into the skillet. As the eggs begin to set, add the onions. Cook for 1 minute. Add the bok choy. Stir. Add the bamboo shoots. Add the soy sauce. Add the pepper and the garlic. Add the shrimp. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Continue to cook for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix sesame seeds and egg whites in shallow bowl. In another bowl mix 1/4 cup of the pecans and the oil. Dip chicken tenders in the seeds and egg whites then in the pecan mixture. Heat the oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken tenders and cook until lightly browned. Transfer to plate. Add hoisin sauce and mustard and whisk until smooth. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of the pecans and the preserves. Serve sauce with chicken.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and green onionsaut for 3 minutes or until onion is translucent. Add garlicsaut for 1 minute. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heat to mediumadd lemon juicebring to a boil. Add avocadoscook 1 minute or until tender. Remove from heatstir in yogurt until well blended. Add crabmeatstir until well mixed. Transfer to a bowlcoverchill 1 hour.

Combine gelatin and boiling water. Stir until completely dissolved. Stir in berries. Pour into a 9x13-inch pan. Refrigerate until set. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in sugar. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Pour over cubes. Sprinkle with pretzels. Refrigerate until set. Garnish with whipped cream and cool whip.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine shredded hash browns, ground beef, black beans and salsa. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine soup, water, melted butter or margarine and sour cream. Pour over hash brown mixture. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Drain cooked chicken, reserving 1/2 cup of broth. Cut into bite-size pieces. Heat margarine in skillet. Cook celery and onion until tender. Stir in chicken and reserved broth. Add crumbs and parsley. Season to taste. Lightly beat eggs and add to mixture. Stir well. Pour into 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

In a large pot, melt butter. Add shallots, garlic, tarragon, thyme, and saute until tender. Add mussels, parsley, chives, ale and pepper. Cover the pot with a lid. Cook over medium heat until the shells have opened. Serve with French bread. Serves 4.

Bring water to boil in large saucepan. Add pasta. Cook 10 minutes. Meanwhile brown chicken breasts in butter over medium heat. Add italian dressing mix, stirring until well coated. Pour in wine. Add soup. Bring to boil. Stir in cream cheese. Add cooked pasta. Mix well. Transfer to serving dish. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Daily Value for Vitamin B6 is 2 mg
