Daily Value for Riboflavin is 1.7 mg
Daily Value for Niacin is 20 m

Blend sour cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt together until smooth. Add red food coloring and blend well. Add crushed pineapple and banana. Pour into paper cups and freeze. Just before serving, top with pecans and bing cherries.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. Grease a loaf pan or line with parchment paper. In a mixing bowl combine all the dry ingredients. Stir in the butter and sugar. Mix until it is a smooth paste. Add in the vanilla and egg and mix. Add in the mashed bananas and stir until just combined. Finally fold in your nuts or chocolate chips and pour into your greased pan. Bake for about an hour. Watch closely around 45 minutes. If the center starts getting too brown cover with foil for the last ten minutes of cooking. Let cool in pan for ten minutes before removing.

In a large bowl, combine flour, salt and baking soda. In a medium bowl, combine eggs and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth, then gradually add the sugar and beat until thick and creamy, about 2-3 minutes. Add the buttermilk, and beat until blended. Add the boiling water and oil and blend well. Stir in the dry mixture just until blended. Pour into the greased and floured 9-inch square pan and bake for about 35 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Frost as desired.
name: chocolate ice cream cakeingredients: vanilla ice cream, semi-sweet chocolate chips, chopped walnuts, whipped cream, caramel saucepreparation:Take a graham cracker and smash it with your hands into crumbs (about the size of a pebble). Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Sprinkle with a handful of chocolate chips and chopped

Heat butter and onion in saucepan and saute until onion is transparent. Add cooked white rice and mix well. Add cheese whiz and sour cream. Mix well. Add broccoli and mix well. Remove from heat and spoon into an 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Cover with cheddar and parmesan cheeses. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown. Serves 6.

Spread about 1/4 cup cream cheese on each slice of bread. In small bowl mix together remaining cream cheese and lemon juicespread on each slice. Spread mustard on 2 slices. Top each with 2 slices turkeydivide spinach between 2 sandwiches. Top with 2 slices provolone. Place remaining 2 slices between the turkey. Spread top and bottom of each sandwich with 1/4 cup roasted sweet peppers. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving. Cut into 6 equal pieces. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie plate. In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredientstoss with apples. Spoon into pie shell. In a small bowl, combine the first five ingredientscut in the butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over the apples. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the filling bubbles and the crust is golden brown. Cool and serve with vanilla ice cream if desired.
name: pork chops in a creamy mustard sauce with red cabbage and green beansingredients: bacon, green beans, cream of mushroom soup, pork chops, red cabbage, mustard powder, red onionpreparation:Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook bacon in skillet until browned and crisp, about 10 minutes. Remove bacon and place on paper towel-lined plate, reserving drippings in skillet. Brown pork chops in reserved bacon drippingstransfer to plate

Cook mixed vegetables according to package directionsdrainset aside. In a small skillet, combine celery, mushrooms and water. Cook over medium heat until celery is tenderdrain well. In a large bowl, combine mixed vegetables, celery mixture, almonds, soy saucetoss lightly. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 24 hours. Makes 6 servings.

Saute the onions and garlic in the butter in a heavy 4 to 5 quart pot. Add the mushrooms and saute until they are soft. Stir in the pearl barley. Pour in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and cook for 50 to 60 minutes or until the barley is tender. Stir in the ground pepper and salt. Serve hot.

Seperate crescent rolls into triangles. Cut each apple into eight wedges. Wrap a triangle around each apple wedge. Place in a greased 13-in. X 9-in. X 2-in. Baking dish. In a bowl, combine sugar and butter and sprinkle over rolls. Slowly pour the soda around the rolls. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream.

Make 2 pie crusts. Bake at 425f for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 375f and bake for 40 minutes or until done in centre. Combine the canned pumpkin, kahlua and the corn syrup in a large mixing bowl. Blend well with a hand mixer for about 3 minutes or until smooth. Add the eggs to the bowl and mix until smooth. Pour into the prepared pie crusts and bake for 25 minutes at 375f, or until done in the centre. Cool before serving. Garnish with whipped cream or ice cream.
Preheat oven to 375f. Line 9-inch pie plate with 1 crustflute edges. Combine filling ingredients in a large bowlmix well. Pour into crust. Lay second crust over fillingcrimp edge to seal. Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape. Bake 1 hour or until done in centre. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Sprinkle fillets with oregano, salt and pepper. Cover fillets with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with remaining oregano and top with cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut the cauliflower into florets. Clean the leek and cut it into small pieces. In a large saucepan saute the cauliflower with a small amount of olive oil. After 3-5 minutes add the leek and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the stock. Bring to a boil. Add the nutmeg. Simmer for 10 minutes. Puree with a hand blender or food processor. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the remaining olive oil. Serve immediately.
I don't know what to do with Leeks! Can someone help me please??
I usually add them to onion/celery base for soup or stew.
I also love them for a potato-leek gratin.
I just read this post on "Taste of Home" magazine's website. I was wondering if you could post this recipe as well. It is a wonderful combination.
Stir together the first 4 ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 12 hours.
Drain yogurt mixturediscard liquid. Combine yogurt mixture and next 3 ing

Place 3 chicken breasts in bottom of crockpot. Add 1 can of cream of chicken soup and 1 can of chicken broth. Cover. Cook on high 4 hours. Melt butter and add to crockpot. Add egg noodles and cook additional 30 minutes. Serve.
Split bagels and toast. Beat together eggs and milk. Pour into bottom half of bagels. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve with top half of bagel.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 1.5-quart baking dish. Core and quarter apples. Arrange in baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan and cook on low heat until apples are tender. Spoon over apples. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve with walnuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix relish with 1/2 cup water. Place chicken in 9x13 glass baking dish. Mix together salt, pepper and oilspread over chicken. Bake for 1 hour or until done. Serve with lemon wedges.
Suggest blog. Please rate this recipe.

In a medium size saucepan over medium heat saute onions in the olive oil for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes more. Add the tomatoes. Add the chili flakes, vinegar, sugar, and 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add basil. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve over pasta.

Bring water to a boil. Add rice. Cook uncovered 20 minutes or until done. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Add oil to a large skillet. Saute carrots over medium heat until tender. Add garlic. Saute until fragrant. Stir in rice mixture, basil, oregano, and corn. Add peas. Cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with basil and oregano. Serve hot.

Cook pasta shells as directed on box. In a separate pan, cook hamburger. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce to hamburger. In a separate pot, combine sour cream, whipping cream, and 1 cup parmesan. Mix. Stir in cooked hamburger. Put the shells in a casserole dish. Spread the meat mixture over the top. Top the meat mixture with the remaining cup of parmesan and the mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Serve.

Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile mix the milk with the seasoning packet that comes in the box. Add the milk to the noodles. Mix in the tuna. Pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Combine the breadcrumbs with the potato chips. Sprinkle over the top. Bake for 20 minutes.

Cut tofu in small cubes and cook in microwave on high for 5 minutes. Add vegan mayonnaise and mix well. Add celery, onions and dijon mustard and mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste and mix well. Refrigerate overnight so flavors blend well. Can be eaten on bread or alone as salad.

Heat the olive oil and saute the garlic and the crushed red pepper flakes for 1 minute. Add the raw shrimp and saute for 1 minute. Season with the salt, old bay seasoning and dry sherry. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and fold in the parsley. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 2-quart baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. Cube bread into 1-inch cubes and place in baking dish. In a large bowl, combine cream, milk, superfine and white sugars, vanilla extract, nutmeg, and saltmix well. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and egg whitesfold into cream mixture until well blended. Pour mixture evenly over the bread cubescover with foil or a lid. Bake for 20 minutesuncover and bake an additional 15-20 minutes or until pudding is set. Remove from ovensprinkle with raisinstop with powdered sugar if desired.

Peel and boil sweet potatoes until tender. Drain. Mash with a potato masher. Add butter. Stir in milk and pumpkin pie spice. Blend. Add the remaining ingredients. Spread into a 9x9 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 25 minutes or until lightly browned and set.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Slice the leeks lengthwise as thin as possible. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the leek slices and stir until they are limp. Add the carrot and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Drizzle the juice of the lime over the top and sprinkle the cilantro over. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook bacon in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and place on paper towels to drain. In the same skillet, cook broccoli florets in the drippings until tenderdrain. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli with the cheese, bacon, pineapple tidbits, raisins and onions. In another bowl, combine the mayonnaise and vinegaradd the sugar and mix well. Drizzle the dressing over the broccoli mixture and toss to combine. Yields 10 servings.

Mix together 1/2 cup each chocolate wafers and blanched almonds. Stir together 1/4 cup each white sugar, instant coffee and coffee liqueur in a small bowlset aside. In another small bowl, combine 1/4 cup each white sugar and light corn syrupset aside. In a large bowl, combine chocolate wafers mixture with sugar and liqueur mixture. Add light corn syrup mixturemix well to form a stiff ball. Chill at least 30 minutes or until firm enough to roll. Meanwhile, combine 1/4 cup each white sugar and cinnamon sugarset aside. Roll balls into 1-inch ballsplace on wax paper-lined baking sheets. Roll balls in white sugar mixtureset aside to firm up 1 hour or longer. Store tightly covered up to 1 week. Makes 48 balls.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the biscuits in half. In an 11x7 baking dish, lay half of the biscuits down. In a bowl, combine the melted butter with the sugar and cinnamon. Pour the mixture over the biscuits. Lay the rest of the biscuits on top of the mixture and cover them. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 10 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown 1 pound peeled and sliced kohlrabi in butter. Sprinkle with salt and sugar. Add flour and stir to make a thick paste. Gradually add chicken broth and simmer until the liquid is reduced to a thick sauce. Stir in parsley and serve at once. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Line a large cookie sheet with waxed or parchment paper and set aside. Cream together the butter and icing sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Mix in the cornstarch and vanilla and then add the flour a bit at a time until the mixture becomes a soft dough and is no longer sticky. Roll the dough into two logs on the waxed or parchment paper and refrigerate for at least one hour. When the dough is firm and easy to slice, preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit again and cut the logs into coins, placing them on the cookie sheet about one inch apart. Bake for about eight minutes or until the edges just begin to turn golden. Remove from the oven and let cool on the cookie sheet for a few minutes before serving or moving the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

Boil the water and add the carrots. Cook until crisp tender. Melt the butter in saucepan. Stir in apple cider and brown sugar. Bring to boil. Add the carrots and simmer for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with tarragon and season to taste with pepper.
Steam broccoli and green beans for 3-4 minutes. Cool. In a large salad bowl, combine the vegetables with the cashews, almonds, sea salt and olive oil. Mix well. Serve at room temperature.

Combine egg yolks and condensed milk in heavy saucepan over low heat. Beat constantly with wire whisk or hand blender until mixture thickens and coats the whisk or blender. Add the vanilla extract and stir well. Refrigerate this mixture while you make the cookies. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit or 190 degrees celsius. Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Mix in the salt and baking soda. Add the sifted flour, one cup at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the bottoms are lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

Melt butter. Add sugar and cocoa. Stir well. Add 2 cups milk and salt. Beat until smooth. Add 3 cups milk and 4 large eggs. Beat until smooth. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool. Top with whipped cream and nuts. Serve.

Place salmon fillets skin-side down in a 13 by 9-inch pan. In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, orange juice, orange zest, fish sauce, chili sauce, ginger, garlic, mint stems, cilantro stems. Pour over salmon. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until salmon flakes easily.
Combine sugar, water, cornstarch in medium saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Stir in salt, butter, maple syrup. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Lightly grease the top of the bread and place it in the pan. Top with the sausage and cheese. In a mixing bowl whisk together the eggs and the milk. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the sausage and bread. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the center is firm. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Cut off the top of the pepper leaving the stem intact. Remove the seeds and ribs. Mix the cream cheese with the seasonings. Spoon into the pepper. Wrap each pepper with a slice of bacon. Secure with a toothpick. Place on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the bacon is crisp.
name: jalapeno pepper stuffed cherry peppersingredients: sweet red cherry peppers, cream cheese, green onions, garlic sausage, jalapeno peppers, mayonnaisepreparation:Cut cherry peppers in half, vertically, leaving stem for presentation. Remove seeds. Drain well on paper towel. In a small bowl combine all remaining ingredients and mix well. Spoon filling into pepper halves.
name: jalapeno spread dipingredients: mayonnaise, jalapeno peppers, jalapeno juice, ground cumin, sugar, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, saltpreparation:Add

Stir together the flour and the next four ingredients in a large bowlmake a well in the center of the mixtureadd the egg and milk, stirring just until moistenedadd the orange juice and mix wellheat a greased griddle or frying pan over medium heatpour the batter onto the griddle or into the panbrown on each sideserve with your favorite topping.

Clean the mushrooms, then cut off the stems (save them). Heat the olive oil and butter together in a pan over medium heat until the butter melts. Saute the stems and the garlic until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the wine. Add the mushroom caps to the wine mixture. Cook until the wine boils down and the caps are soft, about 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Add the butter. Beat until the mixture is smooth. Heat a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook for 2 minutes or until the bottom is set. Use a rubber spatula and carefully lift the edges of the egg mixture. Tilt the skillet so the uncooked egg flows under the cooked egg. Cook for 2 minutes or until the top is set. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the egg. Cover for 1 minute or until the cheese is melted. Butter the bread. Cut each slice of bread in half. Top each half of the bread with a slice of cheese. Place the bread on the griddle. Cook for 1 minute on each side or until browned. Serve with the egg.

First of all wash hands thoroughly. Wash the hot dogs. Boil them for about 10 minutes. Let them cool for a while. While you are waiting for them to cool, make the dough. Mix all ingredients together. Knead the dough. Roll it out in a long rectangular shape. Place hot dogs in a row along the length of the dough. Wrap it up. Use a toothpick to make sure it is sealed well. Make a few holes in it. Dip it in beaten eggs. Then in breadcrumbs. Let it cool for 15 minutes in the freezer. Bake it in a preheated oven at 190 degrees Celsius for about 40 minutes. Serve it hot with mustard.

Prepare the pie crust and place in a tart pan with removable bottom. Combine the flour, orange zest and the sugar together and mix well. Add the egg and combine well. Add the rhubarb and raspberries and toss together until coated with the flour mixture and spread evenly in the prepared tart pan. Brush the rim of the tart pan with the beaten egg and top with the crust and seal the edges with the tines of a fork. Place the tart on a baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile combine the red currant jelly and the powdered sugar together and set aside. After the crust has cooked for about 20 minutes, remove the tart from the oven and sprinkle the top of the tart with the currant mixture, baking until the currant mixture is set and bubbling. Cool slightly before serving. Serves about 8.

In a small saucepan, cover the dried apples with the boiling water and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally until just tender. Remove the apples and set aside. Add the sage leaf and the cinnamon stick to the pan and cook for 1 minute more. Strain the liquid through a sieve into a small pan and discard the sage and cinnamon. Add the whisky and honey and heat until just simmering. Divide the apples and cooking liquid between 2 mugs and garnish with the lemon rind and sage leaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a 9x13x2 inch baking dish, combine zucchini, corn, pimiento, and garlic. Combine oil, salt and pepperpour over vegetables. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown. Serve warm.
Favorite recipes of the week for Zucchini.
Zucchini Recipes is an online community with a variety of recipes submitted by home cooks. We'd love for you to share your recipes and join our community.
Sign up for free recipes and exclusive email offers.

Boil new potatoes in lightly salted water until tender. Add butter and onion to pan. Saute until onions are clear. Add green beans and creole seasoning. Saute until green beans are crisp-tender. Serve immediately.

Roast seeds in oven at 250 degrees for 25 minutes to 1 hour or until very fragrant and lightly colored. Combine in a spice mill and grind to a fine powder. Store airtight at room temperature for up to 6 months. Sprinkle on roasted meats and vegetables before serving.

Wash beans in a bowl of cold water. Bring water to a boil and add the beans, onion, tomatoes, oxtail soup mix and seasoning to taste. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 1 hour or until beans are tender.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease and line a muffin pan with paper cases. In a large bowl combine quinoa and quinoa flour, baking powder, and baking soda. In another bowl combine honey and eggs. Add the honey mixture and mashed bananas into the dry mixture and combine well. Add the cranberries and mix well again. Spoon mixture into paper cases and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Store in airtight container.

Mix all dry ingredients. Add oil and eggs and mix well. Add vanilla and preserves. Mix well and refrigerate for 1/2 hour. Roll out dough on floured board into thin layers. Cut out circles with cookie cutter and fill with preserves. Fold over and seal edges and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees until lightly browned and cooked through. Makes about 3 dozen.

Crush vanilla wafers. Mix together with oleo and powdered sugar, press into 9x13 pan. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour. Spread frozen orange juice on top of vanilla mixture. Spread 1/3 of coconut over frozen orange juice. Melt chocolate chips in top of double boiler or in microwave oven. Spread chocolate over coconut layer. Spread remaining coconut over chocolate layer. Refrigerate until firm.
name: no-bake cookiesingredients: butter, powdered sugar, quick-cook oats, cocoa, vanilla extract, cinnamon, walnutspreparation:Mix together 1/2 cup butter, powdered sugar, oats, cocoa, and vanilla extractpress into 9x13 pan. Spread frozen orange juice over the top of cookie mixture. Spread 1/3 of coconut over frozen orange juice. Melt chocolate chips in top of double boiler or in microwave oven.

Soak the salt cod for 8 hours or overnight in cold water. Drain and discard soaking water. In a large stock pot, cook the pork until crisp and fat is rendered out. Add the onion and cook until softened but not brown. Add the potatoes and carrot and cover with 4 to 5 cups boiling water. Cook until vegetables are softened, about 10-15 minutes. Add the fish to the pot and season with pepper. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until fish is tender and flakes easily with a fork. Add the corn niblets and milk. Simmer 5 more minutes or until heated through. Serve with crackers or toasted croutons.

Separate yolks and whites. In large bowl beat yolks until thick and pale yellow. Combine yolks and sugar in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until yolks thicken and become light yellow. Add heavy cream and stir until mixture is smooth. Add Grand Marnier and Kahlua. Stir to blend. Pour into four small ramekins or custard cups. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20-25 minutes or until just set. Cool for at least 1 hour. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate chips.

In a large shallow dish combine the eggs, milk, coconut, cereal, nuts and salt. Dip the bread in the mixture coating both sides. Heat the oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the sandwiches until golden brown on both sides. Serve warm with maple syrup and whipped cream.
name: french toast with chocolate and almonds
name: healthier french toast
name: yummy low fat french toast
name: french toasted banana sandwich
name: caramelized french toast
name: cheesy baked french toast
name: basic french toast
name: coconut macadamia nut french toast
recipe by: Kris

Bring 1 quart of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Stir in the noodles. Cook uncovered, stirring often, for 3-4 minutes. Stir in the sour cream. Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in the pot cheese and melt it. Serve immediately.

Fry the bacon and take the bacon grease out. Clean the pan and fry the onions in the bacon grease until clear. Add the flour and stir until light brown. Add the salt and pepper and then add the tomatoes. Add the sugar and the bay leaf and the celery leaves. Cook until thick. Add the celery leaves and the bay leaf. Serve over any meat.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Combine the first 6 ingredients in a bowlstir in the parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Dip fish in buttermilkdrain. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Place fish in a 13x9-inch baking dishtop with almonds and drizzle with 2 tablespoons butter. Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 15-20 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons butter before serving. Serves 4-6.
Fill a mug with hot milk. Add spiced rum and sugar to taste. Garnish with grated nutmeg.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Separate wonton skins. Place a teaspoon of filling in the center of each wonton. Bring up the sides to form a cup. Press the edges with a fork to seal. Place 1 inch apart in ungreased 12 inch pizza pan. Bake for 5-7 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Serve hot.

Slice onion and fry in a bit of butter in a large sauce pan. Add flour and continue to stir over low heat until brown. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add milk in small amounts and stir until gravy is formed. Drain frozen hash browns and add to pan. Heat through. Add cheddar cheese. Serve over mashed potato.

Peel and slice potatoes into a large bowl. Toss with onions and seasonings. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook for about 10 minutes or until they are golden brown. Serve immediately.

In a large pot of boiling water cook the macaroni until just tender. Drain and return to pot. Add the tomatoes and the seasonings and mix well. Spread in a 1 quart casserole. Butter the top. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes.

Combine honey and soy sauce in a small bowl. Stir well. Heat 2 tablespoons sesame oil in a large skillet. Add broccoli florets and mushrooms. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Add remaining vegetables and cook and stir 2 minutes longer. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil and the honey mixture. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Top with peanuts. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lightly brush fish with olive oil. Place in an ungreased baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle fish with sea salt and pepper. Remove from pan. Mix together juice of 1 orange and 1 lemon. Add juice to baking pan. Place fish in pan. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Sprinkle fish with slices of orange and orange zest. Top with capers. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine pasta, velveeta cheese and canned tuna. Mix well. Pour into greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Spread cream of mushroom soup over pasta. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes.

Bring a pot of water to boil for the pasta. In another pot over medium heat, warm the olive oil and add the garlic. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the garlic is soft and the oil is infused. Add the spinach and cook until it is wilted and bright green. Stir in the beans and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium low. Add the cooked pasta to the pot of beans and stir gently to combine. Taste and add seasonings to your liking. Top with the grated cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Chop bacon and onion. Slice mushrooms. Slice asparagus on the diagonal. Brown bacon in skillet. Add onion, mushroom and bacon. Cook until the bacon is crisp. Drain. Beat together milk, eggs, italian seasoning, and garlic. Add to skillet. Remove from heat. Spread mixture in a 9 inch pie crust. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 40 minutes. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl combine turkey legs with sea salt and black pepper to taste. In a separate bowl combine molasses with red wine vinegar and whisk until smooth. In another bowl combine ketchup with worcestershire sauce and whisk until smooth. In a large ziplock bag place turkey legs and pour molasses mixture over top and seal bag. Refrigerate at least an hour or overnight. Preheat oven to 250°F. Line 2 baking sheets with aluminium foil and spray with coconut oil spray. Place turkey legs on the foil and spray with coconut oil spray. In a small bowl combine ketchup and worcestershire mixture and brush on turkey legs. Sprinkle on red onion and cook for about 2 hours or until cooked through and juices run clear. Remove from oven and serve hot.
Mix all the ingredients for vinaigrette in a small saucepan and set aside to cool. Mix all the other ingredients in a bowl and pour in the vinaigrette. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line an 8x8x8 inch baking pan with aluminum foil. Grease the foil with cooking spray. Dust with confectioner's sugar, tapping out the excess. Combine the white cake mix and diet sprite in the bowl of an electric mixer until blendedstir in the raspberry jell-o gelatin. Beat the egg whites on medium speed until frothy. Add the cream of tartar and increase the speed to highbeat until the whites are stiff peaks form. Fold the whites into the batter just until no white streaks remain. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown and springs back when touched with a fingertip, about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven, and let the cake cool for 1 hour in the pan before removing it from the pan using the foil. In a medium bowl, stir together the cool whip and confectioner's sugar. Fold in the chopped coconut.

Combine breadcrumbs, dressing mix and sour creamset aside. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat egg yolks until light and lemon-colored. Combine egg yolks and breadcrumb mixtureset aside. Dip each breast into the egg whites. Dip into the breadcrumb mixture and press lightly onto both sides. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Turn chicken and continue cooking for another 10-15 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Serve with ranch dressing if desired.

Separate the egg whites from the yolks and beat the egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg yolks into the egg whites. In another bowl, combine the salad dressing and spicy brown mustard. Add the salad dressing mixture to the egg mixture and stir just until blended. Heat the canola oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the egg mixture and cook the egg mixture without stirring for about 1 minute or until the edges begin to set but the center still looks wet. Use a spatula to fold the egg mixture into thirds to allow the uncooked egg mixture to set underneath. Cook and stir the egg mixture for about 1 minute or until the egg mixture is almost set but still has a slight moist texture in the center. Sprinkle the parsley and garlic powder evenly over the top. Sprinkle the mozzarella evenly over the top. Cover and cook for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the egg mixture is set. Serve immediately.

Soak carrots in water overnight. Bring water and ginger to boil in a pan over medium heat. Add carrots and lemon peel and boil for about 2 minutes or until carrots are soft. Let cool slightly. Puree carrots and lemon peel in a food processor or blender with honey, cinnamon and 1/2 cup cream cheese until smooth. Pour into greased and lined square pan (22cm x 22cm). Grind bread crumbs and hazelnuts and sprinkle over mixture. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown at 180C/360F. Remove from pan and leave to cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream or creme fraiche on top. Serves 8.
Combine all ingredients except sour cream. Add sour creamstir well. Coverchill. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 2 cups.

Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat. Add onion. Cook and stir until onion is soft, about 4 minutes. Stir in rice. Cook and stir 2 minutes or until rice is heated. Stir in chicken, gingerroot and seasonings. Cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in center. Stir in orange juice. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve over cooked rice. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375. Season the center-cut pork chops with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add the olive oil. Brown the chops on all sides. Deglaze the pan by pouring in the wine and scraping the pan to get all of the browned bits. Add the honey and mustard to the pan. Stir to combine. Transfer the chops to a 9" x 13" baking dish. Pour the pan sauce over the top and bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Mix together bread crumbs, pecans and parmesan. In a shallow dish combine butter and mustard. Dip fish into mustard mixture and then press into bread crumb mixture. Place fish on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes at 450 degrees or until fish flakes when pressed. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve hot.

In a bowl, combine orange juice, orange peel, garlic, and ginger until well mixedset aside. In another bowl mix flour, salt and pepper and dredge both sides of each piece of fish in flour mixture. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add fish and cook until both sides are golden brown and fish is opaque in the center (approximately 3-5 minutes on each side). Add the remaining vegetable oil to pan if necessary and add onion slices and cook until onions are translucent and slightly browned (about 2 minutes). Add the orange mixture to the pan and bring to a boil and stir to combine. Simmer until thickened (about 2 minutes). Place fish on a serving plate and pour orange mixture over fish. Top with green onion if desired.
name: ginger miso glazed tilapiaingredients: tilapia fillets, sesame oil, fresh ginger, miso, soy sauce, rice vinegar, lime juicepreparation:
Whisk together everything except for the fish filets.

Combine 1 1/2 cups heavy cream and 1/4 teaspoon instant espresso powder in small saucepan. Cook over medium heat just until steam rises from pan. Set aside to cool completely. Beat 2 1/2 cups plain fat-free yogurt and 1/4 cup fat-free sweetened condensed milk in blender until smooth. Transfer 1/2 cup yogurt mixture to small bowlstir in 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon and 1/2 cup chopped dried figs. Spoon remaining 2 cups yogurt mixture and 1/3 cup cinnamon-fig mixture in freezer containersfreeze 4 hours or until firm. Spoon 1/2 cup cooled espresso mixture and 1 tablespoon each chopped dried figs and walnuts in each containerfreeze 4 hours or until firm. Makes 4 servings.
name: greenlandic coffeeingredients: whiskey, kahlua, grand marnier, hot coffee, whipped creampreparation:Pour a

Peel the skin from the avocado (but do not remove the pit). Place in a large bowl with the onion. Mash together with a wooden spoon until smooth. Add the water and the salt. Continue mashing until the mixture is smooth, but slightly chunky. Serve with tortilla chips.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add cold water to chill. Add Cool Whip and stir gently until blended. Pour into a pretty glass bowl. Cover and refrigerate until set. Dip from bottom to top.

Brown frankfurters in butter. Cut in 1/2 inch slices. Brown onion in butter, stirring constantly. Stir in basil, celery soup and milk. Bring to boiling point, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute longer. Combine tomatoes and parsley. Spread half of mixture on bottom of 2 quart casserole dish. Layer half the frankfurters on top, then half the tomatoes. Repeat layers. Top with remaining tomatoes and frankfurters. Mix remaining sauce and pour over casserole. Sprinkle with parsley and bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve over wide egg noodles.

Mix together salsa and dressing in a small bowl. Spread evenly onto the bottom half of each tortillasprinkle with mustard. Add lettuce and bacon, and top each with tomato. Cover with top half of each tortilla. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Just before serving, slice each sandwich into 1/2 inch pieces with a sharp knife. Serves 6 to 8.

Bring 3 quarts water to a boil in a large pot. Add pasta. Stir well. Cook until al dente. Drain. Return pasta to the pot. Add the beans, tomatoes, and sausage. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add basil. Toss. Sprinkle with asiago cheese. Serve immediately.
Wash the asparagus well. Arrange in a baking dish with the shallots. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the vegetables. Bake for 30 minutes or until the asparagus is tender.

Place a large frying pan on medium heat. Add the olive oil and butter to the pan. Add the chicken breasts and brown on all sides. Remove the breasts from the pan. Place the breasts in a glass bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients to the pan. Turn up the heat and stir until the mixture is boiling. Add the chicken breasts back to the pan and cover. Lower the heat to medium. Cook the chicken for 40 minutes. Turn off the heat. Serve on a bed of brown rice.

Steam green beans in a covered skillet 1 minute or until tender-crispdrain. Meanwhile, heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and buttercook 1 minute or until garlic is lightly browned, stirring constantly. Remove from heatadd beans and brussels sproutstoss gently to coat with garlic mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar just before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Awesome Brussel Sprouts - Recipes for Your Choice!

In a large bowl combine breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, paprika, thyme and garlic salt. In another bowl whisk together the buttermilk and ground red pepperdunk each breast half in the buttermilk mixture, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray and place the breaded chicken breast halves in the pan. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with margarine. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until no longer pink inside.

melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and mushroomscook until softened. Add white winecook until reduced by half. Add artichoke heartscook 4 minutes. Add shrimpcook until pink. Add lemon juicecook 2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with chives, pimiento and parsley before serving.

Water - 2 1/3 cupSalt - 1 tspSugar - 1 tspDry Milk - 1/2 cupEgg - 1 (beat)Yeast - 1 pkg. (1/4 oz.) Butter - 1/4 c.Bread Flour - 5 cupsMix all together (except butter) in stand mixer or electric mixer until dough is formed. Place dough in greased container (I use a 16 qt. plastic container with a lid.) Turn dough over once, then place lid on container and let rise (about 1 1/2 hours.) After dough has risen once, turn dough over again and let rise again (about 1 hour.) Punch down dough and then let rise again (about 1 hour.) Punch down again and form into rolls (I use a 1/3 cup size measure to form the rolls.) Place into a greased 9x13 pan. Let rise (about 1 hour.) Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Mix melted butter, powder
Cook chicken in broth for about 20 minutes. Add celery, green onion and sweet pickle relishadd mayo, salt and peppermix well. Add chopped parsley on top before serving.
Bring all the ingredients to a boil in a large pot. Simmer for 30 minutes. Allow to cool to room temperature. Store in a covered jar in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place plums and water in a pan and simmer over medium heat until tender. Drain plums and cool. Sift together dry ingredients and set aside. In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat until smooth. Blend in almond extract and vanilla. Stir in dry mixture and then add milk and stir just until mixed. Stir in plums and almonds and spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Rinse the kale thoroughly and remove the tough stems from the leaves. Cut the leaves into very thin strips. Place in a large bowl. In a medium saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold water, bring to a boil and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Mash the potatoes with the butter, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Add the hot chicken broth, a few tablespoons at a time until desired consistency is reached. Mix in the cooked kale strips. Spread out the mashed potatoes onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
I am a student at a small high school in Indiana, USA. I am writing an article about the topic of the day - World Peace Day. I was wondering if I could get permission to use one of your pictures in my article (the one of the peace symbol made out of flowers). I will certainly credit

Cut up stewing beef into bite sized pieces. Slice onions and green peppers into bite sized pieces. Add meat to a pot with water to cover by 2 inches. Add onions, green peppers and bay leaves to the pot. Cook until meat is tender, about 1 hour. Remove meat from pot with slotted spoon and set aside. Add garlic clove and potatoes to the pot, cover with water to cover by 2 inches. Cook for 1 hour. Add the kidney beans and basil to the pot. Add the meat back to the pot, cook 15 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve in bowls.

Cut the chicken into strips. Dissolve the bouillon cube in the hot water. Blanch the beans and asparagus in the bouillon for about 3 minutes. Drain and refresh in cold water. Drain again. Mix the chicken with the beans, asparagus, tomatoes, pine nuts, basil, baby leaves and seasoning. Toss well and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9 x 9-inch baking dish. In a large bowl beat the eggs with the milk and set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ham and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the chives or Ortega chiles and cook and stir until the ham is crumbled and the chives or Ortega are wilted. Stir the ham mixture into the egg mixture and season with salt and pepper. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with the sour cream.
name: baked eggsingredients: hardboiled egg, sour cream, dry mustard, salt, onion, butter, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, paprikapreparation:Slice eggs in half lengthwise, remove yolks, set whites aside. In a bowl mash yolks with a fork
Boil grits according to package directions. Drain. Add butter to the grits, stirring until melted. Stir in the tomatoes, bacon and onion. Serve hot.

In medium saucepan over medium heat combine tomato sauce, lemon juice, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, dijon mustard, pepper, garlic powder and red pepper flakes. Stir until well combined. Reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes or until mixture begins to thicken. Remove from heat and serve immediately with your favorite grilled foods.
Such a tasty recipe for BBQ chicken pizza. This is definitely a keeper.

Preheat oven to 190 c / 375 f / gas mark 5. Roll out the pastry and use to line an 18cm flan tin with a removable base. Prick the base with a fork and line with baking parchment and fill with baking beads. Bake for 15 minutes then remove the baking beads and paper and bake for a further 5 minutes until golden. Meanwhile in a saucepan, gently heat the mixed dried fruit with the butter until melted then add the dark brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in the walnuts and glace cherries and spoon over the base of the pastry case. Beat together the egg yolk, lemon juice, and icing sugar and spread over the top of the filling. Bake for a further 15-20 minutes until golden. Leave to cool in the tin before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 15x10x1-inch baking pan with foil. Spray foil with cooking sprayset aside. Wash potatoes under cold running waterpat dry with paper towel. Peel off any eyes or brown areas with paring knifecut into thin slices. Mix thyme, cumin powder and ground sumac together in small bowlset aside. Heat oil in medium skillet over medium-high heatcook onions until translucent but not brown, about 3 minutes. Mix onions with flour until well blendedadd milk to onion mixture and cook until mixture thickens to consistency of gravy, about 5 minutes. Add spices and saltremove from heat. Dip each slice of potato into flourthen into onion mixturethen into flour again. Lay potato slices on prepared baking sheetbrush both sides with buttersprinkle with thyme mixture. Bake until golden brown, about 45 minutessprinkle with parsley before serving.name

In a large skillet cook the hamburger and onion until the hamburger is no longer pink. Add the taco seasoning mix and water. Stir well. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Transfer to a 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Top with the tomato paste and cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
In a large skillet or pot, add flour. Add a little water at a time and stir until desired consistency. Add all other ingredients. Simmer for 1 hour. Add more water if desired. Enjoy.

In a saucepan combine rhubarb and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add sugar and cook until mixture is thick, about another 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin and milk until dissolved. Pour into mold and chill until set. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream on top.

Spray slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the macaroni, butter, eggs, evaporated milk and soup. Pour into the slow cooker. Combine the milk, cheddar cheese and paprika in a bowl. Stir until the cheese is melted. Pour into the slow cooker. Cook on low for 5 hours. Sprinkle with additional paprika before serving if desired.
Combine the cucumber with the mint and set aside. In a bowl combine the other ingredients. Mix and refrigerate. Serve with the cucumber mixture.

Heat oil in a skillet. Cook chicken over medium heat until browned. Add water, milk, mustard, soup mix, broccoli. Heat through. Spoon into 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with roasted red peppers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Season the cod fillet with salt and pepper. Place the shallot in a small bowl. Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the shallots and cook until they are softened. Add the cherry tomatoes, olives, capers, and oregano. Add the vinegar to the tomato mixture and season with more pepper if you like. Set aside. Spray a small baking dish lightly with cooking spray. Lay the seasoned cod in the baking dish. Spoon the shallot-tomato mixture over the top. Cover the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Carefully remove the foil. Bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top. Serve warm.

Combine all ingredients except for the chicken in a medium sized bowl. Place in a 13 X 9 inch baking pan. Place chicken breasts in marinade and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven until done (1 to 1 1/4 hours). Remove from pan. Toss together water and cornstarch. Add to pan. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Pour over chicken. Garnish with parsley.

Heat the oven to 375 degrees f. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, stirring occasionally, until softened and beginning to brown, about 15 minutes. Add the thyme leaves. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a 13x9x2-inch baking dishset aside. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heatadd the potatoes and cook until golden brown on each side, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer the potatoes to the baking dish with the onion mixturetoss to combine. Sprinkle the potatoes and onion mixture evenly with the butter. Bake until the potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the sour cream before serving.

Beat cream cheese at medium speed with a mixer until smooth. Add milk and mayonnaisebeat well. Add green onions and next 3 ingredientsmix well. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or until ready to serve. Stir in tuna just before serving. Top with paprika. Serve with crackers.

In a 9 x 13-inch pan, pour in all of the crushed pineapple, blackberries and peaches. In a separate bowl, combine the cake mix and the melted butter. Spread over the top of the fruit layer evenly in the pan. Sprinkle the pecans over the top of the cake mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 12-16.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the oven rack on the top third of the oven. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the milk. Bring to a boil and cook for one minute. Remove from the heat. In a medium bowl whisk the egg yolks and cayenne pepper. Slowly whisk the warm milk into the yolks. Place the saucepan over medium heat and cook the sauce, whisking constantly until it thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Spread the sauce over the top halves of the english muffins. Top the english muffins with the slices of canadian bacon and slices of swiss cheese. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the butter. Break the eggs and place them in the skillet. Cook until the whites are set and the yolks are still runny. Transfer to the plates and serve.

Heat the oil and butter over medium-high heat in a large heavy skillet. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the chicken and sprinkle with the sage, salt and pepper. Cook until no longer pink in the center. Add the chicken broth and potato. Cover and cook until the chicken is fully cooked, about 3 minutes. Add the parsley and stir. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with butter, flour and 2 cups milk. Stir in salt, pepper and paprika. Add bouillon granules and remaining milk. Heat. Add velveeta and heat to melt. Serve with steak and vegetable.
Saute onion in butter. Add flour, salt, sugar and pepper. Mix in sour cream, string beans and cheese. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with cornflakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Split the bread lengthwise and toast. Mix the eggs and milk together in a bowl and whisk in the butter. Spread the hot pepper jelly and hot sauce onto the toast. Lay the turkey on top, followed by the ham. Sprinkle on the Monterey Jack pepper cheese and the hot sauce. Fry in a hot skillet until the cheese melts.
Cook chicken until done. Cut into chunks. Add celery and diced bell peppers. Add dressing mix to taste. Mix well and add mayonnaise until desired consistency is reached. Serve on lettuce or bread.

Wash and dry mushroom caps. In a pan over medium heat, fry onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add scallion. Mix in meat and fry until well done. Drain fat from pan. Stir in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Add egg and mix well. Fill caps with mixture, sprinkle with crumbs and bake in a preheated oven at 200 C for 15 minutes.

In a small saucepan, combine sugar, water and creamy peanut butter. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils, about 4 minutes. Cool slightly. Pour over ice cream in bowls or mugs. Garnish with salted peanuts.
Mix mashed potatoes with the rest of the ingredients. Bake at 350 for 1 hour in a greased and floured 9x11 pan. Top with coconut and nuts and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Place the milk, honey, vanilla extract and sugar in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the couscous. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the mixed fruits and nuts. Serve warm.
Cook pastina as directed on package, drain and add milk and butter. Beat 2 eggs and add to mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Top with shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and serve hot.

Cut steak into small cubes. In a medium bowl, mix steak cubes and ginger. Add olive oil and toss until well coated. Season with black pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add steak mixture and brown well. Add a little water if the mixture sticks. Add sweet potato cubes and sweet chili sauce. Stir well and cook until tender. Stir in lemon juice and serve immediately.
Name: Sweet Potato BrowniesIngredients: 1/2 cup whole wheat flour 1/2 cup cocoa powder 1/2 cup brown sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon baking soda 2 large eggs 1/2 cup applesauce 1 cup sweet potato, cooked and mashed (about 1 large potato) 1/2 cup walnuts or pecans (chopped) 1/2 cup white chocolate (or dark) chips Directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an

Bake rolls in the oven at 350 degrees f for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned. Brush with melted butter. Fill with black forest ham and gruyere cheese slices. Top with chive & onion cream cheese spread (see recipe) and place in the oven at 350 degrees f until melted (about 10 minutes). Top with parmesan cheese and worcestershire sauce. Makes 6 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 375f. Separate biscuits into 12 rounds. In a large skillet cook green pepper and onion until crisp-tenderdrain. Place 1 round of dough on an ungreased cookie sheetsprinkle with 1/2 cup pepperoni, 1/4 cup peppers, 1/4 cup onions and 1/4 cup mushroomssprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese. Repeat with remaining doughtop with remaining cheese. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Top each with 2 tablespoons pasta sauce and 1/2 cup cheesesprinkle with black olives. Return to oven until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings (2 pizzas).

In a large saucepan brown meat and onions. Stir in garlic salt. Add tomato sauce, enough water to cover 3/4 the meat and simmer. Slice off tops of peppers and remove seeds. Fill with meat mixture and top with rice. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes longer.

Mix all dry ingredients together and pour in oil, milk and eggs. Blend well. Fold in coffee liqueur. Bake in a greased bundt pan at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing to a wire rack. Combine powdered sugar with liqueur until it is smooth and drizzle over the top of the cooled cake. Garnish with espresso beans and serve.
Wash pink beans. Boil with 4-5 cups of water for 1 hour. Add 3 slices of ham hock. Cook for another 1 1/2 hours or until the beans are very tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In large bowl, mash avocado to desired consistency. Add tomatillos and onionmash to desired consistency. Add tomatoes and lime juice and mix well. In small bowl, combine red pepper flakes and hot pepper sauce. Gently stir into guacamole mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Sprinkle with salt and pepper before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking soda and salt until blended. Add the bananas and mix thoroughly. Add the butter, eggs and vanilla and mix well. Fold in the chocolate chips and mix well. Spread into the greased baking pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the pan comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

Lightly grease or spray baking sheet. Roll out crescent rolls into 6 inch square and place on baking sheet. Brush with miracle whip and sprinkle with pepper. Layer onions and crab meat in the middle of each square. Sprinkle with grated cheese and bake at 375 degrees until heated through and golden brown on top, about 12 minutes. Cut into triangles and serve warm with lemon wedges and parsley.

In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs and cheese. In a separate bowl, combine butter and garlic. Press fish into breadcrumb mixture. Put in greased pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Turn fish over and cook for another 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Drizzle with garlic butter. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Name: Baked Flounder
Ingredients: Flounder Fillets
Lemon Juice, Dried Tarragon
Low-Fat Sour Cream
Name: Flounder Bake
Ingredients: Butter, Onions
Italian Seasoned Breadcrumbs
Name: Flounder Spinach Bake
Ingredients: Flounder Fillets
Seasoned Croutons
Whole Kernel Corn
Name: Flounder Saute
Italian Peppers
Name: Crunchy Baked Fish Fillets
French Fried Onions
Name: Pan Sauteed Sole Flounder Parmesan
Ingredients: Sole Fillets
Name: Crunchy Fish

Mix together the dark brown sugar, all-purpose flour, eggs, salt and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla in a large bowl. Add the milk and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of vanillabeat well with an electric mixer until smooth. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray two 8-ounce ramekins with cooking spray. Divide the pudding evenly among the ramekinsplace in a shallow roasting pan. Add enough water to pan to come halfway up side of ramekins. Bake until pudding is set in center, about 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pancool completely. Store in refrigerator. Top with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Bring 1 gallon of water to a boil and add 2 tablespoons of salt to the water and cook the spaghetti. Drain and return to the pot. Add 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil and 4 cloves of minced garlic and toss together to coat the spaghetti with the olive oil and garlic. Add 1/2 hot red chili peppers to the pot and toss with the spaghetti. Chop 2 tablespoons of fresh Italian parsley and add to the pot and toss again with the spaghetti. Serve the hot spaghetti immediately with 1/2 of a hot red chili pepper and a sprinkling of fresh Italian parsley on top of each serving of the hot spaghetti.

Rinse and pat dry the chicken. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and saute until golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 15 minutes. Remove the skillet from heat. Add the rosemary and marmalade. Stir to combine. Return the skillet to heat. Add the vinegar and olive oil. Stir to combine. Toss to coat. Remove the pan from heat. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter. Pour the glaze over the top. Garnish with the orange segments and parsley.
Boil potatoes. Mash them. Add peas and butter. Heat through. Add watercress. Gently fold in corn. Add salt and pepper.
In a saucepan over medium-high heat, bring broth to boiling. Reduce heat and stir in mashed potatoes, cheese and spinach. Heat through. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
Prepare Jiffy cornbread mix as directed on box. Add 1 tsp mayonnaise to the batter. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes.

In a large pot over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and cook until softened and translucent. Stir in carrot and garlic and cook until softened. Add peas and stir to combine. Add turkey ham and stir to combine. Add broth and stir to combine. Add marjoram and stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir to combine. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine the beef, salt, and pepper and knead until combined. Divide into four even portions and form into patties. Heat the butter in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the patties to the pan and fry until cooked through, about 4 minutes per side for medium. Remove from the pan and keep warm while making the fries. Fry the fries in the hot frying pan until crisp and golden brown. In the meantime make the gravy. In a separate pan over medium-low heat add the beef stock, cream, sage, thyme, garlic powder, onion powder and bay leaves. Stir occasionally until the mixture comes to a simmer then reduce to medium-low heat. Simmer until reduced by half, about 20 minutes, then remove the bay leaves. Add the butter and whisk until smooth. In the last minute of cooking add the mozzarella cubes to the gravy and stir until the cheese is melted and the gravy is smooth. To assemble the burgers, place the beef patty on the bottom

Combine first 7 ingredients in a large 6-quart slow cooker. Cook on low 8 hours. Puree and press through a food mill into a large bowl. Cover and chill 4 hours or up to 2 days. Spread apple butter into 1-pint jar or container. Seal and store up to 2 weeks refrigerated. Makes about 2 1/2 cups apple butter.

Combine dry ingredients. Cream together Crisco, sugar and eggs. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk, beating until well mixed. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes in a greased tube pan or bundt pan. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a cooling rack.
I love the Pound Cake recipe with the Chocolate Ganache and the Crunchy Pound Cake recipe! I love to experiment with recipes. I’m trying the Pound Cake with the Cream Cheese frosting this weekend!
I love the Pound Cakes with the Chocolate Ganache! I also love the Cream Cheese Frosting recipe! Thanks for the great recipes!

In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, strawberries, kiwi, and almonds. Divide between two plates. Top with the onions. Slice the chicken into thin strips. Arrange over the onions. Top with the feta cheese and poppy seeds.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Rub pork with mixture and set aside. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and cornstarch. In a large ziplock bag combine brown sugar and cornstarch and mix. Add pork. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate 2 hours. Preheat grill to medium high. Place pork on hot grill and cook for 6 minutes. Flip and cook for an additional 6 minutes. Slice and serve with fresh salsa.

Brown bratwurst in skillet and remove from pan. Add green bell peppers and red bell peppers. Cook until softened. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add caraway seed and paprika and cook 1 minute longer. Return bratwurst to pan and cook 5 minutes longer. Serve over hot cooked potatoes or buns and mustard and enjoy.

Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken breasts to the pan and cook until golden brown. Add the broth, dried herbs, cauliflower and carrots and bring the liquid to a boil. Cover the saucepan and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes. Add the cooked pasta and parmesan cheese to the broth, and stir to combine well. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Put the oil in a large nonstick skillet and turn the heat to high. When the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds and when they begin to sputter, add the garlic and cook for a minute longer. Add the onions and cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the lentils to the onions and stir well to mix. Add 2 cups of the water to the skillet. Turn down the heat to low and cook the lentils for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the salt and cayenne pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine honeydew melon and 1/2 cup lime juice. Drain macaroni again. In a large bowl combine macaroni, honeydew, ham, celery, onion, mayonnaise, 1/2 cup lime juice, honey and cilantro. Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until golden brown. Transfer to a plate. In the same skillet combine the ham, spinach, mustard and goat cheese. Cook until the goat cheese has melted. Return the chicken to the skillet. Top with breadcrumbs and cook for 2-3 minutes more. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Season chicken breast with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, mix flour and 1 tablespoon oil. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture to coat all sides. Heat the remaining oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook, turning once, until the outside is brown, about 3 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle the chicken with the fresh thyme, olives, and sherry. Bake until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and add the gnocchi. Cook 5-6 minutes or until the gnocchi float to the top. Drain well and set aside. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and add the garlic. Stir in the basil leaves and cook for about 1 minute. Add the cheeses to the skillet and stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is smooth. Add the prosciutto and stir until the prosciutto is heated through. Add the gnocchi to the skillet with the cheese mixture. Toss well to coat the gnocchi with the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper, if desired. Serve with a fresh green salad.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a shallow baking pan with the margarine and sprinkle with the cinnamon. Arrange the chops in the pan. Arrange the sliced apple over the top. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the top. Bake for about 45 minutes or until the pork is no longer pink in the center and the liquid is thick and bubbly. Serve over rice or potatoes and enjoy.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add snow peas and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add cooked brown rice and stir to combine. Top with cilantro.
In heavy medium saucepan over low heat, combine milk, sugar, butter and flour. Cook 5-10 minutes until thickened. Stir in cocoa and salt. Makes about 1 cup.

Sift together sugar and cinnamon. In a medium saucepan, combine sugar mixture with water. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat and cook until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Let syrup cool for 20 minutes. Whisk in soymilk and vanilla extract. Cover and chill at least one hour. Fill shallow metal pan with ice cubes and pour in cooled mixture. Freeze for about two hours or until mixture begins to crystalize into large chunks of ice. Sprinkle with almonds. Dip a few mint sprigs into mixture, then skewer onto each plate. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Mix together first six ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the last five ingredients. Stir together wet and dry ingredients just until moistened. Pour into a 9x13x2-inch glass pan coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into 12 bars.
I'm not sure which one to try first.
I can't decide what I like better. I love to use Pam in the oven and on the stove top. It works so well. I have always used it but never tried this recipe. I am going to try it this weekend and then post my results.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour a 9×5 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, and cinnamonset aside. In a small bowl, combine the applesauce and sugar until smooth. Add the egg whites and vanillamix well. Add the applesauce mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until well blended. Fold in the mashed bananas. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for about an hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
A Banana Bread Recipe that you can use on your website or blog.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease and flour a cookie sheet. Beat together butter and chocolate in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and continue to beat until well blended. Add flour and beat until smooth and well blended. Add sugar and beat until smooth. Fold in nuts if desired. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes or until set. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack and cool completely.

Put all crock pot seasoning packet contents in slow cooker bowl. Add potatoes. Add chicken broth to cover potatoes. Layer remaining ingredients over potatoes in slow cooker. Cover with lid or foil. Cook 8 hours or until pork is tender. Serve over rice or noodles.
Love to have some of this for dinner!
I made this for dinner tonight and it was delicious! I had to make some modifications to my own taste (I added garlic to the onions to saute), but it was easy and delicious.
I made this tonight for supper. It was delicious!
I made this recipe this weekend, but used smoked turkey legs in place of the pork. I added some onions, too. It was really good!
I made this recipe for dinner tonight. It was delicious! I made some modifications to my own taste (added garlic to the onions to saute), but it was easy to make. Thanks for another great recipe!

Beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer on high speed for 1 minute or until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar until well blendedbeat in vanilla extract until well blended. Shape into a 1 inch ballroll in nutsrefrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking pan or dish with butter or cooking spray. Mix together apple pie filling and raisins. Peel the sweet potatoes and slice them into thin rounds. Place the sweet potato rounds and the raisin mixture into the prepared baking dish or pan and stir gently. Bake for 25 minutes or until the sweet potato rounds are tender. Melt butter with the apple pie spice and stir into the mixture. Spread pecans over the mixture and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Sprinkle with extra apple pie spice, if desired. Serve warm or cold.

In a blender or food processor combine the oil, vinegar, pepper, and salt. Blend well, then set aside. Saute the onion and jalapenos in olive oil for 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute more. Add the cilantro and saute for 2 minutes more. Turn off heat. Add the cilantro mixture to the blender with the oil mixture. Blend well until smooth. Taste for seasonings. Store in the refrigerator. Serve with chips or as a sauce for fish or chicken.

Heat oil over medium heat and add shallots until lightly browned but not burned. Add garlic and fresh cracked pepper, and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add corn kernels, fish sauce, crushed red pepper flakes, and 1/4 cup of water. Stir until the corn is just cooked through. Set aside. Whisk together egg and cornflour until smooth, then add into the pan along with the remaining 1/4 cup of water. Stir until the mixture thickens, then turn off the heat. Let the mixture cool for a few minutes. Place the mixture into a bowl, add the cooked corn and mix together until evenly combined. Use a tablespoon measure to scoop the mixture into small balls. Heat oil over medium heat and shallow-fry the corn balls until golden brown on both sides. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Serve with fresh chili paste or ketchup for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350. Saute the ground turkey with olive oil until cooked. Add garlic and seasonings. Add the spaghetti sauce and let simmer for 30 minutes. Add corn and let simmer for 10 minutes. Add the elbow macaroni and bake for 20 minutes. Serve with parmesan cheese if desired.

Steep tea bags in boiling water for 3 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Stir in unsweetened cranberry juice, apple cider & brown sugar. Slice a cinnamon stick in half. Slice a piece of ginger into thin slices. In a pot combine the cinnamon stick & ginger slices. Bring to a boil for 30 minutes on low heat. Strain out the ginger & cinnamon slices. Pour the apple cider mixture over the cinnamon & ginger syrup. Chill at least an hour before serving. Float an orange slice in each serving glass.
I’d like a word or two about the word “fruit.” Fruit is a noun that is the part of a plant that develops from a flower. It is also a verb that means to bear fruit. When referring to a piece of fruit, however, we don’t use the word “fruit” as a verb. Instead we use the word “bear” as in “apples bear fruit.” If we’re talking about a tree that bears fruit we can say “the tree bears app

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place potato wedges in a large bowl. Toss with 1 tablespoon oil and sprinkle with salt. Place in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Whisk together maple syrup and marmalade. Whisk in mustard and lemon juice. Stir in pecans. Spread over potato wedges. Bake 5 to 10 more minutes until heated through.

Bring broth to a boil in a large pot or Dutch oven over high heat. Add the rice and cook uncovered for 12 to 15 minutes. The water level should be about even with the top of the rice. Add the carrots and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine honey, soy sauce and vinegar. In another bowl, combine garlic and ginger. Mix well. In a skillet, over medium heat, add enough oil to lightly coat the bottom. Cook pork 5 minutes on each side. Pour glaze mixture over pork. Continue cooking 5 minutes longer or until meat thermometer reads 160.

Combine gelatin and boiling water in a bowl, stir until dissolved. Add the sour cream and stir until smooth. Stir in the pineapple. Pour into a 2 qt. mold. Chill until firm. Top the gelatin with the vegetables, sprinkle with nuts, and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, salt, and baking powder and mix well. In a separate bowl combine cream and whipping cream, then stir in green chili pepper and garlic and mix well. Add to flour mixture and stir just until a soft dough forms. On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut out shapes with a 3 inch round cookie cutter and place on a greased cookie sheet. Brush tops with beaten egg and sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the beets until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. Cut the beets into quarters and return them to the pot. Add the butter, onions and sugar. Toss gently until the sugar has melted and the beets and onions are coated. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate. Toss just before serving and season with salt and pepper to taste.
i am looking for a recipe for roasted beet and lemon juice salad...anyone have any ideas?
I just saw this recipe for pickled red beets (from Cook's Illustrated). Has anyone tried it?
This recipe was very good and easy to follow. I was really impressed how well the spices were absorbed and how delicious they tasted. The only thing I would change is to use less salt and more pepper in the recipe.
I am not sure what kind of vinegar you are using here but I would try some red wine vinegar or raspberry vinegar. I hope this helps!

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine lentils, vegetable broth, diced onion, red bell peppers. Bring to a boil, cover the saucepan and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for about an hour or until the lentils are tender. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add red pepper flakes. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve warm. Serves 6-8.

In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat the butter over medium-low heat. Add the red onion and garlic cloves. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the bay leaf and the black peppercorns and cloves. Stir well, and cook for another minute or two. Season the mixture well with salt. Pour in the red wine and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat. Lay out the puff pastry and place the onion mixture in the center. Top with the Jarlsberg and the thyme. Fold the dough over the filling and press firmly together. Make an incision in the middle of the pastry and put in a few more thyme leaves. Brush the pastry with the egg yolk and milk mixture and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Pour hot water over the stuffing according to package instructions. Spread on the bottom of a greased 13x9 inch pan. Place the chicken breasts on top of the stuffing. Stir together the condensed soup, sour cream, peas and carrots in a small bowl. Pour over the top of the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 35 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink.

In a small bowl combine soy sauce, molasses, sesame oil, tahini, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and chili oil until well blended. Toss with the cooked noodles and green onions. Mix in the salt to taste and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
hiyashi soba cold noodlesingredients: soba noodles, water, japanese soy sauce, mirin, ginger, leeks, nori, wasabipreparation:Boil water, soy sauce and mirin. Allow to cool and place in the refrigerator. Cook soba according to package instruction. Wash soba in cool running water. Place soba in bowl and garnish with ginger, leeks and nori. Pour cold broth over the noodles. Add wasabi according to taste.
soba and shrimp saladingredients: soba noodles, wasabi powder, soy sauce, lemon juice, spinach, green onions, baby shrimp, pick
Blend first four ingredients and refrigerate. Serve over cottage cheese and top with green onion. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet. Mash the bananas well in a large mixing bowl, then add the butter, applesauce, raw sugar, and vanilla extract. Stir the eggs into the mixture one at a time, adding them in small amounts. In a separate bowl, sift the flour with the baking soda and salt. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet. Stir in the quick-cooking oats and chocolate chips. Drop the cookie dough by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven when the edges are set, but the center remains soft. Allow the cookies to cool on the cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling.

Prepare the marinade by sauteing the onions in the oil until soft. Add the parsley, and cook another minute or two. Add the garlic and cook until it is golden brown. Add the tomato sauce and cook for another minute or two. Remove from heat and allow the marinade to cool. Pour the marinade over the fish steaks and allow them to marinade for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. Preheat the broiler, and place the fish steaks in a shallow casserole dish. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper and broil for about 4 minutes per side or until the fish is just cooked through and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from the broiler and serve immediately with the tomato sauce spooned over the top.
Baked Halibut Recipes / Cooking & Recipes / RecipeGold
Baked Halibut Recipes
Bake halibut steaks with a mixture of lemon zest and Parmesan cheese for a delicious dinner entrée.
Bake the fish in a casserole

Bring large pot of salted water to a boil for pasta. Cook broccoli in a large pot of boiling water for 6 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain both pasta & broccoli and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes until golden brown. Whisk in milk until smooth & thickened, then add Dijon mustard. Add cheese & stir until melted & smooth. Stir in broccoli & cooked pastatoss until well coated. Serve immediately with additional cheese if desired.
