Mine came out a little runny in the middle, so I'll make it again and maybe add more milk.
I will be making this again and again! I added the zest of a lemon and a little fresh thyme. I also added more milk than called for because I like it creamy. Delicious!
Great soup! I added some minced garlic when I browned the onion.
This was my first time making this soup and I must say it was delicious! I did however add a little more milk than the reci

Heat 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry until aromatic but not browned (30 seconds to 1 minute). Add the shrimp and stir-fry until opaque. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil and the onion. Stir-fry until the onion is translucent. Add the rice and fish sauce and stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the sugar and stir-fry until the sugar is melted. Add the shrimp and pineapple and stir-fry to combine. Remove from the heat and stir in the green onions. Serve immediately.
Mix ranch dressing mix with cider vinegar and butter until smooth. Add hot pepper sauce and paprika. Place in a slow cooker. Add the chicken wings and cook on high for 2 1/2 hours. Remove and serve.

In a large bowl, cream together margarine and sugar. Beat until fluffy. Beat in cream cheese. Beat until fluffy. Add Jellostir until dissolved. Fold in whipped topping. Fold in drained raspberries. Spoon into a 9x13 dishchill until set. Sprinkle with pretzel sticks.
Prepare jello according to package instructions. Add all other ingredients. Chill 1 hour. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In large skillet over medium heat, add ground beef. Season with Italian seasoning. Cook until beef is no longer pink. Drain off any excess grease. Add ravioli to skillet. Add spaghetti sauce. Add frozen spinach. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour into a casserole dish. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve.

Slice pita bread into 3 pieces. Spread each piece with cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle each with 1/3 of the vegetables and 1/4 of the cheese. Arrange 1 piece of bread on a large platter or tray. Top with 1/3 of the salad mixture and 1/4 of the tuna mixture. Top with 1/3 of the vegetables and 1/4 of the cheese. Top with remaining bread slice. Repeat steps until all ingredients are used. Serve with salad.

Wash the spinach thoroughly and drain in a colander. Place the spinach and 1/4 cup of water into a pan and cook over medium-low heat until the leaves are bright green and wilted but still have some body. The water will evaporate and steam will rise from the pan. Drain well and sprinkle the sesame seeds evenly on top of the cooked spinach. Heat the sesame oil in a small skillet until it just begins to smoke. Pour the hot oil evenly over the spinach and sesame seeds and toss until well coated. The dressing may be prepared ahead and kept chilled. It will keep about one week, stored in a tightly covered container. Mix together before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground turkey until browned. Drain off excess fat and add carrots to skillet. Cook until carrots are tender-crisp. In small bowl, combine the egg with the Italian seasoned breadcrumbs, Worcestershire Sauce and Garlic Powder. Season with black pepper to taste. Gently stir the egg mixture into the ground turkey mixture until well blended. Transfer mixture to prepared pan. Spread the frozen hash browns evenly over the top of the mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Drizzle with the melted butter. Bake 30-35 minutes or until bubbling and golden brown. Serve immediately with salsa or sour cream if desired.

Cream yolks and sugar until light and creamy. Add vanilla extract and mix well. Stir in chopped nuts and lemon rind. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet and bake for 8 minutes in a moderate oven (350). Cool on wire racks.

Soak bread in half-and-half for 10 minutes or until soft. Squeeze out liquid and mash bread with the back of a fork. Combine with ground turkey, beaten egg, and seasonings. Make small patties and dredge in breadcrumbs and place on a plate. Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat and fry cutlets until cooked through and browned on both sides. Remove cutlets from skillet and place on paper towels to drain excess oil. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy or serve over noodles or rice.
If you are looking for some great recipes for cutlets I have found a great site with lots of recipes for cutlets at allrecipes.com . Here are some of my favorite recipes for cutlets from that site.
These look great and I just got an amazing deal on ground turkey from Krogers this week so I will have to try the Russian style cutlets!
These look so good! I love cutlets and have never really thought to make them at home!
Great recipes and love the pictures!
I have never had

In a bowl whisk together the mayo, honey, vinegar and poppy seeds. Add the apples and cranberries to the dressing. Gently fold in the cooked chicken. Place the chicken mixture onto a slice of bread. Spread more dressing over the top of the bread. Add another slice of bread over the dressing and the chicken.

Cream together the butter and powdered sugar until fluffy, then beat in the vanilla. In a separate bowl combine the flour and baking powder, then add to the creamed mixture. Shape into 1-inch balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar while warm if desired.
My recipe for homemade chocolate chips is just a little different than most I have found. This recipe is very similar to a recipe I found in one of the Southern Living magazines. I have tweaked it a little, though.
Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over medium heat. Remove from heat when all of the chocolate has melted. Mix in the peanut butter and vanilla extract until well blended.
Place the chocolate mixture in a bowl, cover the bowl with plastic wrap or wax paper, and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour (or until chocolate has hardened).
Scoop the chocolate out of the bow

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in garlic. Reduce heat to low. Cook for about 2 minutes. Stir in brown sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves, 3 minutes more. Meanwhile, season beef with salt and pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add beefcook for 1 minute on each side. Remove beef from pan. Drain onions, reserving butter. Add onions and 1 Tbsp. butter to pan. Toss onions until glazed. Add balsamic vinegartoss. Place beef on top of onions. Spoon onion mixture over beef. Garnish with parsley.

Combine ground beef through sugar in a large mixing bowl. Mix well and form into 1 inch balls. Place on a large baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. While the meat balls are baking, combine the tomato paste and tomato sauce in a saucepan. Add sugar and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the meat balls to the sauce and simmer until thoroughly heated. Serve with spaghetti or over rice.

Whisk the sugar, cranberries, honey, milk, and eggs together in a shallow dish. Place the bread slices on the dish. Sprinkle the brie evenly over the top of each slice. Dip the brie-topped sides of the bread into the egg mixture. Heat the butter in an ungreased skillet. Cook the sandwiches until the bottom is golden brown, 3 minutes. Turn the sandwiches over, top side down. Cook until the other side is golden brown, 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and sprinkle the sandwiches with powdered sugar. Cut each sandwich into 2 or 3 triangles. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut one of the crusts in half and roll each half out to about 10 inches. Cut each piece into four pieces. Place one piece of pastry into a 9 inch pie plate. With a fork or small whisk, beat together the butter and the water. Brush the top of the pastry with the butter mixture. Layer the mushrooms on the bottom and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer the spinach and the cheese on top. Cut the second pastry in half and place one half on top of the filling. Brush the top of the pastry with the butter mixture. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking for 20 minutes. Let cool slightly and cut into wedges.

Combine first four ingrediants in a sauce pan and simmer until liquid is reduced to 2/3 of original volume. Let cool. Stir in beer. Cover and chill 24 hours. Mash until desired consistancy. Add water or beer to thin to desired consistancy.

Preheat oven to 375. In a medium bowl, combine brownie mix and water. Mix according to box directions until well blended. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer on medium high speed until foamy. Gradually beat in applesauce and sugar until stiff peaks form. Fold in whipped topping with a rubber spatula. Divide batter among 12 paper-lined muffin cups. Bake until set but still soft in center, about 18 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine chocolate chips and applesauce until melted and smooth. Dip tops of cupcakes in chocolate. Top with candies. Refrigerate.

Mix eggs and cornflour to a smooth batter. Add in the salt and sugar and whisk together until the mixture is smooth. Add in the melted butter and whisk until smooth. Place in a greased and lined tin and bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees celsius for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in tin for ten minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Beat together eggs, sugar, flour and salt. Add orange juice and rind. Beat well. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into centerit should come out clean. Remove from oven. Cool in pan for about 5 minutes. Then turn out onto wire rack to cool completely.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add onions and cook until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Add garlic and cook an additional 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a large saucepan over medium heat. Add remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to skillet. Add potatoes, cook for 4 minutes. Add to onion mixture. Add broth to cover potatoes. Add the cauliflower. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork, about 20 minutes. Working in batches, puree the mixture in a blender or food processor. Return soup to the pot. Add water to thin the soup to desired consistency. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped chives. Serves 4-6.

In a 4-quart saucepan, combine the broth, corn, celery rib, carrot and onion. Cover the pan, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the chicken, diced tomato and seasoningsheat through. Serve immediately.

In small bowl combine soy sauce, rice wine and brown sugar. Blend well and set aside. Heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and gingerroot and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add beef and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Add sauce and cook 1 minute. Stir in snow peas and cornstarch mixture. Stir-fry for 1 minute longer. Serve over rice and pass hot mustard.

In a large skillet cook onion, curry powder and butter over medium heat until onion is tender. Stir in chicken broth, aroma seasoning, and cooked chicken. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is heated through. In a 2 quart casserole dish combine cooked rice with chicken mixture. Sprinkle corn flake crumbs over top of dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Brown ground beef and onion in a large skillet. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. Heat tomato sauce. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Combine macaroni, meat mixture and pepperoni slices. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top and bake 5 minutes more. Serves 4.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken breast and cook until browned. Remove chicken from skillet and cut into bite-sized pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the eggplant and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden. Transfer eggplant to a plate and set aside. Add the marinara sauce, crushed tomatoes with their juices and the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet. Add the chicken and basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Drain the pasta and add to the pan with the sauce. Stir to combine. Transfer the mixture to a large casserole dish. Top with the mozzarella and Romano cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until browned. Serve with additional sauce.
Beat margarine, powdered sugar, vanilla and flour together well. Add walnuts. Shape into balls about the size of a large marble. Roll in powdered sugar. Refrigerate. Makes about 125.

In a small saucepan, combine the barbecue sauce with enough water to make 1 1/2 cups of sauce. Cook over medium heat until smooth and bubbly. Place the hot dogs in a baking dish. Top with the sauce and bake in a 350 degree oven until heated through. Serve hot in a roll with the slices of cheese.

Grill 2 to 3 ears of fresh corn at a time over direct heat, turning occasionally until well charred, about 15 minutes. Remove from grill to cool slightly. Cut kernels off cobs into a bowl. Add frozen orange juice concentrate (thawed) to bowl. Mash together with potato masher until well combined. Add molasses, chipotle chiles, lime juice, cilantro, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Taste and adjust seasoning with more lime juice or salt to taste. Serve warm with more fresh cilantro and lime wedges for squeezing.

In a bowl of a food processor, combine flour and lard. Add sugar, then salt. Pulse until mixture is evenly distributed. Add cold water one tablespoon at a time, pulsing until mixture clumps around blade. Remove dough to a clean bowl. Add egg and pulse until just incorporated. Cover and chill for 30 minutes. Roll out dough between two sheets of wax paper to about 1/8-inch thickness. Lift dough onto a plate or baking sheet. Refrigerate until firm enough to roll easily. Dough can be frozen for up to two months. To use frozen dough, let stand for 20 minutes. Roll out as directed above. Makes 2 crusts.

Prepare the pudding according to the package directions. Drain the canned pineapple well. Add the eggs and the remaining dry ingredients. Mix thoroughly. Pour into greased 9 by 12 by 2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until well browned. Cool. Serve warm.

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a saute pan over med-high heat. Add shallots and saute until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the shrimp and scallops and saute another 2 minutes. Add the mussels and saute another 2 minutes, shaking pan to mix everything together. Add the mushrooms and saute another 2 minutes. Pour in the wine and lemon juice, raise the heat to high and bring to boil. When it boils, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil. Taste for seasoning, adding salt and pepper as needed. Serve the seafood mixture in the pouches.

Preheat your bbq to a high heat. Place the cut side of the tomato down on the grill. After 2 minutes of cooking turn over the other way for 2 minutes and then put the other side down for another 2 minutes. The tomato should be a little blackened on the cut side and soft inside. Slice the green onion into thin rounds and put them on a plate with the tomato. Spoon pesto on top of the tomato and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and parsley.

In a 9-inch skillet cook chicken over medium heat for 6 minutes. Stir in salsa, miracle whip, and chili powder. Cook and stir until thickened. Remove from skillet. Place one tortilla in the same skillet. Spread evenly with about 2 cups of chicken mixture. Sprinkle with about 1/4 cup of the cheese. Fold in half. Cook over medium heat about 1 minute or until lightly browned. Remove from skillet. Repeat with remaining tortilla. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine apples, cranberries, and 2 tablespoons of the brown sugar. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. In another large bowl, combine the oats, flour, pecans, and remaining 1/2 cup brown sugar. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle over fruit. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until topping is lightly browned and fruit is bubbly. Serve warm.

Combine tomatoes and lemon juice in a bowl and set aside. Cook haloumi in a frying pan over medium-high heat for 2 minutes on each side or until golden. Add pesto and cook until haloumi is coated and heated through. Arrange haloumi on plates and top with slices of tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.
This entry was posted on March 11, 2013 at 6:31 am and is filed under Uncategorized.	You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed. You can leave a response, or trackback from your own site.

Brown sausage in skillet. Drain. Add potatoes to skillet and heat through. In a large bowl combine eggs and milk. Add potatoes and sausage to bowl. Stir in cheese and mix well. Bake in greased 2 quart baking dish at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Place 1 cube steak in the center of each piece of foil. In a large bowl mix together the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and the dry onion soup mix. Pour over the steaks. Add the potatoes, celery and carrots. Fold the sides of the foil over the ingredients and fold the ends up. Bake for 1 hour or until the steaks are tender.
Place all the ingredients into a blender and blend until the cantaloupe is pureed. Pour into a bowl and serve chilled.

Cook celery and onion in soup pot with the stock for 5 minutes or until celery is tender. Add broccoli florets and cook for 5 minutes more. Meanwhile melt the margarine in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the mashed potatoes and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring often, or until hot and bubbly. Stir in the half and half and cook for about 5 minutes more or until hot. Combine the broccoli mixture, the mashed potato mixture, the thyme and the cheese in the soup pot. Stir well. Simmer for 15 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper before serving. Serve hot.
Mix ground beef with onions, add soup mixes and sliced mushrooms. Pour into baking dish. Follow directions for biscuits and top with biscuits. Bake until done.

Combine cocoa and 1/2 cup of the sugar in a small saucepan. Add milk and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese and stir until smooth. Cool to room temperature. Beat in remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and vanilla. Fold in frozen topping. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours. Decorate with topping and serve.

Combine picante sauce, lime juice and oil in a large bowl. Add new potatoes and stir to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight. Before serving, stir in remaining ingredients and adjust seasonings if necessary. Tastes better the second day.

Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Place all the other ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend for 30 seconds and then scrape down sides of blender and blend another 30 seconds. Add the chickpeas and blend until the mixture is smooth. Taste for seasonings and add more of any of the spices if desired. Serve with pita bread, crackers or fresh vegetables. You may also spread on sandwiches or wraps. Store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

In a heavy bottomed saucepan take 400gms of sugar and 200gms of milk. Cook on low heat and wait till the sugar dissolves. Turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. Stir continuously to avoid the sugar from sticking at the bottom. It will begin to bubble after 2 to 3 minutes. Add 50gms ghee and 20gms of rava. Keep stirring till it turns golden brown and then add 20gms of cardamom powder and 4 to 6 strands of saffron. Once the mixture leaves the sides of the pan, add the remaining milk and keep stirring. The mixture will leave the sides of the pan once it starts to thicken. When it starts to leave the sides of the pan add 200gms of coconut. Keep stirring till the mixture leaves the sides and is thick enough to make balls. Switch off the gas and add the remaining ghee. Knead the mixture into balls. Let it cool and then roll in desiccated coconut. Store in an air tight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet. Add the shallots, season the chicken with salt and pepper. Brown the chicken on both sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil in a medium saucepan. Add the shallots. Cook over medium heat until the shallots are softened. Add the broth, wine, tarragon, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Add the potatoes. Simmer over low heat for 15 to 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Transfer the potatoes to a serving platter. Arrange the chicken breast halves on the platter. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Garnish with the parsley.

Brown sausage. Add 1 tbsp. oil to pan. Saute onion. Combine sausage mixture with remaining oil, rice, chicken stock, tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder and pepper. Combine well. Place half of mixture in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Top with remaining rice mixture. Top with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered at 375f for 45 minutes.
I have been using this website for years now. It has helped me come up with numerous recipes for my family. I love that I can search by ingredient. I can always find something that I can make for my family.
This website is amazing. I use it every time I want to make a recipe. It has saved me a lot of money because I don't have to buy recipe books anymore.
I have been using this website for years. It has saved me a lot of time because I don't have to look for recipes anymore.
This website has saved me a lot of time because I don't have to look for recipes

Cut the pears in half lengthwise and remove the cores. Arrange the pear halves, cut sides up. Toss the arugula in the lemon juice. In a small bowl, combine the hazelnut oil and 1 tablespoon of water. Add the lemon juice mixture to the arugula. Sprinkle the salad with the parmesan cheese. Divide the salad equally among 4 plates. Crumble the blue cheese over the top. Sprinkle the salads with the nuts. Serve immediately.
Pit and slice the apricots. Cook in a pot with sugar and water until the liquid is gone and the apricots are soft. Stir in almond extract and almonds. Serve warm or cold.

Combine lemon cake mix, water, vegetable oil, egg yolks, and poppy seeds in a medium bowl until crumbly. Beat egg whites at high speed until foamy. Add cream of tartarbeat until soft peaks form when beater is lifted. Gradually add sugarbeat until stiff peaks form when beater is lifted. Fold into batterstir just until blended. Spread batter evenly in a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
In a large mixing bowl combine the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt) with the sugar. Cut in the margarine until crumbly. Add the milk gradually, blending well with a fork until a soft dough is formed.
Roll the dough into a ball (about 1 inch) on a lightly floured board. Flatten the ball slightly and place on a lightly greased baking sheet

Melt the butter in a small saucepan and stir in the flour. Add the stock and stir until smooth and boiling. Add the dill and cook for another minute or two. Season with vinegar and sugar and let cool. In a bowl beat the egg yolk and the lemon juice. Add this mixture to the dill sauce and stir until the mixture thickens. Season with salt.

Combine beef, stuffing mix, eggs, salt and pepper in a large mixing bowl. Mix well. Form into 24 balls. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown meatballs in batches until browned. Drain. In a small sauce pan, combine remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the browned meatballs. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towel-lined plate to drain. Cut each tomato into 4 wedges. On each of 4 croissant halves spread mayonnaise to within 1/4 inch of edges. Top each with 2 tomato wedges. Sprinkle each with 3/4 teaspoon garlic, 1 teaspoon parsley, 2 bacon slices, and 1 lettuce leaf. Close sandwiches and wrap in plastic wrap. Serve.

Beat together cream cheese and salad dressing until well blended. Spread in the bottom of a small casserole dish. Top with the seafood cocktail sauce. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Layer with the imitation crabmeat and shrimp. Sprinkle with the green pepper and tomatoes. Top with the green onions. Bake in a preheated 325 degree F oven for 18-22 minutes or until the top is brown and the casserole is heated through. Serve with crackers or bread.

Peel and seed the cucumbers. Cut into 1/4" slices. Combine the vegetable oil, vinegar, and sugar and red pepper in a bowl. Add the cucumbers and toss to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Cut the onions and red radishes into 1/4" slices. Add to the cucumbers. Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Stir before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add carrots and cook for 3 minutes. Add green beans and stir to combine. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 10 minutes or until the beans are tender. Stir in almond milk and herbs. Season with salt. Garnish with parsley.

Place red potatoes and onion in bottom of slow cooker. Place corned beef brisket over top of vegetables. Add apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard, ground cloves, and black pepper. Cover and cook for 6-8 hours. After cooking is complete, remove corned beef and shred. Place shredded corned beef back into slow cooker. Add cooked cabbage. Cook for an additional hour. Serve with additional cider, if desired.

Pour about 2 1/2 inches of vegetable oil into a deep-fat fryer or deep saucepan. Heat to 375. In a bowl, mix flour, mint, oil, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Beat egg whites until stiff. Stir into flour mixture. Stir in onion. Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, to make batter droppable from a spoon. Drop spoonfuls of batter into hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Makes 2 dozen.

Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in tomatoes, bell pepper and bacon. Unfold doughseparate at perforations. Place about 1 tablespoon filling in center of each trianglebring corners of dough together to form a square. Press edges together to seal. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 45 servings (2-1/2 cups).

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift flour and ground ginger together and fold into egg mixture. Add gingerroot and dried fruit. Divide among six greased ramekins. Place in a baking dish and pour in enough boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake 1 hour. Remove from water bath and let cool to room temperature. Cut into wedges and serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into 1/2-inch strips. Toss with chilies, tomatoes, and onion in a large bowl. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper, chili powder, cumin, and salt. Cook until bell pepper is tender. Add chicken mixture to skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve with warm tortillas, shredded cheese, guacamole, and sour cream.

Soak the beans overnight in cold water. Drain the beans, then rinse them well before cooking. In a heavy bottomed pot or dutch oven combine the oil, onions, bay leaf, garlic, thyme and the beans. Heat the beans over medium heat until the liquid comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour until the beans are tender but not mushy. Stir in the chicken stock, add more salt and freshly ground black pepper if needed, then simmer for another 15 minutes to blend the flavors. Serve hot with your favorite breads or toast.

In food processor, chop apricots until small chunks. Add dried cranberries and orange zest. Process to fine crumbs. Add chocolate. Process until blended. Form mixture into 1-inch balls. Dip tops into melted chocolate. Yields 4 dozen truffles.

Preheat the oven to 450. In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the peanut butter and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and cook for 1 minute. Add the coriander and the red pepper flakes and stir to combine. Add the chicken and stir to coat. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or a casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve the chicken topped with the tomato sauce.

Chop the leeks into 2cm (3/4 inch) lengths. Heat the butter in a saucepan. When melted, add the leeks and sauté over a low heat until soft but not brown. Add the parsley, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the potatoes to the leeks. Pour over the stock and bring to the boil. Simmer for 10 minutes until the potatoes are cooked. Remove from the heat. Sift in the flour and add the double cream. Return to the heat and stir continuously over a low heat until the mixture thickens. Allow to cool. Blend until smooth. Stir in the chives. Serve with a crisp salad.

Cut the peppers in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. In a large skillet cook the meat over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Add onion and jalapenoscook until onion is tender. Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste. Add the broth, bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Fill the halved bell peppers with the meat mixture. Place in a greased casserole. Cover with rice. Pour the broth mixture over the peppers. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serves 8.

Place gelatin in small bowl. Add cold water and stir well. Set aside for 5 minutes until slightly softened. Meanwhile, place 3 cups orange juice in medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Add gelatin mixture and stir until dissolved. Add 1/4 cup sugar and lemon juice. Stir well. Remove from heat and stir in 1 1/2 cups cold water. Pour mixture through mesh strainer to remove any lumps. Pour mixture into freezer container or ice cube trays. Freeze until solid. Beat remaining 1 cup cold water into the remaining 1/4 cup sugar until mixture is thick and frothy. Stir into orange mixture. Freeze until slushy. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

In large bowl combine butter, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and lemon pepper. Mix well with popcorn. Store in covered container for up to 2 weeks or store in freezer for 4 months.

Beat together the peanut butter and splenda until smooth and creamy. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper and bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until slightly browned on edges. Do not overcook or the inside will be doughy. Allow to cool for a few minutes then remove from wax paper and cool completely before storing in an air tight container.
Practical Recipes for Easy Cooking
The recipes I have chosen for this book are those that I have found easy and practical for my own cooking and I hope you find them just as helpful as I have done.
The recipes I have chosen for this book are those that I have found easy and practical for my own cooking and I hope you find them just as helpful as I have done. I have tried to keep the recipes as simple as possible so that even those who don't know how to cook will be able to cope with them.
This book is divided into several sections. The first section is devoted to soups and starters - these are simple things that can be made quickly and easily and they will give the meal a

In a small bowl combine cornstarch and brown sugar. In a large bowl combine apple juice, vinegar and orange zest. Skewer the green bell peppers, onions and pineapple chunks alternating with the sausage. Toss in the marinade and let stand for at least 20 minutes. Drain the sausage from the marinade reserving the marinade. Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the sausage and cook until brown and cooked through. Pour the reserved marinade over the sausage and simmer until thickened stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and serve over rice or pasta.

Prepare pie shell according to package directions. Bake at 450 degrees F for 7-9 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Meanwhile combine pudding mix with skim milk and vanilla protein powder until thickened. Refrigerate for about an hour or until firm. Fill cooled pie shell with pudding mixture and spread evenly over the bottom and sides of shell. Top with sliced bananas and spread with cool whip. Refrigerate for about an hour before serving.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Drain. Mash the potatoes in a large bowl until smooth. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the green garlic and cook until wilted and tender, about 5 minutes. Add the heavy cream and cook until it bubbles. Remove from heat. Add the garlic and parsley and stir until combined. Add the garlic and herb mixture and mash until combined. Season with the salt and pepper. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a serving dish and garnish with the remaining chopped green garlic and parsley.
I love the recipe and will be trying it on Sunday.
I think I have read somewhere about the green garlic but I have no idea what it is. Can you tell me where I can find it?
Sure thing, I’ll update the post with a link to green garlic.
This looks awesome. Can’t wait to try it. I’m going to have my husband make it for me since I’m out of town. He loves to cook and bake and I

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In skillet, saute mushrooms and onion in butter over medium heat until tender. Stir in garlic. Blend in 1 cup cracker crumbs and 2 Tbs. cheese. Spread in 13×9-inch baking pan. Stir remaining cracker crumbs and cheese in small bowl. Sprinkle over mushroom mixture. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until golden brown. Drizzle with soy sauce and wine. Broil 1 inch from heat 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with crackers or bread.

Cut off the tops and bottoms of the jalapenos. Remove the seeds and membranes. Lay the jalapenos on a baking sheet and roast them in the oven for about 20 minutes. Let the jalapenos cool down. When they are cooled down cut them in half and remove the seeds. Fry the bacon till crispy and drain off the fat. Remove the crispy bacon from the pan and lay it on a paper towel to drain off the excess grease. Add the cream cheese and the cheddar cheese to the pan and stir until melted. Put the jalapenos in a bowl and pour the melted cheese in. Add the bacon and stir. Take a tortilla wrap and spread the cheese mixture evenly all over the inside of the wrap. Roll up the wrap and cut it in half. Serve immediately.

Peel, seed and slice winter squash. In a large saucepan bring 2 quarts water to a boil. Add rice and cook for 15 minutes. Add the squash. Cook for 5 minutes longer. Drain rice mixture. Rinse rice under running water. Cook rice for 5 more minutes. In a large skillet cook bell peppers and onions in olive oil for 5 minutes. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add rice mixture, black-eyed peas, salt and hot pepper sauce. Cook for 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Combine broth and water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Stir in malt vinegar, roasted garlic cloves, dijon-style mustard, honey, peanut oil, salt and pepper until well combined. Serve warm for dipping.

In a heavy skillet, heat butter, then add the chicken breasts. Sprinkle both sides of the breasts with salt and pepper. Brown the breasts well on both sides. Remove breasts and place in a deep bowl. Pour off all the fat from the skillet leaving only about 2 tablespoons of the fat. Return skillet to burner on medium heat. Add the sherry, lemon rind, the juice from half of the lemon, and the heavy cream. Simmer until sauce thickens. Place the breasts on a warm platter, sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and the juice of the other half of the lemon. Spoon the sauce over the breasts and serve immediately. Serves four.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar has dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extracting all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.
Raspberry Cordial Recipe - My Grandmother's recipe for Raspberry Cordial.
Chicken Cordon Bleu Recipe - A quick recipe for chicken cordon bleu for dinner tonight!
Reverse Cordon Bleu Recipe - This is a delicious variation of the classic chicken cordon bleu.
Cordon Bleu Stromboli Recipe - This is a unique variation of a stromboli recipe that can be made in less than an hour.

In a large pot, combine the first 7 ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatreduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes or until the beans are tenderuncover and cook until the liquid is reduced to about 3 cups, about 15 minutes longer. Stir occasionally while cooking. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place the hot dogs in an even layer on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the hot dogs are heated through and brownedremove from the oven, and set aside. Heat the barbecue sauce in a small saucepan over low heatremove from the heat before the barbecue sauce begins to thicken. Stir the barbecue sauce into the bean mixture until well combinedpour the bean mixture into a 9 x 13 baking dish. Serve the beanies n weenies over the bean mixture.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter and the brown sugar until it reaches the hard crack stage, 300 degrees F, on a candy thermometer. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla and the nuts. Spread into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes until it cools and set up slightly. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips. Let cool completely and then break into pieces.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onion, celery ribs, and garlic in the olive oil for about 5 minutes, until tender but not browned. Add the crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, smoked paprika, cayenne, rosemary, and marjoram. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer for 20 minutes. Add sour cream. Reheat but do not boil. Serve with a dollop of sour cream in each bowl.

Bring 3/4 cup water to boil in 2-quart saucepan. Add tortellini. Cook until pasta is tender but still firm to bite (about 15 minutes). Drain pastaset aside. Melt butter in same saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in hamsaute until crisp. Add creamheat through. Add pastatoss until well-coated. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesansprinkle with chives. Serve hot with peas on top.

Place puff pastry into a pie plate. Combine brown sugar, salt, and apples. Spread over top of pastry. Bake at 400 degrees for approximately 40 minutes or until apples are tender. Spread caramel over the top of the hot apple pie. Top with whipped cream sprinkled with powdered sugar or ice cream if desired.
Quick And Easy Apple Doughnuts!
I love the combination of sweet apples with salty bacon. I served the chicken with a side of potatoes with melted cheese on top and it was delicious!

Spread the mayonnaise over the top slice of the white bread. Place the lettuce leaves over the bottom slice and the chicken over the top slice. Place the second slice of bread over the chicken and top with the cooked bacon. Place the second slice of bread over the bacon and spread the remaining mayonnaise over the top slice. Cut the sandwich into four quarters. Garnish with the pickles and serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350°F. Spray two 9x5 inch loaf pans with cooking spray. In a large mixing bowl combine all-purpose flour, baking powder and saltset aside. In a large mixing bowl beat eggs and sugar until light and lemon colored, about 3-5 minutes. Add vanilla and rum extracts. Add beaten egg mixture to the flour mixture. Stir in the eggnog and butter until well blended. Divide batter equally into the pans and bake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar and serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Coat the salmon in the curry mixture and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Roast until cooked through (12-15 minutes). Serve the salmon with rice and garnish with basil leaves.

Cut 4 rounds from the rye loaf. Fry the egg in butter until the whites are just set. Fold the egg in half and place it on the bread round. Crumble the smoked salmon over the egg. Add the freshly ground pepper to taste. Finely chop the fresh dill sprigs. Sprinkle the chopped dill over the top of the egg. Serve.

crust: combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter. press into a 13x9 inch pan. spread evenly. filling: combine the sweetened condensed milk and raspberry jam. spread over the crust. sprinkle with flaked coconut. top with the cashews and white chocolate chips. bake at 425f for 20 minutes or until golden brown. cool completely. cut into squares.
i am going to try the yellow cake one and the caramel pecan one. i would have tried the strawberry jello one but i do not like strawberries and jello together.
I can't believe how many recipes you have on this site! I have tried many of your recipes and they are wonderful. My favorites are the Oreo fudge brownies and the creamy coconut pie. I am going to try the Yellow Cake Dream Bar and the Caramel Pecan Dream Bar. I love caramel and pecans!
The caramel pecan ones sound so good!
I am going to try the Sm

Mix club crackers and margarine together. Add milk. Mix well. Add brown and granulated sugar. Mix well. Add graham crackers and mix well. Spread mixture on a 13x9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. When mixture is cooled, add chocolate chips and crunchy peanut butter. Spread well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Cut into bars.

Cut chuck into 2 1/2 pound portions. Place carrots, potatoes and pearl onions into the bottom of a 4 to 6 qt. Slow cooker. Sprinkle each piece of chuck with a half teaspoon of the soup mix and a 1/2 cup of the Guinness stout. Place the pieces of chuck on the top of the vegetables. Sprinkle the remaining soup mix and the remaining Guinness over the meat. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until meat is very tender. Remove the meat and vegetables to a serving dish and strain the sauce into a bowl. Pour the sauce over the meat and vegetables before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine the cantaloupe and fresh spinach leaves. In a smaller mixing bowl combine the raspberry vinegar, olive oil, honey, and lime juice. Whisk dressing together until emulsified. Toss dressing over the cantaloupe and spinach leaves. Sprinkle pistachios over the top.

Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add potatoes, boil until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain, return to pan and mash until smooth, adding cream cheese, sour cream and garlic salt to taste. Set aside. In a separate bowl combine melted butter, eggs, sour cream, cream and seasonings. Stir in the potatoes. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Serve hot. Serves 6.

In a large bowl, combine oats and milk. Let stand for 5 minutes. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer at high speed until foamy. Add vanilla extract and 1/4 cup sugarbeat until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into oat mixture. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Fold into the batter just until no white streaks remain. Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Drop batter by the 1/4 cupful onto the hot griddle. Brown on both sides. Serve hot with desired toppings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chicken breast halves between 2 sheets of waxed paper. Pound chicken breast halves until 1/2 inch thick. Layer chicken in 9x13 baking dish. In small bowl mix ranch dressing and italian bread crumbs. Dot butter over chicken and sprinkle with dressing/breadcrumb mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 to 40 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Meanwhile, heat 1 Tbsp oil in skillet over medium-low heat. Cook bacon until crisp. Crumble. Remove from skillet and set aside. In same skillet, over medium-high heat, combine remaining oil and eggs. Stir constantly until eggs are cooked through. Stir in cheese until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon. Spread mixture evenly over top of chicken. Bake 5 minutes or until eggs are set. Serve warm with rolls.

Preheat oven to 375 f degrees. Poke potato skins all over with a fork. Bake for about 1 hour or until tender. Cut in half, scoop out potato pulp and set aside to use later. In a medium bowl, combine potato pulp, sour cream, chives, butter, cheddar cheese and bacon. Place potato halves back on baking pan and fill each half with the potato mixture. Bake for about 10-15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Stir together pomegranate juice, water, and pomegranate seeds. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened slightly, about 10 minutes. Pour into a saucepan over low heat and add the sugar. Stir until dissolved, then add the grenadine. Turn off heat and add the tapioca. Stir gently and let sit for about 10-15 minutes or until the pearls are translucent. Serve warm or cold with whipped cream or ice cream.

Heat oil in wok or skillet. Add the beef and cook until lightly browned. Remove meat and set aside. Add the bell peppers and onions and cook until crisp-tender. Add the meat back in. Stir in the hoisin sauce and water. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. Stir in the soy sauce and cornstarch. Cook for another minute until the sauce thickens. Serve with steamed rice.

Heat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Mix together chicken, mustard, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper in large bowl until thoroughly blended. Place bread crumbs in another bowl. Dip chicken pieces in mustard mixturethen roll in bread crumbs until evenly coated. Place chicken pieces in single layer in lightly greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 40 minutes or until no longer pink. Meanwhile, combine honey and mustard in small bowldrizzle over chicken. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes then slice into 1/4-inch thick slices. Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook until lightly golden brown and crisp on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Stir in cheddar cheese and onion and cook 2 more minutes until melted through. Stir in parsley. Spread evenly into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake until golden brown and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.
Sautee onions in oil untill golden brown. Add garlic cloves chili& allspice& cinnamon& lime juice& sugar& cook for 1 minute.

Cream the molasses, sugar and egg. Stir in the flour and spices. Chill the dough for 2 hours or overnight. Roll the dough into balls and place on a greased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Crumble bacon into a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add clams to skillet. Pour in enough beer to cover them. Cover skillet with a lid, reduce heat to medium low and let simmer until clams open. Serve in bowls with bread for dipping.

In a bowl, mix the crabmeat and the first seven ingredients. Spoon into a lightly greased 1-quart baking dish. Combine the bread crumbs and parsley. Sprinkle over the top. Bake uncovered at 350 f for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving with crackers.

Dissolve sugar free black cherry gelatin in boiling water. Add cherry vodka and stir until dissolved. Add red bull energy drink, stir until dissolved. Add additional vodka until desired taste is reached. Pour mixture into plastic cups or paper cups. Refrigerate until firm and serve chilled.

Prepare crepes according to package directions. In skillet, cook spinach in butter until wilted. Add onionsaute until translucent. Add milk and saltbring to boil. Add flourstir until smooth. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add spinach mixturecook and stir 1-2 minutes or until thickened. Add 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Spoon mixture in center of each creperoll up. Place in shallow dish. Combine remaining parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheesesprinkle over crepes. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 10 minutes.

In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and vanilla extract. Add the egg and beat well. Add the cream cheese and mix well. Add the cake mix. Stir in the vanilla extract and powdered sugar until well blended. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm enough to shape into balls. Remove from refrigerator and roll into 1 1/2 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly brown on the bottoms. Cool on wire racks.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent. Stir in the garlic and parsley, then the pimientocontinue to cook for an additional 2 minutes. Stir in the seasonings. Place the potatoes in the skillet, then the chicken broth. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Mash the potatoes in the skillet and heat through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Soak bread in a bowl of cold water for a few minutes. Drain bread and squeeze out excess water. Mix together bread, eggs, milk, cheese, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Transfer to prepared baking dish and sprinkle bacon over the top. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until cooked through and set in center. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve immediately.

Combine the pudding mix and the milk in a large bowl. Fold in the whipped topping. Spread a layer of the pudding mixture on the bottom of a greased 9-in. square pan. Layer the graham cracker squares over the top. Spread another layer of the pudding mixture over the top. Cool in the refrigerator for at least two hours. Spread the frosting over the top and refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares and serve.

Place all the ingredients except for the bread into a blender and process on high for 1 minute. Arrange slices of bread into 2 layers on a baking pan. Pour 1/2 of the batter over each layer of bread. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serve immediately with a dollop of whipped cream or ice cream and additional fresh fruit or fruit sauce.

Thread the dove breast with the red bell peppers and onion. Brush the dove breasts with the teriyaki sauce. Place the mushrooms in the center of the skewers. Cook the dove breasts for about 15 minutes or until the breasts are thoroughly cooked.

Pound each chop slightly with a tenderizing mallet to even thickness about 1/2 inch. Sprinkle each side with 1/2 teaspoon of flour, salt and dry mustard. Dip each chop in beaten egg and then coat with remaining flour mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add coated chops and brown about 2 minutes on each side. Remove pork and keep warm while you prepare sauce. Place all remaining ingredients in a saucepan and cook until thickened stirring often. Return pork chops to pan and cover with sauce. Cook covered on low heat about 1 hour until pork is very tender and liquid is slightly thickened. Serves 4-6

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until golden brown and carmelized, about 10 minutes. Season steaks with steak seasoning and add to pan. Saute until browned, about 5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper. Divide steaks evenly between rolls and top with provolone. Wrap in foil, transfer to ven and bake until cheese melts, about 10 minutes.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat and add the onion and bell pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cajun seasoning and cook for 30 seconds. Add the rice and stir. Add the salt and pepper. Stir to coat. Pour in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Stir. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve hot.
Mix together and simmer 10 minutes.
Spoon into a pie plate and bake at 350 degrees F for 10 to 15 minutes.
Submitted by: CARMEN166
Chicken Parmesan Pasta Casserole
A classic comfort food dish that can be made ahead of time and is great to serve to a crowd.
Submitted by: BARBIEM
Submitted by: ROBIN520
Submitted by: ELIZABETH67
Bacon Ranch Mush

Bring a large pan of water to the boil and add the tagliatelle. Cook for 10-15 minutes, until al dente. Drain the pasta and return to the pan with the oil, garlic and courgettes. Cook over a low heat for 5-10 minutes until the courgettes are soft but not mushy. Toss the pasta and courgettes with the lemon juice and season well. Sprinkle with the basil and parmesan and serve immediately.

Heat oil in deep fryer to 375. Make pancake batter as directed on box. In a gallon size ziploc bag put 1/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp. cinnamon. Heat oil in deep fryer. To make donut holes, using a small ice cream scoop or two spoons scoop batter into hot oil. When the hole floats to the surface remove from oil with a slotted spoon. Roll holes in the bag with the sugar/cinnamon mixture. Let cool. Makes about 3 dozen.

Bring water to boil in a large pot. Add the potatoes. Cook for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender. Drain the potatoes and place them in a large bowl. Add the remaining vegetables and herbs to the bowl along with the sour cream and mustard. Toss lightly to combine. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. To serve the salad, drizzle it with lemon juice and olive oil. Serve the dish warm or cold.

Spread one side of each piece of bread with mayonnaise or butter (or a mixture of both). Spread other side of each piece of bread with cream cheese. Place the cheese side of one bread slice onto the bottom of a plate. Lay a piece of Swiss cheese over the bread slice and top with another slice of bread. Repeat with remaining bread slices and cheese. Spread each sandwich with mayonnaise or butter. Place sandwich on a grill pan or in a skillet over low heat and cook until the bread is golden brown on both sides. Remove from heat and cut each sandwich into two pieces. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

In a small bowl combine the tomato sauce, italian seasoning and garlic powder. Cut the chicken breast halves into cubes and place in a shallow bowl. Combine the egg and corn flake crumbs and then stir in the parmesan cheese and dried parsley. Dip each piece of chicken in the egg mixture and then roll in the crumb mixture. Place the pieces in a greased casserole dish and sprinkle with the tomato mixture. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese and return to the oven for another five minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve over spaghetti.

In large skillet brown meat with 1 tablespoon oil, crumbling with a fork. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, the salt and the pepper and cook until browned. Stir in the pizza sauce and the water and cook for 5 minutes, or until thickened. Add the pasta and cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in the cheese and serve warm.

In a small skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute. Add the cayenne pepper and cook for 30 seconds more. Add the cream cheese and cook until melted. In a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the milk and the egg yolk. Stir the milk mixture into the cream cheese mixture. Cook over medium heat until the sauce is heated through, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the parmesan cheese and the black pepper. Serve immediately over vegetables or pasta.
"We're not really sure where he got it from," said Cindy Sweeney, a nurse practitioner with the University of Florida Health Shands Cancer Center who treated the patient with the rare disease. "He had a bad headache for about three weeks, then he started vomiting one morning. He didn't have any fever or any other symptoms."
In his mid-30s when he developed the disease, the patient had not been outside the United States, the researchers reported. The man had

Heat oven to 400f. Line or grease 12-muffin cup or use paper liners. Beat butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in buttermilk, eggs and vanillastir in bananas and dry ingredients just until blended. Stir in blueberries. Spoon into prepared pans, filling nearly full. Bake for about 20 minutes, until golden and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender but firm. Draincool. Toss potatoes with vinegar and oil. Add dill. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold in vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese. Chill. Serve at room temperature.

Rinse pork under cold running water. Pat dry with a paper towel. Generously rub meat all over with olive oil. Insert the garlic slices into the holes. Sprinkle meat lightly on all sides with the thyme, basil, and rosemary. Place in a shallow baking dish. Bake for approximately 1 hour in the preheated oven or until a meat thermometer registers 165 degrees. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve.

Clean leek and cut up. Put in a skillet on medium heat. Add olive oil. Cook until leek is tender. Put in crock pot. Add butternut squash. Cook until squash is tender. Add navy beans. Add herbs de provence. Add rotel tomatoes. Add mozzarella cheese. Add bacon. Cook on low for about 4 hours. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 220c/425f/gas 7. Cream butter and sugar. Add vanilla and custard powder. Mix well. Stir in the caster sugar. Roll into small balls and place on a greased baking tray. Make a well in the middle of each ball and add a piece of chocolate. Flatten out slightly and bake for about 5 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack. Makes about 20.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a saucepan melt 1 cup of dark brown sugar in 1/2 cup of water over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Add 1/4 cup of flour and stir until mixture forms a ball. Stir in 2 tablespoons of chopped pecans. Pour into an unbaked 9-inch pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes. In another saucepan melt 1/3 cup of butter. Stir in 1/2 cup of light brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of flour. Stir until mixture forms a ball. Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped pecans. Drop by teaspoons on top of filling in pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool for at least 1 hour. Yields 8 servings.
Combine the first 7 ingredients in a medium bowl. Add the sugar and stir. Add the feta, onion, and nuts. Toss to coat. Divide the salad among 4 plates. Sprinkle with the red onion and serve.
Cut hot dog buns in half and spread with butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan and sesame seeds and bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Makes 12 servings.

Combine onion, garlic and water in large pot on stove-top over medium heat. Simmer until onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). In a 6-quart slow cooker or large casserole dish, stir together onion mixture with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Place roast on top of mixture. Pour 1/2 cup water over roast. Sprinkle with remaining onions. Cook in preheated oven for 1 hour 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). Cook for additional 1 hour 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve on rolls with barbecue sauce.

Beat butter, sugar and eggs until smooth and light. Sift together the cake flour, soda and salt. Add half of the sifted dry ingredients to the butter mixture and beat until smooth. Add remaining half and beat until smooth and light. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan. Bake in a 300 degree oven for one hour and fifteen minutes or until done. Cool and dust with confectioners sugar or top with lemon curd or lemon glaze.

Mix the sugar and water in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly until mixture starts to bubble. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until a thick paste is formed. Add the cornstarch and continue cooking until it dissolves and mixture starts to bubble again, about 2 minutes. Remove from heatadd butter, lemon juice, and lemon rindbeat until smooth. Remove from heatbeat in eggs one at a time until mixture thickens. Pour into a 2-quart heatproof bowl or small crock. Place over a pan of simmering water (double boiler)cook for 1 hour, stirring constantly, or until mixture is very thick. Remove from heatstir in remaining lemon juice until well blended. Cool completely. Beat in whipped cream until mixture is fluffy. Serve in a large glass bowlgarnish with strawberries or lemon wedges. Serves 8 to 10.

Cut the cabbage into quarters. Place it into a large saucepan with the apple juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon honey, and the cider vinegar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover and cook until the cabbage is tender, about 5 minutes. Uncover, increase heat to high and boil until liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Stir in the raisins. Transfer to a bowl. Let stand for 2 minutes. In a small saucepan whisk together the oil, the remaining teaspoon of salt, the remaining tablespoon of honey. Place over low heat. Heat until the honey has melted and the mixture is warm. Pour over the salad.

In a large skillet saute onions in butter until tender and golden brown, about 25 minutes remove with a slotted spoon. Add flour and stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk until blended. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Reduce heat to low and return onions to skillet. Heat through. Serve over toasted french bread for dipping.
Combine the first 6 ingredients. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before serving. Roll into pretzel stick and serve with crackers.

In a large heavy saucepan or dutch oven heat the butter and add the fennel and garlic. Saut over low heat until the fennel is soft about 10 minutes. Add the thyme and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the wine and chicken stock and cook uncovered for 20 minutes or until the liquid has reduced. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Peel the potatoes, and cut them into eighths. Add the potatoes to the boiling water, and cook for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until tender. While the potatoes are cooking, mix together the dressing in a small bowl, and set aside. Remove the potatoes from the boiling water with a slotted spoon, and place in a large mixing bowl. Add the dressing, onions, and gherkins to the bowl, and stir well to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot or cold, or refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

In a large bowl, beat together eggs and milk. In a small bowl, combine salt and pepperstir into egg mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd egg mixture and gently swirl until the bottom is almost set, about 1 minute. Sprinkle evenly with cheese and allow to set until beginning to brown. Cut into wedges and serve.

Place chops in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine soy sauce, white wine, sugar and cornstarch. In a second small bowl combine garlic and Chinese five spice powder. Dip both sides of the pork into the soy mixture. Sprinkle with the garlic mixture. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet. Brown the pork on both sides. Remove the pork to a plate and pour the pan drippings into a bowl. In a small bowl mix together the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons cold water. Add to the pan drippings and stir. Pour the sauce over the browned pork and serve.

Preheat the oven to 200c. Cut the parsnips into 1 cm thick rounds. Place the rounds in a bowl, add the salt and mix. Lay the rounds out onto the baking trays. Brush with the sunflower oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden.

Put cottage cheese and powdered milk in blender and blend until smooth. Add eggs and blend well. Add lemon juice and blend again until mixture is smooth. Add honey and almond essence and blend once more. Pour into baking dish or pie plate and bake for about an hour or until done. Cool and chill before serving.

Combine ricotta cheese, sugar and eggs in medium bowl. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into a greased 8-in-square baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool slightly. Beat whipping cream in small bowl until soft peaks form. Spread over ricotta mixture. Garnish with cherry, pecans.

Place dried cranberries and water in a medium saucepan. Add the fresh cranberries and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the sugar and bring to a boil again. Add the port and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often until the mixture has thickened, 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let cool to room temperature. Discard the cinnamon stick. Store in the refrigerator. Makes 1 cup.

Combine all of the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl and blend well with a fork or whisk. Add the buttermilk and mix until smooth and blended. Add the margarine and stir until blended. Fill greased or paper lined muffin cups two-thirds full and place a heaping teaspoon of the jam in the centre. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-25 minutes or until well-browned and a tester inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a rack for 5 minutes before removing to the rack. Cool completely and serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12-18.
Combine cereal, peanuts and chocolate chips. Spread evenly on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool. Makes about 4 dozen.

Place chicken breasts in slow cooker. Sprinkle with sauerkraut and swiss cheese. In a small bowl combine the dressing and water. Pour over the chicken and sauerkraut. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until the chicken is tender and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the slow cooker and shred with two forks. Return the shredded chicken to the slow cooker and stir well. Serve with pumpernickel bread slices.
Crock Pot Recipe-Made in the crock pot and so easy and delicious.
This recipe for Mini Reubens, by , is from Family Favorites Cookbook, one of the cookbooks created at FamilyCookbookProject.com. We'll help you start your own personal cookbook! It's easy and fun. Click here to start your own cookbook!
Spread the dressing over 1 side of the bread slices. Top half of the slices with half of the cheese, the corned beef, sauerkraut, and then the remaining cheese. Top with the remaining bread slices--d

Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and kielbasa. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Add peas and navy beans. Stir to combine. Add rice and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer 45 minutes. Stir in broth. Heat through. Stir in garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Season with thyme.
Preheat oven to 375. Beat egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in pumpkin. Beat in milk, salt and spices. Beat in egg whites until stiff. Pour into unbaked pastry shell. Bake 1 hour.

Cook rotini according to package directions. In a large skillet saute onion in butter until tender. Add tomatoes. Cook 1 minute. Stir in zucchini and cook until crisp tender. Sprinkle in cheese and lemon juice. Stir to blend. Add pasta to skillet. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with basil. Makes 4 servings.

Cook macaroni in boiling water 10-15 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Saute onions in butter 2 minutes. Add macaroni to onions. Add in tomatoes. Stir in water. Add seasonings to taste. Heat for 10 minutes. Combine breadcrumbs and butter. Sprinkle over macaroni. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve as a casserole dish.

In a bowl combine all-purpose flour with salt and 1/2 cup of water. Mix well. Gradually add in oil. Knead dough. If too dry add more water. If too sticky add more flour. Cover dough with a dish towel. Let rest for 10 minutes. Divide dough into 2 portions. On a lightly floured surface roll out each portion into a 1/8-inch thick circle. Using a cookie cutter cut out dough rounds. Place dough circles on a lightly floured surface. Using a small spoon drop a teaspoon of filling into center of dough circle. Pinch dough together around filling. Place pierogies on a lightly floured surface. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add pierogies to the pot. Cook 5 minutes. Remove pierogies with a slotted spoon to a plate. Serve with butter and onions.

Crack the eggs into a bowl. Beat well. Add the milk. Add the cream cheese and beat again. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the vegetable oil. Add the egg mixture. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the eggs are beginning to set. Add the chives. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the eggs are almost cooked. Remove from the heat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Wash and core the apples. Mix together brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and flour. Lay out buttered paper in a 9x13 glass pan. Take each apple and roll in brown sugar mixture until completely covered. Place in pan. In a small bowl mix together milk, sugar, flour, vanilla and egg. Pour over apples. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until apples are softened and sugar is brown.
Mix sugar and flour in a small bowl. Slowly stir in orange juice. Mix melted butter and vanilla wafer crumbs in a separate small bowl. Place apples in a greased 1 quart baking dish. Layer sugar mixture, cheese and vanilla wafer crumb mixture over apples. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until top is browned.
Grease 9x13 pan. Beat eggs, sugar and oil, together. Add flour, soda and cinnamon. Mix well. Add apples and walnuts, mix together. Pour into prepared pan

Bring lemon juice to boil in medium saucepan. Add water and reduce heat to low. Add granulated sugar and cornstarch and stir. Cook for 4 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Add margarine and salt. Serve over toast or with fruit.

Cut pineapple into 1/2-inch cubes. Cut cucumber into 1/2-inch cubes. Cut mango into 1/4-inch cubes. Finely chop jalapeno. In a large bowl combine pineapple, cucumber, mango and jalapeno. Add lime juice and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Combine cilantro, jalapeno and salt and pepper to taste. Add to pineapple salsa and stir to combine. Brush both sides of the scallops with oil. Heat a heavy-bottomed skillet over high heat until very hot. Sear scallops for 2 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Transfer to plates. Serve with the pineapple-mango salsa.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. combine the first four ingredients in a large saucepan over low heat until melted and smooth. remove from heat and stir in the rest of the ingredients until blended. pour into the prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes or until set in the middle. cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.

Cut pork into 1 inch cubes. Place in a Ziploc bag. Add olive oil and mix well. Add hot paprika, sage and garlic. Close the bag and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Remove from refrigerator and allow pork to come to room temp. Heat a grill to medium. Sear pork on both sides and place in a preheated 350 degree oven. Roast about 1 hour. Turn once and allow to cook another 30 minutes or until internal temp reaches 160 degrees. Allow to rest 10 minutes before cutting.

Bring 2 1/2 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in ramen noodles. Cover. Cook for 2 minutes. Drain. Add the remaining 2 1/2 cups of water to the saucepan. Stir in the vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the seasoning from the ramen package. Add the eggs. Cook for 30 seconds or until the eggs are cooked. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Spray an 8x8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a bowl, combine corn muffin mix, water, green chiles, and salt until smooth. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with the cheese. In a bowl, beat together the eggs and cilantro with the refried beans. Pour the mixture evenly over the baked muffin mixture. Bake for another 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the eggs are cooked through.

Cut the top off the bulbs of garlic. Remove the outer skin and place in a small saucepan. Add cold water until the garlic is completely covered. Add 1 tsp salt. Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Drain the garlic, reserving the water. Place the garlic in a food processor and add the water. Blend until pureed. Pass the puree through a fine-mesh strainer. Combine the oils in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and strain the oil into a small bowl through a fine-mesh strainer. Pass through a coffee filter or cheesecloth lined fine-mesh strainer until clear. Return to the saucepan. Whisk in the puree until smooth.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cabbage, onion, salt, pepper, and garlic. Saute until the onion is softened. Add the chicken and stir gently to mix. Cook until the chicken is no longer pink. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the mayonnaise. Spread 1/2 cup of the coleslaw mixture in each of the 4 tortillas. Roll up the tortillas. Serve immediately.

Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until just tender. Drain the pasta, reserving one cup of the cooking liquid. In a wok or large frying pan, heat the oil over high heat. Add the garlic, gingerroot, tahini, soy sauce, sesame oil, onion, cilantro, and the reserved pasta cooking liquid. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth. Add the pasta. Cook for a minute or two longer to heat through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Rinse fish fillets and pat dry. Place fish fillets in greased shallow baking dish. Sprinkle lemon juice over all the pieces of fish. Mix together breadcrumbs and seasonings for a coating mixture. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over the fillets and drizzle with a little oil. Bake in preheated 400 degrees fahrenheit oven for 25 minutes or until the fish flakes easily. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the tomato, onion, sweet green pepper, and basil. Mix well. Serve cod fillets over the tomato mixture and garnish with additional basil if desired.
Mediterranean Cod, Spicy Cod With Tomatoes And Spinach, Roasted Cod With Prosciutto Cherry Tomatoes And Olives, Cod With Fennel Mushrooms Tomato Dill, Baked Cod With Cheese, Cod Fish Cakes, Herb Coated Cod, Tomato Crowned Cod.
Mediterranean CodSpicy Cod With Tomatoes

Cut off any blemished part of each lemon (the thick skin beneath the peel). Using a vegetable peeler or sharp knife, remove the peel from each lemon and cut into strips 2 inches long. Toss the strips with the caster sugar and set aside for 30 minutes. Pour 2 litres mineral water into an ice-cold jug and stir in the lemon juice and mint leaves. Add the peel-coated sugar mixture and stir well. Serve straight away, or chill for up to 2 hours before serving.
Freshly Squeezed Lemonade Recipe. Freshly squeezed lemonade is easy to make, using just a few basic ingredients!
Freshly Squeezed Lemonade Recipe. Freshly squeezed lemonade is easy to make, using just a few basic ingredients!

In a large saucepan bring chicken stock to a simmer. Add the ravioli and cook for 2 minutes. Add the spinach and cook for another 3-4 minutes. Turn off the heat. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot with grated parmesan cheese. Serve with Italian bread.

In skillet, cook sausage, onion and bell pepper until browned. Add oil and heat until hot. Add diced tomatoes, italian stewed tomatoes and ketchup. Cook over low heat 10 minutes. Cook ziti according to package directions. Add sausage mixture and cook 3 minutes. Spread ziti mixture in 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.
chicken mozzarella sandwiches - Bring pasta sauce to a boil in a medium skillet over medium-high. Arrange chicken in sauce. Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until chicken is heated through. Top chicken with cheese. Cover and cook until cheese is melted. Serve on rolls.
swiss steak mozzarella - Cut meat into serving size pieces. Coat with flour. Melt margarine in skillet. Brown meat slowly on both sides. Put into a 9x13 inch baking dish.

Brown the italian sausage in the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat until browned on all sides. Remove from pan and set aside. Add the tomato sauce to the pan used to brown the sausage, lower heat to medium low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the chablis or white wine and mushrooms and simmer for another 10 minutes until the liquid is absorbed. Return the sausage to the pan and simmer until the sausage is heated through.

Cut steak crosswise into 1/4 inch slices. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, balsamic vinegar and sugar. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Place a small amount of the mixture on the bottom of a nonstick skillet and place the steak slices on top. Cook for 4 minutes. Turn over and cook an additional 3 minutes for med-well.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add onion, carrot and celery, and saute until softened. Add the garlic and saute for about 30 seconds. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the barley and rice and cook for about 8 minutes. Stir and then add the salmon. Cook for another minute or two. Stir and then add the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at once.
