Combine raspberries and sugar in a medium pot and bring to boil, cook over high heat for 10 minutes. Stirring frequently until thickened and reduced by half. Stir in port, cook over low heat until thickened (about 3 more minutes). Stir in the adobo sauce. Serve warm or cold. Serve with anything that could use some zing!

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in cereal until coated. Transfer to a greased 13x9 inch baking pan and press down. Cool completely. Melt chocolate in a double boiler and drizzle over top. Let cool. Cut into bars.

Melt the butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender and golden brown. Add the flour and stir constantly for 1 minute. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly. Stir in the heavy cream and sherry. Season with salt and paprika. Simmer the mixture for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the cooked lobster meat and the chives. Heat thoroughly. Serve immediately. Garnish with more chives if desired.

Rinse the rice under running water and place it in a large saucepan. Add the celery and the onions, and pour over the butter. Bring the mixture to the boil over a high heat. Add the rind, the salt and the orange juice. Cover the saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes. Add 1 1/2 cups of water and bring to the boil. Cover the saucepan and transfer to the oven. Bake in a pre-heated 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. In a small saucepan melt the butter over a low heat. Add the parsley and the slivered almonds and toss well. Remove the rice from the oven. Stir through the parsley and almonds. Serve.

In 12-inch nonstick skillet saute the onions and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the oil until crisp-tender. Add the apples and cook 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, sauerkraut, caraway seeds and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer 10 minutes or until slightly thickened and vegetables are tender. Add the frankfurterscover and cook until heated through and no longer pink in center, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a sheet pan with aluminum foil. Place chicken in a medium bowl. In a small bowl combine honey, soy sauce, brown sugar, rosemary, garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons of water. Pour over chicken. Toss to coat. Spread mixture on the prepared sheet pan. Bake 30 minutes or until juices run clear. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and fresh flat-leaf parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Place ham on rack in roasting pan and heat in a preheated 325f oven for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar and orange juice. Remove the ham from the oven and brush with half of the glaze. Sprinkle with ground mustard and return to the oven for another 20 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the meat reads 140f. Brush with remaining glaze and cook another 15 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 160f.

Whisk first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens in large bowl with enough dressing to coat. Top with onion, cranberries and pecans. Sprinkle evenly with goat cheese. Yields 6 servings (serving size: about 3 ounces greens and about 1 ounce goat cheese).

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan with margarineset aside. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda and sugar. In another bowl, mix skim milk with lemon juiceset aside. Add white sugar, skim milk mixture, and lemon zest to the dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 55 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan, then let cool completely on a wire rack.

Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Add onions to pan of cold water. Boil until tender (about 30 minutes), adding chunks of potatoes last (about 15 minutes). Drain well and place back into the pan. Melt butter in pan over medium heat, stirring until potatoes are lightly browned. Add sour cream and orange juice, stirring until smooth. Add orange zest. Season with salt. Serve hot or warm.

In a large bowl mix together the dry ingredients. In another bowl mix the margarine and sugars until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and the applesauce. Stir in the dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in the nuts and cranberries. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Remove excess fat from pork shoulder and place in large skillet or dutch oven over medium heat. Add water and cook until meat is tender about 2 hours. Turn meat and continue cooking for another 2 hours or until meat is tender enough to be shredded with a fork. While meat is cooking, add tequila, molasses, garlic cloves and salt and pepper to taste. Stir and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add additional water as needed to prevent mixture from burning and sticking. While meat is cooking, add tequila, molasses, garlic cloves and salt and pepper to taste. Stir and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add additional water as needed to prevent mixture from burning and sticking to pan. When meat is tender, shred with two forks and add to the skillet and stir to combine meat and sauce. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Once cooled, cover and refrigerate at least one hour. Garnish with green onion and serve with tortillas and cilantro.

Cream the shortening and the sugar. Add the eggs and mix well. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Add the milk and vanilla. Mix together the dry and wet mixtures. Pour into a greased and floured pan. Sprinkle with the cinnamon and sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let cool in the pan.

Cook the macaroni in boiling water for 10-12 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl mix the macaroni and 1 cup of the pickle juice. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate for 1-2 days before serving.

Combine the mayonnaise with the parmesan cheese. Coat the pork chops with the mayo mixture and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork chops and cook for 3 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 155f. Pour off any excess fat. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the lipton soup mix and stir to combine with the onions. Stir in the water and heat until the liquid boils. Cover the skillet and simmer for 5 minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in the parsley. Serve over hot noodles.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Add flour and mix just until blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased muffin cups. Bake for 7 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely.

Peel cucumbers and slice in half lengthwise. Scoop seeds out with spoon and discard. Cut cucumbers into thin slices. Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes or until mustard seeds turn dark brown. Pour over cucumbers. Let stand 15 minutes. Serve over tomato slices.

In a bowl, combine hoisin and Sambal Oelek. Add scallions and wine. Set aside. In a gallon-sized Ziploc bag, combine all remaining ingredients. Marinate overnight or at least 4 hours. Grill on medium-high heat until done. Serve with rice or noodles and garnish with more scallions.
Combine all ingredients and stir. Refrigerate for an hour or so. Serve over shrimp or fried fish. Serve over fried fish, shrimp and so on.

Combine onions, peanut oil and cardamom in a medium size saucepan and saute over medium heat until onions are golden. Add the peanut butter and brown sugar and continue sauteing until the mixture is smooth and well blended. Add the soy sauce and lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Add the liquid red pepper seasoning. Serve over rice or vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl combine the cake mix with the water, pumpkin, vanilla extract, and cinnamon. Fill each cup about two-thirds full. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool on wire racks.
name: weight watcher recipes - chocolate mousse for one (8 points)ingredients: fat free creme fraiche, fat free sweetened condensed milk, semi sweet chocolate chips, nonfat milk, fat free whipped topping (8 points)preparation:Pour milk in bowl of blender or food processor. Add condensed milk, chocolate chips, creme fraiche, whipped topping, and blend until smooth. Refrigerate.

Mix all dry ingredients and blend well with hands or stand mixer until crumbly. Add egg yolk and milk and mix well. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes until elastic. Let rise for 2 hours. Punch down and roll out into loaf pans. Let rise for 1 hour and bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Makes two loaves of unleavened bread.

Combine vinegar, olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a zip-top plastic bag. Add chicken to bagseal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to 2 hours, turning occasionally. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinadediscard marinade. Grill chicken 4 to 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink at bone and juices run clear. Yields 1-1/2 pounds per person.
You may also search for Chicken with Rosemary to find more books (not just these).

Place fillets in shallow bowl. Beat buttermilk with garlic and instant potato flakes until well blended. Dip fish fillets in buttermilk mixturepress on potato flakes to coat. Place fish in greased 8-inch square baking dish, and pour remaining flakes over fish. Dot with butter. Bake at 425f for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
"The Best Ever" Potato Recipes from Family Cooks is part of the Taste of Home recipe book series published by Oxmoor House Inc..

Soak split peas in beef broth for about 20 minutes. Cut onion in half and stuff with almonds. Tie in small cloth. Soak in boiling water. Drain. Cut lamb in bite size pieces. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add lamb and brown on all sides. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add split peas and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer for about 15 minutes until split peas are tender. Remove lamb to a platter. Add apricots and prunes. Cook for another 10 minutes. Serve with rice and yogurt.
I like the second one. The food looks amazing.
The marinade for the grilled pork looks especially good.
I can't say as I have any particular favorite food from the Netherlands, but I'll be darned if that doesn't look pretty tasty!
I love the Dutch cookies. I also love the lamb khoreshe. I would love to try that one.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Spread frozen green beans on a cookie sheet or baking pan and bake for 15-18 minutes. In the mean time, mix together 3 tablespoons olive oil, the garlic clove, dried rosemary, and salt. Remove from oven and stir the green beans into the olive oil mixture. Return the pan to the oven for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add okra, 1/3 cup water, onions, and ginger. Cook, stirring occasionally, until okra is tender about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, cardamom, garlic, and jalapenos in a small bowl. Add tomatoes to the skillet with the okra mixture. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in jalapeno mixture. Continue cooking until thickened. Serve with injera bread.

Mix wheat flour with 1/2 tbspn salt. Mix with eggs then knead. Leave it for 10 minutes then knead again. Roll out thinly & cut into 2-3 cm rounds. Boil for 3 minutes then add yogurt & mint, parsley& salt to taste. Serve hot or cold.

Warm the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring often until tender. Add the beans, stock and bay leaves. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the beans are tender, about 20 minutes. Stir the onions occasionally while the soup is cooking. Serve the soup with the avocado wedges, tortillas, cream, chiles guajillos, white cheese, garlic and hot sauce.

Combine the tapioca and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until thickened and clear. Pour into a bowl and stir in the orange zest. Let cool.In a bowl, toss together the apples and the tapioca mixture. Sprinkle with the sugar and stir until coated.Let cool slightly. Roll out half the pastry dough to fit an 8-inch pie dish. Place the apple mixture in the dish and dot with the butter. Top with the second piece of dough and pinch the edges to seal. Trim the edges. Brush with egg wash. Cut several slits in the top of the dough. Bake for 1 hour. Cool and serve at room temperature.

Cut each breast in half. Place the flour in a shallow bowl or plate. Lightly flour both sides of the chicken. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until brown on both sides. Remove the chicken to a plate. Add the white wine to the skillet and boil until reduced by half. Stir in the sage. Return the chicken to the skillet. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in the mustard. Spoon over the butter. Serve immediately.

In a large pot of boiling water, boil the sweet potatoes until they are tender. Drain, return to the pot and mash with the brown sugar, orange juice, orange zest, nutmeg and 2 Tbsp. coconut. Add the remaining coconut and mix well. Let cool. In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, marshmallows and remaining 2 Tbsp. coconut. Using a cookie scoop or tablespoon measure, scoop the mashed potato mixture, roll in the sugar-cinnamon mixture, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake at 250 degrees for 45 minutes. Let cool before serving.
French fries are one of the most common snack foods on the face of the earth.
French fries are a great way to get your children to eat their vegetables!
French fries are a great side dish to a sandwich or burger.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain and add broccoli and mushrooms. In a mixing bowl, beat egg yolks. Add the sour cream and mayo and blend well. Add the salt and pepper. In a greased 13x9x2 inch pan, layer the noodles, then the cheese and the sour cream mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

In a medium bowl, combine pears, blue cheese, walnuts and 1/2 cup of the dressing. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place lettuce leaves on individual plates. Top with pear mixture. Drizzle with remaining dressing and garnish with Tabasco.

In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, cook the pasta until it is just tender but still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain. In a large skillet, heat the oil over moderate heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic, the tomatoes and their juices, the olives and the oregano. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Cook over moderately low heat for 15 minutes. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Add the spinach, the parsley and the cheese. Toss to blend. Serve.

Saute the mushroom and onion in the butter until softened. Stir in the garlic, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice and cream. Set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile toast the bread slices until brown. Spread the mushroom mixture on the toast and garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine 1/4 cup of the flour, the salt and black pepper. Set aside. In a deep skillet or dutch oven, pour in enough oil to cover the bottom of the pan (about 1/2 to 3/4 inches). Heat the oil over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer reads 350f (about 5 minutes). Remove the chicken from the buttermilk and dredge it in the flour mixture. Tap off the excess coating. Fry the chicken, turning once, until golden brown and cooked through (about 10 minutes). Transfer the fried chicken to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. In a shallow bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup flour, the milk and the egg. Season with a pinch of salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Dip the chicken in the batter and return to the hot oil until browned and cooked through (about 3 minutes). Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain

Soak the dried apricots in water overnight. Drain and cut into pieces. Combine sugar and 1/2 cup of water in a small saucepan. Stir over medium-high heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the syrup becomes thick and amber in color, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the dried apricots. Set aside to cool. Peel and pit the apricots. Combine the lemon juice and almond extract in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Add the cooled syrup and puree until very smooth. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer. Refrigerate until ready to use. Process the mixture in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container and store in the freezer until ready to use.

In a large bowl combine the first five ingredients. Add the remaining five ingredients and mix well. Chill dough for 20 minutes. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 f for 10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet and place on a wire rack to cool. Makes 22 cookies.

To make the brisket rub, combine sweet onion, garlic cloves, chili powder, beef base, worcestershire sauce, cumin, liquid smoke in a small bowl. Rub brisket liberally with the mixture and set aside at room temperature for 1 hour. Remove any excess rub from the brisket. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add brisket and brown evenly. Pour beer over brisket. Cover skillet with a lid and simmer for 1 hour. Turn brisket over. Add chili sauce to skillet. Cover skillet with a lid and simmer for another hour. Turn brisket over. Cover skillet with a lid and simmer until brisket is tender. Remove brisket from skillet. Slice into thin slices against the grain. Serve with baked potato or corn bread.

Mix butter and flour together in a bowl until crumbly. Add a small amount of cold water and mix until you have a soft dough. Roll out to 3/8" thickness and cut with a 3 1/4" round cutter. Repeat until all the dough is used up. Place a teaspoon of filling on each round. Bring 2 quarts of salted water to a boil in a large pot. Drop 8 of the rounds into the boiling water. When they float to the surface after about 10 minutes, remove them with a slotted spoon and serve immediately with melted butter. Repeat with remaining rounds. Makes 16 soup dumplings.

Boil the potatoes in enough water to cover the potatoes for 5 minutes. Then add the celery to the water and cook for another 5 minutes. Drain the water from the potatoes and celery. While the water is draining you can chop the green onions up into little pieces and set them aside for later use. Once the potatoes and celery are drained you can remove the skin from the potatoes and the strings from the celery and set them aside for later use. Then you can cut up the celery into little pieces. After that is done you can chop up the potatoes into little pieces as well. Then you can add the celery and potatoes to a bowl that you will mix the rest of the ingredients in later on. Once that is done you can add in some vegetable oil to the bowl that you will mix all the ingredients together in later on. Once that is done you can add in some vinegar to the bowl that you will mix all the ingredients together in later on. Once that is done you can add in some onions to the bowl that you will mix all the ingredients together in later on. Then you

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine sour cream, parsley and garlic powderset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. In the same pan cook sausage until browned. Drain grease from pan and stir in sour cream mixture until well blended. Remove from heat and stir in eggs, one at a timecook until set but not dry. Remove from heat and stir in bacon and 1/2 of the cheese. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle remaining cheese evenly over top of mixture. Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted and casserole is hot, about 15 minutes.
This is a wonderful casserole to have for a big group of people, as it can be made in advance, then popped in the oven to reheat before serving. The ingredients can be mixed in a large bowl ahead of time, then spooned into a

Bake pie crusts according to package directions. Fill each pie crust with spaghetti sauce and mozzarella cheese, and sprinkle with mushrooms and chicken. Serve with marinara sauce and grated parmesan cheese.

Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add lemon juice, zest, and vanilla. Mix well. Sift flour and baking soda together into a small bowl. Stir into the creamed mixture until blended. Cover and chill for 1 hour. Heat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place about 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on wire racks.

Mix tuna, celery and onion together. Spread mixture on each hamburger bun slice. Sprinkle with mozzarella and tomato slices. Place sandwiches under broiler for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Heat up a liter of water and add 2 tablespoons of ground cardamom seeds and 1/2 teaspoon of saffron and stir. Let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes and then add 1/2 cup of rose water and let simmer for another 5 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon of rosewater and stir. Add 1 cup of brewed coffee and stir. Serve warm in cups with rose petals.

Boil the noodles for 5-7 minutes on high heat. Drain the pasta and set aside. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. In a mixing bowl, combine the noodles with the milk and stir together until the noodles are fully coated in the milk. Add the mac and cheese mix to the noodles and stir until combined. Grease a baking dish with the butter and spread the noodle mixture evenly across the surface of the dish. Cover the noodles with the broccoli cheese soup, spreading the soup evenly across the surface of the dish as well. Sprinkle the meat over the top of the soup and bake for 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown and bubbly. Serve the dish warm with a side of bread or crackers for dipping. Enjoy your budget-friendly meal!

Soak 8 wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes. Grill the shrimp on a medium-hot fire for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the grill and place in a shallow serving bowl. Add the fresh parsley and the remaining marinade. Serve warm or cold.

Combine rice and 3 cups of the milk in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, cover the pan and reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove the cover and stir occasionally until the rice has absorbed all the liquid. Remove from the heat and stir in the sugar. Pour the remaining 1/2 cup of the milk into a small bowl and add the egg yolks, beating with a wire whisk until well blended. Whisk the egg mixture into the rice mixture until well blended. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla. Return to the heat and bring to a simmer. Remove from the heat and whisk in the heavy cream until smooth. Stir in the cinnamon until well blended. Transfer to a serving dish, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until well chilled before serving.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery, carrot, and garlic. Sweat 5 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and season with thyme, salt, and cayenne. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken breast halves. Reduce heat to medium-low. Poach the chicken until it is cooked through. Remove from the broth. Slice the chicken into 1/2-inch pieces. Return to broth. Heat through. Serve warm. This is one of my favorite dishes to have during lent.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Marinate at room temperature at least 1 hour before serving. Serve cold. Serves 6.

In a large bowl, stir together the pineapple and apricots. Stir in the margarine. Add the chutney, apricot brandy, ginger, cheddar cheese and cream cheese. Spoon into a 1-quart glass serving dish. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Serve with crackers.
How Do You Cook Pineapple Cheese?
If you know another way to cook Pineapple Cheese please make a comment in the comment box to help others.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine sour cream, flour, and sugarset aside. Brown beef and drain. Stir in onion. Pour sour cream mixture over beefstir well. Pour into 9×13-inch baking dish. Combine cream-style corn and seasoningpour over beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned and bubbly.
Sounds like something we might try…thanks for posting!

This sounds wonderful! I love my cornbread…I am going to try it!

Cut broccoli into very small pieces. Blend together the mayonnaise and vinegar. Mix the rest of the ingredients into the dressing mixture. Chill for at least one hour before serving. Serve over a bed of lettuce for a full meal or as a side dish for a light meal.

In large mixing bowl of electric stand mixer, combine warm water and honey and sprinkle in the yeast to dissolve it. Let stand 5 minutes until mixture is bubbly. Add the oil and maple syrup and stir to combine. Add the salt and cinnamon and mix. Add the oatmeal and mix just until combined. Add the bread flour and mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the mixing bowl. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic (about 7 minutes). Place the dough in a lightly greased mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel. Place the bowl in a warm spot and let the dough rise until doubled (about 1 hour).Punch down the dough and place it on lightly greased baking sheet (12 inches by 18 inches). Roll the dough out to about 1/2-inch thick. Place the raisins on the dough and sprinkle with the cinnamon. Roll the dough up like a jellyroll and pin

Brown the sausage in a skillet over medium heat. Drain the fat. In a Dutch oven, combine the sausage with the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir frequently so the vegetables don’t stick to the bottom of the pan. Serve in bowls with grated parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large bowl, mix the Vital Wheat Gluten, nutritional yeast, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, mushroom stock, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and black pepper until well combined. Divide the mixture into three logs and shape into logs. Place in an oven safe pan with a 1/2 inch of water at the bottom of the pan (not touching the bottom of the logs). Cover with foil and bake for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover for the last 20 minutes of baking. Remove from oven and let cool to room temperature before slicing and serving with your favorite toppings.

Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add in chopped garlic. Saute until golden brown. Add in chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Add bread cubes and let soak for 10 minutes. Mash with back of fork until desired consistency. Add egg. Stir gently. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350. Peel and slice the potatoes as thin as possible. Slice the onion as thin as possible. Add the milk to the potatoes in a large bowl. Add the sour cream, cheese, onion and chives. Mix well. Spray a casserole dish with non stick spray. Spread the mixture in the dish and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake in the oven for 50 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serves 4.

Shred the cooked chicken in a large bowl. Add the celery, onion, lemon juice, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges and almonds. Chill in the refrigerator. To serve, place a bed of romaine lettuce in the bottom of a serving plate and add the chicken mixture. Makes one serving.

Place the butter and brown sugar into the bowl of a mixmaster fitted with a paddle and beat together until light and creamy. Add the eggs and beat until well blended. Add the flour and milo and mix until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Refrigerate the mixture for at least half an hour before making the cookies. Heap tablespoonfuls of the mixture onto a lightly greased baking tray. Bake in a preheated oven (175c) for about 10 minutes or until lightly coloured around the edges.

Peel and cut the banana into slices. Pour the juice into a blender with the peach slices and the bananas. Blend until the peaches are pureed. Pour the yogurt in the blender and blend until the yogurt is mixed. Pour the mixture into a glass with a few ice cubes. Drink with a straw.

Prepare 2 cookie sheets by spraying with nonstick cooking spray. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, marshmallow cream and vanilla. Stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add in pecans. Quickly stir until all the nuts are coated with the mixture. Using a cookie spoon, drop the mixture by heaping teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Using a clean spoon, spread the mixture into a 5 by 7 inch rectangle on each sheet. Use a knife to cut the logs into 1 inch thick slices. Repeat until all mixture has been used up. Allow logs to sit at room temperature until set, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan combine the caramels, margarine and milk over low heat until melted. Drizzle caramel over each slice and allow to cool on wax paper at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 5 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour.

Heat a medium fry pan over medium heat. Add the olive oil and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the spinach and stir until the spinach is wilted. Add the cannellini beans and stir until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with bread.

Cut the fish into 1-inch cubes or into fillets. Boil in water until tender (about 1 hour). Cool and reserve. Sauté bacon until crisp and drain on paper towels. Set aside. In a separate skillet over medium heat, saute green pepper and onion in olive oil until tender. Stir in tomatoes and cook until mixture is soft. Stir in fish and heat through. In a separate bowl, beat eggs until smooth. Add to fish mixture and stir well. Heat until just set. Serve over cooked rice in shallow soup bowls. Sprinkle each serving with crisp bacon. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Peel and slice the eggplants into 3/4 inch slices. Place on a baking sheet and drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with the salt. Roast until the edges are crispy and the insides are tender, about 1 hour. Remove and let cool to room temperature. When cooled, combine the roasted eggplants with the remaining ingredients in a food processor. Puree until smooth and spoon into a bowl to serve. Makes 2 cups

Preheat oven to 400f. Line a large baking sheet with foilset aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat and cook the garlic until it is golden brownabout 1 - 1 1/2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they begin to turn goldenabout 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and toss the vegetables together on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle the vegetables evenly with coarse salt and balsamic vinegar and spread the vegetables in an even layer on the baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are just tender and turning golden brownstirring occasionally during the cooking time. Add the asparagus spears and spread the vegetables in an even layer on the baking sheet. Sprinkle the vegetables evenly with coarse salt and balsamic vinegar and stir well. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are just tender and turning golden brownstirring occasionally during the cooking time. Remove the vegetables from the oven and season with freshly ground pe

Pour water in saucepan. Add oats, coconut, salt and coconut extract. Cook over medium heat until it becomes creamy. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Serve hot or cold with more coconut sprinkled on top.

Cook the leek in a large pan of boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Meanwhile, place the rice in a pan with 400ml of water and bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and cover. In a non-stick frying pan, brown the chicken breasts in a little olive oil. Set aside. Heat the butter and olive oil in a saucepan until foaming. Add the leek and saffron strands and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the rice, stock and lemon zest and juice. Cover and cook over a low heat for 15 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the peas and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in skillet over med heat. Brown the chicken breasts. In a 2 qt casserole mix the soup and 1/2 cup of water. Add the rice and the chicken breasts. Cover and bake 1 hour or till done. Remove from oven and add the cheese. Bake 5 minutes or till the cheese is melted. Serve with crackers.

Beat butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Fold in flour and lemon rind until smooth. Pour into greased 9 inch pie pan. Bake at 375f for 45 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool on a wire rack.
My favorite is angelic lemon cake dessert!
Lemon lava cake is my favorite one!

In a large saucepan combine the first five ingredients. Cook until meat is no longer pink and the onion is tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients except cheese. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for about five minutes or until noodles are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Makes four servings.
cook noodles according to package directions. Drain well. Heat butter. Add all remaining ingredients. Toss to mix. Makes 4-6 servings.

Combine almond flour, flax seed meal, and cinnamon in a bowl and mix well. Add the splenda and water and mix well. Add the oil and mix well. Roll the dough out onto a wax paper covered surface and cut the dough with cookie cutters (you may have to roll the dough a few times to get it to the desired thickness). Bake at 350f for about 5-10 minutes until the edges are a light golden brown color (you may have to bake for a minute or so longer if you are using a large cookie cutter). Remove the crackers from the oven and cool on the counter for about 5 minutes (or you can just cool them on the cookie sheet).

In a plastic bag combine honey, ginger, garlic and soy sauce. Add chicken thighs to the bag. Close the bag tightly and turn to coat the chicken. Chill for 3 hours or overnight. Remove chicken from marinade. Grill over medium heat for about 8 minutes per side or until cooked through.

I would love to try the sweet bbq ones! They look delicious.
These are perfect for my family. Thanks for sharing!

I would love to try the Tipsy Chicken Thighs. I would make them for my family.
I would love to try the spicy sweet ones. I would make them for my family.
I would love to try the Tipsy Chicken Th

Saute the onion, garlic salt and pepper in the butter until the onions are tender. Add the frozen broccoli florets to the onions and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Cook the chicken breasts until doneremove them from the pan and shred them with two forks or cut them into small pieces. Add the cream of chicken soup and milk to the skillet with the onion mixture and cook until hot. Add the instant rice and the shredded chickenmix well. Top with grated provolone cheese. Serve immediately.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water until they can be pierced with a knife. Drain and cool in cold water. Combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, dill and celery in a small bowl and mix well. Cut the cooled potatoes in half lengthwise and gently mix in the celery mixture. Add the onions and mix gently. Sprinkle with black pepper to taste. Store refrigerated until serving time. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
In a large bowl, combine beans, shallots, garlic, parsley, vinegar, mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss lightly. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.

In a large pot, over medium heat, saute the ginger in olive oil for about 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes. Add the chicken stock and 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add the soba noodles and cook until the noodles are softened, about 10 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 more minutes. Taste for seasoning and add salt if necessary. Stir in the soy sauce. Serve hot garnished with chopped green onion or sliced green onion. Serve with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the soup.

Place sausage in skillet. Cook over medium heat until browned. Add summer squash. Cook over medium heat until tender crisp. Meanwhile prepare a saucepan of boiling water. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. In a large bowl combine sausage mixture, pasta and salad dressing. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place on broiler for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve on top of italian bread. Serve with oregano leaves.

In a medium saucepan combine onion and butter over low heat. Cook for about 4 minutes or until onions are softened. Stir in bay leaf. Add rice and stir until coated with onions and butter. Add water, salt & pepper to taste, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook covered until done. In a small bowl mix peas with hot pepper sauce. Stir into hot cooked rice. Stir in fresh parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 450. Toss squash with 1 Tbsp of olive oil and 1 tsp of rosemary. Place in a baking dish and roast for about 20 minutes. In a large saucepan cook onion and garlic in oil over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Stir in rice and cook for 1 minute. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Stir in roasted squash and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in remaining rosemary and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Stir in Parmesan. Spoon squash mixture evenly into 4 bowls. Top with 1 Tbsp of crumbled cream cheese and drizzle with 1 tsp of balsamic vinegar. Garnish each serving with rosemary.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat eggs with condensed milk until blended. Stir in chocolate until melted. Pour into prepared graham cracker crusts. Bake until firm. Spread caramel topping over pies. Top with pecans. Serve immediately.

Rinse the lentils. In a saucepan bring to a boil the water, lentils, garlic, and seasonings. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until tender. In a separate saucepan melt the margarine. Add the ground beef. Cook until beef is no longer pink. Drain fat. Add the onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Add ketchup, mustard, vinegar, and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Add the drained lentil mixture. Heat through. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green pepper rings. Serves 4-6.

In a medium saucepan, bring potatoes, cream of chicken soup, water and milk to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from the heatlet stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Stir in the sour cream, cheddar cheese, butter and onion until smooth. Transfer to a lightly greased shallow 2-quart casserole dish. Bake, uncovered, at 400 for 40 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Rinse and pat dry the fish. Toss the fish in the lime and oil mixture. Allow the fish to marinate for 30 minutes or more in the refrigerator. Grill the fish for 3-5 minutes per side. Serve with a salad and a glass of white wine.

Soak the dried navy beans overnight. Cook them until they are tender. Drain them, reserving the cooking liquid. Mix the rest of the ingredients together. Add the beans to the mixture. Let stand 1 hour. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Serves 8.

In a medium bowl, combine the orange juice, vinegar, honey, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cover and chill for 1 hour. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, avocado, and onion. Just before serving, add the dressing and toss well.

Cut the ham into strips and lay them out on a cutting board. Lay a piece of the swiss cheese on a piece of the ham then place the chicken breast on top of the cheese and roll it up in the ham. Wrap each breast in a slice of the ham then place in the crock pot with the soup and milk. Sprinkle the seasoning over the top and cover. Cook on high 4 hours or low 6 hours and serve with rice or noodles and vegetables.

Cook broccoli in boiling salted water for 5 minutes. Drainrinse with cold waterpat dry. Combine broccoli, almonds, oranges, onions and vinegar in a large bowl. Combine orange juice and zest, oil and sugar in a small bowl. Drizzle over broccoli mixture and toss gently to coat. Chill before serving. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 160c. Butter and line a deep square cake tin with greaseproof paper. Cream the butter and the white chocolate together until well combined. Add the brown sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add the golden syrup and milk and beat until smooth. Sift in the flour and baking powder and beat until well combined and smooth. Spread the mixture evenly in the tin and place in the oven to cook for one hour or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool completely in the tin before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Beat the thickened cream and the icing sugar together until smooth. Spread over the top of the cake and dust with a little icing sugar to serve.

Drain the chickpeas and reserve the liquid. Puree the garlic cloves and liquid with the coriander and cumin and a little of the reserved chickpea liquid, with a hand-held electric blender or food processor. Place the mixture in a bowl and add the chickpeas and seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Stir well to combine thoroughly. Place the mixture between two sheets of non-stick baking paper and roll out to make a 15cm-20cm log. Slice into 1cm-thick rounds and place in a bowl. Heat the oil and deep-fry the falafel slices a few at a time for about 2 minutes or until golden-brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.
Core & slice apples thinly. Mix sugar with spices & add apples. Mix well & place in oven at 250 degrees for 2 hours. Stir frequently. Serve hot with ice cream, cream, or plain.

Spread a good amount of butter onto one side of each piece of bread. Place the buttered side down into the sandwich maker and top with chutney and ham. Place the other piece of bread on top and cook until done. Serve immediately.
The "sandwich maker" is a very versatile kitchen appliance. It can be used to make grilled sandwiches, hamburgers and other food items. It is usually electric and has a non stick coating. You can either put the sandwich or burger in the middle and put the lid on top or put the lid on top and then put the sandwich or burger in the middle. The lid has a handle for easy opening and closing. The non stick coating ensures that the food doesn't stick to the appliance and makes cleaning easier.

Peel the asparagus and cut into two-inch lengths. Place in a bowl and toss with the ham and the oil. Let marinate. Thread the ham and asparagus onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 4-6 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile beat the egg yolk and milk in a sauce pan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly until thickened. Pour over the asparagus. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve immediately.

Place yeast in warm water. Stir in sugar. Let stand until yeast has dissolved. Add oil. Beat in egg. Stir in salt. Add flour, 1 cup at a time until soft dough forms. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk. Roll out on lightly floured surface to desired shape. Cut into desired shapes. Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes or until done.

In a blender or food processor combine yogurt, mayonnaise, lemon juice & zest, and capers. Blend until smooth. Arrange slices of tomato in a shallow bowl. Pour lemon caper sauce over the top. Refrigerate until serving.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 9-by-12 inch glass cake pan. In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Combine the flour and cocoa powder and stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in amaretto and ground almonds. Spread into the pan and bake for about 25 minutes or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Let cool in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve.
I was just reading the "name: white chocolate macadamia caramel bars" recipe when I realized I have a very similar one in one of my old recipe books.
Mine is called "Pecan Crunchies" and the recipe is from the "Old Fashioned Cookie Book" by Evelyn Lincoln.
Mine is similar except the recipe calls for pecans instead of macadamia nuts. I'll have to try yours.
The only difference is that your recipe calls for caramel sauce. Mine is a regular old caramel

Cook ground beef with onion until crumbled. Add the zucchini and cook until crisp-tender. Drain. Stir in salt and pepper. Add italian cheese blend. Press half of the mixture into a lightly greased 9 inch pie plate. Mix together Bisquick, milk, and eggs until smoothstir in remaining beef mixture. Spread over the base. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting. Serves 4-6.

Cut potatoes into quarters and boil until soft. Drain and mash with a little milk and margarine, then add bacon pieces and seasonings. Heat margarine in a frying pan and stir in chopped onion, followed by flour and seasonings. Gradually add milk and stir until smooth. Beat in eggs and add the cheese. Spoon onto mashed potatoes and bake for about 30 minutes at 190 degrees centigrade in a moderate oven. Sprinkle with dried breadcrumbs before serving. Serves six.

Preheat oven to 450f. In a small bowl, combine buttermilk and mustardstir well. In another small bowl, combine cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese. Lightly pound chicken breasts between 2 sheets of wax paper or plastic wrap to 1/2 inch thickness. Sprinkle with sage and rosemary. Dip in buttermilk mixture. Dip in cracker mixture. Place, skin-side down in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan. Bake uncovered 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut biscuits into quarters and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Melt butter and spread over biscuits. Combine sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over biscuits. Bake for 10 minutes or until light golden brown. Stir nuts into sugar mixture and sprinkle over biscuits. Bake 5 minutes longer or until biscuits are golden brown. Serve warm.

Beat egg whites til soft peaks form. Beat in sour cream, brown sugar and cocoa til combined. Stir in coffee and vanilla. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Spoon into individual dishes and garnish with sour cherries or mint leaves.

Peel and slice each fig halfway through lengthways then add to a non reactive saucepan. Add the Marsala and orange juice, and bring to a boil for 2 minutes. Add the orange zest and honey to taste, then boil again for another minute. Dissolve 2 tbsp orange blossom water into 4 tbsp water, then pour over the fruit. Remove from heat, cover the pan with a lid or a piece of foil to prevent evaporation while you prepare the rest of the dish. For the dressing, whisk together 1 tbsp orange blossom water, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tbsp creme fraiche and 1/2 tsp mint leaves, then season to taste with sea salt. In a serving dish, arrange 6 pieces of fig each on their side, then spoon over some of the dressing. Garnish with mint leaves and serve at room temperature.
Mix onion soup mix into boiling water. Add cooked rice and margarine. Heat through. Serve.

Combine dark sweet cherries with half of pie filling. Mix dry ingredients. Cut in butter with fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Blend in nuts. Sprinkle over filling. Bake 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the whipping cream and the sour cream. Pour in the chicken base. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmercook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and 1/4 cup of the clarified butter. Place the saucepan back on low heat and slowly add the flour mixture. Stir constantly. Add the jalapeño juicestir well. Cook for 1 minute longer to thicken the sauce. Remove from the heatstir in the cheese. Serve immediately, or store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease 2 baking sheets or line with parchment paper. Combine butter, egg white, flour, baking powder in a bowl. Beat until well blended. Add egg yolksmix well. Place almonds in a bowladd 1/2 of the almond mixturetoss well. Dip each almond in the egg yolk mixtureallow excess to drip off. Place in a single layer on greased baking sheets. Bake for 7-8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes or until firmremove to wire racks to cool completely. Store in tightly covered container or in freezer for up to 3 months. Makes 300 sticks.

Cut tempeh into cubes and marinate in soy sauce overnight in refrigerator. Drain and set aside. Boil celery in water until tender, drain and set aside to cool. Dice pickle and scallions. In large bowl, combine tempeh, diced celery, diced pickle, parsley, soy mayonnaise and mustard. Season to taste with lemon juice and salt and pepper. Chill or serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine cocoa and granulated sugar. Add oil, beating well after each addition. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, and saltstir into cocoa mixture just until blended. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until set. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Spread with frosting. Decorate as desired.

Cook sausages in boiling water until firm. Drain. Cut into slices. Heat oil in frying pan. Add mixed vegetables. Cook until crisp. Add onion. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Add sausages. Add curry powder. Cook over medium heat 1 minute. Serve.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

In large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add snow peas and tiny peas. Stir to combine. Add chives and cook for 2-3 minutes longer or until crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 f. Line a 9-inch square pan with parchment paper and set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 1 minute. Beat in the egg and vanilla. In a medium bowl whisk together the cocoa and the baking powder until combined. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool and cut into squares.
