Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract, flour, baking soda, salt, white sugar, quick oatmeal, and nuts. Drop by level teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow the cookies to cool on the cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

In a large bowl mix together the jell-o and boiling water. Stir in the cream cheese until blended. Chill until set. Mix cherries and cola in a small bowl. After jello has set, pour into a mold. Chill for 2 hours. Garnish with chopped nuts. Refrigerate until serving time. Prep time includes refrigeration time.

Combine soups in 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Blend in half-and-half, butter, garlic. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Add noodles to soup mixture. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat fish with seasoning. Add oil to panswirl to coat bottom of pan. Add fishcook 3 to 5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove from pankeep warm. Add remaining ingredients to panstir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Divide fish evenly among four serving platestop evenly with sauce.
Name: sauteed black olives with tomatoes Ingredients: black olives, tomatoes, salt, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh thyme leave, ground pepper, fresh flat-leaf parsley Preparation: Rinse and drain olives. You can pit them or not, whichever you prefer. Combine tomatoes and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. Heat olive oil in a medium skillet, add garlic, and cook over medium-low heat until just starting to brown, 2 to 5 minutes. Add olives and thyme. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, 3 to 4 minutes. Add tomatoes

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic. Add shrimp. Cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and heat until hot. Add figs. Cook until figs are soft. Add garlic. Cook until garlic is soft. Add horseradish, mustard, sugar and vinegar. Cook until mixture bubbles. Add shrimp. Cook until mixture bubbles. Serve on top of rice.

Fry bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute onion until tender. Add tomatoes, black-eyed peas, cooked rice, bacon, salsa. Cook until heated through. Garnish with garlic powder, black pepper, and hot sauce.

Cook new potatoes in lightly salted boiling water until tender but not soft. Cool potatoes. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. In medium bowl, combine dressing, celery, green onion and hard-boiled eggs. Mix well. Add potatoes and mayonnaisemix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for several hours before serving. To serve, spoon potato mixture onto lettuce leavestop with sour cream or yogurt, chopped celery, green onions, chopped hard-boiled eggs, and horseradish to taste.

Wash and scrub potatoes to remove any dirt or debris. Pierce with a fork at several places to allow for even cooking. Bake at 400 degrees F. for about 1 hour or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Let stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine yogurt, tomatoes and olives in a bowl. Spoon over potatoestop with feta cheese and herb seasoning. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Butter one side of each slice of white bread. Layer one slice with mozzarella, then the other slice with the mozzarella. Place the top slice of white bread down with the buttered side up. Arrange the mozzarella slices as desired in the middle of the white bread slices, and then top the mozzarella with the roasted red peppers. Sprinkle with the parmigiano-reggiano cheese and basil leaves.

In a heavy saucepan, add bacon. Cook until crisp, then remove to drain and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to the pan and bring to a boil. Add the green beans and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.
name: garden green beansingredients: fresh green beans, fresh mushrooms, onions, garlic, olive oil, sliced water chestnuts, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, parmesan cheesepreparation:Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
name: asian green beansingredients: fresh green beans, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic clove

Pre-heat oven to 350f. Grease a 9x13 glass pan or dish. In a large bowl, mix together onion, salt, garlic salt and pimento. Spread half of the mixture into the bottom of the pan. In a medium bowl, mix together the potatoes, cheddar cheese, stuffing mix and butter. Spread over the onion layer. Top with the remaining onion mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pierogies until they float, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the baconcook until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove the bacon to paper towels to drain. Add the onions to the same pancook 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the garliccook 30 seconds longer. Stir in the cabbage. Cover and cook over low heat for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add the watercook 2 minutes or until the cabbage is tender and the sauce is thickened. Remove the pan from the heatstir in the dill. Season with salt and pepper. Top the pierogies with the cabbage mixture. Garnish with the bacon if desired.

Preheat oven to 375f. Dry the sole fillets with paper towels. Sprinkle with flour and season with salt. Melt butter in an ovenproof casserole. Add the sherry and soy sauce. Place the sole in the casserole. Bake for 15 minutes or until the flesh flakes easily with a fork. Dot with butter, sprinkle with lemon juice and serve with a garnish of parsley.
You can also find recipes similar to the ones above for specific foods or meal types like lunch , side dish , or vegetables . Or, you can also find more typical recipes from Portugal .

Cream the butter and sugars in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla extract and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Stir in the chopped Baby Ruth bars. Drop by spoonfuls onto a parchment-lined or greased baking sheet. Bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes on the pan. Remove and let cool completely on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container.

Peel oranges and slice thinly. In a small saucepan add water to cover orangesbring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcook for 15 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Drain orangescool completely. In a small bowl, combine orange juice and cornstarchadd water to make 1/2 cup liquid. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffybeat in egg. Add milk, 1/2 cup of the liquid mixture, and vanillablend well. Sift together the flour, salt, and baking powderstir into batter. Stir in oranges and nuts. Pour batter into 2 greased loaf panssprinkle with nuts if desired. Bake at 350f for 60 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes before removing to racks to cool completely. Yield 2 loaves (12 servings each).

Marinate the chicken in soy sauce and oil for a few hours. Cook the chicken in boiling water and shred. In a separate pan, heat the oil and saute the eggplant. Add the chicken, curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and fish sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the lime leaf and cook for another minute. Add the thai chile and serve over the spaghetti. Garnish with cilantro and kaffir lime leaf.

Place the new potatoes in a large pot filled with water. Bring the water to a boil. Cook the potatoes until tender. Drain and place back in the pot. Add the butter spread and mix with the potatoes. Mash the potatoes until smooth. Add the nonfat milk and sour cream. Mix well. Add the bacon bits and chives. Mix well. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook hamburger in a large pan over med/high heat until it's cooked all the way through. Drain the liquid fat and add the whole mushrooms and minced onion to the pan to saute. Drain the liquid fat and add the whole mushrooms and minced onion to the pan to saute. Add the remaining seasonings to the pan and stir together well. Add the tomato paste and stir well to combine. Add the water to the pan and stir well to combine the seasonings and the water thoroughly. Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer until the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the spaghetti noodles and cook over med/high heat until the noodles are cooked to your liking. Stir in the shredded parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
I made this tonight and it is fabulous! I added some leftover zucchini to the sauce and some italian seasoning and oregano to the spaghetti. It was so easy and soooo delicious! Thanks!
I made this for the family last night and it was delish. I made it with

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease 2 loaf pans.In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. In another bowl, combine the egg and milkstir into the dry ingredients until just blended. Add the walnuts and the stuffed green olive and chopped pimiento. Pour into the prepared pans and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 2 loaves.

Mix together cream cheese and powdered sugar with a hand mixer until smooth. Add butter and continue to mix until fluffy. Mix in cool whip until smooth. Add milk and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth again. Put into pie shell. Top with cool whip and crushed oreos.

Grease a 2 litre capacity ovenproof dish with the butter. Cut the bread into cubes. Layer half of the bread in the dish. Sprinkle over the chocolate chips. Cover with the remaining bread. In a large bowl beat together the eggs, caster sugar, vanilla essence, cinnamon and nutmeg until lightly foamy. Pour over the bread. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the pudding is set. Serve hot or cold with cream or ice-cream.

Cook the penne in a large pot of salted water according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, saute the sun-dried tomato in a large skillet with the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Stir in the basil and set aside. In another skillet melt the butter over low heat. Stir in the alfredo sauce and the half and half. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in the penne and the tomato mixture. Season with the black pepper.

Grease and line a baking tray. Mix the coconut and rice bubbles in a large bowl until well blended. Stir in the glace cherries and chocolate chips. Melt the margarine, golden syrup and coconut essence together over a low heat and pour into the dry mixture. Stir until well coated and press into the prepared tray. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix ricotta cheese, eggs, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Slowly add the flour and stir until you have a soft, smooth dough (it should be like melted butter). Take small portions of the dough and roll it in your hands until you have little pillows of dough. Roll the pillows in the tomato sauce and put them in a baking pan with the tomato sauce. Bake at 375 until the top is golden brown. Serve with parmesan cheese on top. Serves 4.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine sugar and cornstarch. Stir until well mixed and dissolved. Add milk and heat, stirring constantly until thickened and boiling. Remove from heat and add butter and brown sugar. Cool. Fold in half-and-half. Stir in vanilla. Pour into a baked pie shell. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Refrigerate. Creamy and delicious.
Combine all in a blender or food processor and process till smooth. Serve immediately or freeze for up to 3 hours. Serve in dessert cups with a dollop of whipped cream or shaved ice cream.

Soften the cream cheese in the microwave. Mix in the rest of the ingredients, and stir until smooth. Serve with crackers or toast. This is also great as an hors d'oeuvres spread for the holidays. Serves 6-8.

In a deep pot, heat the olive oil. Saute the onions with the garlic powder. Add the potato. Add the cream. Add the paprika. Add the bacon bits. Stir the pot well. Beat the eggs lightly and mix them in. Stir until smooth. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine Bisquick mix, granulated sugar and egg. Stir in milk until smooth. Pour into a greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Sprinkle with chopped nuts if desired. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
I will be trying these recipes out asap. I love baking and the first recipe sounds good enough to eat for breakfast lol.
I love the recipes you have put on your blog!!

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add onion, carrot and oregano. Cook until onion is translucent. Add quinoa. Stir for about 30 seconds. Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover skillet. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Fluff the quinoa with a fork. Stir in peas. Serve warm with lemon juice and salt and pepper.

Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, garlic powder and egg in a bowl. Mix well. Shape into patties. Brown patties in a skillet with vegetable oil. Stir together mushroom soup and milk. Spoon over patties. Top with cheese. Cover and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.

Rinse pigeon peas in warm water. Soak in water overnight. Drain and rinse again in warm water. Add 1-1/2 quarts water for every 2 cups of pigeon peas. Bring to boil over medium heat. Simmer 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until peas are soft and tender. Drain. In a large skillet, brown pork chops in 2 tablespoons butter over medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Add meat to peas in large bowl. Mash lightly with a potato masher. Stir in cornflour, thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper to taste. Blend with fork or wooden spoon until well combined. Form into 2-inch meatballs. Melt remaining tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute meatballs in butter 2-3 minutes per side or until browned, turning once. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Heat the butter in a deep skillet or frying pan. Fry the onion until tender, add the curry powder, cake flour, and the salt. Stir well to mix together and let the flour cook for a couple of minutes until it is golden brown and crusty at the bottom of the pan. Add the vinegar and the water. Let the mixture come to a rolling boil while stirring constantly. Once the mixture has come to a boil, cover the pan with a tight fitting lid and allow the mixture to simmer for about 10 minutes or until thickened. Meanwhile prepare the eggs by either boiling them or poaching them in water seasoned with a bit of vinegar or lemon juice to help the whites turn white instead of gray when they are cooked. After the mixture has simmered for 10 minutes, add the eggs to the mixture one at a time using a slotted spoon. The eggs will take on the color of the sauce because the sauce will be very hot at this point. Once the eggs are added, stir the mixture well to make sure that each egg is coated with the sauce. Cover the pan

Beat whites until foamy. Add milk and eggmix well. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil. When oil is hot add whites mixture. Cook 2-3 minutes or until set. Top with remaining ingredients. Cook 30 seconds. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Peel the skin off the butternut squash and cut it in half. Bake in oven for 40 minutes. When squash is done, remove the seeds and cut the pieces in cubes. In a pot, add the vegetable broth and cook the vegetables for 20 minutes. Add the baking soda and let it boil. Turn off the heat and add the butternut squash cubes and the half-and-half. Mash the vegetables with a fork. Season with salt and pepper and add the cinnamon. Serve the soup hot.

Prepare the grill. Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl whisk together the orange juice, tomato paste, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic cloves, orange zest, ground ginger and hot red pepper flakes. In another small bowl whisk together the olive oil, butter and white wine. Place the fish on the grill. Brush it on both sides with the white wine mixture. Grill the fish on both sides until done. Serve the fish with the sauce.

Cut the potatoes into small cubes. Arrange the cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle the olive oil over the cubes and sprinkle with the minced garlic. Sprinkle with the salt. Roast for 15-20 minutes until potatoes are tender. Take out of the oven and toss. Serve warm.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat until melted. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the hot sauce and tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are softened. Add the basil leaves and cook for another minute or two. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice and bay leaf. Add the salmon and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through. Serve with the sauce spooned over the top.

Combine egg white and water in a small bowl. Add brown sugar and white sugar. Mix well. Add salt and cinnamon. Add pecans. Toss until well coated. Place on wax paper covered baking sheet. Bake for 45 minutes at 250 degrees f. Stir once after 30 minutes. Cool completely before storing.

Combine the brown sugar and heavy cream in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat and cook until boiling, stirring constantly to prevent crystallization. Remove from the heat and stir in the almonds and the salt. Pour into the prepared baking dish and spread into an even layer. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Add the onion and saute until softened and translucent. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the herbes de provence and saute for 1 more minute. Add the vegetable broth and the diced tomatoes and bring to the boil. Add the white wine. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cannellini beans and simmer for 2 more minutes. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread pizza crust with pizza sauce. Top with bacon and spinach. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake for 10 minutes. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake 10 more minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. Mix yellow cake mix with pudding mix in a medium bowl until crumbly. Add oil and watermix until smooth. Beat eggs in a small bowl until light and fluffy. Stir into mixture with nuts. Spread in pansprinkle with sprinkles. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool slightlycut into squares.
name: nut cakeingredients: shortening, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, milk, vanilla, nutmeatspreparation:Cream shortening and sugar, add egg yolks and beat well. Mix flour and baking powder together and add alternately to shortening mix with milk and vanilla. Stir in nuts. Beat egg whites until stiff, then fold into batter. Bake in a greased pan in a 350 degree oven for 50 minutes.
name: honey nut cakeingredients: hazelnuts, dried apple,

Sautee onion with ginger, garlic, cayenne pepper and curry powder over medium heat in a small sauce pan until fragrant (2-3 minutes). Stir in garam masala. Add spinach and cook until spinach has wilted (about 5 minutes). Stir in yogurt and cook until warm (1-2 minutes). Serve immediately with garlic naan or basmati rice. Serves 2-3.
Mash the cooked and cooled potato with the butter and milk. Sieve in the flour and the cheese, add the beaten egg and season with salt and pepper. Form into small rounds and fry in butter.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.In a large skillet, heat 4 tablespoons butter. Add the scallions and saute until lightly browned. Add the mushrooms and continue to saute until they are tender. Add the flour to the skillet and stir to blend. Add the paprika, salt and pepper and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the veal and cook until no longer pink. Add the remaining 1 1/2 cups of butter and the wine. Cook for 1 minute, stirring until the liquid is reduced by half. Transfer the mixture to a casserole. In a small bowl combine the whipping cream and the sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over the veal. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with rice.

Combine pecans, flour, salt, maple syrup, brown sugar, egg yolks, vanilla and water in blender. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold into nut mixture with a spatula. Pour into a greased and floured 9x9 pan and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until done. Cool before removing from pan.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and allow to cool slightly. Toss potatoes in a bowl with 1 teaspoon oil. Season with salt. Add broccoli and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Cook until tender about 5 minutes. Add beans to pot. Stir to combine. Add remaining 1 teaspoon oil, dill, lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over potatoes and garnish with crumbled goat cheese.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over med-high heat. Cook the onion in the hot pan for 3 minutes or until lightly browned and beginning to soften. Add the pepper and cook for 2 minutes or until softened. Add the turkey sausage, cooking and stirring for 5 minutes or until lightly browned and no longer pink. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomatillos, wine, salt and cayenne pepper. Stir in the rice and stir for 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve at once. Serves 4.

Cut squash and onions into small pieces. Boil until tender. Mash some. Combine with remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes.
Mix all ingredients. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes.
Heat oil in a large skillet and cook squash until it becomes tender. Stirring often. Add peanuts, salt and sugar. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the flavors have mingled, about 5 minutes. Serve hot.
Put water in pot add potatoes. Cook potatoes until a little soft. Add vegetables and cook until desired texture of veges. Olive oil or butter can be spread on top. Salt and pepper to desired taste. Since i am always watching my weight i do not put butter or olive oil on top only salt and pepper.
Place corn into large pot and cover with salted water, bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender,

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Rub fish steaks with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place fish in a shallow baking dish. Bake 12-15 minutes until cooked through. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute zucchini and onion for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until just fragrant. Add halibut and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until warmed through. Stir in parsley. Serve fish with vegetables and lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine flour, corn syrup, butter, egg yolks and almond extract. Blend well. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough out into a rectangle about 1/8-inch thick. Cut out circles with a biscuit cuttertransfer circles to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Beat egg whites and powdered sugar with a mixer until stiff peaks formspread meringue over dough circles, covering completelybake for 8-10 minutes or until meringue is setcool completely on a wire rackin a small bowl, mix together dark corn syrup, butter, vanilla extractadd powdered sugarmix until smoothspread over each tartsprinkle with pecan halvesrefrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
The Pecan is native to North America, but has spread throughout the world. Pecans are native trees to the southern United States and grow wild in the forests of Arkansas, Louisiana, Oklahoma, Missouri, Texas, Florida

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Season the duck with lemon pepper and garlic heads and let it sit for 20 minutes. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the duck and saute 4 minutes on each side. Transfer to a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes per pound or until the internal temperature reaches 155 degrees F. Drizzle with fresh lemon juice and serve warm or cold.

In a saucepan over medium heat, saute the onions in the oil until the onions are soft. Add the flour and cook 2 minutes. Add the chili and garlic and saute 1 minute. Add the stock and cook 1 minute. Season with salt to taste.
I have to agree with everyone else here...I don't know how I'd get through a week without enchilada sauce. I'm not even a big enchilada fan but I do love to make them for my family. I don't use the canned sauce anymore...I prefer to make it fresh. I can't believe how much better it tastes!
I'm new to this forum and I must say I'm really impressed with all the recipes and comments. This is my second post and I'm going to try and make the cajun shrimp enchilada's tonight. I'm so excited I can't wait to taste them.
I'm making the Mexican Green Sauce tonight. I can't wait!
I don't know how I missed this one. I just got back from my

Melt margarine in skillet over moderate heat. Cut apple into slices and add to skillet. Stir until thoroughly coated with margarine. Sprinkle with sugar and brown lightly on each side. Place on bread slices and serve warm.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and is clear. Add the vanilla, stirring constantly to blend. Serve hot or cold. Serve with ice cream, cakes, or pies or pour over pancakes or waffles. Use in place of the cinnamon-sugar topping on French toast or crepes, or sprinkle over apple dumplings before baking. Store any leftovers in the freezer for up to 6 months or in the refrigerator for up to 1 month. Makes 3 cups.

Sift flour into a bowl, make a well in center of flouradd eggs, milk, salt and pepperwhisk together until smoothfry on a lightly greased griddle or frying pan until both sides are brownedserve topped with slices of brie cheese, chives, cayenne pepper, if desired.

Melt vegetable oil in a 9x13 inch pan. Add pork chops. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Brown on both sides. Stir soup, sour cream, water, and dill weed together in a saucepan over low heat. Spoon half of the soup mixture over the pork chops. Layer half the potatoes over the top. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake in 350f oven for 1 hour 20 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over med-high heat. Add the onion and saute until softened but not browned. Add the garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, anchovy fillet and crushed tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are softened. Add the capers and the tuna in olive oil to the saucepan, season with salt, mix well, and cook until heated through. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions and drain it in a colander over a bowl. Add the sauce to the pasta along with the parsley and toss well to combine. Serve immediately.

In a 9x13" baking dish combine cooked hashbrowns, the raw meat and the cheddar cheese. Dice the onion and add to the mixture. In a large bowl combine the eggs, heavy cream and the seasonings. Pour the egg mixture over the meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Spread pineapple in a 9x13 pan. Sprinkle pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle with dry cake mix. Pour a cup of water over the mixture. Drizzle melted margarine over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the cake is done. Sprinkle with flaked coconut.

Mix soup, water, rice, onion powder and salt in a 2-qt shallow baking dish. Top with vegetables and sprinkle with pepper. Cover and bake at 375 for 45 min or until rice is done and vegetables are tender and chicken is no longer pink in center. Uncover and sprinkle with cheesebake 2 minutes longer or until melted and golden brown.

In a medium bowl, combine flour & cocoa. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine butter, sugar & egg. Beat until well blended. Stir in flour mixture. Divide mixture in half. On an ungreased cookie sheet, form each half into a log about 3 inches wide & 7 inches long. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven & cool for 10 minutes. Slice into 1/3 inch slices. Melt chocolate in a double boiler. In a small bowl, combine coconut & icing sugar. Dip 1/3 slice in melted chocolate. Shake off excess. Roll in coconut mixture. Repeat with remaining slices. Yield 20.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl combine light brown sugar and flour. Whisk together the oil, vanilla extract and eggs until well combined. Add the egg mixture, the morsels and the pecans to the flour mixture. Stir until combined. Spread the batter into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool and cut into squares. Makes about 16 squares.

Heat margarine in a 2 litre saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and stir fry for about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, chopped onion and garlic. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add green capsicum and cook for 3 minutes. Add boiling water and stir. Cover saucepan. Cook for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in pepper.
I've got some ideas to add to the list. I'm also going to check out the ones you posted.
I love your rice ideas. I am going to try a few this week.
I love this list. I'm going to make some tonight.
I am going to try some of these this week!
I just made some low country red rice yesterday...it was really good.
I'm going to try the Moroccan one for sure.
I love the ones you posted too! I have made the saffron rice before. It is so good!
I love rice! I'm going to try a few of these this week.
I love the ones you posted. I made the low country one last night. It was very

In a medium bowl, mash the avocados with a fork or potato masher until chunky. Add the lime juice, cilantro, corn kernels, red bell pepper, red onion, cheese, jalapeño jack cheese, and hot sauce. Stir gently to combine. Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on the surface of the guacamole, pressing to eliminate any air pockets. Serve at room temperature. This dip is best when made within 8 hours of serving, but it can be prepared up to 1 day in advance. Cover and refrigerate. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before serving, but keep covered until ready to serve.
Beat together cream cheese, milk, eggs. Add in remaining ingredients. Pour into a greased 13x9 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

In a large bowl stir together the millet, wheat germ and puffed cereal. Combine the honey, peanut butter and vanilla. Pour into the dry mix and stir until well combined. Add the chocolate chips and raisins and stir again. Spread into a greased 8x8x2 inch baking pan and bake in a preheated 350f oven for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.
Foods that are high in fiber such as cereals, brown rice and beans are also important to a healthy diet.

Sauté the vegetables over medium heat until golden brown. Add curry powder. Add vegetable broth to cover. Add potato and simmer for about 15 minutes until potato is tender. Add the zucchini and cook for a few minutes. Remove from heat. Blend the contents of the pan to puree. Season to taste. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350. Rinse and pat dry the cod. Whisk together the horseradish, lemon juice, garlic and fennel seeds. Spread the mixture over the top of the fillets. Combine the panko breadcrumbs, parsley and pepper in a shallow bowl. Dip each fillet into the mixture and place on a baking sheet. Bake for about 25 minutes. Serve with mustard.

In medium saucepan bring water to boiladd carrots. Cook uncovered 10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain well. In medium skillet melt butterstir in brown sugar and vinegar. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils, stirring constantly. Add carrotstoss lightly. Serve immediately. Makes about 3 cups.

Trim the ends off the mushroom caps and set them aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion. Saut until the onion is golden. Add the water and cook over low heat until it evaporates. Add the balsamic vinegar and cook over medium heat until it evaporates. Stir in the Dijon mustard, lemon juice and parsley. Remove the skillet from the heat. Stuff each cap with the mixture. Place the caps on a broiler pan or baking sheet, drizzle with the olive oil and broil for 3 minutes, or until the mushrooms are lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). grease baking sheet or line with parchment paper. combine margarine and peanut butter in a large bowl. add the bananas and beat until well blended. beat in the egg and vanilla. in a small bowl, combine the flour, splenda and baking sodastir into the peanut butter mixture until just moistened. drop by teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet, about 2 inches apart. bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. let cool on wire rack for about 1 minute before removing from baking sheet. cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Use as is or serve chilled as a dip with pita wedges or chips or as a condiment with lamb or beef kebabs or meatballs.

Beat eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy. Stir in flour until well blended. Fold in pecans and chocolate chips. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 325f for 40 minutes. Serve warm with whipped topping or ice cream.
10/14/2009 Recipe from the 1950's. The original recipe was from a cookbook printed in 1950, so I don't know how long this one has been around. I've been making it for over 20 years now.
11/4/2009 This recipe was given to me from my mom and has been a family tradition for about 25 years.
11/8/2009 A variation on traditional pecan pie recipes.
12/2/2009 This is an old family recipe from my grandmother.
1/14/2010 This is an old family recipe that I have made for years.
1/15/2010 I have made this recipe for many

Sift together flour, sugar and baking powder. Beat oil, milk and eggs. Add the flour mixture and beat well. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for one hour and 10 minutes. Cool completely before icing. To prepare icing, combine 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until smooth and thick enough to drizzle. Drizzle over the top of the cooled cake. Sprinkle chopped pecans on top.

Mix morsels, brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in small bowl. Combine apples, butter, and water in 4 qt saucepancook on medium heat until tender. Stir in oats until well blended. Spread apples into lightly greased 3-qt baking dish. Sprinkle with morsel mixture. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until apples are bubbling. Top with pecans. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausages and cook until browned. Remove from pan, drain and set aside. Add oregano and garlic and stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add beef stock and bring to a boil. Add sausages, black olives and mushrooms. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with bread or pasta.

Heat oil in a large heavy skillet. Pat dry the pork chops and sprinkle with pepper. Brown the chops in hot oil in the skillet. Drain and set aside. In the same pan over moderate heat, add the wine and cook until reduced by half. Mix the cornstarch with a little of the beef broth. Add the rest of the broth and the onions to the wine. Cook until the mixture thickens and boils. Remove from the heat. Return the pork to the pan and spoon the sauce over the pork.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery and saute until softened, about 2-3 minutes. Add garlic and saute until lightly browned, about 1-2 minutes more. Add tomatoes with their juice, cumin and salt and pepper. Simmer until thickened slightly, about 10 minutes. Add vegetables and cook until just tender but still firm. Divide among individual pie shells or a single pie shell. Bake in preheated oven for 25-35 minutes, until golden brown and bubbly. Cool slightly before serving. Serves 4-6.

Prepare water, vermouth and salt for poaching in saucepan. Bring to boil, then turn off heat. Place white fish fillets in water, cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile prepare poaching liquid by dissolving butter in water and vermouth. Sprinkle salt and pepper over white fish fillets. Heat poaching liquid to boiling, add white fish fillets and parsley. Poach white fish fillets for 10 minutes. Drain fish and keep warm. Cut sliced almonds in half. For each serving: Arrange sliced almonds on plate. Place white fish fillets on almonds. Pour poaching liquid over white fish fillets and garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedge.

Cut off top 2 inches of each beet. Remove top with vegetable peeler or sharp knife. Cut each beet lengthwise in half. Remove seeds. Place beet halves in shallow baking pan or on baking sheet. Drizzle with margarinecover tightly with plastic wrap. Microwave on high 3 minutes or until tender, turning once. Combine syrup and lemon juice in small saucepancook over low heat, stirring constantly until glaze is thickened, about 3 minutes. Spoon glaze over beets.

In a bowl, combine the lean pork, onion, apple, parsley, garlic and egg. Mix well. Add the breadcrumbs and barbecue sauce and mix well. Divide the mixture evenly between the 6 wells of a 6-well muffin pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, turning once or until done. Makes 6 meatloafs.

Combine concentrate and fresh juice in large bowl. Add curry powder and mix well. Add tofu and mix well. Marinate in refrigerator for 1-2 hours. Turn tofu after 1 hour. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until slightly brown. Serve warm or cold.

Cut off the stalk ends. Pull off and discard any yellow or discolored leaves. Cut each sprout in half through the stem. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add sprouts and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until tender but still crisp. Serve hot.
