Wash and snap the ends off the beans. Place the bacon in a skillet and cook over medium heat until crisp. Add the butter and stir to dissolve. Add the sugar and stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the green beans and cook for 4 minutes. Add the soy sauce and garlic powder and cook for another minute. Serve over cooked rice.
I have been trying to find this recipe for years. I lost the recipe when my mom passed away and have been trying to find it ever since. Thank you for posting it. It is my favorite!!

Combine bread crumbs and parmesan cheese in a shallow bowl. Beat egg in another shallow bowl. Heat oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Dip each chicken breast into the egg, then into the bread crumb mixture. Add to the hot skillet and cook 3 minutes on each side or until the juices run clear. Add mushrooms and shallot and cook 2 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with parsley. Place 1 chicken breast on each of 4 plates and top each with 2 tablespoons mozzarella. Spoon mushrooms and shallot on top of the mozzarella. Serve immediately.

Combine heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla in a sauce pan. Heat and whisk until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. In a bowl, combine cream mixture with cranberries. Fold in chopped apple and chopped walnuts. Chill for at least 3 hours. Serve in a small glass.

In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onion, green pepper, garlic until onion softens. Add frozen hash brown potatoes and cook until heated through. Add ham and cook until heated through. Add salt, black pepper. Sprinkle cheese over top. Cook until cheese is melted and browned on bottom.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowlserve on bread slices.

Trim and chop celery. Cook in butter until tender. Add onion and cook until tender. Add apple. Add flour and cook 2 minutes. Add curry powder and cook 1 minute. Add milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 3 minutes. Cool. Chill. Garnish with celery leaves.

Line a 13x9-inch baking pan with foil, leaving an overhang. Combine chocolate and butter in a small bowlset aside. Beat eggs and sugar in a medium bowl until thick and light. Fold in chocolate mixture. In a small saucepan, heat water and espresso powder just until bubbles form around edge. Remove from heatadd to egg mixture. Sift together flour and saltstir into mixture. Pour into pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, cook the onion, carrot, celery rib and apple in the vegetable oil until softened and lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute more. Pour the red wine and port into the pot. Stir in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Strain the stock into a large measuring cup. Press the vegetables through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the solids. Discard the solids. Strain the stock again through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the sediment. Press the vegetables through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the solids. Discard the solids. Strain the stock again through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the sediment. Transfer the stock to a large bowl. Stir in the cream. Add the butter a tablespoon at a time until the stock is smooth. Chill the stock until thoroughly chilled. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. The stock will keep for up to 3 days in the refrigerator. Makes about

Preheat oven to 350. Grease three 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl combine the white sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Beat for two minutes until well blended. Stir in the walnuts. Fold in the carrots. Divide the batter evenly among the three pans. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and let stand for 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edges of the pans and invert onto wire racks to cool. Serve the cakes topped with the cream cheese frosting.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift together flour, cocoa and baking soda and mix well. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonsfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes. Let cool on sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Place the eggs in a large saucepan. Add cold water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcook at a simmer for 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl of ice water and cool. Peel the eggs. Scoop out the yolks. Place the yolks in a small bowl. Mash with a fork. Stir in the mayonnaise, Dijon and jam. Add the hot sauce, ground habanero chile and black pepper. Stir well. Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a plain decorating tip. Pipe the yolk mixture into the center of each egg white half. Garnish with the peach salsa. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve chilled.

Slice the tomatoes into 1/2 inch pieces. Toss in a large bowl together with all the remaining ingredients. Taste for seasonings and add more of the yogurt or seasonings as needed. Garnish with more of the herbs and serve.

Pre heat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheet with wax paper and set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Beat the eggs and vanilla extract. Add the eggs and vanilla extract into the sugar and cream. Sift the flour, baking powder and soda. Stir the flour into the cream mixture. Fold in the chopped nuts. Drop by teaspoonful onto prepared sheet. Bake for 8 to 9 minutes. Remove and cool on the sheet for 2 minutes. Lift the cookies out of the melted chocolate and place on wax paper to cool.

Preheat oven to 200c. Heat oil in 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add scallions and garlic. Cook 2 minutes or until scallions are crisp-tender. Stir in swiss chard. Cook 5 minutes or until wilted. Add chickpeas. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in dill. Sprinkle with feta. Bake for 2 minutes.

Prepare the pork mixture. In a food processor, combine the ground pork, garlic, salt, soy sauce, oyster sauce and water. Pulse until the mixture is well combined. Heat the oil in a wok or skillet. Add the pork mixture and cook for 2 minutes. Add the raw shrimp and cornstarch. Cook until the liquid is gone. Stir the eggs into the mixture. Add the green onions. Serve over rice.

Cut the chicken into 1-inch cubes and season with salt and pepper and garlic powder. Heat a small amount of oil over medium-high heat and cook the chicken until browned on all sides (about 10 minutes). Place the browned chicken into the slow cooker along with the remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve over rice and sprinkle with parsley.

Combine water, kosher salt and sugar in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Add bay leaves, shallots, allspice berry and garlic. Reduce heat to medium high and boil until mixture has thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in hot pepper sauce. Remove from heat. Remove bay leaves. Cool to room temperature. Pour into a gallon sized Ziploc bag. Place pork roast into bag. Seal bag. Turn bag so that it is lying flat. Place in refrigerator overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Remove from bag. Place roast in a shallow baking dish. Bake 1 hour in 375 preheated oven. Serve with mashed potatoes.
I’m not sure how to comment on this blog. I’m not sure if I’m doing it right. I am trying to make a comment on a post about Crock Pot Pork Roast. My comment is that I like it.

Place chuck roast in the crock pot. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and pour over the roast. Cover and cook in low for 7 to 8 hours. Remove the roast and cool slightly. Slice the meat and place on the rolls. Serve with the liquid as a dip for the sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil. Cut off the bottoms and then slice each brussels sprout half lengthwise. Toss with melted butter. Sprinkle the sage leaves over the brussels sprouts. Roast until browned and tender about 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).Place tenderloin in baking dish with 1/4 cup maple syrup, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup ketchup, 1/2 teaspoon dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon orange zest, 1 teaspoon curry powder, 1/4 teaspoon coriander, 1/4 teaspoon worcestershire sauce and 1 tablespoon garlic clovesbake 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 20 minutes.Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutesserve with baked sweet potatoes and steamed green beans with garlic butter sauce.

In a heavy skillet saute the vegetables in the butter until soft. Add the salt and the pepper. Add the peas. Add the water and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in the pimiento. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 13x9x2 pan. Break up the sausage and fry till crispy. Remove from pan and set aside. Beat eggs and add milk, salt and dry mustard. Pour over bread. Cover with sausage and sprinkle with cheddar. Bake for 45-60 minutes. Remove from oven and let set for about 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet heat the olive oil and saute the green onions until tender. Add the asparagus and peas and cook until crisp tender. Add the tomatoes and cook until warm. Add the lemon juice and cook for an additional minute. Add the tuna and toss until heated through. Add the cooked pasta and toss until well blended. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the chicken broth, gingerroot, and soy sauce. Add the peanut butter and honey and stir until smooth. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ginger, garlic and chili paste and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the spaghetti and stir for 3 to 4 minutes. Add the broth mixture and simmer until the noodles are al dente and the liquid is reduced by half. Add the green onions and peanuts and heat through. Serve hot.

Season fish with garlic powder and chili powder and turmeric and garam masala and lemon juice and lemon wedges. In a small bowl, mix garlic powder, chili powder, turmeric and garam masala and lemon wedges. In a small bowl combine lemon wedges and garlic powder and chili powder and turmeric and garam masala and lemon wedges and sprinkle on the fish fillets. Grill the fish until it flakes easily with a fork.

Cut each chicken breast into 3 thin strips. Place strips in 13 by 9 by 2 inch baking dish. In medium bowl, stir together ketchup, dressing and pepper. Pour over chicken. Bake uncovered 1 hour 15 minutes or till no pink remains. Garnish with parsley. Serve with pasta or rice.

Brown sausage in frying pan. Drain excess fat and add mushrooms and onion. Cook for 5 minutes or until mushrooms are cooked through. Add bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes or until bell peppers are crisp tender. Add cabbage and seasoning and cook until cabbage is tender. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place in bowl with cabbage mixture. Toss together and serve immediately.

In a large skillet, saut? the mushrooms in the olive oil over medium-high heat. Stir in the leek and saut? until the vegetables are tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the broth is reduced by half. In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and cold water. Add to the skillet. Cook until thickened. Stir in the sour cream, lemon juice, and tarragon. Serve.

Blend together corn syrup, sugar, and water without stirring until dissolved. Without stirring, cook until the hard ball stage. Remove from burner. Add peppermint oil and stir well. Divide into 2 portions. In one half, add green coloring. Pour over greased platters and let cool. When cool enough to touch, pull each apart separately. Form into ropes. Cut into desired lengths and shapes.

Place all the ingredients in a small saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes. Use a fork to pierce the pork chops. Pour the marinade over the pork chops and place in a baking pan. Cover with foil and place in the refrigerator for 4 hours. Grill the pork chops and serve with the remaining sauce. Serves 4 to 6.
I have made this a few times and it is great. I usually make it a day before cooking.
I have been making this for a while and it is the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a medium bowl, mix together pancake mix, egg yolk, water and oil until just combined. Set aside.In a food processor or blender, puree carrots and yellow onion until smooth. In a medium saucepan, combine pureed vegetables with garlic powder, paprika and parsley. Cook over medium heat until mixture is dry and thickened, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool slightly.Place pancake mixture in large bowl and stir in vegetables mixture until just combined.Let cool for about 30 minutes.Place mixture in greased 2-quart baking dish. Cover with foil, and bake in preheated oven for one hour, or until top is golden brown.Let cool slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut firm tofu into cubes about 2 inches on a side. Arrange in baking pan. Coat lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Bake about 20 minutes until lightly browned. Meanwhile combine almonds, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper in small bowl. Combine egg and 2 Tbs. cold water in another small bowl. Combine tofu cubes and almond mixture in another small bowl. Spoon mixture into cavities of tofu cubes. Dip fingers in egg mixture and press to seal cavities. Dip stuffed tofu in egg mixture again and roll in remaining bread crumbs to coat. Place breaded cubes on baking sheet and bake another 20 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Place all of the dry ingredients into your blender, add 1/4 cup of water and blend until the mixture is smooth. Transfer to a glass container and stir in remaining 1/2 cup water. Store in refrigerator for two weeks before serving. Makes about 1/2 pint.

Bring 2 cups water to boil. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add rice and simmer uncovered until tender (about 15 minutes). Remove from heat and let cool. Combine remaining 2 cups water and salt. Stir in skim milk and vanilla. Heat to boiling. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon. Add to water mixture. Pour into 2-quart casserole dish. Fill with rice. Pour skim milk mixture evenly over rice. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven 30 minutes or until heated through.

Put the tapioca and water in a bowl and let soak for about five minutes. Drain the soaking water and rinse the tapioca very well. Put the tapioca, milk, egg, and sugar in the rice cooker pan. Add the salt and the vanilla extract. Set the cooker to "cook" mode and cook on low for three hours or until the mixture thickens to your liking. The cooking time will vary depending on the type of rice cooker you use and the amount of liquid added to the mixture. If you prefer a slightly firmer pudding, cook a little longer on low. If you prefer a softer pudding, cook a little longer on high. Stir the mixture occasionally while cooking to prevent it from scorching or burning on the bottom of the rice cooker pan. Serve warm or chill in the refrigerator before serving. This is a delicious dessert for cold winter days or as a light dessert for your next family meal. You can serve this with whipped cream or a dollop of fresh fruit. The possibilities are endless!

Heat olive oil cooking spray to coat skillet. Add onion and saute 2 minutes. Add ground beef and cook 3-5 minutes or until done. Add condensed cream of tomato soup, tomato sauce, water & rice. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover & simmer 20 minutes or until rice is done. Stir in cut green beans. Cover & simmer 3-5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley & serve.

Preheat oven to 425f. Score ham and stud with pineapple slices and whole cloves. Combine brown sugar, maple syrup, vinegar, worcestershire sauce and instant coffee granules in a small bowl. Spread over the top of the ham and sprinkle with dry mustard. Wrap tightly in foil and place in a shallow roasting pan with an inch of water in it. Bake for 20 minutes per pound at 425f until cooked through. Remove from oven and serve immediately or cool slightly and slice into thin slices before serving.

Mix together cream cheese, garlic and salt to taste. Add artichoke hearts and black olives. Garnish with green onions, sun-dried tomatoes and parsley. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve with crackers, bread or vegetables. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine bratwurst, sauerkraut, and swiss cheeseset aside. In a separate bowl combine Bisquick, milk and beerstir well until blended. Pour over bratwurst mixture and stir until well blended. Spoon into a greased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 25 minutes or until top is lightly browned and a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Combine dressing mix with milk. Add peas. Drain onionsadd to vegetables. Combine with pasta. Add tomatoes, olives and green onions. Mix well. Serve at room temperature. Garnish with additional green onions, if desired.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13x2 inch glass baking dish. Beat the butter and olive oil in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add the bittersweet chocolate and beat until smooth. Add the eggs and beat until combined. Add the salt and sugars and beat until combined. Add the flour and cinnamon and beat until just combined. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until the edges are set. Cool in pan on a wire rack.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini and saute until just tender, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add the pasta and toss well to coat. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and the bell pepper. Cook until the bell pepper is just softened. Transfer to a platter or bowl. Sprinkle the olives and sunflower seeds evenly over the pasta. Drizzle the pesto over the top and serve immediately.

Peel and cut the sweet potatoes into 3/4-inch cubes. Place in a large saucepan with water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Drain the potatoes and place them back into the pan. Mash with a potato masher until smooth. Add the butter and green onion. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Add the sour cream and mix well.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) Grease a 9×13 inch baking dish. Mix together marinara and polenta. Pour into prepared baking dish. In a food processor combine pesto, 1/2 of the pine nuts, mozzarella, and 1/2 cup of the marinara. Spread over top of polenta mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup marinara and remaining pine nuts. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Let set for 10 minutes before serving.

In a medium saucepan, combine 2 cups boiling water and 2 envelopes unflavored gelatinstir to dissolve. Add 1/2 cup sugarstir to dissolve. Add the desired amount of the desired Kool Aid® flavored beverage powder and 1/2 cup cold waterstir well to blend. Pour into 6 popsicle molds (5 oz). Freeze until solid. To unmold, run warm water around the outside of the molds until pops come out easily. If you make these a day ahead of time, place the molds on a cookie sheet and put them in the freezer overnight to unmold more easily.

Mix first 3 ingredients and 2 tb soy sauce in large nonreactive bowl. Add lamb. Turn to coat. Refrigerate 3 hours to overnight. Preheat oven to 375f. Heat remaining 1 tb soy sauce in heavy large ovenproof skillet over high heat. Add lamb. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer skillet to oven and roast lamb chops to desired doneness, about 10 minutes for medium rare. Transfer lamb to platter. Spoon sauce over. Toss together peanuts and remaining 1 tb soy sauce in separate small bowl. Sprinkle over.
Lamb Chops are very tasty and tender meat. The meat is prepared in different ways. It is sometimes baked or broiled but the most common way of cooking lamb chop is frying. The meat is first marinated in spicy mixture and then fried in oil.

Cut mushrooms in half lengthwise. In a skillet heat olive oil over medium heat, add garlic, cook 1 minute stirring constantly. Add onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, black pepper stirring constantly. Add cream cheese stirring until melted. Add half of the parmesan cheese mix well. Spoon into each mushroom cap. Top with remaining cheese. Bake at 400 for 5-8 minutes or until heated through.
Blend the butter and cream cheese together well. Add the flour and blend to a soft dough. Wrap in cling film and chill.

Spray a large non-stick skillet with non-stick cooking spray. Mix together the lemon pepper and flour. Place the chicken breasts into the flour mixture and coat them well. Brown the chicken in the pan over medium-high heat. When the chicken is browned, remove it to a platter. Add the curry powder to the pan and stir to cook the flavors. Return the chicken to the pan and add the avocado. Stir until heated through. Place the chicken into lettuce leaves. Top each serving with salad dressing. Garnish with the tomatoes and olives.

Wash and snap off hard ends of asparagus. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until bright green and tender. Drain and cool under cold running water. Heat the vinegar and water to boiling. Add asparagus and cook for 1 minute. Remove and cool. Combine rice wine vinegar and water, stirring until sugar and salt dissolve. Stir in dark sesame oil and lemon juice. Garnish asparagus with lemon rind and sesame seeds.
These look amazing and I'm going to try to find some at my local store. Thanks for sharing this great idea!
Thank you for your comments. I am glad you are finding this blog useful.
These are great and you have given me so many great recipes. Thanks for sharing these.
Thanks for your comments. I love to cook and love to find new recipes and I love to share them.
I'm so glad you like my blog and I am glad you are finding recipes that you like.

Melt the butter. Saute the onions until soft. Add the thyme. Add the flour to the butter and onions. Cook for several minutes, stirring constantly. Add the chicken stock. Simmer for several minutes. Add the zucchini. Simmer until tender. Add the cream. Season with the roquefort cheese. Salt and pepper to taste.

Boil 2 pounds of red potatoes in unsalted water until tender, 15-20 minutesdrain and set aside to cool. Mix 1 1/2 cups mayonnaise with 1/4 cup cider vinegar and 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill until smooth. Mash the potatoes with the mayonnaise mixture and add 3/4 cup finely chopped red onion. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Garnish with fresh dill sprigs and serve chilled or at room temperature.

Combine the apples, onions, ginger, garlic and raisins in large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for 45 minutes., stirring occasionally. Add vinegar. Increase heat to medium. Stir in spices and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in salt. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Pour into sterile glass jars. Seal. Makes 5 quarts.

Wash and rinse white rice. Add 3 cups of water to your rice cooker. Spray sausage with cooking spray and saute over medium heat until browned. Crumble and add to rice. Add cilantro leaf and black sesame seeds. Cook for 15 minutes. Turn rice cooker off and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet. Spread cracker crumbs into even layer on cookie sheetset aside. Melt butter and brown sugar together over medium low heat. Add sliced almondsstir to combine. Pour over the graham cracker crumb layerspread evenly with spatula. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.

Crush graham crackers and combine with margarine and sugar. Press into a 9x13 pan and bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with chopped pecans and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until pecans are golden brown. Cool for an hour before cutting into bars.

In a gallon sized plastic bag place all the ingredients. Put in the chicken pieces and coat with the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours. Grill over medium heat. Turn chicken several times until cooked through. This recipe can be doubled.

Combine the flour with the salt, oil and sugar. Add the eggs and water. Knead the dough until smooth, adding more flour if necessary. Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8 minutes. Roll the dough out about 1/4 inch thick. Cut out circles of dough with a doughnut cutter or a glass. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or deep skillet until hot. Fry the doughnut circles a few at a time until golden brown. Place on paper towels to drain and cool slightly. Dip each doughnut into the cinnamon-sugar mixture or sprinkle with nuts. Serve hot.

Prepare the syrup by combining the sugar and water in a pan over a low heat. Stir until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and cool completely. Combine the syrup with the lime juice in a jug with 1 litre of cold water. Chill for 30 minutes to blend flavours. Just before serving pour the malibu rum over the ice cubes. Add the lime syrup, stir well and pour over the ice. Garnish with a slice of lime.

Place shucked oysters in bowl with a few drops of hot sauce and the salt and pepper to taste. Beat eggs and milk together. Put crackers into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin. In a 4-quart kettle or deep-fat fryer heat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dip each oyster into egg mixture then roll into the crushed crackers, letting the cracker adhere to the egg-coated oyster. Fry for 4 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon and place on paper towels to drain. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in spinach. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until wilted. Stir in onion. Cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Add spices. Cook for 1 minute. Add cooked rice. Stir until combined. Add tomatoes. Cook for 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in lemon juice. Season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.

In a crock pot combine all ingredients except chips and sour cream. Heat on low for 6 to 7 hours or on high 3 to 4 hours. Ladle into bowls and top with chips and sour cream.
Wow. The tortilla tomato soup looks very good. I’m going to make it sometime.
I’m definitely going to make the tomato soup!
I love the tortilla tomato soup!
I have made the crockpot tortilla soup many times. It is great! I used a can of black beans instead of dried and a can of tomatoes instead of diced tomatoes with green chilies.

Mix sugar and water in a blender container. Add tequila and blend until smooth. Add fresh lime juice and blend again. Add tequila and blend until smooth. Add fresh lime juice and blend again. Add orange and amaretto liqueurs and blend until smooth. Chill thoroughly. Place 1 to 2 teaspoons of mixture in each of 2 or more glasses. Fill each glass half full with crushed or cubed ice. Add a few drops of lime juice and stir.
Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in sour cream and vanilla extract. Fold in whipped topping and fruit. Cover and chill. Serve with crackers or fruit.

Preheat oven to 400. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and pour marmalade over top. Seal bag and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove from fridge and place on wire rack on a baking sheet. Place one slice of bacon over each piece of chicken and wrap tightly around meat. In a small bowl combine soy, sesame oil and ginger and pour over top of each piece of chicken. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until juices run clear and internal temperature is 165.
Chicken nuggets made with shredded wheat recipe. Learn how to cook great Chicken nuggets made with shredded wheat . Crecipe.com deliver fine selection of quality Chicken nuggets made with shredded wheat recipes equipped with ratings, reviews and mixing tips. Get one of our Chicken nuggets made with shredded wheat recipe and prepare delicious and healthy treat for your family or friends. Good appetite!

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk together the oil, cumin, paprika, turmeric, and salt. Add the breasts and toss to coat. Arrange the breasts in a shallow baking dish. Bake the breasts for 20 minutes. Then turn the breasts over. Bake for 10 minutes more, or until the breasts are cooked through. Remove the breasts from the baking dish, sprinkle with the spring onions, and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease muffin cups. Cream shortening and sugar. Add egg and mix well. Blend in milk. Add dry ingredients alternately with jam and nuts. Bake for 15 minutes or until done. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and brown sugar. Add peanut butter and mix well. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in the flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the nuts and chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Do not overbake. Cookies are done when the edges are lightly browned.

Brown ground beef with diced onion. Drain. Add cream of mushroom soup, corn and carrots. Mix well. Spread mixture evenly into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Spread evenly with the thawed green beans. Sprinkle evenly with the tater tots. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle evenly with the shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until cheese is slightly browned. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in large bowl and mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 325 for 7 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack.

Place graham cracker crumbs in bottom of small glasses or shot glasses. Place small scoops of cheesecake on top of crumbs. Garnish with strawberries and syrup.
I am looking forward to trying them this summer!
Those are some great recipes! I am definitely going to try the strawberry no bake cheescake bars!
Wow! What awesome recipes! I have been looking for some great recipes to make with the kids this summer and this is just what I needed! Thanks so much!

Combine snow with the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla until just blended. Pour into a freezer container or other container and freeze for 2-3 hours. Remove the container from the freezer and allow to thaw 15-20 minutes. Pour into glass serving dishes or molds. Top with decorative candies before returning to freezer until ready to serve.
Name: butterscotch ice creamIngredients: milk, heavy whipping cream, butterscotch chips, brown sugar, butterscotch pudding mix, vanilla extractDirections: In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, heat 1 cup of the milk with the butterscotch chips and brown sugar until melted. Stir in the remaining milk and heat until steaming hot. Stir in the vanilla extract. Combine the butterscotch pudding mix with the hot milk mixture until smooth. Cool the mixture to room temperature. Whisk the heavy whipping cream until soft peaks form, add the remaining butterscotch pudding mix until combined. Pour the butterscot

In a casserole dish, place the yellow rice mix in the bottom. Pour boiling water over it and stir until well mixed. Add the cooked chicken breasts and sprinkle with the cheez whiz. Add the broccoli. Mix well and sprinkle with the black pepper. Bake for about an hour at 400 degrees. Top with the sour cream when it comes out of the oven. Serve with crackers or biscuits.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. In a bowl combine the ground beef and onion soup mix. Add water and stir until well blended. Cook and stir for 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in yogurt. Divide the meat mixture evenly among the pita bread rounds. Sprinkle with mint and tomatoes. Cut each pita round in half and serve with the remaining tomato slices and mint for garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 F.Mix together the lemon juice, olive oil, worcestershire sauce, salt, lemon zest, dried rosemary, dry mustard and pepper in a small bowl. Place the meat in a baking dish. Pour over the marinade. Turn the meat to coat all sides. Cover the meat and chill for 6 to 24 hours. Remove the meat from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Remove the meat from the marinade. Place the meat in a shallow baking pan. Discard the marinade. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes for medium doneness. Let the meat stand for 10 minutes before slicing.
Pour the orange juice and ice cubes into a large glass and stir. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add amaretto and southern comfort. Add a splash of grenadine and serve.

Heat the olive oil in a large pan and fry the leeks and garlic for 2-3 minutes. Add the dry white wine and simmer until reduced by half. Add the clams and white pepper and oregano. Cook until the clams open. Serve with the linguine.
pasta and vegetables
pasta and vegetables.
name: pasta and vegetablesingredients: pasta, olive oil, onion, zucchini, carrot, red bell pepper, garlic cloves, tomato paste, tomato puree, dried oregano, dried basil, dried rosemary, dried thyme, dried marjoram, dried sage, dried parsley, dried bay leavespreparation:To prepare the pasta, boil the water in a pot and add a little salt. Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain the pasta. To prepare the vegetables, heat the olive oil over a medium heat and saute the onion and carrot until soft. Add the zucchini and bell pepper and continue to saute until the veget

Put the milk, cocoa powder, sugar and extra dark chocolate pieces into a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook for 2 minutes or until bubbles form. Add rum and stir well. Serve immediately. Top with a sprinkle of chocolate and a few crushed peppercorns.

Heat oil in a skillet. Fry onions until they turn translucent. Add green chilies and garlic cloves and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add ginger, turmeric and salt. Fry for 1 more minute. Add the cabbage and stir-fry until the vegetable becomes soft. Add coconut at the end. Fry for a minute more before removing from heat.
Combine all ingredients and chop with a food processor until finely chopped. Serve with warm pita bread.

Place cranberries in a large saucepan. Stir in brown sugar, orange juice, ginger, and cinnamon. Add enough water to just cover berries. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low. Simmer until berries begin to pop. Remove from heat. Stir in orange peel and crystallized ginger. Serve warm. Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Rub fillets on both sides with salt and pepper and sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium heat until it is hot enough to fry an egg. Add garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato halves and cook for 1 minute more. Add white wine vinegar, cover and let simmer for 2-3 minutes until tomatoes are soft but not mushy. Remove from heat and add basil, stirring to incorporate. Place a filet on a piece of foil and top with a scoopful of tomato mixture. Drizzle with a little more oil if desired. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Wrap foil around filet to seal in the juices. Repeat with remaining filets. Grill for 4-5 minutes or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Serve immediately with leftover tomato mixture spooned over top.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, corn syrup and 1/2 cup of water. Stir constantly until the mixture boils. Remove from the heat and stir in the cream and butter. Stir constantly until the mixture reaches 245 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla and salt. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x12 inch pan and spread evenly with a spoon. Sprinkle the nuts over the top and allow to set at room temperature until firm enough to cut. Drizzle with the dipping chocolate. Cool.

In a large saucepan cook elbows in boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes. Drain. In a large saucepan melt margarine over low heat. Stir in flour. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Cook and stir in shredded cheddar and monterey jack cheeses. Add pasta. Cook over low heat for an additional 5 minutes. Serve.

Slice veal thinly and cut into strips. Heat oil in frying pan. Add onions and saute until brown. Add veal, mushrooms and salt and pepper. Brown meat and mushrooms. Remove mixture from pan and set aside. Add flour to pan and stir until it is browned. Add whipping cream and stir until smooth. Add white wine and lemon juice. Cook until sauce is smooth and thickened. Add veal and mushrooms. Cook until hot. Serve over hot buttered noodles.

Mix lemon juice with corn syrup, lime juice, sugar, and water. Boil, stirring until thick and syrupy. Cool completely. Put apricot preserves in a small potboil over low heat for 1 minute. Stir in liquid honey, butter, lemon juice mixture, and lemon zestboil 1 minute. Cool completely. Store in fridge up to 2 months. Sauce may be used as glaze for pork chops, chicken, or fish, or as an accompaniment to ice cream or cake.For Daiquiri Sauce:Mix sugar, corn syrup, water, lemon juice, lime juice, and lemon zest in a small pot over low heatcook, stirring constantly, to boil, 3 to 5 minutes or until thick and syrupy. Cool completely. Store in fridge up to 1 month. Sauce may be used as a topping for cake or ice cream or as a glaze for ham or chicken.For Pineapple Ginger Sauce:Mix pineapple juice with

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add carrot, onion, and cauliflower. Sauté until tender. Add water. Simmer until tender. Stir in pasta. Cook until pasta is tender. Add basil. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with romano cheese.

In a skillet over medium-high heat add the carrots with enough water to cover the bottom of the pan. Bring the water to a boil and cook for about five minutes or until the carrots are tender crisp. Drain the carrots and add them back into the skillet with the butter and maple syrup and stir until the butter has melted and the carrots are glazed. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the dressing and stir until the mixture is well blended. Sprinkle the pecans on top and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Cream butter with peanut butter and sugars until fluffy. Add eggs, beating until combined. Stir in vanilla. Combine oats and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in morsels. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and vanilla and beat until blended. Add salt and baking soda and mix well. Add xanthan gum and instant pudding and beat until blended. Add the flour and mix until blended. Stir in pecans and chill for about an hour or until dough is easy to handle. Roll into small balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 12 minutes or until set. Cool for about 1 minute on the cookie sheet and then remove from the cookie sheet and place on a cooling rack or wire rack.

Beat margarine with brown sugar until light & fluffy. Beat in the egg & flavoringbeat well. Sift together the flour & soda & saltmix well into the creamed mixture. Fold in the chocolate chips & almonds. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on a greased cookie sheetbake 350 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet while warm to prevent over browning. Let cool on wire racks.
Boil water. Add mint. Steep for 3 minutes. Stir in tea bags, sugar, lemon and orange juices. Let cool. Stir in vodka. Serve over ice in tall glasses garnished with a lemon and orange slice.

Peel the mushrooms and cut into slices. Peel and wash green onions and cut into slices. Cut carrot into thin strips. Roughly cut chicken into 4 pieces. Soak egg white in hot water. Pour hot water into a pot and add all ingredients except for green onions. Bring it to boil over high heat. Lower heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add green onions 10 minutes before it is done. Mix soya sauce with water and add it in right before it is ready. Add pepper according to your taste.

Cook the beans until just tender. Drain the beans and set aside. Heat the oil over medium heat and add the onions. Saut for about 15 minutes. Add the tomato and cook for a few minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir the beans into the mixture. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
Recipes for Green Bean Recipes - How To Make Green Bean Recipes
Green Bean Recipes - How To Make Green Bean Recipes
Greek Style Green Beans
Name: Greek Style Green Beans
Ingredients: Diced Tomatoes, Water, Onions, Fresh Parsley, Garlic, Of Fresh Mint, Oregano Leaves, Salt, Black Pepper, Green Beans
Preparation:Wash, Place In Pan With Water To Cover Beans. Simmer Uncovered Until Beans Are Just Tender, Stirring A Few Times. Meanwhile, Combine Undrained Tomatoes With Water, Onions, Parsley, Garlic, Mint, Oregano, Salt And Pepper In A Saucepan. Cover

Cream together cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until creamy. Add egg and sour cream and beat well. Sift together flour, soda and salt. Add gradually into creamed mixture and stir until blended. Fold in pecans and pineapple. Spoon into greased 12 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until the onions have started to soften a bit, about 2-3 minutes. Add the kale and stir-fry for another minute or two. Add the zucchini and tofu. Stir-fry until the zucchini is soft. Add the chickpeas and the lemon juice. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes or so, until everything is hot. Sprinkle the dish with sea salt to taste. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a bowl beat ricotta with a mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon cinnamon and 1 teaspoon vanillabeat for another minute. Add powdered sugar until well blendedbeat for 2 minutes. Spray one side of a tortilla with cooking spray. Spread about 1/4 cup dip on tortillasprinkle with 1/4 cup chocolate chips. Roll upsecure with wooden pick or toothpick. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Store refrigerated for up to 3 days. Cut into 1-inch slices to serve.

Boil the rice in the water for 30 minutes. Drain and cool. In a large bowl combine the mayonnaise, sour cream and cashews. Chop the celery and chicken. Add the celery and chicken and mix well. Add the rice and mix well. Serve over a bed of lettuce with alfalfa sprouts.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, onion, dried cranberries, oranges, almonds, blue cheese and poppy seed dressing. Serve immediately.

Cut off the top of each tomato and scoop out the pulp. Rub the insides of the shells with butter. Rub the pulp with garlic and orange zest. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the shells in a single layer in a shallow baking pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, until the shells are soft. Cool slightly and scoop out the pulp. Serve at once.
Place waffle on a plate. Spoon apple pie filling on top of the waffle, then add scoop of ice cream. Sprinkle with pecans and cinnamon if desired.

To make dumplings, sift flour into bowl and make well in centre. Add coriander leaves and stir gently. Add egg yolk and water. Mix gently to form dough. Bring water to boil. In batches, drop dumplings into water and cook for 2-3 minutes or until dumplings float. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towel. To make sauce, heat oil in wok or frying pan. Add chicken and stir-fry for 1 minute or until chicken is lightly browned. Add oyster and fish sauces and stir-fry 1 minute. Add garlic and chilli and stir-fry 1 minute. Add coconut milk and sugar and bring to simmer. Add dumplings and simmer until heated through. Serve with rice.
Scoop out the pulp of the avocado and mash. Add cheese and mix well. Add chopped herbs and mix well. Add pistachio nuts and mix well. Add crushed pepper flakes to taste. Refrigerate and serve cold.

Pour the jello over the cottage cheese in a 9x13 inch pan. Refrigerate until set. When the mixture is set, add in the cooled whipped topping, followed by the crushed pineapple. Refrigerate again for 2 hours or until ready to serve.

Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan and cook tofu for 2 minutes on each side. Add pineapple chunks and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add sherry and cook for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and cornflour mixed in a little water. Simmer for 1 minute and add green onion and bean sprouts. Cook for a further minute. Serve on rice.

Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl. Stir in the milk and the sugar. Add the vanilla and mix thoroughly. Dip both sides of the slices of bread into the mixture. Fry in an oiled skillet over medium heat until the egg mixture is cooked and the bread is golden brown on both sides. Sprinkle with the cinnamon and serve hot. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-cup bundt pan. Cream together the butter and cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add the sugar and beat well. Add the eggs one at a time and beat until well blended after each addition. Add the milk and the hot water and beat well. Sift together the dry ingredients and mix into the wet. Add the instant coffee and the hot water. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for approximately one hour or until the cake tests done with a wooden skewer. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before turning out onto a wire rack. Drizzle with the glaze.

Place the salt, water and thyme in a large pan. Heat gently for a minute or two until the salt has dissolved. Place the turkey in a roasting tin. Pour the stock over and add the sage. Drizzle with the olive oil. Cover tightly with foil and place in the pre-heated oven for 1 hour. Remove the foil and sprinkle the butter evenly over the bird. Place the pan back in the pre-heated oven. Cook for a further hour. Remove from the oven and leave the bird for about ten minutes before carving.

Mix the kool-aid drink mix with the orange juice. Beat the cream cheese with a mixer until light and fluffy. Fold in the powdered sugar until blended. Add the whipping cream and blend in completely. Pour into the graham cracker crust. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until ready to serve. Sprinkle with toasted coconut if desired.

Bring water to a boil. Add carrots and celery. Lower heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add onion and simmer an additional 5 minutes. Add corn and simmer 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in maple syrup. Serve immediately.

Mix flour, egg, cold water, salt and pepper. Beat well. Cut in butter to resemble course meal. Press into tart pan. Bake 15 minutes at 400 degrees. Fry bacon and drain. Add to tart. Mix zucchini and basil. Lay zucchini mixture in tart shell. Bake 15 minutes at 350 degrees.

Rinse 15-bean mix. In pressure cooker, add water, dried onion flakes, garlic powder, fresh ground black pepper. Add ham bone, diced tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes at high pressure. Remove lid. Add ham and cook 2 more minutes. Add 15-bean mix. Stir well. Serve.
I am a big fan of your blog. I will bookmark your blog and visit regularly.
This is a great list. Thank you for sharing it.
You've done a great job. Thanks a lot.

In resealable plastic bag, combine oil, pepper, and garlic powderadd chicken. Seal bagturn to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to overnight. Remove chicken from baggrill, covered, over medium heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Serve with salsa and cheese.

Slice potatoes into even rounds. Heat up a little olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add potato rounds. Cook for about 10 minutes until golden. Remove potato rounds from frying pan. Stir together mayonnaise, garlic clove, and hot paprika. Mix in parsley. Serve potato rounds warm with mayonnaise mixture.
Today i made a healthy snack for my son. He loves it!
You will need a mandolin for slicing these.
Peel and wash sweet potatoes.
Place a few drops of olive oil in a non-stick frying pan.
Place the sliced potato in a single layer.
Season lightly with sea salt and cracked black pepper.
Brown lightly, do not overcook.
Take off heat and place in a bowl.
Drizzle a little more olive oil and mix lightly.
Season lightly with sea salt and cracked black pepper and mix lightly.
Place in a serving dish or tray.
These are

Cook mushrooms in water till done. Add olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper, seasoning to taste. Cut zucchini in half lengthwise and summer squash in half crosswise. Scoop out seeds and stringy parts from zucchini and summer squash. Cut mushrooms into thin strips, julienne zucchini and summer squash. Stir fry the mushroom mixture with the julienne vegetables. Serve as a side dish or vegetable main dish. Serves 4-6 people.

beat one egg in a small bowl, add 2 Tablespoons of water add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrowave for 1 minute, beat with fork or small whisk until mixed add 2 tablespoons of egg whites, beat together salt and pepper to tastemicrow

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Drain on paper towels. Meanwhile cook the onion and mushrooms in the bacon fat over medium-low heat until soft. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the milk and sun-dried tomatoes. Cook until thickened. Stir in the light sour cream. Season with the pepper and the bacon. Cook the pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain well. Toss the pasta with the sauce and top with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Mix sugar, flour, margarine and pecans. Press into ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 450f for 5-8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Spread with cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with cream. Bake at 350f for 5-8 more minutes or until bubbly and golden.
I've been having fun with these lately. They are soooo easy to make.
First, I used my hand mixer to make the dough.
The dough is really soft after mixing it together so you will need to work with it and knead it together to make it workable. I've seen recipes that suggest adding more flour to the dough to make it more workable but I didn't need that so I didn't bother.
I used a cookie scoop to make the dough balls and then put them on the cookie sheet. I didn't bother to refrigerate them because it wasn't warm enough to leave them out to harden.
I put them in the oven at 3

Heat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking pan. Cook and drain onions in a skillet over medium-low heat until softened. Stir in meat, cracker crumbs, garlic powder, kosher salt and pepper. Mix well. Divide into 4 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball. Spray each ball all over with cooking spray. Place balls in pan. Bake for about 30 minutes, until done. Makes 8 servings.

cut baguette in half. brush cut side of baguette with olive oil. broil until toasted. slice grape tomatoes in half. combine in bowl with chopped garlic and italian seasoning. add olive oil. spread over toasted baguette. sprinkle with cheese. broil until cheese is melted. garnish with parsley.

Place potatoes and peas in a pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and boil until tender. Drain potatoes and peas and let cool. In a small skillet heat olive oil. Add the egg, potatoes and peas and stir until well combined. Salt to taste. Fold the omelet into quarters and serve.

Peel and slice the onion. Add oil to frying pan and saute until onion is translucent. Add rice, chicken bouillon cube and 2 cups of water (or more if needed). Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover. Simmer for about 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch cubes and add to rice and onion mixture (you can add more water if you need to). Cover and cook for another 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Serve with lemon and parsley.

In a large pot add all vegetables except potatoes. Add chicken broth. Cook for 10 minutes. Add potatoes. Cook for 10 minutes more. Add kielbasa. Cook for 10 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, italian seasoning. Cook for 10 minutes more. Serve hot.

Place washed and dried potatoes in microwave safe dish and add enough water to cover the bottom of the dish. Cook at high for about 5 minutes. Turn potatoes over and cook for about another 5 minutes. When potatoes are done cut in half lengthwise and scoop out the center. Put the potato halves in an oven safe dish and add butter and milk. Melt the butter and mix the potatoes and milk together. Add cheese and bacon and stir well. Bake at 400 for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are heated through. Serve warm.

Cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the condensed milk and beat until combined. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add the sifted flour and the baking soda and mix well. Add the chocolate chips and mix well. Refrigerate for at least an hour. Make balls with a small scoop of dough and place on a greased baking tray about 5cm apart. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes at 160 degrees celcius until slightly golden. Remove from tray immediately and allow to cool on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container.
Toast the baguettes. Spread mayonnaise on the bottom half of each. Spread with Dijon mustard. Top with the ham. Slice the avocados and arrange on the sandwiches. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine cornstarch and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir constantly so that it does not burn. Add remaining 3 3/4 cup water. Add remaining ingredients and cook over low heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Chill. Makes 1 1/2 cups.
Combine pecans, arugula, cheese and 1/2 of dressing in a large bowl. Mix well. Arrange on a plate or in a bowl. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Top with sliced peach. Serve.

Boil 1 large can of chicken stock or bouillon. Add 8-10 cubes of cube hamburger stock (White Castle has their own brand of turkey burgers). Cube up 12-16 hamburgers. Brown in a skillet in a small amount of oil. When brown add to the stock/broth mixture. Add 1 small chopped onion and 1 stalk of finely chopped celery (or one large if you like a lot of celery). Simmer until heated through. Serve over rice or hot biscuits.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the cauliflower florets. Add the flour to the mixture and cook for 2 minutes. Add the stock, and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium low. Simmer until the cauliflower is tender. Stir in the milk, the garlic powder and the garlic salt. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Stir in the cream cheese until melted. Serve in bowls with grated cheese sprinkled over the top.

In a wok or large pot, heat up the oil and saute the mushrooms for a few minutes. Add the bok choy (or any kind of choy you have) and saute for another few minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add in the seasonings and simmer for about 10 to 15 minutes. Check for taste and adjust accordingly. You can add more mushrooms if you want a more mushroom flavor.
Toast your favorite type of bread. I like sourdough or whole grain. Spread with peanut butter and sprinkle with pumpkin and some honey and pumpkin pie spice. Delicious!

Prepare espresso and steamed milk in a separate cup. In another cup mix together caramel sauce and brown sugar cinnamon syrup. Drizzle espresso over the caramel mixture and top with whipped cream and a sprinkling of cinnamon.

Cook the ground turkey and vegetables in a large skillet over medium heat until the turkey is no longer pink. Drain the excess fat. Add tomato sauce and seasonings. Cover and simmer on low heat for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, wash the peppers. Remove the seeds and ribs. Add the couscous to the boiling water and let stand for 5 minutes. Add the couscous to the meat mixture. Stir. Stuff the peppers and place in a baking dish. Cover with tomato sauce. Bake uncovered at 350 for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Sprinkle chops with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, onion, lemon juice and ketchup. Brush both sides of the chops generously with the mixture. Place in a shallow baking pan. Bake uncovered at 400 for 20-25 minutes or until chops are no longer pink. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
I am going to try this recipe for my family. Thank you!
I made the lemon marmalade pork chops recipe tonight. My husband and I both enjoyed it. I think it will be a keeper.
I made these tonight for my family and they were delicious! I added a little more marmalade but it was just right.
I made the Lemon Marmalade recipe for my family tonight and it was wonderful. I will definitely make this again. Thanks for the recipes.
I made the lemon marmalade recipe tonight. It was very delicious! Thank you for the recipe.
I made the Lemon Marmalade

Mix marmalade and mustard in a small bowl. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Sprinkle fish with salt, black pepper and ginger. Add to skillet and cook 3 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve topped with marmalade mixture.

Cut up the marshmallows into tiny pieces and put them into a saucepan with 150ml of the thickened cream. Melt on a low heat and cook until thick and smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining thickened cream and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Pour into ice cream maker and freeze for 15-20 minutes. Stir together and refreeze for another 20 minutes. Remove from ice cream maker and stir through ice cream and swirl it through with a knife or spoon. Serve with caramel sauce and extra marshmallows to garnish if you like.

Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat and add in Rice Krispies and stir until well coated. Add in the marshmallows and stir until melted. Add in the dried cranberries and stir to mix well. Pour mixture into an ungreased 8x8-inch baking dish and let cool. Melt chocolate chips and almond butter in microwave until smooth and drizzle over top of Rice Krispies. Let cool completely before cutting into squares.
Most of the recipes are pretty straight forward and I have used the raspberry squares recipe many times.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add scallions, garlic and cook until onions are softened, about 5 minutes. Add flour and stir until well coated with butter. Cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Add broth and cook 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add cream and stir until well blended. Remove from heat and stir in tarragon. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine the first five ingredients. Increase heat to medium and cook until mixture is smooth and thickened. Serve immediately, topped with whipped cream and ground cinnamon.
Combine the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Add mayonnaise, tossing well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. Drain before serving. Garnish with lettuce. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare the tofu by draining the water from it. Then pat the tofu dry with kitchen paper. Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the tofu and turn it around in the oil for 3-4 minutes until crispy. Add the chili paste, water and rice wine vinegar and stir it. Add the salt and sugar and simmer for 3-4 minutes until the sauce reduces. Taste for seasoning. Serve the fried tofu with the chili sauce on top.

1. Trim bottoms of brussels sprouts and cut in half lengthwise. Toss in a large bowl with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Spread in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet and roast in preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until edges are browned and tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. 2. Transfer cooled sprouts into a food processor with the parmesan cheese and pulse until desired consistency. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
i love brussel sprouts and these look wonderful. i like the addition of the nutmeg.
I am not a fan of brussel sprouts but these look good!
I love brussel sprouts but I have not been able to find any that look like these in the store.
I love love love these! I need some more recipes for these yummy veggies!
I love the combination of Brussels sprouts and pine nuts!
I love Brussel sprouts and
Pour cinnamon into the cocoa and mix well. Measure in the remaining ingredients. Pour into a jar with lid and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, beat together butter, eggs, salt, baking powder, and matcha green tea powder until smooth. In a smaller bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of the flour and 1 tablespoon of the matcha green tea powderwhisk into the batter until incorporated. Stir in remaining 2 1/2 cups of flour until just combined. Scrape into prepared pansmooth top with spatula. Bake in preheated oven until toothpick inserted 1-inch from edge of pan comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool 15 minutes in pan on wire rackturn out onto rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
Sugar, margarine, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, evaporated milk
Beat sugar, butter, vanilla and eggs in large bowl, low speed for 3

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or foil and coat with cooking spray. In a small mixing bowl, combine the almonds, olive oil, sea salt and paprika. Stir gently to coat evenly and spread on prepared baking sheet in an even layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, or until lightly toasted and the nuts are dry and golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container up to 2 weeks at room temperature.

Wash and wipe dry the mushrooms and cut a slit lengthwise in each cap. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat and cook the breadcrumbs until golden brown and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, add the artichokes and tomatoes to the saute pan and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the olives and feta cheese and cook for 1 minute longer. Tuck a small handful of breadcrumbs into each mushroom cap and top with the artichoke mixture. Sprinkle with thyme and a little ground black pepper and serve immediately.

Slice steak into thin diagonal slices. In small bowl stir together olive oil, soy sauce, honey, and vinegar. Put steaks in large resealable plastic bag or glass dish and pour in marinade. Marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours, turning once. Grill steaks until desired doneness.

Preheat oven to 350. Heat the butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add marjoram. Brown meat on both sides. Add fresh mushrooms. Cover pan tightly and place in oven for about 40 minutes. In a small saucepan heat 1/3 cup port. Add sour cream. Heat through but do not boil. Serve over meat. Salt and pepper to taste.

Wash greens and cut into 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet and brown chicken in it. Add the greens and 3 cups water. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add apple cider vinegar. Cook until greens are tender. Serve in bowls. Serves 4.
In a blender, puree one orange half and one lemon half with the sugar. Add 3/4 cup of water and blend. Pour into tall glasses and serve with orange and lemon slices.

In large skillet saute green pepper and ham in butter until tenderstir in tomatoes and tomato juicebring to a boiladd ricestir until mixture is smooth and heated throughstir in peascover and let stand for 3 minutesstir before serving.

Place butter and flour into a microwave-safe bowl and mix well with a fork until blended. Microwave for 1 minute or until mixture resembles bread crumbs, stirring after 30 seconds. Gradually stir in milk until mixture is smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Add cheddar cheese and mix until melted. Layer potatoes and cheese mixture in a lightly greased 3-quart slow cooker. Cover and cook on low setting for 6 to 7 hours or until heated through and top is golden brown. Stir before serving.

Cut each tomato in half lengthwise and place the cut sides down in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and the salt and cook until the tomato skins begin to brown and the flesh begins to soften, about 5 minutes. Turn the tomatoes over and continue cooking until the other sides have browned and the flesh is soft and collapsing, about 5 more minutes. Add the fresh thyme and cook for an additional minute. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the tomatoes cool for about 10 minutes. Serve as an appetizer or as a side dish with fish or chicken.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add garlic powder and saute for 30 seconds stirring constantly. Add green bell peppers and saute for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut dough into 1 inch strips and then cut strips into 1 inch squares. Place squares on greased cookie sheet and bake at 400 for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with garlic-pepper mixture and mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake for an additional 5-6 minutes or until cheeses are melted. Serve warm.

Cook the noodles in salted boiling water until tender but still firm to the bite (al dente). Drain and add the butter to the pan of hot cooking liquid. Stir to melt the butter. Add the cream, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth. Add garlic salt and the dill weed to taste. Pour over the cooked pasta. Sprinkle with soft breadcrumbs if desired. Serve immediately.

Mix together the cheeses and bacon, add flour and seasonings to taste. Mix in beaten eggs and milk. Pour into pastry-lined pie pan. Bake at 425f until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve hot with horseradish sauce.
