I am going to try the blueberry p

Prepare cake according to package directions. Cool on wire rack. Combine cream cheese and zest and blend well. Spread on cooled cake. Spread with cool whip. Sprinkle with pastry filling. Drizzle with Chambord and sprinkle with more pastry filling. Roll up and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare brownie mix according to package directions but use only one half the oil amount. Add Heath candy bars and stir well. Spread into a 9x13 inch pan and bake for 35-40 minutes or until set. Cool for 10 minutes. Mix together sweetened condensed milk and powdered sugar and drizzle over brownie mixture. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Form into 1 inch balls and roll in powdered sugar or coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Cream together the butter, sugar and sour cream until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and the vanilla and beat until blended. Add the flour, salt and the baking powder and the baking soda and mix until blended. Beat until smooth and creamy. Add the lemon juice and mix until blended. Chill for at least 1 hour and up to overnight. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface and cut with cookie cutters of your choice. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Cool on wire racks before frosting or decorating.
Baked goods are best when they're made from scratch. The best recipes are made by the people that you love the most.
There are some very good baked goods recipes out there on the internet and there are also some very bad ones as well.
If you are looking for an easy baked goods recipe to make then this is the place for you. This recipe is for the perfect chocolate chip cookie. This recipe is sure to please anyone that likes

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add shank and brown on all sides. Add honey and soy sauce. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until shank is very tender. Remove shank from pot and set aside. Heat broth to a boil and add rice. Cook for 15 minutes. Add gai lan and simmer for 3 minutes. Cut shank into bite-sized pieces and serve over rice with gai lan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Whisk together Dijon mustard, dill, herbes de Provence and olive oil until combined. Rub on both sides of the filets and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Roast for 8 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve warm with lemon wedges.

Heat milk and water to scalding. Add flour and stir for 1 minute. Add butter and wine. Cook until thickened. Beat 1 egg white with 1 teaspoon lemon juice and add to sauce. Add rest of the eggs and beat. Season with salt and pepper. Butter toast and spread with cheddar cheese. Place canadian bacon on toast. Pour sauce over and serve immediately.

First you will want to soak your pecans in water overnight. This will soften the nut and make it easier for them to stick together. You can also use this method if you are going to dip your pecans in chocolate. The next day you can drain your pecans and lay them out on a plate. I like to use a paper plate for this. You will want to take each pecan and place it on its side with the point of the pecan facing the edge of the plate. Now take a small piece of cheese and place it right on the point of the pecan. You can also cut the cheese in half and place it on both sides. I also like to add a small amount of cinnamon and nutmeg to the cheese. Next take an apple slice and place it on the cheese. Now you are going to take the pecan and press down on the cheese and apple to secure them together. Then you can lay them out on the dehydrator tray. You will want to dehydrate them at 125 for about 12 hours. When they are done they will be a little soft so you will want to let them sit

Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Place in saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcook until tender. Drainset aside. In a small bowl combine butter with the fresh herbs. Mash potatoes with the butter mixture until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 6 servings.

Mix dry ingredients. Add shortening and mix till crumbly. Add egg and milk and mix till just blended. Add blueberries and lemon rind. Form into ball, flatten out, cut into ten-twelve pie shape slices, bake at 425 for 15 or so minutes.
Nice photos! I love blueberries too!

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add sherry and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and 1 cup of the brothcook until mixture is well blended, stirring frequently. Stir in noodlescook until heated through. Stir in remaining broth and the mushroomscook until heated through, stirring frequently. Remove skillet from heat. Stir in remaining 1 cup broth, 1/3 cup sherry, and the mushroomscook until heated through, stirring frequently. Transfer mixture to a lightly greased 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle the top of the casserole with the remaining 1 cup sherry and the pimiento. Sprinkle evenly with the mushrooms and the almonds. Sprinkle the top of the casserole evenly with the cheese and the chicken. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the top of the casserole with the parsleybake an additional 1

Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl combine the corn oil, sugar, and eggs. Add to the dry ingredients. Add the carrots. Fold in the walnuts. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 35-40 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. For the icing, combine the icing sugar and milk until smooth. Frost the cooled cakes. Cut in wedges to serve.

Beat egg whites with 1/2 cup sugar until peaks form. Add cream of tartar, saltine, flaked coconut and nutsmix well. Spread evenly in a 9x13 pan. Set aside. In a saucepan, combine the remaining sugar and water. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin until dissolved. Add whipping creamstir until smooth. Spoon over white layer. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Beat together the egg whites and the sugars until stiff peaks form. Beat in the vanilla and flour until well blended and smooth. Fold in the apples. Turn into a greased 8 inch square baking dish. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until set and golden brown. Cut into squares to serve.

In a pressure cooker cooking pan, pour in enough vegetable oil to cover bottom of pan. Brown meat in pan over med heat for about 10 minutes. Pour off excess fat. Add onion to meat. Mix together italian dressing mix and ranch dressing mix. Sprinkle over meat. Add brown gravy mix. Pour in 3 1/2 cups of broth. Place lid on pressure cooker. Set cooker to high pressure for 30 minutes. Release pressure by turning off heat. Remove lid. Serve.
1. Preheat oven to 300°. Place potatoes in a large bowl.
2. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add carrots and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Add broth, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, rosemary, bay leaf, parsley and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered, until carrots are tender, 20-25 minutes. Stir in potatoes.
3.

Wash and trim the brussels sprouts and cut them into halves. In a skillet, brown the bacon. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and pour off most of the fat from the skillet. In the drippings, cook the onion until soft. Add the brussels sprouts and cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the sour cream and season with freshly ground pepper. Serve hot over the bacon and onion mixture. Garnish with the parsley.

Soak lentils overnight. Drain and rinse the lentils. Add water to cover the lentils by 4 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils are very soft and the broth has thickened a bit. Add the ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper and cumin seed. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the oil and the onion flakes. Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro if desired.

Line a 3-quart glass bowl with plastic wrap. Cut the angel food cake into 1-inch cubes and put half of them into the bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining 1-1/2 cups of cool whip, the strawberries and the lemon juice and spread evenly over the cubes of cake. Sprinkle with 1-1/2 cups of chocolate chips. Top with the remaining angel food cubes and cool whip mixture. Cover the trifle with the remaining plastic wrap and freeze overnight. When ready to serve, remove the trifle from the freezer 1-1/2 hours before serving. Unwrap the trifle and garnish with remaining chocolate chips, if desired.

Mix the flour and seasoning together in a mixing bowl. Cut the butter into the flour with a pastry blender or fork. Add the ice water slowly until the dough forms a ball. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to about 1/4 of an inch thick. With a biscuit cutter or glass (about 3 inches), cut the dough into circles and place on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 20 minutes or until light brown.

In a large bowl mix the skim milk and cocoa powder until smooth. Add in the sugar and mix until smooth. Add the canola oil and stir well. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Fold in the oatmeal. Drop onto a greased or parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

In a 2-quart casserole, saute onion and green pepper in 2 tablespoons butter or margarine until tender. Stir in beef. Cook, stirring until evenly brown. Stir in beans and barbecue sauce. Remove from heat. Stir in salt. Spread half the muffin mix evenly over meat mixture. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Spoon remaining muffin mix over cheese. Spread remaining cheese over all. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown.

Grease 1-1/2-quart casserole dishset aside. In saucepan over medium heat, combine pumpkin pie filling and applesauceheat through. Stir in honey and lemon rindcontinue heating until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 3 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Transfer to prepared casserolespread mixture evenly. Bake 30 minutes or until mixture is thick and bubbly. Remove from ovenstir in pumpkin pie spice. Cool completely (about 1 hour). Spoon into serving bowlscover and chill 2 hours or until ready to serve. Yield: 12 servings. Serving Suggestion: Serve warm over toasted bread or as an appetizer with crackers or bagel chips.

Place frozen cauliflower into slow cooker. Top with onion, celery ribs and stock. Stir in the Worcestershire Sauce. Cook on low for 7 to 8 hours. Stir in the heavy cream. In a separate bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup and the sour cream. Add the soup mixture to the cooker. Stir in the cheese and season with pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes. Serve with crackers or toasted sour dough bread.
If you like this recipe, you might like these others recipes from the same category.
name: cream of crab soupingredients: crab meat, onion, celery, milk, flour, butter, white wine or sherry, bay leaf, chivespreparation:In a saucepan combine the crab meat, onion, celery, milk and flour. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Add the butter, wine or sherry and bay leaf. Cook until the liquid is reduced. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chives.

In a bowl mix together 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cornmeal, 2 tablespoons oil, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon fast-rise yeast, 2 egg yolks and 1 cup milk. Stir until smooth. In a separate bowl, beat 2 egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into all-purpose flour mixture until just mixed. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 2 minutes, or until smooth and elastic. Place dough into an oiled bowl, turn to coat dough with oil, cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 450f. Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 12-inch circle on a lightly floured surface. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes 2 (9-inch) crusts.

Lemon-pepper chicken: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon saltadd the chicken breasts and toss to coat. Arrange in a single layer in the prepared baking dish. Bake for about 30 minutes or until a thermometer inserted 1-inch from the center reads 165 degrees F. Metaxa-cream sauce: While the chicken bakes prepare the Metaxa-cream sauce. Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heatstir in the Metaxa and cook for 5 minutes. Add the heavy cream, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and the basilcook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in 1 teaspoon parsley. Serve the chicken with the Metaxa-cream sauce spooned over.

Finely chop the garlic and add it to the tomatoes and cook gently for 5 minutes. Add the sugar, olive oil and salt and pepper and cook for a further 5 minutes. Add the rindless bacon and cook for another minute or two. Serve on cooked pasta and top with grated mascarpone cheese.

Cook ground beef with onions until browned. Stir in kidney beans, rice, and salsa. Bring to boiling. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Let stand 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Combine water and sugar in heavy saucepan over medium heatstir until dissolved. Add lime juice and bring mixture to a boilcook for 2 minutes. Pour mixture into 9-inch square baking panadd lime slices and freeze until solid, about 4 hours or overnight. Stir mixture once or twice while freezing. Add champagne and raspberriesfreeze until mixture is slushy and partially frozenabout 40 minutes. Transfer mixture to ice cream machineprocess according to manufacturers directionsadd more champagne if mixture is too solid or slushy. Transfer mixture to serving dishes or glassesgarnish with mint.

Fry bacon in skillet until crisp, remove. Dice green pepper, onion and cabbage. Cook bacon fat in skillet until fat is almost gone, add green pepper, onion and cabbage. Cook 4 minutes. Add carrots, cook 3 minutes longer, stir in garlic, cook 1 minute. Stir in roast pork, cook 1 minute longer, add cooked rice, frozen peas and soy sauce. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Break up the noodles and place in colander. Pour boiling water over the noodles and drain well. Mix with the slaw and green onions. Mix the three seasoning packets with the vinegar and olive oil and pour over the slaw mixture. Sprinkle the almonds and sunflower seeds over the top of the mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Lightly beat the eggs with the cream cheese in a bowl. Add the dill and garlic powder and season with salt and pepper. In a large nonstick skillet heat the butter over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook over medium heat until just set. Serve immediately.
Combine the ingredients in a shaker and shake well with ice cubes. Strain the mixture through a fine strainer into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with the raspberries and the rosemary sprigs.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add the dry lentils. Reduce heat and boil for 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain and let cool. Put the lentils into a bowl. Combine the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and a little salt and pepper. Pour over the cooled lentils. Fill a large bowl with grape tomatoes, mangoes, avocados and the lentil mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine the oatmeal and the cheese then add the flour, mustard powder, salt and ground pepper. Stir until well mixed and then add the fat and baking powder and mix well again. To cook heat oil in large skillet on medium heat and then form the mixture in small balls and place in the hot oil and cook till golden brown then drain on paper towels to remove the excess oil. Serve warm and enjoy.

125+ Easy Frito Corn Chip Recipes : Food Network | Recipes | Food Network
Frito Lay Corn Chip Recipes - Yum! Recipes | Food Network - 125+ Easy Frito Corn Chip Recipes : Food Network | Recipes | Food Network
Frito Corn Chip Recipe Collection - Cook

Prepare a vinaigrette by combining the vinegar with the oil, garlic and pepper. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the carrots, sugar, salt, and spices. Add the vinaigrette and mix well. Let stand at room temperature for one hour. Gently mix in the cilantro and serve.

Combine the apples, strawberries and rhubarb in a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the sugar, flour and the spices. For the topping, combine the oatmeal and brown sugar. Cut the butter into the mixture with two forks until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Spread over the fruit. Bake at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the fruit is tender and the topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until well mixed and light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and essence until smooth, then sift in the flour and mix well. Stir in the milk to make the mixture of dropping consistency. Grease and line a deep 20cm round cake tin and pour in the mixture. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes until well risen and golden and a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes then turn out on to a wire rack to cool completely.

Place the tea bags into the pitcher or bowl and pour the boiling water over them. Cover the pitcher or bowl with plastic wrap or waxed paper and let the tea steep for 2 hours or overnight. After the tea is ready, stir the sugar and lemonade concentrate into it. Add the ginger ale or lemon-lime soda and stir again.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook tuna in the butter until lightly browned. Remove tuna from skillet. In a medium bowl combine the flour, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce. Stir into tuna mixture. Add the curry powder. Cook until thickened. Stir in the sour cream. Serve over the asparagus. Garnish with the parsley.
Mix together all dressing ingredients in blender. Add more hot sauce to taste. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant. Add chicken breasts and stir for a few minutes, until they change color slightly. Add water and bring to a boil. Add tomato paste, soy sauce, lemon juice, fresh parsley (optional) and simmer for 30 minutes or until tender. Add more water if you prefer a thinner soup. Serve with shells and a sprinkle of parsley on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In medium mixing bowl, combine cornbread mix, milk, eggs and melted butter. Beat until well mixed. Add ham and cheese. Spoon into greased 12-cup muffin pan. Bake 20 minutes or until set. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 400f. Season the inside of the clay pot with 1 tsp olive oil. Brown the chicken in a skillet. In a large bowl toss the carrots and potatoes. In a small bowl combine the remaining 2 tsp of olive oil, the garlic, parsley and caraway seed. Place the chicken in the bottom of the clay pot. Add the carrots and potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the italian dressing over the top. Sprinkle the garlic parsley mixture over the top. Bake uncovered for 30-35 minutes. Serve hot. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add the butter and stir until melted. Add the pasta and saute for 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through, tossing frequently to prevent sticking. Add the salt and pepper to taste, stir to combine, and remove from the heat. In a small bowl combine the vinegar, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the pasta water. Pour the balsamic vinegar mixture over the pasta in the skillet and toss to coat evenly. Divide the pasta among individual plates. Garnish each serving with a sprinkle of the cheese.
Linguini is the plural of linguine (which is Italian for "little tongues"), a type of pasta. It is a thin ribbon pasta, similar to spaghetti but square in cross-section. In Italian it is called "fettuccelle." It is often used in dishes with seafood or other light flavorings, such as marinara or pesto sauces, as

Rub the lamb with the barbecue sauce and sweet chili sauce. Let it marinate in the fridge for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 350F. Line a roasting pan with foil and place the meat on the pan. Baste the meat with the honey mixture. Roast in the preheated oven for 30-45 minutes. Cook until the temperature in the thickest part reaches 135F. Let the meat rest for 15 minutes. Cut into slices. Serve warm with rice.

Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Add the soba noodles. Cook according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli and carrots. Cook until soft, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. Place the seitan in the skillet. Cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes. Turn off the heat. Cut the seitan into bite-size pieces. Divide the noodles, vegetables and seitan among individual bowls. Drizzle with the teriyaki and tamari. Garnish with green onions and serve.

In a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until softened. Stir in the flour and cook for about two minutes. Add the stock and bring to a simmer. In a small bowl, mix the flour and paprika to make a roux. Add to the stock and simmer until thickened. Stir in the florets and bring the heat back up to medium. Cover the pot and cook for about eight minutes. Stir in the cheese and serve.

Combine lime juice and sugar in a tall glass. Muddle with a muddler until sugar is dissolved. Add in crushed ice. Add in a shot or two of white rum. Top with pomegranate juice and club soda. Garnish with a lime wedge and sprig of mint.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Wash potatoes well and cut into cubes. Wash squash and cut into cubes. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium heat. Brown potato cubes for 5-8 minutes. Add squash cubes and brown for 5 minutes more. Meanwhile combine flour, salt and pepper on plate. Dip each potato cube into flour then into oil, shake off excess oil and place in skillet. Repeat with squash cubes. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until crisp. Serve hot.

Cut up 1 large or 2 medium onions. Saute in bacon drippings till golden brown. Add 1 pound of diced potatoes and a quart of water. Bring to a boil. Add a small amount of sugar, pepper to taste, 1 teaspoon of salt, and a small can of milk. When potatoes are tender add 1 pint of whole clams. Add 1 1/2 cups of milk, bring to a boil for 3 minutes and serve hot.
Mix catsup, sugar, olive oil, vinegar, garlic, onion flakes, celery seed and parsley in large bowl. Stir until blended. Stir in beans. Refrigerate 4 hours or until chilled.

In a mixing bowl, beat 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 cup butter. Add 2 eggs and beat well. Add 1 1/2 cups canned pumpkin. Sift together 2 cups of flour, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Add to mixture and mix well. Spoon batter into 2 greased and floured loaf pans and bake in a 350 degree F oven for 60 to 75 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans.

Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add the lentils and 5 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes or until the lentils are soft. Add the salt and black pepper and continue to cook for another 10 minutes. Serve with flat bread.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook noodles according to directions. Drain and rinse well in cold water. Drain well again. Add beef and sauerkraut to the cooked and rinsed noodles. Stir until well blended. Combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the mixture. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Sprinkle top with caraway seeds. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350. Combine chicken pieces with mashed potatoes and parmesan cheese. Add garlic powder and butter. Spread mixture in a greased 13 x 9 pan. Bake for 45 minutes to one hour.

Place carrots in boiling water. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain and place in cold water for 2 minutes. Drain and place in cold water for 2 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Cut cauliflower into small pieces and add to carrots. Peel onion and slice thinly. Cut carrots and cauliflower in small pieces and add to carrots. Add capers and parsley and mix well. In a small bowl combine vinegar, mustard and oil. Pour over vegetables and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Place chicken in single layer in baking dish. Combine picante and chipotle powder in small bowl. Spoon about 1 tablespoon onto each breast. Sprinkle cheese over each breast. Bake until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle each breast with about 1 teaspoon green onion. Yield 4 servings.

Toss spinach with 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large bowl. Season with salt. Divide among 4 plates. Add the shallot to the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the bowlcook over moderate heat until softened, about 1 minute. Add the sherry vinegarsimmer until thickened, about 3 minutes. Season with pepper. Toss the vinaigrette with the spinach. Top with the pecans and crumbled gorgonzola.

In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the green beans for 2 minutes. Drain wellrinse under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium-low heat until melted. Add the flour and whisk for 2 minutes. Slowly whisk in the milk, pepper, sugar and onion until smooth. Bring to a boil, whisking constantlyboil for 1 minute. Remove from the heatstir in the sour cream and 3/4 cup of the cheese until blended. Pour the mixture over the beans in a shallow 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut bread in half and toast. Spread one piece with mustard. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with ham and another piece of bread. Cut sandwiches in half. Beat eggs and skim milk. Pour over sandwiches. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot.
Mix all the ingredients together. Spread in a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until lightly browned. Cool for 30 minutes and serve.

Sauté leeks, garlic and onions until tender (about 10 minutes). Pour in 4 cups water (or more if you prefer a thinner soup) and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Add potatoes and simmer for another 10 minutes or until tender. In the meantime, heat cream in a small pan over medium heat until just bubbling around the edges. Pour over soup to heat through. Add fresh tarragon to taste. Serve with plain yogurt on top or to the side.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Stir in 1 tablespoon chutney, 1 teaspoon curry powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Blanch peas 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Combine cream cheese and milk in a medium bowlmix well. Stir in chutney mixture, 1 teaspoon curry powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Serve dip with crackers. Garnish with nuts if desired.

In a large bowl combine the flour, beer, sugar and baking powder. Gradually stir in the oil and egg until smooth. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dip each piece of fish in the batter and drop carefully in hot oil. Fry for 3 minutes or until golden brown and crisp and fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish from oil and place on a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and tartar sauce or your favorite dipping sauce.

Boil water in a large saucepan. Add asparagus. Cook until bright green, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain. Place 6 spears on each plate. Top each serving with 1/4 melon ball. Sprinkle each serving with 1/4 tsp blue cheese. Drizzle with 1 tsp wine. Drizzle with 1 tsp hot mustard. Top each serving with a pinch of orange zest. Sprinkle each serving with 1/4 tsp hazelnuts. Salt and pepper to taste.

Sprinkle steak with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tsp vegetable oil in a 10 inch saute pan over high heat. Add steak in a single layer and sear until well-browned, 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and set aside for 10 minutes to rest. Crumble bacon and cook in the same pan until crisp over high heat. Add onion and stir until softened, about 5 minutes. Add lime juice and season with salt and pepper. Slice steak across the grain into 1 inch strips. Place 2 tortillas in front of each person, spooning meat mixture evenly over each tortilla. Top with avocado, bacon, salsa, cheese and cilantro, if you wish. Fold tortillas in half and serve.

Cut the tops off the peppers and set aside. Blend the sweet red peppers with the tomatoes in a blender until smooth. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for a minute or two, until it starts to soften. Add the garlic and cook for a minute longer. Add the ground cumin and chili powder and stir for a minute longer. Add the black beans and mix well. Stir in the salsa and frozen corn. Cook for a few minutes over medium-low heat until the corn is heated through. Turn off the heat. Spray a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Fill the peppers with the bean mixture. Layer the peppers in the baking dish. Sprinkle with the Monterey Jack Pepper Cheese and the sour cream. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with the reserved peppers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a standard 12-cup muffin pan. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Beat the butter and sugar together until light and creamy. Beat in the egg until smooth. Add in the milk. Add the dry ingredients and mix until just incorporated. Add in the chopped nuts and mix. Fill each muffin cup 1/2 to 2/3 full. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 25 to 30 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes, then remove to wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.
A friend of mine was telling me about how her family goes on a fall weekend vacation every year. They go to Vermont and stay at a lodge. They do hikes and spend time in nature. I was jealous. It sounds like a wonderful way to spend a weekend with family. This year I thought it would be fun to bring some of that

Melt margarine in large saucepan. Add onions and garlic. Cook until tender. Add rice. Cook 1 minute. Add broth. Heat until boiling. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook 18 minutes. Fluff with fork. Serve.
Rice is the staple food for the people of Asia. It is eaten at most meals in various forms, both plain and prepared. The most common form of cooked rice is plain boiled or steamed rice. In the West, this is sometimes called "white" rice (not to be confused with the rice of the same name) because the grains have been polished to remove the bran.
Rice is cooked by boiling or steaming, or by more sophisticated methods such as absorption. It may be cooked in a pot or pan alone or in combination with other foods. It is often served plain as an accompaniment to another dish. Rice may be used as a thickening agent in stews or gravies. It is also ground into flour.
Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa. It is usually cultivated in flooded

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread cream cheese on graham cracker crust. Spread with chunky peanut butter. Bake for 15 minutes. In a small bowl mix together powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Stir in cool whip. Spread over peanut butter layer. Spread with remaining cool whip. Sprinkle with roasted peanuts. In a small bowl mix together chocolate syrup and carmel syrup until smooth. Spoon over top layer. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with a spoonful of whipped topping.

Cut off any excess fat on the ham steaks and place in an ovenproof dish. Add the onions and brown sugar and mix together well. Place the dish in an oven preheated to 180C (350F) and bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until the meat is almost cooked through. Heat the whiskey and the Dijon mustard together until the mustard has dissolved into the whiskey. Add the vinegar and the flour and mix well. Place the mixture in a saucepan and slowly add the water, whisking all the time. Stir until thickened and bring to the boil and simmer for about 5 minutes until the sauce has thickened. Remove the ham from the oven and pour the sauce all over the meat. Return the dish to the oven and bake until the meat is golden and the sauce has thickened even more. Remove from the oven and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss sultana raisins and carrots together in a large bowl. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the brown sugar, coriander, cumin and gingercook and stir until fragrant. Stir the garlic mixture into the carrot mixture and mix well. Turn the mixture out into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle the yogurt evenly over the top. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Stir the carrot mixture 2 or 3 times while bakingbake until the top is golden.

Combine the apples, flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and egg in a large bowlstir until moistened. Spread evenly into an 8-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the margarine, brown sugar and cinnamoncut in until crumbly. Sprinkle over the apple mixture. Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings (serving size: about 1/8 of recipe).

Cut cabbage into 1/2-inch strips and shred carrot and scallion. Set aside. Melt butter over medium heat and saute ramen noodles for 3 minutes or until crisp. Stir in cabbage mixture and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain and cool. Combine sugar, oil and vinegar in a jar with lid and shake well. In a serving bowl combine cabbage mixture, sesame seeds and almonds. Drizzle with dressing and toss lightly to blend. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving. Serves 10 to 12.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients and mix just to combine. Stir in the orange zest and juice. Spoon into 12 greased muffin cups. Bake in a preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

Preheat your oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine the vegan margarine, brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla, whole wheat flour, water, and baking soda. Stir until well combined. Stir in the oats. Stir until well combined. Add the chocolate chips. Stir until well combined. Drop dough by tablespoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until slightly browned around the edges. Let cool on cookie sheet. Enjoy.

Combine the first eight ingredients in a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Stir in the pumpkin puree and mix until blended. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead the dough until it forms a ball. Roll the dough into a 1/2 inch thick rectangle. Cut the dough into 3 inch squares with a knife or pizza cutter. Place the squares 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned on the bottom. Serve warm.

Cook pasta roni in large pot of boiling water 7 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse in cold water. Return pasta roni to pot and stir in tuna, italian seasoning, butter flavored cracker and butter. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through stirring constantly.
Bring water to a boil. Add pasta. Cook until pasta is just barely done. Remove from heat and add milk. Mix thoroughly. Serve hot. Add 2T sugar. Butter may be added as desired.

In a large bowl, combine onion and potatoes and toss with oil. Place on a jelly roll pan. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 30 minutes or until potatoes and onions are tender. In a small bowl, combine the roast beef and bacon and toss with salt and pepper. Heat the worcestershire sauce in a small bowl in the microwave for 20 seconds. Combine the egg and milk and beat with a fork. Pour mixture over potato mixture. Sprinkle with roast beef mixture. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the chives and bake for another 5 minutes or until mixture is slightly browned. Top with cheddar cheese and broil until cheese is slightly browned.
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with aluminum foil.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the first eight ingredients. Mix well. Pour into the prepared pan.
3. Bake for 20 minutes.

Cover chicken with broth and boil for 1 hour. Remove chicken from broth and reserve. In a separate bowl, combine the sweet whole kernel corn with the broth and diced tomatoes. Cook for about an hour. While cooking, dice the chilies and place them in a small bowl. Heat the tortilla chips under the broiler or on a cookie sheet until they are just beginning to turn golden brown. When the soup is cooked, stir in the diced tomatoes and chilies. Place the chicken into the bowl and add the seasoning to taste. Serve the soup with tortilla chips.
These are all really easy and pretty quick to make. The best thing about them is they all freeze well. I make them and freeze them and then thaw them out when I need them. They are perfect for those nights when you don’t feel like cooking or for lunch. Enjoy!

In a large pot, brown the sausage in a little olive oil. Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towel to remove excess fat. Add the onions to the pot and cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. Add the chicken broth and potatoes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Cut the sausage links into 1 inch pieces and add to the pot along with the baby spinach leaves and heavy cream. Cook for about 3 minutes or until the spinach is wilted. Season to taste with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot in bowls with grated parmesan cheese sprinkled on top..
You can also check Italian Sausage and Beans and Italian Sausage Pasta Sauce Recipe for recipes.
Recipes for Italian Sausage Casserole
Italian Sausage Casserole
Italian Sausage Casserole (b)
Italian Sausage Casserole (a)
Italian Sausage Casserole (c)
Dice cooked sausage into small pieces and stir into Velveeta cheese. Stir in grape jelly. Spread on rye cocktail bread. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees.

Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp. Remove bacondrain and set aside. Add mushrooms and onion to drippings in skillet. Saute until tender. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add green beans. Cook and stir until just tender. Stir in white wine and cook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve over rice or pasta. Garnish with reserved bacon.

Cut avocados in half and remove seeds with a spoon. Scoop out flesh with a spoon and place in bowl. Add salt to taste. Mix well. Add roma tomatoes and onion to the bowl. Add the cilantro stems in last. Mix well. Add lime juice to taste. Mix well. Serve immediately.

For vinaigrette, combine olive oil and lemon juice in small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. For shrimp salad, combine all salad ingredients except for parsley. Toss to combine. Divide onto plates. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season both sides of the breast halves with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown on both sides. Remove from pan. In a small bowl, whisk together orange juice & mustard. Add chicken to pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcook until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boilcook until thickened. Sprinkle thyme & sage over chicken. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion. Cook stirring occasionally until the onion is caramelized. Season with salt and pepper. Lay the pork tenderloin on top of the onions. Cook in the oven for 25 minutes or until the meat thermometer reads 155 degrees. Remove the pork from the skillet and allow to rest for 10 minutes. Cut into thin slices.

In a large saute pan heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, salt, and pepper, saute 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally until onions are softened. Add fish, saute 3-4 minutes per side until lightly browned, then add tomatoes, chilies and wine. Cover tightly and simmer 15 minutes or until fish is just barely done through. Remove from heat add olives, stir gently. Serve over rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Cut orange rind into julienne strips. Sprinkle with salt. Mince orange and lemon rinds. Toss fish fillets with orange juice and lemon juice. Place in shallow dish. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Cover with orange-lemon rinds. Bake at 450f for 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one baking sheet.Mix together flour, butter, egg yolks and 1/2 cup of milk until smooth and then stir in remaining 3 cups milk. Add the salt. Beat egg whites until stiff then fold into batter. Drop batter by large spoonful onto baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and gently press down with back of spoon to make about 2-inch mounds. Place a plum in each mound then brush with melted butter. Bake for another 3 to 4 minutes until mounds are puffed up and golden brown. Serve warm with sauce.

In a large bowl combine yellow cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda and saltmix well. In a separate bowl combine eggs and cream-style cornmix well. Add egg and corn mixture to cornmeal and mix well. Pour into greased 9-inch pie plate and bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutescut into wedges and serve warm with sour cream.

Combine refried beans, taco seasoning, sour cream and cream cheese in a 1 quart casserole. Mix well. Add beef and stir to blend. Spread in a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle with jalapeno before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large heavy saucepan combine margarine and chocolate over low heat. Stir until completely melted and smooth. Add corn syrup and vanilla and mix well. Remove from heat and stir in icing sugar. Fold in Rice Krispies and spread into a greased 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set. Cut into squares to serve.
Mix all together and bake at 350 for about 35-40 minutes

Stir the coffee and the chocolate in the top of a double boiler over direct heat until the chocolate is melted and completely blended into the coffee. Mix in a few grains salt and the sugar. Boil for 4-5 minutes, stirring constantly. Place the top of the double boiler over hot water in the bottom. Gradually mix in the scalding milk. When the mixture is near the boiling point, beat with an electric mixer until light and frothy. Pour into 4 cups or mugs and top with whipped topping if desired.

Spray a 9x13 casserole dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the cooked chicken with the Bisquick. Mix the Bisquick and the milk together with a whisk until the mixture is smooth and well blended. Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle the onion over the top of the mixture. Top the mixture with the corn and the enchilada sauce. Sprinkle the taco seasoning over the enchilada sauce. Sprinkle the chicken with the remaining half of the shredded cheese. Bake the mixture uncovered in a 425 degree oven for about 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the mixture is hot through. Serve over tortilla chips with sour cream and salsa.
name: quick taco bake
2 TBSP taco seasoning mix
1 (15.5 oz) can diced tomatoes with green chilies
1 (16 oz) can diced tomatoes
1 (16 oz) can diced green chilies
1 (

Warm 1-1/2 cups water in a large pot. Peel and cut squash into 1-inch cubes. Add cubes and remaining 1 cup water to the pot. Cover and cook for about 30 minutes or until very tender. Cool slightly. Preheat broiler. Drain squash. Spread evenly in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Broil until crisp and brown. Combine milk and egg substitute in a bowl. Stir in parmesan cheese and seasonings. Spread over squash. Broil until lightly brown. Makes 4 servings.

Muddle the mint leaves in a glass. Add the sugar and lime juice. Mash the mixture with the back of a spoon. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the mixture into the glass. Add the blueberries to the mixture. Stir in the lemonade. Top off with the club soda. Add the rum. Add the mint sprig. Garnish with a lime slice.

Combine all ingredients well and store in a sealed container. To use as a dip for vegetables or crackers, mix with mayonnaise or sour cream according to taste. To use as a salad dressing, combine with milk or buttermilk according to taste and shake well before serving.
Name: Big Batch Ranch Dressing Mix Ingredients: Dried Parsley Flakes, Dill Weed, Onion Powder, Salt, Garlic Powder, Ground Pepper, Dried Onion Flakes Preparation: Mix together all ingredients. Store in a 1 cup canning jar or other airtight container. When ready to make dressing, combine 1 cup of mayonnaise, 1 cup buttermilk, and 1 tablespoon dry dressing mix. Whisk well. Store in refrigerator. Name: Creole Ranch Salad Dressing Ingredients: Sour Cream, Fresh Garlic Clove, Buttermilk, Vinegar, Fresh Basil Leaves, Crushed Red Pepper Flakes, Mayonnaise, Salt, Black Pepper

Cook eggs (2 to 3 minutes) for hard boiled eggs, then place in bowl of cold water for a few minutes to stop further cooking. Remove from water and drain. Cut the bottoms off of 1 slice of white bread (4 slices total) for dippers. Mix egg yolks together with butter and seasonings to taste. Stuff into dippers, sprinkle top of egg yolk with paprika for coloring if desired.
Combine first three ingredients in large saucepan. Heat to boiling. Stir in cinnamon stick and reduce heat. Simmer covered for 20 minutes. Strain mixture to remove spices. Serve hot.

Combine the peaches, pineapples, apples and 1 can of the pineapple juice in a large bowl. Combine the milk and the pudding in a saucepan. Bring the mixture just to a boil. Remove from heat and allow the mixture to stand for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir the fruit mixture. Add the remaining 2 cans of pineapple juice. Add the milk and pudding mixture. Gently mix. Refrigerate 3 hours or until ready to serve. Gently fold in the sour cream. Makes 8 servings.

In a heavy saucepan heat oil over medium high heat. Saute onions for 2 minutes or until softened. Stir in chili pepper. Add rice and mix well. Add chicken stock. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and cover tightly. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until most of the liquid has been absorbed by rice. Add spinach and continue cooking for about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and fresh dill. Serve with yogurt sprinkled with fresh dill.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine margarine and flour. Cut in the margarine with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in tuna and milk. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute. Add noodles and peasstir gently. Bake in greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Marinate 1/2 tequila in 1/2 key lime for 2 hours. Slice onion & tomatoes. Pound 6 garlic cloves with 1/2 teaspoon salt & 1/4 teaspoon pepper to make 1/4 cup paste. Thread 1/3 tomato, 1/3 onion & 1/3 garlic onto 4 skewers. Coat with marinaderepeat. Thread remaining garlic & tomato on 2 more skewers. Skewer remaining onion & marinate in 1/2 tequila & 1/2 key lime for 2 hours. Thread 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts onto 2 skewers. Marinate in remaining tequila & key lime for 2 hours. Grill chicken & vegetables 5 inches above medium coals 10 to 12 minutes, turning & basting frequently with marinade. Makes 4 servings.

Dust livers with flour. Shake off excess. Heat 1/8 inch of oil in a skillet to 360 degrees. Fry livers 1 minute per side until browned. Remove and drain. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat from the skillet. Return livers to the skillet and add lemon juice. Cook 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Remove the tips from the wings and discard. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in a 9x13 inch pan over medium heat. Add the chicken wings and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until lightly browned and crisp. Remove to a plate. Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter in the pan and stir in the hot sauce and vinegar. Simmer 1 to 2 minutes. Place the wings in the pan and bake 20 minutes. Toss the wings and return to the oven for an additional 10 to 15 minutes. Stir frequently. Serve hot.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together milk, dark chocolate, and butterscotch schnapps until combined. Remove from heat and serve immediately with marshmallows if desired.

Melt butter with sugar. Add beaten eggs and stir. Add lemon juice and flour. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and smooth. Remove from heat. Beat with an electric mixer until cool. Add milk and beat until well mixed. Pour into moulds. Bake at 200c for 15 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool to room temperature before turning out. Serve with cream or ice-cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 9 x 13 cake pan with cooking spray. In a large saute pan over medium heat, cook sausage until no longer pink. Add onion and cook until slightly browned. Add beer, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard, cornstarch, water and beer. Bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes or until thickened. Place sausage mixture in the bottom of the cake pan. In a large bowl combine all remaining ingredients. Pour mixture over sausage. Cover the cake pan loosely with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover the cake pan. Bake for 10 more minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with potato salad.

Brown ground beef with taco seasoning in large skillet. Stir in potatoes and cheddar cheese. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in salsa. Cook 5 minutes more. Serve on tortillas with lettuce, green onion & sour cream if desired.

Brown the vegetables and dried seasonings in the butter. Mix all the remaining ingredients together and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour. Stir in the cheese and cook for 5 more minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Fry bacon until just crispy. Crumble. In a large bowl, combine the bacon with the cheddar cheese, diced pimentos, mayonnaise, onions, Worcestershire sauce, salt, red pepper and pepper. Spoon into a serving bowl. Serve with crackers.

Sauté bacon drippings, onions and breadcrumbs in a large casserole until golden brown. Beat eggs lightly with milk and wateradd mild cheesemix well. Combine with bread crumb mixture and add salt and pepper to taste. Pour over onion mixturesprinkle with cheesebake at 400 degrees for 1 hour.

Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat. Add chickencook 5 minutes on each side or until done. Add watercover. Simmer on medium-low heat 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in taco seasoning mixcook 1 minute or until heated through. Spoon into warmed taco shells. Top with desired toppings.

Cook linguine in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Saut the zucchini until tender. Add the broccoli, red pepper, salt and pepper. Add the broth and simmer. Stir in the hot pepper flakes. Add the linguine. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Sift dry ingredients together and set aside. Put cocoa in a bowl with boiling water. Stir until smooth. Add shortening, sugar, vanilla and egg yolks one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter. Add dry ingredients alternately with buttermilk, beating well after each addition until smooth. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 15 minutes. Loosen sides of pan and turn out on a rack to cool. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Heat olive oil in a fry pan over medium heat. Slice the roast into 1-inch strips. Add the strips of meat to the fry pan in a single layer. Cook for one minute on each side. Remove the meat strips from the pan and place onto a baking dish. Stir the rosemary into the pan drippings. Sprinkle the meat strips with salt and pepper. Pour the wine into the pan. Cover the meat strips with the wine. Bake for 20 minutes in a 400 degree Fahrenheit oven. Garnish the meat strips with the rosemary. Serve the meat strips hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. On a baking sheet, place the green beans and drizzle with the oil and a few tablespoons of the vegetable broth. Roast for 20 minutes. Add the garlic and roast for 10 more minutes. Transfer to a bowl and toss with the remaining broth, lemon juice and the seasonings. Toss to coat. Garnish with the almonds. Serve warm or room temperature. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place the fish fillets in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Season with salt and pepper.In a large skillet saute the onion and mushrooms in the olive oil over medium heat until they begin to brown. Add the garlic and saute 2 minutes longer. Pour in the white wine and boil until it is almost evaporated. Add the tomatoes and zucchini and boil until thickened. Pour the mixture over the fish in the baking dish and sprinkle with the fresh herbs. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Place brie on bottom slice of bread and top with ham and pepper. Spread mustard on other slice of bread and place on the pepper/ham/brie. Melt butter on a pan on medium heat until hot and brown and place sandwich on pan and cook for a couple minutes. Flip and cook for a couple more minutes until the bottom is brown and the cheese is gooey and the ham is hot. Enjoy!

Melt butter and chocolate together. Stir in all dry ingredients. Add egg and mix until combined. Roll into 12 balls. Place on a greased baking tray and press down with the palm of your hand to 3cm thickness. Bake at 180c for 15 to 20 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Spread both sides of 1 onion roll with mayonnaise. Wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 3 days. Cut the kielbasa into 4 pieces and place in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook until heated through and slightly browned on all sides, 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and cut each piece in half crosswise. Crack the egg into a small bowl and whisk lightly. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in another skillet over medium heat. Add egg and cook until set, 2-3 minutes per side. Cut kielbasa in half crosswise. Top each slice of bread with 2 pieces kielbasa, 2 pieces egg, 1 slice each of cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese, and 2 slices kielbasa. Heat in a skillet over medium heat until cheese is melted and sandwiches are heated through, about 2 minutes per side. Makes 2 servings.

Soak glutinous rice in water for about 1 hour or longer if rice is new. Drain excess water. In a heavy pot or wok, put in the rice, sugar, and butter. Cook until all moisture is evaporated and rice is tender. Mix in salt to taste, then add in coconut cream and cook for a few more minutes.

Sprinkle the flour and seasonings all over both sides of each breast. Heat half of the olive oil in a large saute pan and sear each breast on both sides for 3 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. Add remaining olive oil to the pan and saute onion and garlic until soft and translucent, 2-3 minutes. Add the wine and continue to cook until wine is reduced to a glaze by about half. Return the breasts to pan and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot and sprinkle with fresh parsley if desired.
1. Place potatoes and carrots in a large pot of boiling water. Cook until tender but not mushy, about 15 minutes for potatoes and 20 minutes for carrots. Drain vegetables and return to pot.
2. Add butter and cheese and stir until melted and vegetables are well-coated. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
3. Serve immediately with a crisp green salad.

Beat corn syrup and milk until thickened. Add egg yolks and beat well. Add pumpkin. Beat well. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Fold egg whites into mixture. Add spices. Pour mixture into 2-crust pie pan. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 50-60 minutes or until center of the pie is set. Cool and serve with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream.

Spread pesto sauce over one side of each bread slice. Lay slices of fresh parmesan cheese over pesto sauce. Place slices of bell peppers over cheese. Place slices of fresh mozzarella cheese over bell peppers. Top each cheese slice with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Spread remaining pesto sauce over slices of cheese. Place remaining slice of bread over cheese slices. Grill in a non-stick skillet until cheese is melted. Cut in half to serve.
The following recipes are for sandwich recipes.

In a bowl, mix the prawns with the salt and pepper. In a frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat, add the garlic and fry until it begins to brown. Add the prawns, and stir to coat with the garlic and oil. When they begin to turn pink, add the wine and cook until the wine is almost evaporated. Add the chilies and cook for 1 minute more. Serve with steamed rice and a green salad.

Spray a muffin pan with Pam cooking spray. Peel and slice potatoes into rounds about 1/4-inch thick. Layer bottom of each cup with a few slices of the potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese and a little more than 1 tablespoon of the green onions. Repeat layering process until all the ingredients have been used up. In a small saucepan, combine the remaining green onions with the cream. Bring to a boil over medium heatcook until heated through. Divide the green onion mixture evenly over the potato gratins. Bake in the pre-heated oven until the cheese is melted and the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

In small bowl combine sugar, oil, vinegar, salt, dry mustard, celery seed and garlic salt. Set aside. In large bowl combine tomatoes, sweet onion and green pepper. Add dressing and toss to combine. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serves 8

Place the red potatoes in a large pot of cold water over high heat. Once the water reaches a rolling boil, reduce heat to medium and cook for about 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced. Drain potatoes. In the meantime, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and cook for about 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain beans. Put the potatoes and the chicken broth into the bowl of a food processor. Puree until the mixture is smooth. Add the pesto and the salt. Puree until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Add the beans. Season to taste with additional salt if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Trim the ends off the brussels sprouts, chop into small pieces and add to a stock pot along with chicken stock, butter, flour and milk. Bring to a boil for 3 minutes to thicken slightly. Add heavy cream and nutmeg, and season with tabasco sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Serve with croutons or crackers or just plain.
Mrs. Nina Watts, a 69-year-old woman, was admitted to St. Joseph’s Hospital with chest pain and shortness of breath. She had a history of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), hypertension, and hyperlipidemia. Mrs. Watts reported that she had been feeling well until 2 days prior to admission, when she began to experience increasing shortness of breath and chest tightness that worsened over time. Her symptoms were accompanied by a productive cough that produced yellow sputum, which she described as “thick”. She reported no fever or chills, but she did report some nausea with her cough. She was an active

Beat the cream cheese in a bowl until smooth. Beat in the sugar. Stir in the melted chocolate until smooth. Gently fold in the whipped topping. Divide the batter between 2 plastic ramekins or custard cups. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set. Top with the remaining topping and crushed cookies.

Heat milk, salt, sugar and butter in a small saucepan over low heat until warm. In a large bowl stir together 2 cups of flour and yeast. Add warm milk mixture. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of a stand mixer. Add egg. Stir in enough of remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, to form a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic, adding more flour if necessary. Place in a greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes. Punch down. Turn onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out to a 15x9 inch rectangle. Spread 2/3 of dough with 1/2 of the butter. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese. Top with bacon. Roll up as you would a jelly roll. Cut crosswise into 6 slices. Place in greased 8x8 inch baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place until doubled

In a medium bowl stir together bran and boiling water. Let sit 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together yogurt, sugar substitute and banana until blended. Beat the egg substitute in another medium bowl. Stir the yogurt mixture and the egg substitute into the bran mixture until blended. Stir in the flour and baking soda until just combined. Spoon the batter into a 12 cup muffin pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook garlic and pepper in hot oil 1 minute or until garlic is golden. Add broth and wine. Bring to boil. Add pepper and simmer 5 minutes or until thickened and reduced to about 1/2 cup. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle beef with pepper and cook 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Divide beef among 4 plates and spoon pepper sauce on top of each serving.

Preheat your barbecue to high. Line a baking tray with aluminum foil and lay the salmon skin side down. Combine the chili powder and sugar in a small bowl. Mix in the coriander and cumin. Rub the seasoning mixture all over both sides of the fish. Squeeze 2 tbsps of the lime juice over the fish and drizzle with 1 tsp of olive oil. Cook for 3-4 minutes each side. Serve with extra lime wedges to squeeze over.

Combine orange juice, vinegar, honey and tarragon. Remove skin from chickens. Mix half of the stuffing with 2 T. of the cheese. Stuff the mixture inside the cavities of the birds. Brush the rest of the stuffing with remaining cheese over the skin of the birds. Rub the birds with olive oil. Place the birds into an oiled roasting pan. Pour the marinade over the birds. Bake for 1 hour. Reduce heat to 350 degrees. Bake another hour. Let the birds stand for 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with olives. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Combine schnapps, kahlua and coffee in a 12-ounce mug. Stir until well blended. Fill with ice. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with shavings. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, courgette and a pinch of salt. Cook for 8-10 minutes until the courgette is soft. Add the tomatoes. Simmer for a further 5-10 minutes until the tomatoes break down. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the packet instructions. Drain the pasta, reserving a little of the cooking water. Add the cooked courgettes, tomatoes and pesto to the pasta. Add a little of the reserved cooking water if the sauce is too thick. Season with salt and pepper. Toss in the pine nuts. Serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese.

Boil the frozen corn until tender. When done, drain off the water and run cold water over the corn to stop the cooking process. Drain the water and let it cool down. Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain water off the potatoes and let them cool down in cold water or let them cool down in the fridge for at least an hour. Once the corn and potatoes are both cool, dice them both up into little cubes about 1 inch long. Cut the green bell peppers up into little cubes as well. Mix all the cubed vegetables together in a big bowl with the sour cream. Add the hot chili pepper, olive oil, lemon juice and ground cumin to the vegetables in the bowl. Mix everything together very well with a big spoon until all the vegetables are covered in the creamy sour cream mixture. The mixture will be thick but it'll still be pourable. The more you stir the creamier it will get. Serve in individual portions on a plate with little toothpicks for garnish. The green bell peppers add a nice color to the dish. The

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt 1/2 stick butter in a skillet over medium-high heatadd apple and saute for 2 minutes. Remove apple from panset aside. Beat egg in a bowl with fork. Combine the apple tart mix and 1/4 cup white sugaradd the egg mixture. Stir in the apple and raisins. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate or tart pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve warm or cold with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet on medium heat, heat the oil. Add onion and saute for 10 minutes or until soft. Add brussels sprouts and saute for about 5 minutes or until lightly brown. Add wine to deglaze pan and stir to combine. Pour sprouts into a small baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes until tender. Mix together dijon mustard, maple syrup and black pepper in a small bowl. Stir into baked sprouts. Top with chopped parsley. Serve hot or warm.

Peel the squash and cut into small cubes. Heat ghee in a pan and add all the spices and salt and stir for 30 seconds. Add the cubed squash and stir for 5-6 minutes till the squash is done and has taken up the flavors of the spices and ghee. Switch off the gas and add the coriander leaves. Mix well and serve hot with chapatis or rice.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Arrange the halibut fillets in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. In a bowl, combine the flour and balsamic vinegar. Beat in the garlic. Drizzle the halibut with the oil and season with salt and pepper. Dust the fish with the flour mixture and bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle with dried rosemary before serving.

Preheat oven to 425f. Toss potatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil, kosher salt, and fresh ground black pepper on a rimmed baking sheet until evenly coated. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown and tender when pierced with a knife. While the potatoes are baking, toss brussels sprout with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a medium bowl. Spread the brussels sprout mixture evenly over the potatoes when they are done baking. Top with the bacon and bake for 5 minutes more or until the brussels sprout mixture is crisp and the bacon is browned. Remove from the oven and toss with the butter and lemon juice.

Place all ingredients in a large zip lock bag and refrigerate for 3 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place chicken in a large roasting pan and spread with the marinade. Bake for 1 hour. Broil 3 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix all ingredients together well. Spread on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until lightly browned and crispy. Cool and store in air-tight container.
Sesame seed squares are a favorite snack of mine.
I love sesame seed squares and I love how easy they are to make!
I love Sesame Squares. They're a perfect little snack, especially when you have a craving for something sweet!
These are a staple of my childhood! I've been wanting to make them for awhile.
Sesame seed squares are a great snack and my kids love them!
I love Sesame Squares! These would be a great snack for my kids!
I love sesame seed squares and I love how easy they are to make! I have never heard of Sesame Snackers though they sound very interesting. I will have to try those next time I make some!
I love Sesame Squares! These would be a great snack for my kids! My kids are going to love these!
I've

Cut and pit peaches and place in buttered baking dish. Mix together and set aside flour, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt. Mix together milk and lemon juice and set aside. Melt butter and stir in flour mixture until smooth. Add milk mixture and stir until smooth. Pour over fruit and bake at 400 for one hour.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown pork chops in canola oil for 5 minutes on each side. In a small bowl combine soy sauce and hot pepper sauce and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine coconut milk, soy sauce mixture and pineapple tidbits. Bring to boil and simmer until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in fresh italian parsley. Pour mixture over the chops and serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine herbed goat cheese and italian seasoning in a small bowl. Slice beef into 1/4-inch slices and spread cheese mixture evenly over each slice. Roll up, starting at the narrow end. Place in a lightly greased 9-inch square baking dish. Top with scallions and cheese. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oven and top with roasted red peppers and sun-dried tomatoes. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine all but egg in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until the mixture boils and is thickened slightly. Stir in egg. Pour into tart shells. Bake at 350 fahrenheit for 15-18 minutes or until the custards are set when touched lightly in the center. Serves 8.
How to Make Pumpkin Spice Cake Doughnuts
How To Make a Traditional New Years Eve Cake
How To Make a Simple Carrot Cake
How To Make a Three-Layer Chocolate Cake
How To Make a Simple Cake for a New Baby
How To Make a Classic Angel Food Cake
How To Make a Simple Strawberry Shortcake
How To Make a Simple Caramel Cake
How To Make a Traditional New Years Eve Cake (Without an Oven)
How To Make a Three-Layer Chocolate Cake (Without an Oven)
How To Make a Simple Chocolate Cake (Without an Oven)

In a large skillet, cook onion powder in butter until browned. Add 1/3 of the chicken broth and the reduced-fat cream of chicken soup. Add 3 cups potatoes, cooked and diced. Combine mixture with remaining 1/3 chicken broth. Add cream cheese and stir until melted. Add green chilies and mexican blend cheese. Add to crock-pot. Cook on low 4 to 6 hours. Serve with tortilla.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Season the flour with 1/4 teaspoon of the seasoning and toss the chicken in the flour to coat. Heat the butter in a 9 by 13-inch baking dish in the oven until the foaming subsides. Add the chicken to the dish in a single layer. Roast the chicken until it is browned, about 15 minutes. Add the apples and pears to the baking dish. Roast until the apples are tender and the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes longer. Whisk the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of seasoning into the broth in a small bowl. Add the broth to the baking dish along with the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake until the juices are bubbling, about 15 minutes more. Serve hot.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and pasta. Cook until al dente. Meanwhile, in a large pan melt remaining olive oil and butter. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Season to taste and add lemon zest. Add prawns and cook for 3 minutes. Add pasta to pan and toss. Sprinkle parsley over pasta and garnish with lemon wedges.

Remove skin from fish fillets. Prepare a shallow dish by combining the beaten egg with the milk. In another shallow dish, mix the cereal crumbs with the seasoning. Dip fish in milk then in the cereal crumbs. Heat the oil in a deep fryer. Fry fish a few at a time for 2 minutes. Remove from fryer to drain.

Crush 3 butterfinger candy bars in a large resealable plastic food storage bagset aside. Heat 1 cup nonfat milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until steaming. Remove from heatstir in sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix and cocoa powder until well blended and smooth. Stir in remaining cup milkcover and refrigerate about 15 minutes or until thickened. Spoon 1/4 cup pudding onto each of 6 platestop each with 1/3 cup frozen fat-free whipped topping and a slice of angel food cakesprinkle each with some of the reserved candy bar mixture. Makes 6 servings.
Brown the chops on both sides in a little oil. Add onions to the drippings. Cook until onions are tender. Add the soup mixes. Cook until hot. Serve with rice.

Bring water to boil in a large saucepan. Cook potato until tender. Drain and let cool. Meanwhile, slice potato and carrots into very thin strips. Heat olive oil in a wok or nonstick frying pan. Add green onion and saute briefly. Add potato and carrots and cook 2-3 minutes. Add ginger and saute 1 minute. Stir in ponzu sauce and heat through. Season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine garlic powder, seasoning salt, and black pepper. Rub this mixture over the chicken. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until browned on all sides. Place chicken in a 2-3 quart slow cooker. Stir together the sauce mix, Italian seasoning, wine and zucchini. Pour over the chicken. Cook on low for 5-6 hours or until chicken is done.
I am SOOOOOOOOOO excited!!! I have been looking for a recipe like this for a while now. I am so tired of the same old same old. I was going to try the taco one tonight but I have no tomatoes. I will try that one this weekend. I can't wait to try these out.
I love my crockpot! I've been wanting to try some chicken recipes. I will def check these out. Thanks!
I love my crockpot! I've been wanting to try some new recipes. Thanks for sharing!
I love my crockpot. I've been wanting to try some new recipes

In a large bowl combine the first 7 ingredients. Add butter and blend well. Add the molasses and vanilla and stir to blend. Stir the egg substitute into the mixture. Add the whole wheat flour and raisins and mix well. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Shape the dough into 1-1/2 inch balls. Place 1/2 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten each with your fingers. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on racks.
Awesome. I'm so excited. I'm making them tonight.
I love how you have the recipes printed out and on the fridge. That's the best place to have them. I have them on my fridge too.
Great idea. I have to try these.
Oh I love this! I'm going to have to copy this one.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in balsamic vinegar and orange juicecook for 2 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Add syrup, garlic and orange zestcook for 3 minutes or until thickened slightly. Remove from heatstir in olive oil. Place salmon in a single layer in a large glass baking dish or a 13- x 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Drizzle salmon with 1/4 cup of the glazeseason with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste fish with remaining glazesprinkle with parsley. Serve warm.

In a large zip-top plastic bag, combine the buttermilk, coconut and cilantro. Add the chicken and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 8 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large shallow baking dish, combine the garlic and 2 teaspoons of the salt. Arrange the coated chicken pieces in the dish. Bake until browned on top and a thermometer reads 170 degrees F in the thickest part of the meat, about 45 minutes. Serve sprinkled with the remaining salt. Serves 4 to 6.

Place carrots in a saucepan with 1 inch of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender but still a little crisp, about 5 minutes. Drain carrots and return to pan. Add brown sugar and butter, stirring until glazed and hot. Serve in a shallow bowl, spooning a little cream over each serving. Sprinkle with chopped chives if desired.

Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients except the cheese and spread into the baking dish. Top with cheese and bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Serve with lettuce, sour cream and guacamole.
If you need something hot and quick for lunch or dinner, here are 10 great recipes to help you out.

In a small bowl whisk together the lemon juice, lemon zest, olive oil and sea salt to make the vinaigrette. Wash the zucchini and cut the ends off each zucchini so it sits flat on a cutting board. Cut the zucchini into 1/4 to 1/2" slices. Heat the pan on medium high heat. Add the zucchini to the pan and cook on both sides until it is crisp and tender, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and drizzle the vinaigrette on top and sprinkle the fresh basil on top of the zucchini. Serve immediately or store for a few days in the fridge. Reheats very well if you need to warm up the next day.

Combine flour and salt in a shallow dish. Beat together water and egg in another shallow dish. Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan or deep fryer to 350 degrees. Dip each vegetable in the flour mixture and then in the egg mixture and then in the flour mixture again and place in the oil. Cook the vegetables in the oil for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oil with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease a 13 x 9-inch pan. Mix first three ingredients. In another bowl combine oats and coconut. Stir together and spread in pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely and cut into 24 squares. Garnish with cherry.
In small saucepan, heat coconut milk with vinegar, sugar and salt. Heat over medium heat until just boiling. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat and set aside. Serve at room temperature.

In a bowl add eggs, ricotta cheese, cream of tartar and Splenda. Beat till well blended. Put mixture in a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. Pipe into a small mound shape. Place on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 25-30 minutes.

Place the chicken broth in a large stockpot. Add the garbanzo beans. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Add the carrots and celery ribs. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the onion and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the spaghetti sauce and pasta shells. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the Italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowlbeat until well blended (mixture will be thick). Place in a 15x10x1-inch jelly roll pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 325° for 30 minutes or until set. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Makes 36 squares.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix together chicken, onion, seasoned bread crumbs, garlic salt and salt and pepper in a large mixing bowl. Add beaten egg and mix lightly. Form mixture into golfball size balls and place on a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 25 minutes. Turn oven to broil and broil for an additional 2-3 minutes or until browned on top. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. I like honey mustard or chipotle ranch.

In a bowl combine the broccoli, onion, sunflower seeds, bacon and cashews. Mix in the mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to blend flavors. This salad is best made the day before serving it.

Preheat oven to 450F. Butter 9X5 inch loaf pan. In skillet cook salmon with mushrooms. Drain and add breadcrumbs. Stir together with other ingredients except for the frozen peas. Spread into loaf pan. Bake until set 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with frozen peas. Serve.
