Cream together the butter and sugar, and add the egg and mashed banana, mix well. Add the sour cream and mix well again. Add the flour and mix until just combined (do not over mix). Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread the batter into a greased 8x8 inch square pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes at 350 degrees F. Cool before cutting.
In a small bowl mix together the honey, vinegar, and olive oil. Toss in the grapes. Add the blue cheese. Top with walnuts. Can also add a bit of red onion, if you like.

In saucepan, mix cocoa, sugar and vanilla. Stir constantly over medium heat to prevent lumps from forming. When the mixture becomes thick and glossy, remove from heat and let cool completely. Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's directions.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the pasta. Cook 12 to 15 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 13-in. x 9-in. glass baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the ricotta, 1 cup of the mozzarella and the eggseason with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and the pepper. Mix well. In a large bowl combine the cooked pasta, the remaining 1 1/2 cups of the mozzarella and the Parmesan. Add the ricotta mixture and toss to combine. Spread the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the Parsley. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until the edges begin to brown and the center is set.

Sprinkle curry powder over chicken breasts and leave to marinate for 15 minutes. Heat a little oil in a frying pan. Add carrots and red pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Add curry powder and cook for a further minute. Pour over stock and bring to the boil. Add rice. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add chicken and green chilies. Cook for a further 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Serve immediately.

Mix all the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Add the water, yeast, butter, vanilla, egg, salt and sugar. Mix well until smooth. Let rise until doubled in volume (approximately an hour). Heat oil for frying in deep pan or deep fryer to about 350 F (175 C). Form balls of dough about 2 inches (5 cm) wide. Fry for about 4 minutes or until golden brown on all sides. Drain on absorbent paper. Dip into glaze mixture while still warm and set aside to cool. Drizzle glaze mixture over the donut holes.

Place one sponge cake in each of two small bowls or glasses. Spoon some strawberry ice cream over the cakes. Spoon whipped cream over the ice cream and arrange a few fresh strawberries on each serving.

Split rolls lengthwise and layer with roast beef, turkey, ham and cheese. Top with tomatoes and onion. Drizzle with dressing. Wrap in foil and bake in 350 oven for 20 minutes or until heated through. Remove from foil. Cut into wedges.

Cut the onion in half lengthwise. Cut the half in half crosswise. Place the onion pieces on the bottom of the slow cooker. Add the chicken broth. Place the turkey on top of the onions. Sprinkle with the salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder. Add the garlic. Cover the slow cooker with the lid. Cook on low for 7 to 8 hours. Remove the cooked turkey with a slotted spoon. Discard the onions. Shred the cooked turkey. Add the extra virgin olive oil. Stir. Serve on toasted buns with lettuce and tomato.

Place the chicken in a shallow baking pan and sprinkle with the apple juice. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice and cornstarch. Pour over the chicken. Place the chicken in the oven and roast for 30 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and add the bouillon cube to the pan drippings. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Cook and stir the sauce for 2 minutes. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Makes 4 servings.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute more. Add the rosemary, sage, merlot, and olive oil. Bring to a boil and immediately reduce to a simmer. Continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat. Place the lamb in the skillet and turn to coat well in the marinade. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight. When ready to cook, preheat the grill. Cook the meat for 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Allow to stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Toss the potatoes in the butter and season with the fennel seed, allspice and coarse salt and pepper. Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and roast for about 30 minutes, until golden and crisp on the edges and very tender when pierced with a knife.
name: honey roasted sweet potatoesingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, honey, fresh lemon juice, salt, cinnamonpreparation: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small micorwave safe bowl combine butter, honey and lemon juice. Microwave until butter melts, add cinnamon. Place cubed potatoes in a large bowl and pour honey mixture over potatoes, toss to coat. Place in a roasting pan, salt and bake for about 50 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally.
name: candied sweet potatoesingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, brown sugar, orange zest, vanilla,

In a small bowl combine water, soy sauce, sugar, scallions and pepper. Place chicken quarters in baking pan and pour the marinade over. Cover and let marinade overnight. Next day, heat the oil in a wok or skillet over high heat. Remove chicken from marinade and add to wok. Stir-fry over high heat until well done. Remove from wok and cut into bite size pieces. To make the dipping sauce, combine water, soy sauce, sugar, scallions and white pepper. Add to wok and heat through. Add cucumber and sesame seeds. Serve with chicken and dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish. Slice the croissants in half lengthwise, and spread with the honey nut cream cheese. Layer half the croissants in the bottom of the baking dish. Whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and nutmeg until smoothpour over the croissants. Repeat with the remaining croissants and the cream cheesesprinkle with the butter. Bake until the custard is set and the croissants are golden brown, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the peaches and lemon juice in a medium bowl, and toss gently to combine. Serve the French toast with the peaches and extra lemon wedges on the side.
Southern Comfort Pound Cake
Pound cakes are a Southern tradition. We have tried many different recipes and have finally come up with one that we absolutely love. I have heard that this is the best pound cake recipe and I would have
Grate the cabbage and red bell pepper into a bowl. Combine the cabbage with the cilantro, jalapenos, lime juice, olive oil and cumin and mix well. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

In a 2-quart pan over medium heat, combine sugar and cold water. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture forms a syrup. Stir in chocolate and butter. Reduce heat and cook until mixture is smooth and shiny. Stir in cream and scotch. Pour mixture into 3-quart fondue pot and refrigerate until ready to serve. Preheat fondue pot to 250 degrees. Place poundcake cubes and strawberries into fondue pot. Serve with pineapple wedges.
The first time I ever made fondue was when I was about 18. My friends and I were having a party and someone suggested we make this for dinner. I had never heard of it before and had no idea what it was. When we got to my friends house we were all standing around her kitchen island and I was trying to figure out what we were going to do.
One of my friends said that she had a great idea. She said that we could make it in her microwave. So we took some leftover hamburger meat and put it in a dish and put it in her mic

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the ends from the asparagus. Place asparagus in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the apricot preserves, soy sauce and garlic. Pour over the asparagus on the baking sheet and toss to coat. Bake for 12 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from oven. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve warm.

Mix all ingredients except baking powder and soda. Stir in baking soda and powder. Divide dough in half. Roll out each half on lightly floured surface into a 7 or 8-inch circle. Cut into 8 wedges. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated oven at 425 degrees for 10-12 minutes until browned. Cool on wire rack.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain. While it is hot, pour the milk over the pasta. Add the butter, cheese, saltines, and seasonings. Stir until well combined. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with additional cheese. Bake uncovered in a pre-heated 350 degree oven until bubbly. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Heat butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add onions and cook until translucent and slightly browned around the edges, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and continue cooking for another 5 minutes or until onions are caramelized and very fragrant. Turn off the heat and spread the onions over the bottom half of the bread. Top with the steak and the blue cheese. Spread the mustard evenly over the top half of the bread and top with the other half of the bread. Cut the sandwich into 4 wedges and serve warm.

Cut the string cheese in half lengthwise. Beat the eggs with the milk. Coat the string cheese pieces in the flour. Dip the pieces in the egg mixture and coat with the bread crumbs. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the cheese pieces for 4 to 6 minutes or until browned and the cheese is melted. Drain on paper towels. Makes 16.
Name: Mixed Berry Pancakes
Name: Fresh Tomato and Basil Pizza
Name: Cream Cheese Chicken Tacos
Name: Sweet Potato Mash
Name: Blueberry and Strawberry Crumble

Preheat oven to 400f. Place biscuits into ungreased muffin cups or muffin tins. Press with fingers to cover bottoms and up sides of cups to form a bowl shape. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook hamburger until no longer pinkdrain fat. Add onion and brown sugar and cook until caramelized. Add the barbeque sauce and mix wellcook for 2 minutes longer. Spoon the mixture evenly into the prepared cups. Sprinkle each with cheese. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and allow to stand for 1 minute. Serve immediately. Makes 12 servings.

In a large bowl, combine couscous with garlic and sriracha sauce. Toss in parmesan cheese. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil. Add couscous mixture and toss constantly for 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a 1-quart glass measuring cup, stir together 1 cup flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. In a second 1-quart glass measuring cup, stir together 1 1/4 cups flour and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Sprinkle chicken with flour mixture. In a skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown. Place in 13 x 9 baking pan. Combine the flour mixtures and the paprika, garlic powder and onion powder. Sprinkle over the chicken. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes. Increase heat to 425f and bake for 15 minutes longer.

In a small bowl combine the pesto sauce mix, mayonnaise, breadcrumbs and provolone cheese. Add enough water to make a paste. In a small bowl combine the mushrooms with the salt and pepper and let stand for 10 minutes. In a large skillet heat 1/4 inch of olive oil until hot. Add the onions, mushrooms, garlic and saute until mushrooms are lightly browned, about 4 minutes. Add the chicken breasts and saute until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer the breasts to a platter. In the same skillet add the wine and saute until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the paste mixture and stir until smooth. Add the spinach and mushrooms and stir until the spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes. Arrange the chicken breast on a serving platter and drizzle the pesto sauce on top of the chicken. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Rub pork loin all over with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast in preheated oven for about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cut pork into slices. In a small bowl combine hoisin sauce, orange juice, chicken broth, sesame oil, green onions. Mix well. Pour over sliced pork. Serve.
Mash together avocados, salsa and pepper. Stir in a few teaspoons of garlic salt. Add more until you reach desired taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut lamb into 1-inch cubes and brown in a large skillet. Add water and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Add salt and peppercorns. Simmer covered 1 1/2 hours or until meat is very tender. Remove lamb from broth and set aside. Stir in parsley. Meanwhile, prepare the farikal. Blanch cabbage in boiling water until tender but not limp, about 20 minutes. Drain and cool. Peel away outer leaves and cut into 1/4-inch slices. Sauté with butter and garlic until crisp-tender. Stir in parsley and lemon juice. Place farikal in shallow bowl. Top with lamb and serve with sour cream.

Line a 12-inch baking sheet with wax paper. In a large bowl combine the peanuts, sunflower seeds, wheat germ and raisins. Set aside. In a saucepan, combine the brown sugar, corn syrup and vanilla. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter and the dry ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet. Allow to cool and cut into squares. Store in a tightly covered container.

In a tall glass filled with ice cubes, muddle 10 basil leaves with 1 ounce of the simple syrup, lime juice and rum. Top with soda water and stir well to combine. Garnish with the remaining basil leaves.

In a small saucepan combine the butter and water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then add the carrots and cook for 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally until the carrots are crisp tender. In a small bowl combine the mustard with the parsley, green onions and vinegarset aside until ready to serve. Drain the carrots and place them on a serving dishdrizzle the mustard mixture over the top.

In a large nonstick skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain the fat. Add the spaghetti sauce, spinach, oregano, basil, pepper and garlic powder. Bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile cook the ravioli according to the package directions until tender. Pour the meat sauce over the ravioli and top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Cook the quinoa according to the directions on the package. Bring 6 cups of water to a boil. Add 1 cup of the quinoa. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the remaining cup of the quinoa and simmer for another 5-10 minutes. Drain. Place the spinach in a large bowl. Add the lemon juice and olive oil. Toss to coat. Add the poppy seeds. Toss again. Add the cooked quinoa. Toss to blend. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter with apples, onions, salt and pepper. Cook until apples are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Cook 10 minutes. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Stir in cabbage and cook an additional 5 minutes. Thicken sauce with flour, adding a little water with the flour. Simmer a few minutes longer. Serve hot.

Preheat a grill to high. Remove any excess avocado flesh and place in a medium bowl. Add the lime juice and olive oil and mash with a fork until smooth. Season the mixture with the salt to taste and set aside. Brush the bread slices with the olive oil. Grill the bread for about 3 minutes per side until lightly browned. Remove the bread from the grill and spread with a thin layer of the avocado mixture. Sprinkle with the chopped ham and the cheese. Return to the grill and toast for about 2 minutes more. Slice the sandwiches in half.

Combine lean ground beef with ground ham, butter-flavored cracker crumbs and eggs. Shape into small meatballs and place in 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine cider vinegar, brown sugar and dry mustard with enough water to make thin glaze. Stir until sugar dissolves and pour over meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until done.

Boil the noodles with a little salt for about 3 minutes. Drain the noodles and rinse with cold water. To make the wasabi mayo, combine the wasabi paste and lemon juice with the soy and the mayonnaise. Mix the noodles with the wasabi mayo and the arugula. To make the tuna steaks, combine the soy and the wasabi paste in a bowl and marinate the fish for at least an hour. Grill the steaks or pan fry them until cooked through and brown on the outside. Top the noodles with the fish and a squeeze of lemon and serve.
Drain sardines. Combine all ingredients except carrots and melba toast. Chill for 30 minutes. Serve with melba toast and carrots.

In a small saucepan combine the wine and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and then add the gouda. Stir until melted and smooth. Sprinkle in the cornstarch and stir until thickened. Add the nutmeg and cayenne pepper. Remove from heat and serve in a fondue pot. Serve with crusty bread or vegetables.

Sprinkle cornstarch over the sugar. Add the salt and vanilla. Stir in the milk. Cook over medium heat until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold in the bananas. Turn into the pie crust. Chill. Whip the heavy cream until it forms peaks. Garnish the top of the pie with the whipped cream. Garnish with additional bananas.

In a large skillet, cook butter over medium heat. Add sausagecook until browned on all sides. Remove from panset aside. In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heatstir in flour and herbs. Stir in brothcook, stirring constantly, for 3-5 minutes or until thickened. Add wine, thyme, bay leaf, and marjorambring to a boil. Return sausages to skilletcook for 10 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heatsprinkle with chives before serving. Serves 6.

Place all vegetables and sweet potatoes in a large stockpot. Add all remaining ingredients except dill. Simmer uncovered for about three hours. Add dill during last fifteen minutes of cooking. Serve over cooked noodles. Makes eight servings.

Beat together first four ingredients in large bowl. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Shape into small balls. Place in greased miniature muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Remove from oven. Place one miniature peanut butter cup in the center of each. Let stand for 2 minutes. Remove from muffin cups and cool on wire racks. Store in airtight container.

Peel avocados and remove pits. Scoop out the flesh into a large bowl. Add the lemon juice. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the tomato, onion, jalapeno and salt. Gently fold the mixture together. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine the cornmeal and water in a large bowl. Cook until thickened and smooth (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Stir in the butter, salt, and eggs until well blended. Stir in the flour and baking soda until batter is smooth. Let batter stand 15 minutes. Heat waffle ironbrush with butter. Pour 1/2 cup batter onto ironcook until done. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately with butter and syrup.

Heat oil to 350 degrees F. Beat eggs lightly. Mix water and sugar in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in the salt and flour. Remove from heat. Gradually add in the eggs and beat until smooth. Beat in the lemon rind. Pour into a greased baking pan. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown. Drain. Cool. Cut into strips about 1 inch wide. In a heavy skillet melt shortening. Dip strips into shortening and fry in batches until golden brown. Drain. Roll in granulated sugar. Serve warm.

Combine first eight ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture just to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in dried cranberries and lemon zest. Pour into a 10 inch spring form pan. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine egg whites and ginger. Beat until stiff. Spread over cooled mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes or until mixture is set. Makes one pie (10 servings).

Combine the first four ingredients in a 2 quart saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients. Pour the mixture on wax paper and spread to cool. Cut into 24 squares and store in an airtight container.
Combine all ingredients in large mixing bowl. Refrigerate for up to 2 days. Serve with crackers.

Place bones, water, and ginger in a large stockpotbring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 to 2 hours or until bones are very tender and stock is aromatic. Strain the stock through a fine sieve, discarding the solids. (Note: The stock may be cooled completely and stored, covered, in the refrigerator or frozen for up to 3 months.) Reheat stock as necessary before serving.

Slice grapes in half. Combine fruit, cream cheese and cream. Spoon into grape leaves. Serves 8.
A very sweet, but not overly so. The fruit is a bit too ripe for my taste. I prefer the ones that are not so ripe. I prefer a more tart fruit. It is very good for a breakfast meal.

Combine the dry ingredients. Mix the wet ingredients together. Add the wet to the dry, stirring just to moisten. Turn the batter into two loaf pans that have been sprayed with nonstick spray and sprinkled with cornmeal. Cover the pans with plastic wrap or damp cloths and let rise in warm place for 30 minutes. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Cool on rack.

Melt margarine in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook until bubbles appear around the edges of the pot. Whisk in chicken bouillon and continue whisking until smooth. Add the salt and white pepper to taste. In a small bowl whisk together egg yolk and water. Add a few tablespoons of white sauce and whisk. Add this egg yolk mixture to the white sauce. Continue cooking over medium heat for a minute or two. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit. In an 11x16 inch rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with the salt and pepper and sugar and thyme until well-combined and evenly coated. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss gently to coat. Spread the tomatoes into an even layer and bake for an hour. Stir the tomatoes once halfway through the cooking time. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix together the flour, powdered sugar, butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer on low for 3 minutes. Add the instant pudding mix to the mixture and blend until smooth. Add the milk and continue blending until the mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture into the bottom of a 9x9 glass baking dish. Cover the top of the baking dish with foil and poke holes in the foil with a toothpick. Bake for 55 minutes at 350 degrees F. Once the pie has cooled, spread the Cool Whip over the top of the pie and sprinkle with the nuts.

Heat oil in heavy saucepan over low heat. Slice the mushrooms thinly and cook until soft. Stir in the water. Cook the mushrooms until all the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the milk powder, onion flakes and parsley flakes and cook until thickened. Whisk the flour with a little water until smooth. Stir into the pan. Cook until thickened and smooth. Stir in the sherry wine, salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with green onion tops.

In a large bowl, combine the lime juice, coriander leaves, garlic, ginger and chilies. Add the fish. Allow it to marinate for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a separate bowl combine the fish sauce, soy sauce and pepper. Thread the fish pieces onto skewers. Brush the skewers with the marinade mixture. Grill the skewers over a medium-high flame for 5 minutes per side until the fish is done. Serve with the pepper and coriander.

In a shallow dish, combine first 5 ingredients. Dip each chicken piece into the mixture. In a small bowl combine flour, paprika, parsley and soy sauce. Place in a shallow dish. Dip each chicken piece into flour mixture. Place in a baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until a thermometer reads 165 degrees. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Cook bear steak in a skillet until lightly browned on both sides. Place steak in a casserole dish and pour over the remaining ingredients. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 375f for about an hour or until tender.

Preheat oven to 350f. In medium bowl combine soup, water and garlic powder. Stir until thoroughly blended. Remove chicken from bonediscard bone. Cut chicken into bite size pieces. Fold chicken into soup mixture. Heat 12 inches of oil in deep fryer to 350f. or in large skillet to 350f. Heat oil. Fry 6 tortillas at a time in hot oil for 20 seconds on each side or until golden. Remove from oilplace on paper towels to drain. Place half the soup mixture in 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Top with half the chicken. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato for garnish. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs until foamy with a whisk or a rotary beater. Gradually beat in the corn syrup and brown sugar until well blended. Beat in the butter until smooth. Stir in the salt and vanilla extract until blended. Gently stir in the nuts until evenly coated. Pour into a greased and floured 9-inch unbaked pastry shell. Bake for 45 minutes or until set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack before serving.
Sugar in a pecan pie is about 126.78 g and the amount of protein in a 1 each serving is approximately 2.81 g.
Please refer to the nutrition facts label seen to the left for a full breakdown of complete nutrition found in a pecan pie . With a calorie count of 419.16kcal, a pecan pie is considered a High calorie food.
Obtained from the USDA Nutrient Database, the Nutrient

Take ice cream sandwiches and put into blender and blend for 20-30 seconds. Add cool whip, marshmallow cream, 1/2 bag of ice cream bars (cut into small pieces) and magic shell topping. Blend for 30 seconds. Pour into glasses or bowls and top with nuts. Freeze for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease a 9-inch square baking dish and set aside. Cook spinach in boiling water until wilted and drain well. Combine cottage cheese, eggs, nutmeg and salt and pepper in a large bowl and mix well. Add spinach and combine well. Drain any excess water from spinach and squeeze spinach in a clean kitchen towel to remove excess liquid. Fill each manicotti with approximately two tablespoons of mixture and roll up. Place in prepared dish seam side down and sprinkle with a little nutmeg and a pinch of Parmesan cheese. In a separate bowl combine tomato paste and water and set aside. In a saute pan over medium high heat add olive oil and saute onions until tender. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add spinach and cook until it wilts. Add tomato paste mixture and season with salt and pepper and cook until thickened. Pour over top of rolls and sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until b
Place all ingredients into a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Stir in the eggs. Beat until smooth. Pour into the pan. Combine the last 5 ingredientssprinkle evenly over the batter. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar. Serves 10.

Preheat the oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas Mark 6. Season the fish with salt and freshly ground black pepper and put into a shallow dish. Pour over the single cream and leave for 2 minutes. Place the cheddar on the top of the fillet in a layer of about an inch thick. Spread the coarse grain mustard on top of the cheddar in a layer about a quarter inch thick and top that layer of mustard with the chives. Now roll up the cod starting on one side of the fillet and rolling all the way up and over the other side of the fish. Wrap in cling film or foil and place in the fridge for 1 hour. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over a medium heat until hot but not smoking. Remove the cling film/foil from the cod and place it in the pan. Cook the cod for 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve the fish on a plate with some of the pan juices and a fresh salad of tomatoes and rocket.

In a large pot combine honey, water, vanilla bean (whole), cinnamon sticks, cloves (whole) and lemon zest. Bring to boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Let mixture cool for about an hour. Strain mixture through a sieve into a large bowl. Discard solids. Add vodka. Let mixture steep for 1 hour. Strain into a bottle or jar. Store in refrigerator for up to 1 month. Serve chilled.

Add first 7 ingredients to bread pan. Mix together with dough blade until a dough ball forms. Remove from machine and knead on lightly floured surface about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place back into bread pan and set on top of bread machine. Program for dough cycle. When cycle is complete remove dough from machine. Shape into loaf and place in greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Cover and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (about 1 hour). Bake at 375 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with butter. Sprinkle with remaining onion and cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Makes 1 loaf.

To make the roux, melt the butter in a heavy pot over medium heat. Add the flour and cook stirring constantly for 4 minutes until it is well blended and golden brown. Slowly stir in the chicken broth and whisk until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Remove the pot from the heat and whisk in the cream and cheese. Season with the white pepper and the white wine. In a heavy pot over medium heat melt the butter and add the chives and the lobster tails. Cook for about 3 minutes and turn the tails over and add the wine and the cream mixture. Simmer until the tails are tender. Serve over the pasta and sprinkle with chives.
I love lobsters! And I also love the idea of this recipe! Thank you!
I love the idea of this recipe! I'll be trying it soon!

Cut the mozzarella into 12 chunks. Place each chunk on one half of a bread slice and fold the other half over the top. Press edges together to seal. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and water. Spread the breadcrumbs in another shallow bowl. Dip the cheese pockets into the egg mixture, allowing excess to drip back in the bowl. Dredge in the breadcrumbs, turning to coat evenly and completely. In a large, heavy frying pan, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Working in batches, fry the pockets, turning once, until deep golden brown--about 4 minutes each side. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Serve hot.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drain pastacover to keep warm. Heat butter and oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add shallotsaut 1 minute. Add rice and cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add broth and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in pasta and bacon. Serve immediately.
Place yogurt in blender. Add cream cheese and blend until smooth. Add vanilla, sugar and extract and blend. Add strawberries and blend. Pour into crust. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

Pre-heat oven to 200 degrees C. Grate the potatoes and mix with the eggs and flour. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour the mixture onto a baking tray and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and turn the oven off. Leave the potato cake in the oven and allow to cool for 45 minutes. Slice the cake into 4 pieces. Spread the sour cream over the cake and sprinkle with the chives. Drizzle with the olive oil and serve warm.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease an 8-inch square pan or dish with butter or nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and cinnamon until evenly combined. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, milk, and salt until smoothadd the butter and whisk until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly into the corners and down the sides of the pan with the back of a spoon. Sprinkle the brown sugar mixture evenly over the top of the batter. Cut the apple into thin slices and arrange in a decorative pattern on top of the batterpress the slices gently into the batter to adhere. Bake until the batter is cooked through and golden and the topping is golden brown and crisp, about 35 minutes. Serve immediately with ice cream and maple syrup, if desired.

Heat hot water and add molasses and sugar until dissolved, then add yeast cake and let set for 10 minutes. Grease and lightly flour two loaf pans. Sift dry ingredients into yeast mixture and beat well for 2 minutes with electric mixer. Add shortening and raisins. Beat for another minute or two until all is well blended. Pour into loaf pans and let rise for one hour or until doubled in bulk. Bake at 375 for one hour or until done. Cool in pans for a few minutes and remove to racks to cool thoroughly.

In a 1-quart saucepan combine potatoes, onion, pepper and garlic. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain mixture, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid. Add bacon. Cook until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoonset aside. Add eggs to reserved cooking liquid. Cook over low heat until eggs are done to taste, stirring constantly. Stir in milk. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Add bacon. Pour into tortillas. Roll up. Garnish with salsa.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Lay chicken breasts in the bottom of the pan. Mix together the ginger, nutmeg, orange zest, apple juice, and pepper in a bowl. Pour over the chicken breasts. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix together the sweet potatoes, oil, salt, and pepper. Spread over the top of the chicken breasts. Bake 30 to 35 minutes longer.

Cut steak into thin strips. Combine soy sauce, sherry and cornstarch. Place steak and stir to cover well. Let marinade in refrigerator at least 1 hour. Cook broccoli according to package directions. Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in heavy skillet over high heat. Add ginger and garlic and stir-fry until tender. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add steak and stir until heated through. Remove from heat. Add remaining peanut oil and stir-fry until thickened. Serve over rice.

In a large pot over medium heat, warm the vegetable oil. Add the garlic and onion and saute until the onion is translucent. Add the carrot and saute until soft. Add the black beans and stock. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the cumin and simmer for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Clean the pumpkins thoroughly inside and out. Cut in half, remove the seeds and stringy pulp. Bake the halves cut side up in a shallow baking dish with the cut side up for about 45 minutes or until tender. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for at least an hour. Scoop out the pulp and puree it in a food processor or blender. Return it to the baking dish and stir in the butter, herbs, salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the chicken stock over the mixture and stir to combine. Place the halves cut side up in the oven for about an hour or until the pumpkin is thickened and bubbly. Serve hot or cool with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt. Makes about 3 cups.

Wash potatoes and zucchinipeel and cube potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. Cut zucchini into 1/4-inch cubesset aside. In large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add onionssaute 5 minutes or until golden. Stir in garlicsaute 2 minutes longer or until garlic is lightly browned. Stir in potatoessaute 5 minutes or until just tender. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon saltset aside. Beat eggs in medium bowl with remaining 1 tablespoon butter, flour, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir in potato mixture. Pour into greased 1-quart casserole dishsprinkle with zucchini cubes. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until lightly browned on top and knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
Thanks for this. I love zuc

Thaw spinach according to package directions. Squeeze out excess moisture from spinach in a paper towel. Chop spinach into bite size pieces in a food processor or blender. Mix all other ingredients together in a bowl. Gently fold in spinach. Chill 4 hours before serving. Serve with tortilla chips and/or baked pita wedges.

In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup water. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine broth, ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch mixture. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown pork chops on both sides. Remove from skillet. In the same skillet, saute green bell pepper and onion in butter until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and pineapple. Add broth mixture to pan. Bring to a boil. Stir in cornstarch mixture and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Add pork chops and warm through.

Cream shortening and 1/2 cup of the sugar until light and fluffyadd egg and beat 1 minute at medium speed of electric mixeradd remaining 1/2 cup sugar and beat until well blendedadd milk and buttermilkbeat at medium speed for 2 minutesadd vanilla and mix until well blendedadd flours alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with flourbeat at low speed just until blendedfold in nutsturn dough onto lightly floured boardknead lightly about 2 minutes or until smoothplace in lightly greased bowlcover with waxed paper and towellet rise in warm place about 45 minutes or until doubled in bulkturn dough onto lightly floured boarddivide in halfroll each half into 12x6 inch rectanglesprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugarroll up jellyroll fashion beginning at short endscut into 12 slicesplace 1 inch apart on greased baking sheetscover with towelslet rise until doubled in bulk about 30

Combine the tuna and egg. Add the mayonnaise. Add the onions and the celery seeds. Season with the mustard. Chill for 3 hours. Serve on bread.
This is a great recipe for those who love tuna and want a different recipe.

Cook shells in water until tender. Drain. Stir in can of condensed tomato soup. Stir in whipping cream & velveeta cheese. Stir over med-low heat until melted. Add butter & stir. Season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt & pepper. Serve warm. Serves 4-6.

Drain the tofu of excess water. Slice the tofu into thin strips. In a bowl, mix together tamari, water, five-spice powder, star anise and molasses. Place tofu strips in a non-stick skillet and pour over mixture. Cook over medium heat until tofu is crisp and brown, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.

Place chicken breasts in a large Ziploc bag and pour in lemon juice. Add in italian seasoning and mix well to coat chicken evenly. Add in olive oil and mix well again. Seal bag and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Remove from refrigerator and place in marinade in a shallow dish. Remove chicken from marinade and place on a broiling pan or grilling rack. Grill until juices run clear and no longer pink. Serve with lemon slice.

Preheat oven to 220C/425F. Season fish with salt and pepper. Whisk together the mustard and vinegar. Lightly coat the bottom of a shallow baking pan with 1 Tbsp. oil. Lay the fish in a single layer in the pan and brush with the mustard mixture. Sprinkle with the paprika. Spread the remaining oil over the top of the fish. Bake for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.

Peel kumara and cut into cubes. Place cubes into a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and simmer until tender - about 25-30 minutes. Mash with a little butter and low-fat milk. Heat olive oil in a frying pan and saute brown onion, zucchini and yellow squash until just tender. Season with salt and pepper and set aside to cool. Heat a little more olive oil in frying pan and cook lamb steaks to preference. Slice into thin strips and arrange over mash. Top with sauteed vegetables and serve with green salad.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Drain again and cut the potatoes in half. Preheat the broiler. Drain the water from the avocados. Mash them with a fork. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Spoon the mixture into the center of the cut sides of the potatoes. Broil the potatoes until the avocado mixture is hot and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Cook the couscous according to the package directions. Add the plums and scallions. Remove from the heat. Let sit for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the goat cheese. Stir gently to combine. Garnish with the mint. Drizzle with the honey and balsamic vinegar. Season to taste with the salt and pepper.

In a large skillet cook pork chops in oil over medium heat. Add green pepper. Stir in tomato sauce and vinegar. Mix well. Simmer uncovered about 5 minutes. Add crushed pineapple. Cook uncovered 2 more minutes. Serve over rice with celery.

Cream butter and brown sugar. Beat in egg and add vanilla. Stir together flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add to creamed mixture. Stir in raisins and peanuts. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 425 for 8-10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut potatoes in halves or quarters. Combine oil, black pepper and Herbes de Provence in a large bowl. Add potatoes and toss to coat evenly. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for about 1 hour or until tender. Remove from oven. Serves 4 to 6.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Sprinkle the whole wheat flour into the skillet and stir constantly, being careful not to brown the flour. When the flour is just beginning to brown, add the shiitake mushrooms. Stir and saute for about 5 minutes. Add the thyme and stir. Add the stock, soy sauce, and vinegar. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook the mixture for about 20 minutes, or until the stock has reduced by about half. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Lightly coat the tortilla with butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Fold in half lengthwise and cut in half. In a bowl mix cool whip and honey. Spread on inside of tortilla halves. Place a piece of banana on top and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Top with the other half of the tortilla and serve immediately.
Brown beef with soup mix in skillet until no longer pink. Add tomatoes, simmer for 15 minutes or until noodles are tender. Serve over cooked macaroni.

In a small bowl combine the butter, sugar, eggs, flour, and chili powder. Mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until firm on the outside and still gooey on the inside. Cool completely on wire racks. Yields 2 dozen bites

Boil water. Cook pasta according to package directions. Cook cauliflower in boiling water 5 minutes. Drain. Heat olive oil in a small saucepan. Add garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add pasta to cauliflower. Add olive oil mixture to pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

In a saucepan over medium heat, add the chicken broth, ham and mustard powder. Heat the mixture until it begins to simmer. Remove from heat and set aside. To assemble the sandwiches, place one slice of ham in the center of an english muffin. Top with half an egg and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheddar cheese. Drizzle with the mustard-ham mixture and top with remaining egg and 2 tablespoons cheddar cheese. Place the second half of the english muffin on top and press down gently. Place the muffins in a greased 13x9-inch baking dish and pour the remaining mustard mixture over the top. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons cheddar cheese. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve warm with salad and cream sauce.
Fried chicken and egg sandwichesFried chicken and egg sandwichesFried chicken and egg sandwichesFried chicken and egg sandwichesFried chicken and egg sandwichesFried chicken and egg sandwiches

Bring broth to a boil in a Dutch oven. Stir in barley. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook until tender about 30 minutes. Add onion and cranberries. Cover and cook 5 minutes or until cranberries are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in sage. Let cool. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine broth, barley mixture and almonds in a 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Place turkey on top. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley.
name: roasted turkey breastingredients: turkey breasts, salt, fresh thyme, fresh sage, fresh marjoram, fresh parsley, lemon juice, butterpreparation:Rinse turkey breasts and pat dry. Place in shallow baking pan. Rub with salt and thyme. Add sage, marjoram and parsley. Toss to coat well. Pour over lemon juice. Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for 1 1/

Bring stock to a boil in medium saucepan. Add bok choy. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly. Separate wonton wrappers. Place 1 teaspoon of filling in center of each wrapper. Dip fingers in water and moisten wrapper edges. Fold over to form triangles. Add wontons to stock. Bring back to a boil. Coverreduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve with sesame oil.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add potatoes, cover and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in salsa and cheese until cheese is melted and blended with potatoes. Remove from heat and let stand for 3 minutes before serving.
17/04/17 .Reading time 5 minutes.
20/01/17 .Reading time 1 minute.
Cream cheese and sugar together. Add vanilla and eggs and beat until smooth. Pour into pie crust and bake for about 1 hour at 350 f. Cool. Spread with frangelico icing.

Mix together all the ingredients for the burger in a large bowl. Mix until just blended. Form into patties about 3/4-inch thick. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place the burgers into the skillet and fry for about 3 minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside. Remove from the skillet. Layer the burgers onto the buns and top each one with feta cheese slices and fresh basil leaves. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Beat eggs lightly. Beat in syrup, brown sugar, and lemon peel and juice. Combine flour and pecans. Stir into egg mixture. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shell. Bake 55 minutes or until firm in center and golden brown on edges. Cool and refrigerate. Garnish with whipped cream before serving.

In large skillet over medium-high heat, brown ground beef and pork sausage until no longer pink. Transfer to large bowl and set aside. In same skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion in butter until tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes and waterheat through. Stir in browned meat mixtureheat through. Spoon meat mixture into a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine potatoes, milk and margarine in a saucepanheat through, stirring constantly. Stir in parsleypour over meat mixture in baking dish. Sprinkle with cheesesbake at 350° for 30 minutes. Uncoverbake an additional 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender and cheese is melted. Yield: 12 servings.

Mix margarine and sugar in bowl. Add eggs one at a time beating after each one. Stir in vanilla and milk. Sift together the dry ingredients and add them alternately with the sour cream to the margarine mixture. Stir in the nuts if using. Pour into a greased and floured bundt pan or tube pan. Bake at 325 for one hour or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle of the loaf. Cool for at least 10 minutes in the pan before removing from pan and cooling completely before frosting or wrapping in wax paper and freezing for later use.

Melt butter in the microwave and allow to cool. Beat in the sugars and vanilla. Beat in the egg and then the flour. Stir in the spices. Place in the refrigerator to chill for at least one hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Dip the bottoms of the cookies in powdered sugar.

In a large mug combine the dark rum and sugar syrup with some freshly grated nutmeg and a dash of cinnamon. Heat the water and pour it into the mug along with the cinnamon stick. Top with a dollop of butter and serve immediately.

Combine all in a small bowl. Rub the ribs and let marinate for at least one hour. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees f. Place the ribs on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour. Flip the ribs over and continue baking for another hour. If you want a crispier texture, you can broil the ribs on high heat for a few minutes.

In a medium bowl, combine the cucumbers, red onions, chilies, dried shrimp and fish sauce, tossing well to combine. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, sugar and peanut oil and stir until well blended. Taste the dressingyou may need to add a bit more fish sauce if you prefer a more concentrated flavor. Toss the cucumber mixture with the dressing until well coated. Refrigerate the salad for at least an hour before serving. When ready to serve, garnish with the roasted peanuts.

Combine coconut and sugar in a small bowlstir to coat well. Set aside.In medium saucepan combine milk and egg yolksstir well. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens and coats spoon. Remove from heatstir in vanilla.Combine coconut mixture and milk mixturepour into pie shellplace on baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 12 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.Cool on wire rack for 1 hour. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Brush each phyllo sheet lightly with melted butter and sprinkle with some of the cheese mixture. Roll up each phyllo sheet. Place on prepared cookie sheet. Sprinkle with cheese mixture and repeat the process with the remaining phyllo sheets. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until lightly browned on top. Remove from oven, drizzle with lemon juice, and serve immediately.

In medium bowl combine pineapple chunks with apples and celery. Add kiwi fruit, grapes and walnutstoss to combine. In small bowl combine yogurt, honey and mustardstir well. Add yogurt mixture to fruit mixturestir to coat evenly. Coverrefrigerate at least 3 hours before serving. Serve on bed of lettuce or as is. Makes 6 servings.
I like to use a mix of greens for my Waldorf salad: romaine, chicory and escarole (or chicory & endive). I also like to add sliced almonds to the fruit mixture rather than nuts.
The original recipe for Waldorf Salad is in the cookbook from the Waldorf Hotel in NYC from 1895.
I like to use a mix of greens for my Waldorf salad: romaine, chicory and escarole (or chicory & endive). I also like to add sliced almonds to the fruit mixture rather than nuts. The original recipe for Waldorf Salad is in the cook

Preheat the oven to 375f. In a bowl combine the spinach, egg, cheese, basil, oregano and garlic salt to taste. Spread the mixture onto a floured baking sheet or pizza pan. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the crust is golden. Cut into 8 slices.

Sift together the wheat and cracked wheat. Sift in cornmeal and soya flour. Rub in margarine. In a small pan, heat water and buttermilk. Sprinkle in yeast and stir to dissolve. Add to mixture. Mix to a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 10 minutes. Place in a lightly greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Leave in a warm place to rise for 1 hour. Divide dough into 8 equal portions and form into a ball. Roll out each ball to a 12 inch circle. Brush with melted margarine and sprinkle with mixed herbs and sea salt. Roll up from one end. Place in a greased baking dish and cut into 3 inch rounds. Cover with a damp cloth and leave to rise for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350f. Bake for 15 minutes. Brush tops with melted margarine and sprinkle with sea salt. Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from

Mix soy sauce with orange marmalade and garlic clove. Place country-style spareribs in bottom of 3 or 4 quart crock pot. Pour 1/2 cup ketchup over the top. Pour soy sauce mixture over the top. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

Soak dates in hot water for about 15 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. Pulse dates in food processor until coarse crumbs form. Add remaining ingredients except walnut halvesprocess until smooth. Spoon into walnut halves and serve immediately or cover and refrigerate up to 2 days. Yields 2 servings.

In a 5-quart stockpot, heat the broth to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts, reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the chicken from the stockpot and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the vegetables, garlic and oreganosaute for 4 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir the salsa into the vegetables until blended. Season to taste with the cayenne. Add the pasta to the stockpot and stir to combine. Add the chicken to the stockpot along with the salsa mixturestir to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Stir the parsley into the soup just before serving.

In a large stock pot, saute the onions and garlic in a small amount of oil for 2-3 minutes. Add the carrots. After 2-3 minutes, add the broth and the tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Add the beans. Reduce the heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes. Serve.

In a blender puree the tomato, onion and cilantro. Add the juice from the lime and the jalapeño. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes before serving. Serve with chips or use as topping for chicken or fish.

Peel off stem and seeds from red bell peppers. Cut each into four quarters. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic clove and saut for 2 minutes. Add basil leaves and saut for 1 minute. Add spring onions and saut for another 1 minute. Add tomato, sugar, salt and pepper. Cook over medium high heat for 15 minutes or until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Spoon mixture into bell peppers. Place in an oven safe dish. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Serve.
Toss together all ingredients. Chill. Serve.

1) Mix the biscuits in a large bowl with a bit of cold water until they form a fine paste.2) Add the ground hazelnuts, ground almonds and rice flour until well mixed.3) Divide the paste into 20 equal pieces and form them into balls with your hands.4) Put a ball in the freezer for 10 minutes, then coat it in hazelnuts and dark chocolate.5) Melt the frangelico and pour 1 drop onto each chocolate covered ball.6) Place the chocolate balls back into the freezer for 5 minutes to set.7) Serve immediately on a plate.

Melt margarine in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients except chops. Pour over margarine. Arrange chops over the top. Cover with foil. Bake at 325 F. for 1-1/2 hours. Remove foil and bake an additional 15 minutes. Serves 4-5.

Brown chicken in a small amount of hot vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet. Place onion, bell pepper in skillet. Add picante sauce. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. To assemble, place a small amount of Spanish rice on each flour tortilla. Place chicken mixture on top. Roll up burrito-style. Place in 13 x 9 baking pan. Cover with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Cool slightly before serving. Serve with picante sauce.

In a medium size bowl add gelatin and boiling water. Let stand for one minute. Stir in milk and pudding until well blended. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Cut into shapes using a cookie cutter. To make the sprinkles for the bunny noses put some green food coloring in a bowl and dip the end of a lollipop stick in the food coloring and stick it into the bunny nose.
This entry was posted on Thursday, February 14th, 2008 at 12:21 am and is filed under Uncategorized. You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed. You can leave a response, or trackback from your own site.
In a blender or food processor add all ingredients except sesame seeds. Blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl and stir in sesame seeds. This is a great dressing for a variety of salads.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In 10-inch ovenproof skillet, saute bacon over medium heat until crisp, turning once. Remove bacon and drain all but 2 tablespoons fat from skillet. Add butterheat until melted. Add chops and saute until browned. Remove from skillet to plate. Add onion and garlic to skilletcook 2 minutes or until tender. Stir in sauerkrautcook 1 minute. Add baconstir to mix well. Return chops to skilletstir to coat with sauerkraut mixture. Pour beer over chopssprinkle with salt and pepper. Coverbake 30 minutes or until juice is almost gone.
I have only seen this recipe for Sauerkraut Chicken in one place and that was in The New York Times. I have been searching for this recipe for 2 years now because it was delicious. This is what I found.
1/2 cup of caraway seeds ( I only used 1/4 cup)
1/2 teaspoon of fresh ground black

Preheat oven to 450deg. Lightly coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Coat fillets with seasoning salt and place on baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes. Meanwhile combine sugar, flour and butter in saucepan and cook over medium-low heat until bubbly and thickened. Add mayonnaisestir until smooth. Remove fish from oven and brush with butter mixture. Bake 5 minutes more or until fish flakes easily. In a bowl beat egg yolks and rind until thickenedfold in yolks. Stir in egg whites and parsleyspread over fish and bake 5 minutes longer or until set and browned in spots. Cool slightly. Refrigerate any remaining toppingreheat before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Cut the kefalotyri into 1/4 inch cubes. Add the cubes to a small frying pan over high heat. Add the butter. Cook for a minute or two or until the butter is melted. Add a few drops of lemon juice and the cubes will bubble. Serve over crusty french bread. Serves 1-2.

Combine the oil, garlic, and honey in a small bowl and stir until well mixed. Add the vinegar and stir until well mixed again. Add the salt and pepper and stir until well mixed again. Add the lamb chops to the marinade and toss well to coat both sides of the meat. Allow to marinate for at least 20 minutes and no more than 4 hours at room temperature. Heat the grill to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Grill the lamb chops for 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium doneness. Turn once or twice during the cooking time. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a 3 quart baking dish combine hashbrowns and sour cream. In a small bowl mix soup with the milk and melted butter. Stir into the potatoes. Sprinkle with 1 cup of the cheese. Bake for 40 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with krispies and bake for 5 minutes more. Cool 10 minutes before cutting.
Place onion soup mix and water in crock pot, stir well. Add onion and place pork chops on top of onions. Cook on low for 6-8 hours until meat is tender. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a small bowl, combine the garlic, mozzarella cheese, and butter. Split each biscuit into two pieces, forming a layered effect. Brush each split biscuit with the garlic cheese mixture. Place in an 8x8-inch square baking dish and bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.
I have to admit that I am not much of a bread person, I like to eat it but don't like to make it. I make garlic toast for my husband who likes it very much. I have some french bread that is almost gone and I wondered if I could make this toast with that. I don't think it will turn out because it is very dry already and it is just getting dryer the longer it stays in the cupboard. Any suggestions?
This is an easy recipe that you can do with kids. I know my kids love to make this recipe for me.

Preheat a grill or a broiler to high. Whisk yogurt in a medium bowl to break up lumps. Stir in honey. Season to taste with salt. Lay out 4 small plates. Place 1 fig half on each plate. Top each half with a spoonful of yogurt. Place fig halves cut side up on a baking sheet. Brush lightly with olive oil. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 30 to 45 seconds per side, or until lightly browned. Remove from broiler. Drizzle with honey. Sprinkle with toasted hazelnuts. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle flour over peeled and sliced peach halves. Add brown sugar, butter, vanilla and cinnamon. Bake at 400F for 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Serve with vanilla ice cream if desired.

In a skillet, saute the onion in the butter until soft. Add the peas, salt and cream and bring to a boil. Cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Stir in the ham. Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling water until al dente. Drain the pasta and add it to the sauce. Toss together gently to blend. Serve sprinkled with parmesan.
The information given above is intended to be general. Any individual may react differently to the information provided. If you have any concerns about your own health or the health of your child, please always consult your own General Practitioner or health care provider.

Beat margarine and brown sugar till light and fluffy. Beat in graham cracker crumbs. Press mixture into 13x9 inch pan. Beat cream cheese till smooth. Add milk and syrup. Fold in whipped cream. Spread over crust. Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Top with whipped topping and fresh blueberries.
Pour 1 shot espresso coffee into a cappuccino cup. Add milk to make a latte. Add 2 teaspoons of cocoa powder. Pour 1 teaspoon of pure maple syrup into it. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill. Brush peppers with 1 tablespoon of oil. Grill peppers over medium heat for about 10 minutes, turning once until peppers are tender. Remove peppers from grill and cool for about 10 minutes. When peppers are cool enough to handle, peel peppers. Chop into small pieces. In small bowl combine peppers, 2 tablespoons of oil, garlic, worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, red wine vinegar. Mix well. Place lettuce in large serving bowl. Top with pepper mixture. Top with crumbled feta cheese. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons of oil. Serve immediately.

Cut 4 garlic cloves into slivers. Melt 2 tsp. butter in small saucepan. Stir in garlic slivers and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heatcool. Butter both sides of 4 slices sourdough bread. Place 2 slices buttered side down in 12-inch skillet. Layer with 2 cups shredded Parmesantop with 1/2 cup garlic mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Place another slice buttered side down. Top with 1 cup Swiss cheesespread 1/2 cup mozzarella over top. Top with 2 cups shredded Parmesansprinkle with parsley. Top with remaining slice buttered side down. Add 1/2 cup garlic mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Top with remaining Swiss cheesespread 1/4 cup mozzarella over top. Top with 1/2 cup Parmesan. Sprinkle with parsley. Cook over medium heat for 4 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Turn and cook 3 to 4 minutes

In a bowl sift together flour, sugar, cocoa and baking powder. Add shortening and salt and stir until crumbly. Add milk and stir until just moistened (batter will be slightly lumpy). Divide into two equal parts and place in two mini-muffin cups (greased or lined with paper liners). Bake in mini-muffin cups in Easy Bake Oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 18 - 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack.

Slice lemon. Add juice and sugar to blender. Whirl until smooth. Add half-and-half and blend. Add pineapple and whirl again. Pour into freezer can. Freeze until firm. Whip whipping cream with sugar. Spoon over sherbet. Freeze again until firm. Serve with berries.

Mix butter and brown sugar together. Spread evenly over bottom of 9 x 13 baking dish. Arrange peaches on top. Mix together yellow cake mix, instant pudding mix, sour cream, oil, and vanilla extract. Spread over top of the peaches. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool 20 minutes. Run a knife around edge of pan to loosen. Invert onto serving dish. Let cool. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Cut off top of each squash and discard top. Cut each half lengthwise and scoop out seeds and pulp from inside of each half. Mix sugar, flour, salt and spices together in a bowlmix in orange rind and nuts. Spoon filling into each squash half and bake for 30 minutes, or until squash is tender. Makes 2 servings.

Cut the kielbasa into 1/2 inch thick slices and brown in skillet. Remove from pan and add onion and celery to the skillet with 2 tablespoons of water. Cook until soft. Add green pepper and cook for another minute. Add Cajun seasoning and bay leaf and cook for about 30 seconds more. Add the broth and stewed tomatoes and bring to a boil. Add the kielbasa and rice and stir to mix well. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in parsley and serve

Bring 6 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Add 1 tsp of salt. Add pastacook until al dente. Drainreserve 1/2 cup of cooking liquid. Heat 2 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, chilescook 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in zucchini, oreganocook 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoescook 2 minutes or until softened. Add chicken brothcook 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup of the reserved cooking liquidcook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Stir in reserved pastatoss to coat. Top with cheese.

Wash and scrub the outside of the new potatoes. Place into pot and cover with cold water. Add in 2 tablespoons salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook intil just fork tender. Remove to a bowl and cool to room temperature. Slice the cooled potatoes in half. Add in green onions and sliced eggs. Toss to combine. In a small or medium bowl bowl combine the sour cream with sugar, garlic powder, fresh dill and seasoned salt. Pour over the potatoes and toss to combine. Season with black pepper to taste if desired. Chill for a minimum of 3 or more hours before serving.

Pound the chicken breasts with the flat side of a knife until thin. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the sherry, dry mustard and paprika. Combine the chicken and the sherry mixture thoroughly. Stir in the mayonnaise. Add the onions and hot sauce. Chill for several hours or overnight. Spread onto toasted crackers and garnish with dill.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain. In a large skillet, heat the oil. Add the asparagus and cook over moderate heat until crisp-tender, 4-5 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add the pasta, lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt and the seasoning. Cook over moderately low heat, tossing until heated through, about 1 minute. Transfer the pasta to a large bowl. Add the pine nuts. Toss lightly. Serve the pasta warm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix flour and butter together with a pastry blender. Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Beat the cream cheese, powdered sugar, pudding mixes, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Spread the mixture on top of the baked crust. Sprinkle the top with the chopped pecans. Melt the chocolate candy bars in the microwave oven. Spread the melted chocolate evenly over the top. Refrigerate until set. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Mix pork with eggs, skim milk, dijon-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, kosher salt, black pepper and bread crumbs in a large bowl. Stir in parsley.Divide into four equal portions. Press each portion into a 4 x 4 inch square pan. Bake until no longer pink in the center and a thermometer reads 165 degrees F (75 degrees C), about 45 minutes.Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.Wrap each portion of pork in 4 slices of bacon. Bake in the oven until the bacon is crisp and no longer pink in the center.Serve in place of regular pork loin.

Prepare and cook refried beans according to package directions. Heat vegetable oil in frying pan. Fry onions in hot oil for approximately one minute. Add beans to frying pan and cook for about three minutes. Cook for about three minutes. Heat flour tortillas in microwave for about two minutes. Fill each with beans and onions. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Roll each tortilla and place in baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for about ten minutes. Serve with lettuce and salsa.

In a large skillet, saute onion and seasoning in butter for 3-4 minutes or until tender. Cut zucchini and yellow squash into 1/4 inch slices. Place onion mixture and breadcrumbs into a large bowlstir in cheese and set aside. Beat eggs in another bowl. Combine egg mixture with bread crumb mixture and stir well to combine. Gently stir in zucchini and yellow squash. Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and place over medium high heat. Drop mixture by tablespoons into skillet. Brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar sauce or butter or salsa or whatever you want to eat it with.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut up all veggies and mix into turkey. Add remaining ingredients. Form into 4 loaves and bake for 50 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the hamburger and onion for about 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Stir in the garlic cloves. In a bowl, combine the tomato soup, tomato sauce, cream of chicken soup, milk, and egg noodles. Add to hamburger mixture and mix well. Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until bubbly and brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle tenderloin with salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, ginger. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heatadd pork. Cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer pork to a 5-quart slow cooker coated with cooking spray. Add pineapple chunks and juice, soy sauce, and dried cranberriesstir gently. Cover and cook on low heat setting until pork is tender, about 4 hours.

Place water in pot. Place ramen noodles in water for about 5 minutes or until noodles are soft. Drain noodles. Add ketchup and butter. Combine. Spray 8 x 8 pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place noodles in pan. Top with american cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with bread.
This is the best recipe I have found for stew. My family loves it.
I love this recipe. My husband loves it. My son loves it. I will make this all winter.
This was pretty good but my family likes it spicier.
My kids love this. I'm going to double the recipe next time.
Great recipe. I use the barley instead of rice.
This was ok but nothing special. My family didn't like it.
We like this. It's pretty good.
This is a very good recipe. I like the sage at the end.

Heat olive oil in large skillet. Cook garlic about 1 minute, or until tender. Add chicken stock, turkey leg meat, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add greens to skillet, cover and simmer 20 minutes. Add crushed red pepper flakes to taste. Serve with cornbread.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, cream the butter with the sugars until well blended. Add the eggs one at a time until they are well blended. Add the vanilla and blend well. Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and blend well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop the dough by the tablespoon onto a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Do not over bake. Allow the cookies to cool on the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Mix ground beef with egg. Then add mashed potatoes. Form into 4 patties. Fry in lots of butter. Serve with fried eggs. And fried potatoes. You can also add pickled beet to the potato mix. You can also fry the burgers in olive oil. And add onion to the mix. Or you can add chopped garlic to the mix.

Place the oil in a large skillet. Saute the garlic and onion until soft, about 5 minutes. Stir in the mushrooms, and continue to saute until they are soft, about 5 to 8 minutes more. Remove from the heat. Pour the milk into the skillet. Add the mushrooms, onion, garlic, pork chops, soup, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then cover the pan, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat, fry the onion with a small amount of olive oil until the onion is softened. Add chorizo sausage to the skillet with the onion. Continue cooking, stirring often until the sausage is browned. Add half-and-half to the skillet. Simmer until almost all of the liquid has evaporated. Then add 1 teaspoon dried oregano to the sausage mixture, stirring to combine. Make 4 wells in the sausage mixture and crack in an egg into each well. Cook until the whites are set but yolks are still slightly runny. Serve with tortillas for dipping.

In a wok or deep frying pan heat the olive oil. Add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add the chicken breasts to the pan, cook for 3 minutes each side. Add the lemon rind, capers and lemon juice. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Toss the basil through and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and cream of tartar in a large bowlset aside. Cream margarine in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in the sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and orange zest until well-blended. Stir in the flour mixture, lemon zest, and vanilla extract until a stiff dough is formed. Divide dough into 8 partsroll each part into a 6 inch circle on a lightly floured surface. Place dough circles on ungreased cookie sheetsprick each circle with a fork. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until set in the center. Let cookies cool for 5 minutes before removing them from cookie sheets.Store in an airtight container. Makes 8 large cookies.
Vanilla wafers are a favorite treat for many people. Vanilla wafer cookies are crumbly and soft, and they’re a perfect snack for just about any time of day

Heat oil and butter in frypan over medium heat. Add beef and cook for about 3 minutes each side until browned. Add red wine and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until beef is tender. Drain off any excess liquid. Meanwhile steam asparagus for 2 to 3 minutes until tender but crisp. Combine mayonnaise and avocado dip to form dressing. Place beef and asparagus on lettuce leaves and drizzle dressing over. Serve with herb sprigs and nasturtium petals.

Beat egg and buttermilk in a large bowlstir in brown sugar and margarine. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltstir into egg mixture just until moistened. Stir in oats and blueberries. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes.
Mix together all the ingredients. Taste and add salt and pepper to your liking. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Cook noodles as directed. In a skillet saute garlic and onion in butter until soft. Add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink. Sprinkle in flour. Add water and bouillon. Stir. Add sour cream, pepper. Serve over hot noodles.

Preheat broiler. Pierce 2 small holes at the bottom of each tomato half using a toothpick or sharp knife. Place tomato halves on a foil-lined baking sheet. Stir together the olives and minced garlic. Sprinkle the mixture over the top of each tomato half. Drizzle each half with a teaspoon of olive oil. Broil for 3 minutes on each side or until the tomato is just tender and the garlic is golden. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
name: tomato-garlic sauceingredients: tomato juice, onion, red bell peppers, red wine vinegar, canola oil, dried oregano, dried basil, garlic cloves, red wine vinegarpreparation:In a medium saucepan over medium heat, saute onion in oil until softened. Add red bell pepperscook until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes or until sauce thickens. Pour into a food processor or bl

Crush cookies and combine with melted butter. Press onto bottom and up sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Freeze. In a small bowl, combine peanuts and 2 tablespoons of the fudge sauce. Set aside. Beat the remaining fudge sauce with the coffee liqueur until smooth. Fold in ice cream. Spoon into pan. Top with the reserved peanut mixture. Freeze until firm. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes. Garnish with peanut butter cups. Serve immediately.
Sooo good! I've made these before and they are wonderful. I'm going to try the Peanut Butter Pie next.
I'm going to make them tomorrow and I can't wait! I'm also going to try the chocolate peanut butter cake.
I made the Peanut Butter Pie and it was so good! I'm going to make the Chocolate Peanut Butter Cake tomorrow.
I made the Peanut Butter Pie and it was so good!
I made the Chocolate Pean

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg yolk. Gradually add flour and baking sodamix just until combined. Divide dough in halfwrap each half in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 1 hour or until dough is easy to handle. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll dough 1/2 inch thick on a lightly floured surfacecut with a 2 inch cookie cutter. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are golden brown. Let cool completely on wire racks. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 5 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Sift flour, cornmeal, baking soda and salt into a large bowl. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add sugar and eggs, stirring until well combined. Stir in applesauce. Pour into a lightly greased 10-inch cast-iron skillet. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cornbread comes out clean. Cool slightly before slicing.

Cook the pasta as directed on package. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic. Cook until golden. Add the pesto, pine nuts, and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Cook for 2 minutes. Toss the pasta with the pesto mixture. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Serve immediately.

Brown onions in oil. Add beef stewing meat, green peppers, tomatoes, chili powder, sultanas, sugar, salt and pepper. Cook over low heat until meat is tender. Divide the mixture among 10 egg halves. Garnish with sliced onion or shredded cabbage.

Pare and cut pears in half and remove cores. Cut each half into 6 slices. Combine lemon juice and zest in a small saucepan. Add pears and cook over medium-low heat until tender and softened, about 30 minutes. Remove pears from lemon mixture. Stir in butter, brown sugar, and cream. Cook until hot, stirring frequently. Season with vanilla and whisky. Serve warm pears over sauce.
