Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in the bread crumbs. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and add the water. Mix into the dry ingredients until a soft dough forms. Drop by the spoonful into boiling water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Drain the dumplings, and place them on a baking sheet in the oven for 20 minutes.
Dumpling is an old-fashioned word for food that is made by wrapping other foods in pastry, especially meat and vegetables wrapped in suet pastry and boiled, often in a stock.
Dumpling is also called “jiaozi” in Chinese, which is the most popular food in Chinese people’s daily life. There are two main kinds of dumpling in China, one is meat stuffed dumpling and another is vegetable stuffed dumpling.
Dumpling is one of the most important food in China, especially in the North.
Dumpling is one of the most important food in China, especially

In a large mixing bowl combine all-purpose flour and sweetened cocoa powder. In a separate bowl combine milk and eggs. Beat well. Add flour and egg mixture to mixing bowl and stir well. Heat cooking oil in a skillet over medium heat. Ladle batter into the skillet. Cook each crepe until it is cooked through and flip over to cook the other side. Serve immediately with desired toppings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Melt the butter. Mix the cracker crumbs with the eggs and milk. Add the salt and pepper. Add the Tabasco and mix well. Place the scallops in a casserole dish. Pour the egg mixture over the scallops. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy, add egg and vanilla. Mix well. Gradually add in the dry ingredients and beat until just blended. Fold in white chocolate chips and drop on greased cookie sheet or greased parchment paper. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes, until edges are lightly golden brown. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners. In a medium bowl, combine the chocolate chips and butter. Heat in the microwave for 30 seconds. Stir until smooth. Remove from the microwave and set aside to cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, salt, and eggs. Beat on medium speed until smooth and well combined. Add the vanilla extract and 1/2 cup of the chocolate mixture. Beat until well combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Use a spoon to drop about a tablespoon of the remaining chocolate mixture into the center of each muffin. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until the edges of the muffin are lightly browned and the centers are slightly soft. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Transfer the muffins to a wire rack and allow to cool completely.

In a medium bowl combine cream cheese, condensed milk and juice concentrate. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon mixture into crust. Chill at least 3 hours. Garnish with orange peel if desired.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. To serve, place in individual bowls and garnish with parsley. Serve as desired.
Name: Creamy Salad Dressing ChickenIngredients: 1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup sour cream, 2 teaspoons grated lemon peel, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 2 teaspoons sugar, 2 teaspoons mustard, salt, pepperPreparation: Cube the chicken breasts. In shallow bowl or dish, combine the milk, sour cream, lemon peel, lemon juice, sugar, and mustard. Marinate the chicken breasts in the mixture for 2 to 8 hours. Remove the breasts from the mixture. Place the breasts in a greased baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees F for about an hour or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the breast is pierced

In a large bowl, combine the plum tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, olive oil, red wine vinegar, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Let the mixture sit for 1 hour. Cook the penne as directed. Drain. Add the tomato mixture to the penne and toss to coat. Serve warm.
Pasta is a type of noodle made from unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water or eggs, and formed into sheets or other shapes, then cut into a variety of widths. It is generally served hot as a main courseit can also be chilled in salads or as a side dish. Pasta is generally served in two forms: either as part of a meal, served as a first course or as a main course with a meat-based sauce or vegetable-based sauceor as part of a cold dish (antipasto) served as an appetizer. Pasta is generally a high-calorie foodthe caloric content of a cup of cooked spaghetti is comparable to that of a hamburger. The main components of pasta

In a 12-inch skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Cook onions, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Add ground beef. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 30 minutes.
Place all but tortilla in a bowl. Mix well. Spread cream cheese mixture onto tortilla. Add the tomato. Add the jalapeno peppers. Roll up tortilla. Cut in half. Serve with ranch dressing.

Melt butter in pot over medium heat. Add shallot. Cook until softened. Add scallions. Cook until wilted. Add celery. Cook until tender. Add chicken broth. Bring to boil. Add potato. Lower heat. Cook until potato is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in fresh rosemary and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper. Strain. In small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk together half-and-half cream and cornstarch. Cook until thickened. Add to potato mixture. Stir. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease 15 (4-ounce) ramekins. Combine the cornmeal, buttermilk and eggs in a medium bowl, stirring just until combined. Add the cream cheese and butter and beat just until blended. Add the brown sugar and spice and beat until smooth. Stir in the raisins and pecans. Divide the batter evenly among the ramekins. Place the ramekins in 2 baking sheets. Bake until the edges of the custards are lightly browned and the centers are set but still soft in the middle, 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Top with cranberry chutney and serve. Serves 8.

Wash the apples thoroughly. Cut off the stem end and core the apple. Cut the apple into 1/4" slices. Arrange the apple slices in the bottom of an 8-cup mold. Pour the sugar, corn syrup, water and the cinnamon oil in a saucepan. Heat to boiling. Stir for 2 minutes. Pour the hot syrup over the apple slices in the mold. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until cold. Unmold the apples. Insert the wooden skewers into the apple slices. Melt the red food coloring with the almond bark in the microwave at 30 second intervals. Drizzle the red bark over the apple skewers. Let the bark set for 20 minutes. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius. Rub steak with garlic and rosemary and place on a roasting dish. Combine wine, oil, onion and soy sauce and pour over the steak. Cover with foil and cook for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and rub the steak with the barbecue sauce. Return steak to oven and cook for another 30 minutes or until done to your liking. Serve with salad and potatoes or rice.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ginger, turmeric, cardamom seed, nutmeg, cinnamon stick, and cloves. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Add onion, garlic, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add tomato paste. Cook, stirring constantly, 3 minutes or until mixture is dry. Add beef broth. Heat through. Serve with pita bread.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine mayonnaise and italian seasoning in a medium bowl. Unwrap the doritos and place in a small bowl. In another small bowl combine the butter and garlic. In a large non-stick skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook 3 to 4 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Place the breasts on a foil-lined cookie sheet and top with the garlic mixture. Place 3 to 4 doritos on top of each breast. Bake for 4 minutes or until the doritos are crispy. Top each breast with a bit of the mayonnaise mixture and serve with the remaining mayonnaise.
Combine all in a food processor bowl. Process until smooth. Serve over hot spaghetti or your favorite pasta.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine stuffing mix with milk. Add turkey, onion, celery and dried cranberries. Form into a loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour. Serve warm.
Place ginger and tea in a teapot. Pour boiling water over. Strain. Add lemon juice and sweeten with sugar. Refrigerate. Pour over ice. Garnish with fresh mint.

In a large bowl, cream together butter and cream cheese until smooth. Add ice creams and stir until combined. Spread evenly into the bottom of an unbaked pie crust. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts and drizzle with fudge topping. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve cold.

Mix yogurt with dried dill and vinegar in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 minutes. Spread the haddock fillets with mayonnaise. Roll fish in the dill yogurt mixture to coat. Grill fish over hot coals, basting with the remaining yogurt mixture until fish is done.
In a small bowl, combine lime juice, soy sauce, cilantro, green onion, ginger and sugar. Toss with lettuce and vegetables. Garnish with cashews and raisins.

In a medium saucepan bring 3 cups water to a boil over high heat. Add 1 tbsp salt and the penne. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup cooking water. Meanwhile, in a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add the dressing, broth, red pepper and croutons. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the penne and parmesan cheese. Stir in enough cooking water to moisten the sauce. Toss. Top with mozzarella cheese. Cover to keep warm.

Cut potatoes into strips about 1 inch thick. Arrange on 2 large baking sheets that have been sprayed with cooking spray. Drizzle each potato strip with 2 teaspoons of olive oil & sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of salt & 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Bake for 20 minutes in preheated 350f oven. Turn the potatoes over & continue baking 20 minutes more or until the potatoes are tender & browned. Serve hot.

Mix steak sauce, pineapple juice and cornstarch until smooth. Heat over low heat until thickened and bubbly. Add brown sugar and continue cooking until thickened again and bubbly. Heat oil in frying pan or skillet over medium heat until hot. Add steaks. Turn them over when they have browned on one side for about 3 minutes. Remove them from the pan and pour on the glaze. Turn the steaks over to coat both sides with the glaze. Return to the pan and heat until the glaze is bubbly, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut fennel bulb in half and discard any soft or discolored pieces. Slice remaining fennel halves thinly to create 2 cups of thin fennel slices. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise then cut each half into 1-inch cubes. Toss fennel, squash, olive oil, cumin, cinnamon, chili powder, turmeric, and a pinch of salt and pepper in a large bowl. Spread mixture evenly in a single layer onto a large baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven about 30 minutes or until the mixture is soft and the fennel is carmelized. Remove from oven and stir in red onion. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine the barbecue sauce and the zest in a medium bowl. Stir in the juice. Cut the chicken into 1-inch cubes. Add to the orange juice mixtureturn to coat. Marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Lightly oil the vegetables and grill for 6-8 minutes or until tender. Serve the chicken and vegetables on a bed of greens. Drizzle with the dressing.

Core cabbage leaves. Brown beef. Mix remaining ingredients. Divide meat mixture evenly among leaves. Roll up. In skillet, heat oil. Add rolls. Stirring occasionally, cook until browned. Stir in enough water to cover rolls. Cover. Simmer on low 2 hours. Uncover. Cook 30 minutes or until meat is no longer pink.

Combine all-purpose flour, sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal. Mix in cheese. In 2-quart saucepan, combine brown sugar, flour and milk. Stir over low heat until thickened and smooth. Remove from heatstir in pineapple chunks. Pour into 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and melted butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes.

Mix jell-o with boiling water, stirring constantly until dissolved. Add 1 cup of water and continue stirring until smooth. Pour into 9x13 inch pan. Bake in 350 oven for 30 minutes. Stir egg yolks with 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup water, juice of 1/2 orange and 1 tsp vanilla. Cook over low heat, stirring until thickened and pour over jell-o mixture. Refrigerate overnight. Beat egg whites until foamy, add 1/2 cup of sugar gradually and continue beating until peaks are stiff and dry. Spread over top of gelatin mixture. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Cut into squares and serve cold.

Boil the onion and garlic cloves for a few minutes and remove from heat. Pour the brine into a large bowl and add the onion and garlic cloves. Peel and hard boil the eggs. Peel the eggs and add them to the brine. Cover and refrigerate for 3 days or more. If you prefer you can leave them longer but they will be a little stronger in flavor. You can also substitute red wine vinegar for the white, it gives the eggs a pink tint.

In a saucepan, combine the cornstarch with 1/4 cup cold water. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. In a small bowl, beat the egg yolks with a whisk until well combinedadd the cornstarch mixture and beat until the mixture is smooth. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, bring the half-and-half cream to a boil. Gradually whisk the egg mixture into the hot half-and-half cream to form a custard. Stir frequently until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon (the consistency will be similar to that of heavy cream). Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the vanilla and the crushed pineapple. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch spring form pan or a 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until the pudding is set, when lightly touched with a finger or a knife, the pudding will hold its shape. Cool to room temperature. In a small bowl combine the chopped pecans with the 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/

Combine soy sauce, honey, garlic and plum jam. Cook in a small saucepan over low heat until mixture comes to a boil. Rub mixture over both sides of ribs. Refrigerate overnight. Grill over direct heat for 1 hour or until browned. Brush ribs with more plum mixture during last 20 minutes of cooking time.

Mix the whole wheat flour, baking soda and salt in a large bowl and set aside. In a medium bowl combine the dried cranberries and the orange zest and set aside. In a large bowl combine the egg, vanilla and oil and whisk to combine. Add the starter to the oil mixture and stir well. Add the flour mixture and stir until smooth. Stir in the dried cranberries and the orange zest and mix gently. Fill the prepared muffin pans 2/3 full and bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the pans and let cool on wire racks for 10 minutes before serving.

Whisk together sherry and red wine vinegars in a large bowl. Whisk in the honey. Slowly drizzle in the mustard and whisk until well incorporated. Slowly drizzle in the oils, whisking constantly until well combined. Season the dressing with the kosher salt and black pepper. Toss the tomatoes in the dressing. Divide the tomatoes among 4 large bowls. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours to allow the flavors to marry. In a small bowl, toss the bread with the remaining dressing and season with salt and pepper. Serve the tomatoes on top of the bread. Garnish with the basil.
Steam squash and onion till just tender, mash well. Add egg, salt, seasoning and flourmix well. Make into patties, dip in flourfry in hot oil till golden brown on each side.

In a medium bowl combine the soup, cheese, and mustard. Add the beaten egg and stir well. Stir in the bread cubes. Pour the mixture into a greased 2 quart casserole dish and sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered in a 350f oven for about an hour or until bubbly and browned. Serve hot.

Pound flank steak with a meat mallet or rolling pin until flattened. Combine lime juice, fish sauce, chili peppers, garlic and red onion in a medium bowl. Stir until well combined. Place steak in bowl with marinade. Marinate steak in refrigerator at least 4 hours. Remove steak from marinade. Reserve marinade. Grill steak for about 5 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Remove steak from grill. Cut steak into 1/2 inch pieces. Return steak to marinade. Set aside. Combine cucumber and fresh cilantro in a bowl. Slice scallion on the bias. Layer lettuce leaves on a serving plate. Arrange steak and cucumber mixture on top. Garnish with scallions. Serve with Thai vinaigrette dressing.

Line a jelly-roll pan with parchment paper. Melt the chocolate according to the package directions. Spread the melted chocolate over the paper. Sprinkle the peanuts on top. Press the crackers into the peanuts. Sprinkle the marshmallows on top. Chill until set. Break into pieces. Store at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Preheat grill pan to high heat. Spread bottom half of each slice of bread with mayo. Divide turkey between 2 slices of bread. Top with peppers and sprinkle with Taleggio. Close sandwich and press gently with a heavy pan or the lid of a grill pan. Cook 3-4 minutes per side or until nicely browned and cheese is melted. Remove from heat and place on a cutting board. Cut sandwich in half and serve with watercress.

Cream together the butter and sugars. Add the egg and vanilla, beating well. Add the dry ingredients. Stir in the puffed rice. Drop by rounded tablespoons 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 8-10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Roll in powdered sugar. Makes 3 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (140 degrees C). Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, combine the slivered almonds, egg whites, sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, and vanillabeat until smooth. Divide the batter into 1 inch ballsplace 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bottoms are a light brown color. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the cookie sheets to cool completely on wire racks. Store in airtight containers.

Brown meat and drain fat. Add water and taco seasoning mix and cook for 10 minutes on low heat until sauce thickens. Add green chilies and red pepper and cook for 5 minutes longer. Spoon meat mixture into warmed shells and top with cream cheese and taco sauce. Sprinkle with chopped onions if desired.

Wash blueberries and remove stems. Place blueberries and all other ingredients in a non-reactive pan over medium heat. Simmer until berries begin to pop and syrup begins to thicken. Let cool and serve at room temperature over ice cream or pancakes.

In a large saucepan cook linguine according to directions on package. Meanwhile in a small saucepan bring milk, cream cheese, garlic salt, dried basil leaves and 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heatsimmer until cheese is melted. Stir in shrimp. Drain linguine. Toss with sauce. Serve with additional parmesan cheese.
Place all the pineapple chunks in a blender with the juice. Add ice to chill the mixture. Blend until smooth. Add rum to taste and serve over crushed ice.

Wash and steam the spinach for 5 minutes until it turns soft and tender. Chop it finely and place it in a bowl along with breadcrumbs and egg white and salt and pepper and mix well. Shape the mixture into small ball and roll each ball into the breadcrumbs and place on a plate and keep aside for about 30 minutes to set. Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry the spinach balls till crisp and golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper and keep aside. In a pan heat some butter and add the chili and salt and pepper and fry for few seconds and keep aside to serve with the spinach balls.
This is my first time here and i am enjoying your blog.
Mix corned beef with the potato. Add the rest of the ingredients. Form into 4-inch balls. Fry in oil until brown.

In a small bowl mix together the flour and seasonings. In another small bowl combine the water and tomato sauce. Season the neck chops with the garlic and coat them in the seasoned flour. Brown them in the olive oil. In a small pot add the tomato sauce and water mixture. Heat until boiling. Pour this over the browned chops. Add the curry powder and let simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over hot rice.

Mix the flour, sugar, and salt. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, mix the yeast into the water to dissolve. Slowly pour the liquid into the dry ingredients and mix on low speed until the dough comes together. Increase the speed to medium-high and knead for 5 minutes. Spray the inside of a large bowl with cooking spray and place the dough inside. Spray the top of the dough with cooking spray and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise for 1 hour. Roll the dough out into a 10-inch by 10-inch square. Place the dough on a baking sheet, cover, and let rise for 30 minutes. Heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the French bread is golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In medium size mixing bowl combine sugar and butter and cream together. In small mixing bowl add evaporated milk and vanilla. Stir together and add to sugar mixture. Blend together and add oats and coconut. Press into an 8 x 8 inch greased pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden. Cool and cut into squares.
These recipes sound wonderful. I'd love to try them all. Thanks for sharing.
I love Butterscotch and these recipes sound delicious! I'm going to have to try some of them out! Thanks for sharing!
I love everything with butterscotch. Thanks for sharing these wonderful recipes.

Peel cucumbers with a vegetable peelercut in half lengthwise, remove seeds. Place in a large container with the remaining vegetables. Add salt, mix well. Cover, refrigerate overnight. Drain off liquid and pack in jars. Combine remaining liquid and 1 cup sugar in saucepanbring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Pour over pickles. Seal jars tightly and refrigerate. Makes 5-6 pints.

Line an 11x7x2-inch baking pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper. Lightly grease foil or parchment paperset aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together marshmallows, honey and butter until well blended. Stir in peanut butter, salt and vanilla until blended. Stir in oats. Spread evenly in prepared panset aside to cool completely. In another medium bowl, stir together cereal, coconut and nutsset aside. In a small bowl or pie plate, melt chocolate in microwave on High for 1 minutestir. Drizzle chocolate over top of bar mixturespread to cover evenly. Sprinkle with cereal mixturepress into place. Let stand until set, about 1 hour. Using foil handles to lift from pan, cut into 4 rows by 12 pieces. Store in an airtight container.
chewy peanut butter barslemon barsdolores chewy peanut butter barssnickerdoodle bars

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a shallow bowl. Coat the chicken with egg mixture. Dip into breadcrumbspress firmly to coat. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic to pansaute 30 seconds or until garlic is lightly browned. Add the chickencook 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Sprinkle with parsley.

Place the strawberries in a blender and purée. Mix the first five ingredients until blended. Add the milk and vanilla. Add the puréed strawberries and blend again. Spoon batter into a greased muffin pan. In a small bowl mix the topping ingredients. Sprinkle over the batter. Bake at 375f for 25-30 minutes.

Cook rice according to package directions. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add chicken and saute until lightly browned. Stir in soup and rice-a-roni. Add celery, mushrooms and bell pepper. Season to taste. Spread mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with mozzarella. Bake at 375 for 35 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 f. Cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat well. Stir in the dry ingredients until blended. Add the liquid ingredients. Chill dough for at least an hour. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on greased cookie sheets. Bake for about 9-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the cookie sheets and cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the white and vanilla. Add the egg yolks one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the flour, baking soda and salt. Beat until the mixture just comes together. Stir in the chocolate chunks. Using a cookie scoop, drop the dough onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the centers are set. Cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix together the concentrate and lemon juice. In another bowl mix together the hoisin sauce and the sugar. Heat the vegetable oil until very hot and deep fry the chicken for 8-10 minutes. When done remove the wings from the fryer and place them on paper towels to drain the excess oil. Mix the frozen concentrate with the hoisin and drizzle it on the wings. Sprinkle with ginger and chopped green onions and serve.

In a large pot, combine apple cider and apricot nectarbring to a boil. Add sugar, orange juice and lemon juice and return to a boil. Add spices and cook for an additional minute. Stir in apricot halves. Remove from the heat and serve warm or cool to room temperature before serving.
Congratulations on your 100th post!
I love the idea of an Apple and Apricot Crisp.
Wonderful selection of recipes! I love Apple Cider and this post was just what I needed as I was looking for a recipe this morning. Thank you!
What a great list! I just made some hot cider from scratch today with a little cinnamon and sugar and it was a huge hit!
I am so happy you shared these recipes! We love hot cider! I am going to have to try some of these recipes!
I am totally stealing your hot mexican cider recipe for a little holiday party I have coming up!
Congrats on your 100th post! I am a huge fan of hot apple cider! I love it

Cut the florets into bite-sized pieces. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Spread the florets onto the baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes. Serve at room temperature. Serves 2.

Prepare shortcrust pastry as per packet instructions. Roll out pastry to line 18 cm (7-inch) loose-bottom tart tin. Blind bake for 10 minutes. Heat butter and leek in large pan. Cook until tender. Add frozen spinach. Cook for 5 minutes. Add sour cream. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Season to taste. Pour into prepared tart case. Scatter with grated cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool completely before serving.

Place the tea bags in a pot with the water and sugar. Bring to boil and then reduce the heat to low. Steep for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and discard the tea bags. Stir in the evaporated milk and serve immediately.

Rinse the quinoa in a strainer. In a small saucepan, add the quinoa and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then cover and reduce heat to simmer until water is absorbed, about 10-15 minutes. Combine the lemon juice, olive oil, black pepper, pistachios, parsley and mint. Add the cooked quinoa, red onion and tomatoes. Mix well. Serve on a bed of Lebanese Cucumber. Makes 2 servings.

Muddle parsley in glass. Add water and ice cubes. Shake and strain into highball glass filled with ice cubes. Top with lime juice and sugar and stir. Add club soda and serve immediately. Garnish with lime zest and parsley sprigs if desired.

Place 2 cups sweet yeast in 1/4 cup hot milk in a large bowl. Let stand until foamy, about 15 minutes. Combine cottage cheese, butter, sugar, 1/2 cup milk, and salt in a 1 1/2 quart saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until butter is melted. Beat egg yolks with cornstarch until smoothadd to saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in rum and lemon rind. Remove from heatstir in egg whites and raisins. Pour mixture over yeast mixturestir well until blended. Coverlet stand until bubbles form on surface, about 1 hour. Lightly grease a 13x9x2-inch baking panpour batter into pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool on rack 15 minutesremove from pan. Cool completely on rackgarnish with lemon slices. Makes 12 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook beef in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in spaghetti sauce. Stir in pasta and 1 cup parmesan. Transfer to a 13 x 9-in. Baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup parmesan and mozzarella. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cut carrots into 1/4-inch rounds. Combine brown sugar and butter in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add ginger and caraway seeds. Saute 2 minutes more. Stir in orange peel and orange juice. Simmer 2 minutes or until carrot rounds are tender-crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 F (175 C). Lightly coat 12x8 inch (30x20 cm) baking dish with olive oil. Place salmon fillets in baking dish. Mix together remaining ingredients in small bowlpour over salmon. Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes until fish flakes easily with fork. Makes 2 servings.

Rinse the chickpeas under cold running water. Drain and place in a large bowl. Add 4 cups water to the bowl along with the 1 tsp of salt. Cover bowl. Let sit at room temperature for at least 2 hours or overnight. Drain the beans and set aside. Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Add 2 cups water, the rosemary, 1/4 tsp of salt and 1/4 tsp of pepper. Cover pan and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Uncover pan and continue to cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup. Add the dried beans to pan and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Drizzle on the remaining 1 tbsp of olive oil. Stir in the balsamic vinegar. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with fresh rosemary. Serve warm.

Sift together the flour and salt. Beat the butter and the sugar together for about 3 minutes on medium speed. Beat in the almond extract. Gradually beat in the sifted dry ingredients. Blend in the nuts or the chocolate chips if using them. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes about 4 dozen.

Mash 4 avocados in a medium bowl with 2 cloves of crushed garlic and 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt until smooth. Pour in 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth. Stir in 1/4 cup heavy cream. Stir in 2 tablespoons of lime juice. Refrigerate 1 hour or until soup is cold and well blended. Serve topped with sliced avocado and sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro leaves. Serve with a lemon wedge.

Mix the soy sauce and wine together in a shallow pan or dish and place in the refrigerator while preparing the chicken. Dip the chicken in the marinade and place in a shallow pan or dish and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Mix together the cornstarch and cold water in a small bowl and set aside. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Mix the cornstarch mixture and pour over the chicken. Turn the chicken over and mix the mixture around so it coats the entire surface of the chicken. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds.

Combine the eggs and 1 cup of warm water. Combine well and let sit 10 minutes. Pour into a strainer and drain. Add the flour to a large bowl. Pour in the egg and water mixture. Mix well. Add 1 tsp of salt. Mix well. Pour 1/2 cup of vegetable oil into a pot and heat to 350 degrees F. Put a small amount of batter in a teaspoon and let it slide into the hot oil. Once cooked, remove to a paper towel. Serve with butter or gravy.

Mix all ingredients in a large bowl until smooth. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto a parchment lined baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Bake for about 10 minutes until they are set in the middle. Allow them to cool on the pan for about 2 minutes before moving them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375. In a medium bowl combine prepared stuffing, butter and cheese. Add meat, roasted garlic and eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into an 8x8 baking pan. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.
Name: Slow Cooker Stuffing Directions:In slow cooker combine dressing mix and butter. In a medium bowl combine the soup, milk and onions. Pour the soup mixture over the dressing mix. Cook on low for 5-6 hours. Name: Crock Pot Chicken and Stuffing Directions:In a large bowl combine dressing mix, chicken broth and butter. Spray 4 quart crockpot with cooking spray. Add chicken breasts to the bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients to the crockpot. Cook on low for 8-10 hours.
Name: Crock Pot Chicken and Stuffing Directions:In a large bowl combine dressing mix, chicken broth and butter. Spray 4 quart crock

Place potatoes in a greased 13 x 9 in. Baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beat eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

In medium bowl mix cream cheese, garlic and pepper. Divide evenly onto 4 pieces of bologna. Top each with 1/4 cup cheese and 1 baby dill pickle. Wrap tightly in foil. Chill at least 1 hour. Unwrap. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook for about 3 minutes. Add wine and cook for about 2 minutes. Add collard greens to onions, cook for about 5 minutes until greens are wilted. Add broth, beans and thyme to pan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for about 20 minutes until collard greens are tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the olive oil and red wine vinegar. Add the garlic, oregano, dill and pepper and blend well. Add the buttermilk and feta cheese and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour before using. This recipe is best if you make it the day before you plan to use it. This recipe will keep for 2-3 days in the refrigerator.

Combine turkey, lettuce, apple and orange in medium bowl. Add raisins and nuts. Combine dressing ingredients in small bowl. Add enough dressing to coat. Toss to mix. Serve on bed of lettuce. Makes 4 servings.
Combine cream cheese with apple juice. Add brown sugar and apple pie spice. Stir in chopped apple. Chill. Top with pecans. Serve on crackers. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

Boil bacon and speculaas in milk and water until soft. Strain the liquid through a sieve into a saucepan, discarding the speculaas and bacon. Add ground beef and spices, and mix until evenly combined. Heat through on low heat. Stir in ketjap manis and sambal bajak, and mix until evenly combined. Form into 12-18 balls and place in a baking dish. Cover with a lid or foil and bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through. Remove from oven and cover to keep warm.

Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add 1 teaspoon of the oil. Add half the chickenstir-fry 4 minutes or until browned. Remove chicken from wok. Repeat procedure with remaining 1 teaspoon of the oil and the remaining chicken. Add remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil to the wok. Add the gingerroot. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add the garlic. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add the hoisin sauce. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add the honeystir-fry 1 minute. Add the lime juice. Stir-fry 30 seconds. Return chicken to wok. Stir-fry 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds. Serve with rice. Makes 4 servings.

Place the peanut oil and the Szechuan peppercorns in a large saucepan. Add the ginger and garlic and saut over medium heat for 5 minutes or until fragrant. Add the chicken and saut for 5 minutes. Add the rice wine and saut for another 2 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer over low heat for about 30 minutes. Cook until the chicken is tender and the sauce is slightly thickened. Remove from the heat. Remove the star anise and discard. Serve hot.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add green onions and peascook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drainreturn to pot. Stir in butter and season to taste with salt and chives.

Wash the sea scallops and pat them dry. Season with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan. Add the sea scallops and cook for 1 to 2 minutes per side. The sea scallops should have a nice golden brown colour when they are done. Sprinkle with the chopped chives. Serve immediately.
Fried Rice recipe is the most popular recipe in most of the Asian countries. This dish is very easy to cook and very much tasty. It can be served as a side dish for other main dishes.
Ingredients for fried rice.1. Boil 1 cup of rice.2. While rice is boiling, heat 1/4 cup of cooking oil in a pan.
3. Add one onion chopped finely.4. Saute the onion till it turns brown.5. Add 1/4 teaspoon of garlic and saute for a minute.6. Add 1 teaspoon of chopped ginger.7. Add 1/2 teaspoon of red chilly powder and 1

Mix flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in butter until mixture looks like coarse crumbs. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Press mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Beat cream until it forms peaks. Spread evenly over crust. Sprinkle with pecans. Chill before serving.
A great way to serve pecans!
In a small bowl, combine the chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and peanut butter. Melt in a double boiler over medium heat until melted and smooth. Stir in the pecanspour onto wax paper. Coolbreak into pieces. Makes about 3 dozen candies.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray 15x10x1-in. pan with cooking sprayset aside.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a medium bowlset aside. Unroll pie crustcut into

Prepare a packet with bacon slices, water chestnuts, sugar, ketchup and hot sauce. Wrap packet with wax paper. In another packet place soy sauce and worcestershire sauce. Wrap with wax paper. Place packets on broiler pan and broil until bacon is cooked through, 6-8 minutes, turning once. Makes 4 servings.

Cook the rice according to the directions on the package. Heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onions are translucent. Add the cooked rice and stir to combine. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the soy sauce and cooked chicken. Stir to combine. Add the peas and carrots and stir to combine. Make a hole in the center of the rice. Pour the eggs into the hole and cook until the egg is set. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the fried rice immediately.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).In a medium bowl, mix together the chili powder, paprika, garlic powder and salt. Add the sweet potatoes and toss to coat. Arrange the sweet potatoes in a single layer in the prepared pan. Drizzle with the olive oil, and sprinkle with the brown sugar, cumin and a pinch of pepper. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the sweet potato wedges are crisp and golden brown.
I'm a big sweet potato fan and these look so good! I am definitely going to try them.
These look really tasty and a great alternative to regular french fries.
These are my favorite kind of fries!
I love sweet potato anything!! I love the recipes you've posted...and I'll definitely try them out! Thanks!
I'm a big sweet potato fan and these look so good!
I love sweet potato anything!!

In a small bowl, combine the goat cheese and the red pepper. Spoon into the hollow of each mushroom cap. Place caps in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Broil 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and caps are tender. Makes 12 servings.
I have a question. I have a recipe for chicken stuffed mushrooms that I think has goat cheese in it. I can't seem to find goat cheese here. Is there anything else that I can use?
I've never cooked with goat cheese before but I'm going to try it.
I'm going to try the blue cheese ones this week.

Combine sausage rolls, beef and soup in large skillet. Cook over medium heat until meat is no longer pink. Stir in salsa. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Cook, uncovered for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat oven to 400. Spray baking dish. Sprinkle each breast half with 1/4 teaspoon pepper and 1/8 teaspoon red pepper. Combine honey and juicebrush over both sides of each breast half. Combine cornflakes and parsley. Sprinkle over both sides of each breast half. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until done.

Mix mayonnaise, mustard and worcestershire sauce. Spread on bottom half of sandwich buns. Top with ham, olives, green onion and chilies. Spread with sauce. Add tomatoes. Top with bun halves. Cut into 8 wedges. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix cream cheese, miracle whip, seasonings. Add crabmeat. Layer crackers. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 f. For 15 minutes. Garnish with green pepper, green onions and tomatoes. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in a large pot. Add vegetables and saute until crisp-tender. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about an hour. Pour into food processor or blender and process until smooth. Add evaporated milk and season with salt and pepper. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare 9x5 loaf pan by spraying with non-stick cooking spray. In large bowl, combine flour, 2/3 cup sugar and salt. Set aside. In another bowl, cream butter and remaining sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Beat well after each addition. Add vanilla and lemon zest. Stir in dry ingredients until just blended. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake 50-60 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine 1 cup fresh cranberries and 1 cup water. Bring to boil and simmer until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in brandy. Cool. In another bowl, combine whipping cream and 1 tablespoon sugar. Beat until stiff peaks form. Invert poundcake onto platter. Spread with ruby cranberry sauce. Sprinkle with slivered almonds. Garnish with mint. Makes 12

In large pot add water. Bring it up to boil, add dried navy beans and ham bone. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Remove ham bone. When done add garlic clove, bay leaf, potato, celery and onion. Cook for additional 2 hours. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, mix together the whole milk, yogurt, and vanilla ice cream. Blend with a hand mixer until well combined. Add the marshmallows to the mixture and blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately.

Combine yogurt, lemon juice, ginger and garlic in a large bowl. Add salt to taste. Marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight. Grill over medium-high heat 5 minutes per side or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees fahrenheit. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice and steamed vegetables such as broccoli or cauliflower.

Rinse fish with water. Pat dry. Sprinkle each fillet lightly with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Sear fish for about 2 minutes per side. Remove fish. In the same skillet, saute the onion and bell pepper. Add the butter and worcestershire sauce. Stir to combine. Place fish back into the skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cover. Bake until fish is flaky.

Cook the hamburger in a large skillet with the onion. Add the whole kernel corn and the bean. Pour in the Rotel tomatoes. Add the water and rice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the seasoning mix and simmer for 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with the cheese and cover for a minute or two until the cheese is melted. Serve with the tortilla chips.

Place cubed sweet potatoes in a saucepan with enough water to cover the bottom of the pan. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until tender. Drain off the water and place the potatoes back in the pan. Melt the butter over medium heat and add the brown sugar, heavy cream and ground cayenne pepper (to taste). Stir until well blended and smooth. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a large nonstick skillet, cook the garlic and oil over medium-high heat until garlic is golden. Add tomatoes and cook 1-2 minutes. Remove garlic and discard. Sprinkle chicken with the salt and pepper. Place in baking pan with tomatoes and spread out evenly. Spread apricots and raisins over the top and sprinkle with the thyme. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Turn oven to broil. Broil 1-2 inches from heat for 2 minutes. Turn and broil on other side for 2 minutes. Serve warm.
Combine all ingredients in medium saucepan and simmer for 5 minutes or until honey is completely dissolved. Baste ham every 20 minutes while baking for the last hour of cooking.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees.In a small bowl combine chutney and butter. Cut tenderloins in half lengthwise. Place on a sheet pan. Brush each side of each slice with mango butter mixture. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until cooked through. Serve with steamed rice and topped with green onion.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter, sugar, egg yolk, vanilla and flour until smooth. Divide the dough into two parts, one part smaller than the other. Wrap each part of dough separately in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for one hour or until easy to handle. On lightly floured surface roll doughs out separately to 1/4" thickness. Cut out shapes with a floured cookie cutter. Place onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 5-7 minutes or until just beginning to turn light brown at edges. Remove from oven. Allow cookies to cool completely on baking sheets. When cookies are cool, dip cookies into melted chocolate or decorate with red sprinkles, if desired. Store tightly covered at room temperature for 1-2 days or freeze up to one month. Makes about 3 dozen cookies

Combine cream cheese, milk and green chilies in small bowl. Stir until blended. Chop chicken into small pieces. Spoon cream cheese mixture onto each triangle. Top with chicken. Fold dough over filling. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Brush with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-14 minutes. Sprinkle with chips.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Cut the carrots into long thin strips. Place the carrot slices and the unsalted butter into a large baking dish. Season the carrots with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil, and bake for about 20 minutes.Remove the foil and continue baking until the carrots are tender-crisp.Stir together the ginger ale, chili powder, and garlic powderdrizzle over the baked carrots.Sprinkle the parsley on top just before serving.

In a large mixing bowl beat together the first six ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Fold in the seafood mixture, peppers, onions and tomatoes. Chill before serving on crackers, toasted bread, muffins, bagels etc..

Heat grill to high. Blend meat with seasonings and onion. Shape into 4 patties. Grill for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until done. Top with pizza sauce and mushrooms. Top with cheese. Grill until melted. Serve in toasted hamburger buns.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water until done. Drain them and cool. In a large bowl combine the mayonnaise, soy sauce, brown sugar, ground ginger, and chili garlic sauce. Toss the potatoes with the dressing. Add the scallions, water chestnuts and bell peppers. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
Potato Salad, Potato Salad Recipe
Potato Salad Recipe This is a delicious potato salad. You can add your favorite vegetables. It goes very well with any grilled dish. 2 large boiled or cooked potatoes 2 tsp. mustard 2 tsp. vinegar 2 tsp. mayonnaise 2 tsp. sugar 1 tbsp. chopped pickle 1 tbsp. chopped onion Salt and Pepper 1. Peel the boiled or cooked potatoes. Cut them into cubes. 2. Mix the mustard, vinegar, mayonnaise, sugar and pickle in a bowl. Add the chopped onion. 3.
Mix corn flakes with butter and sugar. Add honey. Serve with milk.

Mix ranch dressing and water in a bowl and set aside. In a medium bowl, toss the green onion and sun-dried tomato with the ranch dressing mixture and set aside. Warm the tortillas in the microwave oven for 20 seconds or until they are soft. Divide the turkey evenly between 4 of the tortillas. Divide the green onion and sun-dried tomato mixture evenly between the remaining tortillas. Add the lettuce to the tortillas with the turkey and top with the remaining tortillas. Serve immediately.

Toast walnuts in a dry skillet over medium heat until they are lightly browned and fragrant, about 2 minutesset aside. In a blender, combine walnuts, soy sauce, cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and puree until smoothset aside. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of oil. Add tomatoes and cook over medium heat until they have softened and begun to burst openset aside. Add another tablespoon of oil to skillet and add green onion and garliccook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add collard greens and cook until they are very dark green and wilted, about 5 minutesset aside. Heat remaining tablespoon of oil in the skillet and add walnut mixturecook until fragrant and heated through, about 1 minute. Add collard greens and cook until heated through and tender, about 2 minutesseason with salt and pepper and fold in lemon juice and cilantro. Divide mixture among 4 tortillas and serve immediately with lime wed

Combine the first five ingredients in a saucepan. Cook until onions are crisp-tender, about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Combine the dressing ingredients in a small bowlstir well. Add dressing to cabbage mixture. Refrigerate 1 hour. Stir before serving.

Cook the chicken until done, drain and let cool to room temp. In a large mixing bowl combine the chicken, bread crumbs, egg whites and celery. Mix together thoroughly, season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste. Divide the mixture into 6 equal patties. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook the patties until browned. Turn the patties over and add the hot pepper sauce to the skillet. Cook until heated through, about 2-3 minutes more. Serve immediately.
Chicken breast is a great source of lean protein that can be prepared in so many ways that are delicious and healthy. Here are some recipes that you can try out for your next meal.
Cut chicken breasts into strips about 2-inches wide.
Place the cut strips into a large resealable plastic bag or container.
Place all the remaining ingredients into the bag or container.
Turn the bag or container over several times to coat the pieces of chicken evenly with the marinade.
Marinate overnight in the refriger

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a 2 quart casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Layer a third of the bread with a third of the ham, a third of the cheese and a third of the eggs. Repeat layers once. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour the milk over the top. Bake for 40 minutes or until the center is set. Serve hot. Serves 4 to 6.

Combine water, cornmeal, cheese, salt, pepper in a saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat and add butter. Serve in bowls sprinkled with parmesan cheese.

Sieve together the plain flour and oatmeal. Mix in the coconut and sugar. Stir in the ginger and butter. Add the golden syrup and water and mix to a firm dough. Form into walnut sized balls and place on a greased tray. Bake at 180 for 10 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
In an oven-proof dish, place dough on bottom. Layer apples over dough, add brown sugar on top of apples. Drizzle on maple syrup. Bake at 400f for 30 minutes.

To make crusts: mix crumbs, honey, butter & melted butter in saucepan over low heat. Spread in greased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes at 375 degrees fahrenheit. Cool. To make filling: combine 2 cups honey, eggs, sugar & vanilla in saucepan over medium heat until honey is melted. Cook, stirring until mixture thickens. Stir in butter & nuts. Cool slightly. Pour into cooled pie shell. Bake for 1 hour at 375 degrees fahrenheit or until filling is set. Cool & cut into wedges for serving.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a medium saucepan, combine milk, cream cheese and butter until melted. Add the sugar, cinnamon and raisins. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heatadd eggs, one at a time, stirring after each addition until blended. Add rice krispiesstir until well coated. Press into prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until set. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

In 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish combine onion, vinegar, water, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and ketchup. Mix well. Add seasoning and cayenne. Place chops in dish. Cover. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Uncover last 10 minutes of cooking time.

Mix cream cheese, milk, salt and pepper until smooth. Spread over crescent roll. Place chicken breast on crescent roll. Fold over one end of dough and pinch the seam closed with a fork. Fold dough over again. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add wontons and cook for 20 seconds. Remove from water and place on a plate to cool. In a medium bowl, mix together cheese, ranch dressing, and sausage. Divide mixture between wontons and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400 F. Place pork chops on a baking sheet and brush each side with garlic. Sprinkle chops with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add butter and onions and cook until onions are soft. Add apple juice and bring to a boil. Place apple pieces and cranberries on top of the sauce. Stir and simmer until thickened. Remove from heat. Place a spoonful of the mixture on each chop. Bake 30 minutes or until juice is clear. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

In a large heavy skillet cook the onion and garlic over moderate heat until softened and beginning to brown, about 8 minutes. Add the prosciutto and cook until crisp. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and cover to keep warm. In the skillet over moderate heat add the tomatoes and the remaining 2 teaspoons salt and cook until the juices run, about 6 minutes. Add the remaining 1/2 cup water and the remaining teaspoon salt and simmer until thickened and reduced slightly, about 20 minutes. Add the capers and stir until combined. Add the prosciutto and juices to the tomato sauce and stir until combined. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary. Serve warm with pasta.

Combine Bisquick and milk. Dip each slice of bread into mixture. Combine egg and vanilla. Dip each side of the bread into egg mixture. Place in skillet with butter. Cook on each side until golden. Drizzle with syrup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a baking sheet and set aside. Cut each sheet of phyllo into six strips. Take one strip and brush with melted butter. Top with another strip of phyllo and brush with butter. Continue layering sheets of phyllo with butter in between layers until you have a stack about 4 inches high. Cut stack in half and place half on a baking sheet. Bake for about 5 minutes. Repeat with other half. When stacks are done baking, remove from oven. Sprinkle each stack with parmesan and sprinkle spinach over the top. Top with hardboiled egg. Place back in oven until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

In a food processor combine all ingredients except cayenne. Cover and process until smooth and creamy. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with cayenne, cover and chill at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with pita chips or crackers or serve in a hollowed out bread loaf with slices of pita bread or crackers as dipping vehicle.

To make the jellies, place the orange juice and gelatin into a large bowl. Stir in the water until the gelatin dissolves. Chill the mixture until it becomes thick but is not set. Stir in the peach and lemon jellies. In a blender, process the strawberries and nectarines. Add the cold water and pulse until the mixture is pureed. Strain through a sieve into a bowl. Mix in the chilled orange-flavored gelatin mixture. Spoon the mixture into prepared molds. Refrigerate for about 3 hours or until the jellies are set. To serve the sangria fruit cups, place one jelly in each of the glasses. Top with the fruit and serve immediately.

Cut the shrimp in half lengthwise and rinse well. Place the shrimp in a bowl and add enough water to cover. Add the cornstarch and lemon juice and toss. Drain the shrimp in a colander and allow to dry completely. In a saut pan heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over high heat. Add the shrimp and stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Add the scallion, garlic and gingerroot. Saut for 2 minutes and add the sea salt and mixed peppercorns. Toss well and add the chile. Saut for 1 minute and add the cilantro. Mix well and serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave on high for 5 minutes stirring every minute. Stir in nuts and spread in pan.

In a 4-quart Dutch oven combine beans, 10 cups water, potatoes, carrots and onion. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer uncovered 1 hour or until potatoes are tender. Stir in ham and cook 5 minutes. Stir in cream and cook 5 minutes. Stir in noodles. Cook uncovered until heated through.

Combine all of the above ingredients except for the powdered sugar in a medium sized sauce pan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 1 minute then remove from the heat. Drop the mixture by teaspoonfuls on to a greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cool for 10 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen.
We are very excited to have you as part of the Taste of Home family. Please take some time to familiarize yourself with the guidelines for posting recipes below. If you have any questions, please contact us at recipes@tasteofhome.com.
Please follow these guidelines when submitting your recipe for review and possible publication. Recipes that are submitted without the above information will not be considered for publication.
Recipe should be an original recipe created by you or your family member. We will not accept recipes that are copies from another source including other websites, magazines or cookbooks.
Recipes should include an original headnote that clearly describes the recipe. You may include a few paragraphs about the recipe’s inspiration or the story

In large roasting pan combine rice and wheat chex. In a microwave safe bowl melt butter. Add Worcestershire sauce and seasoning salt and stir. Pour over the combined Chex and mix well. Spread out to cover the bottom of the pan. In another bowl combine mixed nuts. Spread evenly over the Chex. Cover and chill overnight.

Boil water in large saucepan. Add white bean. Cook until tender, about 1 hour. Drain and save the broth. In saucepan over medium heat, brown sausage. Drain fat. Add white bean, ham, cabbage, tomatoes, and celery. Stir. Add water or broth to cover. Add macaroni. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until macaroni is tender, about 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Sauté mushrooms and onion until soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Mix milk and eggs with salt and pepper. Add to mushroom mixture. Place in unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.
name: spinach and mushroom pastaingredients: penne pasta, eggplant, zucchini, mushrooms, garlic cloves, black olives, tomatoes, onion, baby spinach, basil leaves, tomato pastepreparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine eggplant, zucchini and mushrooms and sautee with garlic cloves and black olives. Add tomatoes and onion and sautee. Add pasta. Combine with baby spinach and basil leaves and add tomato paste. Top with fresh parsley.
name: spinach and mushroom pastaingredients: penne pasta, eggplant, zucchini, mushrooms, garlic cloves, black olives, tomatoes, onion, baby spinach, basil leaves

Deseed and wash the peppers. Dry and cut into small pieces. Peel the garlic and cut into small pieces. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook the peppers and the garlic for 5 minutes. Stir the mixture with a wooden spoon. Add the salt and stir. Remove from the heat and let cool. Store in the refrigerator for 3 weeks.

Brown hamburger. Add onion soup mix and flour. Add tomato paste, water and tomato juice. Simmer for about 1 1/2 hours. Add sour cream. Serve over rice or egg noodles.
name: casserole meatloaf with gravyingredients: lean ground beef, bread crumbs, chopped onion, chopped celery, ketchup, mustard, eggs, tomato sauce, tomato paste, tomato juice, water, mushrooms, green peppers, garlic salt, kosher salt, black pepper, olive oil, italian seasoning, parsley flakes, parmesan cheesepreparation:In a large bowl combine the ground beef, bread crumbs, chopped onion, chopped celery, ketchup, mustard, eggs, tomato sauce, tomato paste, tomato juice, water. Add the mushrooms and green peppers. Season with garlic salt, kosher salt and black pepper. Mix well. Form the mixture into two loaves. In a large skillet over

Heat oven to 425f. Slice apples thinly. Mix together crescent rolls with butter and sugar. Place in bottom of a 9x13 pan. Top with apples. Add orange juice and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 425f for about 15 minutes. Lower heat to 375f and bake for another 20-25 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line muffin tins with paper baking cups. Sift together the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking soda, and cinnamon. Beat the eggs, then add the vegetable oil and vanilla extract. Blend in the dry ingredients just until the batter is moistened. Fold in the pears and pecans. Fill the paper baking cups 3/4 full with batter. Bake for 18 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Allow to cool in the pan 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a bowl cream together cream cheese, butter and flour until well blended. On a lightly floured surface roll out dough to about 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out with a cookie cutter. Place a teaspoon of filling on one half of the circle. Fold over other half to enclose filling. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.

Brush the top of one side of each piece of bread with melted butter and place in panini machine or on hot skillet. Spread apple butter on the unbuttered side of the second piece of bread. Place on top of first piece of bread and spread with apple butter on the other side of the second piece of bread and place on top of the first piece of bread. Cook for 3-5 minutes and then flip and repeat until the sandwiches are browned on both sides. Cut the sandwiches in half and serve with apple chunks and apple wedges on the side.

Melt butter in a medium pot. Add in the flour and whisk until well combined. Slowly add in the milk and whisk continuously until well blended and bubbly. Reduce the heat to medium and add in the salt and black pepper. Add in the oregano and garlic. Cook until well blended and the sauce is thick and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Place anchovies in small bowl. Add lemon juice and mash to a paste. In a bowl, toss together cauliflower, olives, capers, garlic, herbs, and oil. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven 5 minutes. Toss with vinegar and mashed anchovies. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.

Rinse lavender flowers under running water. Place them in a saucepan with 1 cup water. Bring to boil over high heat and remove from heat. Stir in lemon rind and 1 teaspoon of lavender flowers. Let steep for 15 minutes. Strain lavender flowers from liquid. Pour liquid through fine strainer lined with cheesecloth to remove pulp and seeds from peaches. Add rind of 1 lime to liquid. Place 2 cups peach puree in a non-reactive saucepan with 2 cups sugar and 4 cups water. Cook over medium heat until it comes to a boil and continue cooking until mixture reaches a full boil that cannot be stirred down. Add liquid from lavender flowers and continue to boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in 1 tablespoon of liquid fruit pectin. Skim off foam and ladle hot mixture into jars leaving 1 2 inch head space. Wipe rim of jar with damp cloth and seal with lids and screw bands. Process filled jars in hot water bath for 1

Mix all ingredients in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove meat and place in a baking dish. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Turn meat over and bake for another 30 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.

Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, mustard and a few grinds of pepper and a dash of coarse salt. Place tomatoes cut side up on a baking sheet. Spray the cut sides with cooking spray. Drizzle the tomatoes with the dressing. Sprinkle the cut sides with coarse salt. Roast until the tomatoes have browned and caramelized slightly and the inside is soft. Serve at room temperature.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth.

In a bread machine container place the first nine ingredients and set on basic dough cycle. When cycle ends, punch down dough and divide into four equal pieces. Form into balls and place into a greased 15x10x1-inch jelly roll pan. Cover and let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Brush with egg white. Bake an additional 20 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Combine wine, oil, lemon, and lime juices with 1/4 cup water in a large plastic bag. Add beef and seal the bag, turning to coat the meat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours to overnight. Meanwhile, prepare the chimichurri by combining all ingredients in a bowl. Set aside. Remove the meat from the bag and discard the liquid. Arrange meat in a single layer in a roasting pan. Bake for 1 1/4 hours. Remove from the oven and place on a platter. Spread the chimichurri sauce evenly over the top of the meat. Garnish with parsley.

Separate and rinse the cabbage leaves. Heat margarine in a large cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the sugar and stir until it dissolves. Add the green cabbage and cook over medium heat until wilted. Add the smoked sausage and bacon bits and cook until warmed through, stirring occasionally. Add rice and stir until all of the rice has been coated in the onion and cabbage mixture. Add black pepper to taste. Cook for a couple of minutes longer, stirring until rice is heated through. Serve hot!

Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add the quinoa and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat. Let the quinoa cool for about 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa with the carrot, parsley, sunflower seeds, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil and soy sauce. Stir to combine. Season with salt to taste. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 350f. Brush two sheets of heavy-duty foil with oil. Combine mustard, thyme, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Spread potato slices in center of each sheet. Sprinkle with onion rings. Top with mustard mixture. Fold sides of foil over potato mixture. Brush foil with oil. Double fold sides and ends of foil to seal packets. Place foil packets on a rimmed cookie sheet. Bake until potatoes are tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before opening. Makes 4 servings.

In a large mixing bowl beat cream cheese until smooth. Add butter and beat until smooth. Add powdered sugar, brown sugar and vanilla. Mix well. Add semisweet mini chocolate chips. Spread into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with pecans. Mix honey with chocolate graham cracker crumbs. Sprinkle over cheesecake. Refrigerate until set. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with vegetable oil. In a large mixing bowl, combine the salsa, milk, eggs, sour cream, onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, and black pepper. Add the tortilla chips and the beef, stirring until just combined. Spread the mixture into the prepared baking pan, spreading it evenly and making sure that it is not too tightly packed together. Bake for about 1 hour in the preheated oven, until the center of the loaf registers 155 degrees F (68 degrees C) on a thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.
Combine all in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Simmer about 15 minutes. Season to taste. Serve with crispy tortilla strips.

Combine flour, sugar, salt and baking powder. Beat in eggs and milk until smooth. Heat skillet over medium heat and brush with oil. Pour batter in small circles about the size of your palm. Cook about two minutes on each side or until done to taste. Serve with butter and syrup.
In slow cooker combine cooked rice, milk, eggs, sugar, almond extract and salt. Cook on low for 4-6 hours or high for 2-3 hours. Add cherries just before serving and stir gently. Serves 4-6.

Peel and slice the acorn squash and sweet potato. Add the leeks and saute over medium heat for a couple of minutes. Add the chicken thighs and saute. Add the marmalade and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the broth and cook until the potatoes and squash are tender. Add the hoisin sauce and maple syrup. Cover and simmer for a couple of minutes.

In a small saucepan bring the milk to a boil. Stir in the mini marshmallows. Let cool. In a large bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream with a mixer until soft peaks form. Add the marshmallow mixture and beat until well mixed. Add the chocolate chips. Serve over ice cream.
2005-09-12 08:35:01 I don't know if this has been asked before or not. I can't be bothered to read all these entries.
2006-01-25 00:52:05 i need a recipe for frozen strawberry ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, sugars, eggs and vanilla. In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips. With your fingers, place golf ball-sized dough portions 2-inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 9-10 minutes or just until edges are light brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a 9x13 inch baking pan coat with vegetable oil. Arrange the chicken drumsticks in a single layer on the bottom of the pan. In a medium bowl combine the carrots, condensed chicken broth, liquid honey, prepared yellow mustard, brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir until smooth. Pour over the drumsticks. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve hot.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add 1 t. Salt, 2 T. Butter and 1 cup orzo. Cook until tender but firm to the bite. Drain, rinse under cold water and drain again. In a bowl toss together pasta, lemon juice, marjoram, 2 T. Mustard, zest of lemon and olive oil. Add cheese and stir to combine. Sprinkle with scallions. Arrange tomatoes over top. Serve.

Saute beef, onions, and green pepper until meat is no longer pink. Add salt and pepper. To assemble tostados, place a scoop of beans in the center of each tortilla. Top with meat mixture. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Heat in microwave or over the flame of burner until cheese is melted. Roll up tortillas. Cut in half and serve with salsa.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine flour, ground flax seed, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Beat the butter in a large bowl until creamy. Add the egg and the vanilla, then the brown sugar and the granulated sugar. Beat until fluffy, then beat in the flour mixture just until the dough clings together. Stir in the peanut butter. Shape the dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 9 minutes. Makes 4 dozen cookies.

Combine all the ingredients in a small saucepan. Heat over medium-high heat, stirring frequently. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat and let cool. Pour into an air-tight container or jar. Store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

Add 2/3 cup water, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tsp Splenda to oats in bowl of electric mixerbeat on low speed until well blended (about 1 minute). Beat in 1/4 cup chopped banana and 1/2 tsp rum extractbeat on low speed until combined. Transfer to serving dish. Top with remaining banana slices and 1/4 cup chopped pecansserve warm. Yield: 1 serving (1 serving = 1/4 of recipe)

Cook noodles according to package directions. In a 10 inch skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in ham. Stir in cooked noodles. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with caraway seed. Serve immediately.

Core the cabbage. Cut out the stem. Cut the cabbage into wedges. Cut the bacon into small pieces. Cook the bacon in a big saucepan over medium-high heat until crispy. Remove the bacon. Add the cabbage to the pan. Cook the cabbage until the color changes to green. Add the bacon. Sprinkle with the allspice. Salt and pepper to taste. Melt the butter. Pour the butter over the cabbage. Serve.
Name: cabbage for those who dislike cabbageIn a large skillet, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Add cabbage, garlic and brown sugar to pan. Saut until the cabbage is limp, about 5 minutes or so. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in vinegar. Cook, stirring very often, for approximately 20 minutes. Taste and if cabbage is too crunchy for you, continue to cook for a few more minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve.
Name: oriental cabbageSlice onion. Place in bowl with water. Cover and microwave on

Cook the angel hair pasta according to package directions. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, cook 2-3 minutes. Add the cream cheese and cook stirring until the cheese is completely melted. Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the cherry tomatoes. Add the pine nuts and toss well. Stir in the dried basil. Place the angel hair pasta on plates. Divide the shrimp between the plates. Top with the tomato mixture. Garnish with additional dried basil.
In a large pot combine all of the above. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for approximately 3 hours. Remove bay leaf. Serve with sour cream.

In a small bowl mix the shallots and garlic until well blended. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot mixture and cook until soft about 2 minutes. Add the fresh mushrooms and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the red bell pepper and cook for another 2 minutes until tender crisp. Stir in the herbs and remove the skillet from the heat. Tear the swiss into small pieces by hand, then stir into the vegetables and herbs until thoroughly mixed. Cut the bread into 1 12 inch slices. Spread the swiss cheese on the bottom of each slice. Top with a spoonful of the vegetable mixture and sprinkle with black pepper. Place the crostini under the broiler for 2 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and lightly brown. Serve warm.

Spray baking dish with nonstick spray. Layer half of the vegetables in dishspread half of the soup mixture over vegetables. Layer remaining vegetables on top of soupcover with remaining soup mixture. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake 10 minutes longer or until hot and bubbly. Serve with green beans and crackers. Makes 6 servings.

Beat butter until soft. Add in sugar and beat for 10 minutes. Beat in eggs and beat for 10 minutes. Add lemon essence and lemon juice. Add in the dry ingredients. Beat for 2 minutes. Grease and line a 20cm springform. Pour in mixture. Bake in oven at 350 for 1 hour. Leave to cool for 5 minutes before removing from springform.
Beat sugar and eggs together in a bowl. Dip the slices of bread in the mixture, then coat with coconut. Grill for 2 minutes on each side until browned. Serve with butter, jam or syrup.

Combine flour, honey mustard in a shallow bowl or plate. Place breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl or plate. Dip chicken in flour mixture, then in the egg mixture, then into the breadcrumb mixture coating completely on all sides. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Fry chicken in hot oil until lightly browned and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Makes 4 servings.

Rinse collard greens and cut off stems. Chop stems. In a large pot or dutch oven add chopped stems, chopped onion, barbecue sauce and real maple syrup. Cook over medium heat. When it comes to a boil turn down to a simmer. Add chopped greens. Cook until tender. Add butter, salt & pepper. Serve hot.

Brown bratwursts in butter in a skillet until brown. Add water and bring to a boil. Stirring constantly, add flour. Cook for 3 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in sour cream and heat until bubbly. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine juice and mustard in a shallow bowl. Combine cornstarch with 1/4 cup of the broth. Stir until smooth. Stir in remaining brothpour over pork. Bake uncovered 1 1/2 hours or until done (160 degrees). Let stand 10 minutesserve with juice.
I am in love with all the foods you have shared today! This is such a great idea!
Thanks for linking up with me today!
I have tried many of these recipes. I have some really good ones in my recipe box. I'm always looking for new ones.
I love pork and these recipes look amazing!
Pork is one of my favorite proteins - thanks for these recipes!
Love the idea of the monthly meal plan. Thanks for sharing with us at Brag About It.
These recipes sound delicious! I have been looking for new ones for a long time. Thanks for linking up with me today!
Thanks for sharing this great round-up of recipes. I love cooking with p

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl, mix seasoning and bread crumbs together. Press bread crumb mixture onto the surface of the fish and bake in the preheated oven until the fish is done, about 20 minutes. Serve over baked potatoes and fresh vegetables.
