I want a recipe for spicy chicken and rice. I would like it to be a recipe that my husband and I could share without having to worry about it being too spicy. I am a beginner cook and need a recipe that will be easy for me to cook and that I can make without too many ingredients and steps. Thank you for any help you can give me!
Spicy Chicken and R

In a small bowl, combine the seasoning. Place the steaks in a zip-top plastic bag and pour in the seasoning. Turn to coat the steaks. Seal the bag and shake to coat evenly. Let the steaks marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove the meat from the bag and grill the steaks over medium-high heat until browned and cooked to your desired doneness.
Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl and chill at least 1 hour before serving.

Heat the oil over high heat in a large skillet. Saute the onion until it begins to brown, then add the garlic, cayenne and greens. Cook for a few minutes, then add the chicken broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer the greens until they are tender and just beginning to wilt. Serve immediately.

In a large frying pan over low heat, saute the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon and set aside. In a large bowl, beat the eggs until fluffy. Add the bacon, onions and mushrooms. Add the salt and pepper. Return the frying pan to the heat. Add the butter. Pour in the scrambled mixture. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture sets. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and boil for 4 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl add the green beans and the rest of the ingredients. Mix well and serve. This is a great side dish or even a main dish. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 13x9 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the first four ingredients. Stir in the sweetened condensed milk and the maraschino cherry juice. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into squares. Store in the refrigerator.

Cook broccoli according to pkg. instructions. Drain & add to bowl. Cut zucchini & sugar snap peas into bite size pieces. Cut penne. Heat olive oil in saut pan. Add garlic & saute 1 minute. Add broccoli & sugar snap peas. Sauté 1 minute. Add zucchini. Add 1 cup of water & bring to a boil. Add penne & reduce heat to medium. Cook 3 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Add light cream cheese & lemon juice. Stir until combined. Add more lemon juice as desired. Add basil & Parmesan cheese. Stir to combine. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl and set aside. Cream the butter and sugar in a small mixing bowl. Combine the flour and baking soda in a sifter and sift over the butter mixture and stir until well blended. Add the egg yolks and vanilla and stir until well blended. Gradually stir in the milk mixture until just combined. Add the egg whites and stir until combined and lightened in color. Fold in the cornmeal and pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until the cake springs back when touched lightly in the middle and is golden brown in color. Cool completely before cutting and serving.

Add the apples and juice to a large pot and bring to a boil. Add the sugar crystals and stir until dissolved. Add the vanilla extract and honey, stirring to combine. Continue stirring until the mixture comes to a simmer and then reduce the heat so that it is just bubbling gently. Cover and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the apples are softened and the mixture has reduced by half. Serve warm.
Name: Hot Mulled Apple Cider
2 teaspoons ground nutmeg or
10 whole cinnamon sticks or
10 slices fresh ginger
1/4 teaspoon freshly grated orange peel
Combine the brown sugar, whole allspice, whole cloves, salt, and nutmeg in a large pot. Add the apple cider and bring the mixture to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the desired thickness is reached, stirring occasionally. Add the orange peel and cinnamon stick and continue cooking for 2 more minutes. Remove from the heat and let the mixture cool completely before straining it

Cook roast beef in a skillet over medium heat until heated through. Add onion and peppers and saute until onion is tender. Add salsa and simmer 2 minutes. Split hoagie buns and spread with mustard. Top each half with a portion of roast beef mixture and a slice of cheese. Serve hot.

In a skillet, cook onion and garlic in butter over medium heat until softened, about 4 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add black pepper and salt to taste. Sprinkle beef bouillon over mixture and cook 1 minute more. Stir in sour cream and heat through, adding nutmeg to taste. Serve over noodles or rice.

Mix chocolate chips with 2 tbs butterscotch chips. Melt chocolate on stove top. Remove from heat, stir in peanut butter and rice krispies. Pour onto cookie sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Spread out evenly. Cool completely. Break up into pieces.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until it is soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the rice and cook for 1 minute. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute more. Add the coconut milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spread the rice mixture in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle the frozen spinach on top of the rice and spread it evenly. In a small saucepan, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium heat. Add the lentils and cook until the liquid in the pan is absorbed. Add the spinach liquid and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Spread the lentil mixture evenly on top of the rice and the spinach. Sprinkle the cheese on top and bake for 15 minutes.

Cut the avocados into halves. Scoop the flesh out of the shells with a spoon. Place the flesh in the food processor or blender bowl. Add the green chilies, roma tomatoes, and the salt and pepper to taste. Process until smooth. Add the lemon juice, mayonnaise, garlic powder, onion powder, and process until blended. Serve with tortilla chips.

In large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook, stirring frequently, 4 minutes or until tender. Add broth and next 3 ingredientsbring to boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in basil and pepper. Spoon rice mixture into 4 shallow dishestop evenly with tuna and tomatoes.

Preheat broiler to high heat. Place bread in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Brush both sides of bread with olive oil. Broil until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Arrange the bacon on the bottom half of the bread slice. Layer the tomato slices over bacon. Top with a few leaves of lettuce. Sprinkle with basil leaves and pesto. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the top half of the bread back on the sandwich. Enjoy!

Mix together garlic powder, salt and pepper. Rub all over tenderloin steaks. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and 1/2 cup blue cheese. Bake steaks 10 to 12 minutes. Turn and bake an additional 10 to 12 minutes. Serve with sour cream mixture. Serves 4.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Spread into a buttered 10cm square dish. Cover with plastic wrap and leave in refrigerator overnight to firm up. Cut into slices to serve.
Made this today with the addition of bacon bits - YUMMMM!
Awesome recipe, I can't wait to try this for my next dinner party.
Thanks for the recipe. I've made this and it is delicious.

Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, jalapeno pepper and cook until tender. Add basmati rice and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth, coconut milk and thyme. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Stir in red beans and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve.

Saute garlic in oil until golden. Add green onions and jalapenocook until softened. Add avocadosmash until smooth. Add lemon juice, chili powder, and salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips or baked potatoes.

Preheat oven to 200c. Place potatoes in a saucepan of boiling water. Cook for 10 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Cut into 2cm thick rounds. Meanwhile, heat bacon in a frying pan over medium heat until crisp. Drain. Remove bacon from pan. Add tomatoes and capsicums to pan. Cook for 5 minutes or until soft. Cool slightly. Toss through half the bacon. Place chicken in a large bowl. Add tomato mixture. Combine well. Season. Transfer to a 35cm x 25cm x 5cm baking dish. Sprinkle over remaining bacon. Combine parsley with remaining oil. Drizzle over bacon. Bake for 40 minutes or until cooked through. Serve.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add half of the sour cream and the eggs to the hot skillet. Sprinkle the eggs with salt and pepper. Add the green onion. Cook and stir the eggs until they are just set. Remove the eggs from the skillet and add the remaining sour cream. Heat the sour cream in the hot skillet until it begins to bubble. Return the eggs to the pan and top with the cheddar. Cook and stir the eggs until the cheese is melted and the eggs are set. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Season pork chops with salt and pepper and sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Sear the chops for two minutes on each side. Remove the chops to a plate. Heat the garlic and the tomatoes in the pan until the garlic is softened. Add the spaghetti and toss to combine. Place the chops back on top of the spaghetti and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.
These all look fabulous! I will definitely be trying some of them!
I have to try these. I'm a big fan of pork chops.
Thanks for the ideas and recipes.

Combine first four ingredients in food processorprocess until mixture resembles coarse meal. With on/off turns of processor, add water, 1 tablespoon at a timeprocess just until dough starts to clump together. Turn out onto lightly floured surfaceknead gently about 3 times or just enough to bring dough together. Divide in halfroll each portion into 1/2-inch-thick roundwrap in plastic wraprefrigerate at least 30 minutes or overnight. On lightly floured surface, roll each round to 1/8-inch thicknesscut with floured 2 1/2-inch cookie cutterreroll scraps. Line bottom and sides of 9-inch-diameter tart pan with pastrychill 30 minutes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or just until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack for at least 1 hour or refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight before filling. Makes 16 servings (2 slices each).

In a large skillet, heat oil. Add onion. Cook over medium heat until onion is tender. Add garlic. Cook 30 seconds more. Stir in cumin, cilantro, and chili. Add cooked sweet potatoes. Stir to mix. In a small bowl combine cilantro, cumin, lime juice, and sour cream. Spoon about 1/3 cup sweet potato mixture onto 4 tortillas. Top with cheese. Fold tortilla. Brown on both sides on a hot griddle or heavy skillet. Serve with the cilantro sauce.

Combine molasses, brown sugar, dry mustard and salt in a bowlstir in yogurt. Arrange 1/4 of the mixture in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Cover with 1/2 of the beans. Spread 1/4 of the remaining mixture over the top of the beans. Add another layer of the remaining beans. Spread the remaining yogurt mixture over the top. Bake at 350 for 1 hour 15 minutes or until the yogurt mixture is set. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Cut the red, orange and yellow bell peppers into large pieces and slice the onions into large pieces. Slice the portabella mushrooms into halves. Thread the bell peppers, onions and portabella mushrooms on the skewers. Thread the tomatoes on the skewers. Pour the italian dressing on the veggies and marinate for at least 2 hours. Cook the veggies on the grill for about 3-4 minutes on each side until done. Serve warm.

Grate the potatoes. Combine with other ingredients and make into patties about 3 inches in diameter. Fry in hot butter in a skillet or on a hot griddle until brown on both sides. Serve hot.
A potato cake is a food item made from potatoes that has been formed into a cake-like shape and is typically fried or baked. Potato cakes can be made from raw or cooked potatoes, and are often served as a side dish or snack. There are many different recipes for potato cakes, but most include some type of binding agent such as flour or eggs, and often contain spices or other flavorings. Potato cakes are a popular dish in many countries around the world, including Ireland, England, Scotland, Germany, Poland, Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Iceland, Faroe Islands, Greenland, Canada, United States of America, Mexico, Chile, Argentina, Brazil, Peru, Bolivia, Ecuador, Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana, Trin

In a medium bowl combine the potatoes with the seasonings. Toss to coat. Transfer to a baking sheet. Spray with cooking spray. Bake for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray 9x13 inch baking pan with vegetable oil. Layer 1/2 the tortillas in the bottom of the pan. Layer 1/2 the chicken mixture. Sprinkle 1/2 the cheese over the top. Repeat with the remaining layers. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. If desired, sprinkle with lettuce, tomatoes and sour cream. Serves 4.

Combine dry mustard and vinegar. Beat egg until frothyadd mustard mixture and stir well. Add the remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. Spoon into 1/2 pint jarscover tightly with lids. Store in refrigerator for at least 2 weeks before serving. Yields 2 1/2 quarts.

Mix salt, cornstarch, worcestershire and mustard until smooth. Dip chicken in mixture and fry until golden brown. Place on baking sheet. Pour the remaining mixture over the chicken. Top with pineapple slices and maraschino cherries. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until done. Serve over rice or noodles with vegetables if desired.

I am not a fan of the food network show "Diners Drive-ins and Dives" but I

In a skillet or frying pan, brown the smoked sausage. Drain fat from pan. Add onion and cook until tender. Add sauerkraut and cook until heated. Stir in parsley flakes, salt, and fresh ground pepper. In a separate casserole dish, layer pasta and cover with the sauerkraut mixture. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake at 350 until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Place one piece of phyllo in the bottom of each of four greased muffin cups. Place one banana slice on top of each piece of phyllo. Melt two tablespoons of butter in a microwave safe bowl and add one teaspoon of lemon juice and mix well until smooth. Drizzle each piece of phyllo pastry with this mixture. Bake at 375 for about 10 minutes or until the phyllo has turned lightly brown and puffy. Top with hot fudge and caramel candies and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 2 quart casserole dish. Heat 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add butternut squash and cook 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat, drain off any excess water, and allow to cool slightly. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook 2 minutes or until onions are softened, stirring occasionally. Stir in pecans, brown sugar, vanilla and parsley. Add cooked butternut squash and toss to combine. Place in prepared casserole dish and bake 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper if desired.
Beat eggs. Add milk, flour, salt, vanilla. Pour batter into hot greased pan. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with syrup.

Peel and cube the cucumbers and onions. Dice the red pepper. Add all to a bowl. Add salt, sugar and flour to taste. Stir in the ginger and turmeric. Add enough vinegar to cover. Let sit for 1 hour or more to allow flavors to mix well. Makes about 4 1/2 cups

Thaw puff pastry at room temperature until pliable but still cold. Lightly brush edges of thawed pastry with milk. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add sun-dried tomatoes and cook until they just begin to soften, about 1 minute. Add garlic and cook for about another minute, stirring occasionally. Add spinach and cook until wilted and just tender. Remove from heat. Stir in feta cheese until melted. Sprinkle with pepper to taste. Lay half of the puff pastry sheets on the counter to form two 9 inch by 13 inch rectangles. Top each rectangle evenly with the tomato mixture, leaving about 1/2 inch of pastry on all sides. Fold the pastry up around the filling to form pinwheels. Press the edges to seal the pinwheels. Brush each pinwheel with milk and sprinkle with black pepper. Place the pinwheels on the baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.
In a small saucepan bring the water to boil. Add the sugar and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the remaining ingredients. Let cool. You may strain before using.

Melt margarine and cocoa powder in saucepan over low heat. Stir in sugar, eggs and vanilla until smooth and glossy. Remove from heat and stir in flour until well blended. Fold in walnuts. Press firmly into a well buttered 9 inch pie dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Let cool.

In a 2-quart pitcher combine apple juice, decaffeinated tea bags, allspice, honey, and water. Stir well until honey is dissolved. Chill 1 hour or overnight. To serve, pour over ice cubes in tall glasses and garnish with lemon slice, if desired.

Place apple and onion in bottom of 13x9 baking dish. Rinse hens and pat dry. Place in dish with breast side up. Melt butter and mix with soy sauce and parsley. Pour over chickens. Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour. Baste every 15 minutes.
Beat egg whites until very stiff. Add powdered egg whites and water. Add powdered sugar 1 tablespoon at a time until mixture is smooth. Add food coloring.

Preheat oven to 350. Place hot dogs and hot dog buns on baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until hot dogs are done. Split the buns and spread mustard on both halves. Place the hot dog into the bun and add cheese and pepper. Serve hot.

Finely dice all of the vegetables. In a large bowl combine diced vegetables with all of the remaining ingredients. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours. This will give the flavors time to blend together.
Thread shrimp onto skewers. Brush with ketchup mixture. Grill over medium heat until pink and firm, brushing with glaze occasionally, about 5 minutes per side.

In a large heavy saucepan combine the brown sugar, cocoa, light cream, butter and salt. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Beat in the vanilla and pecans. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto waxed paper. Let cool completely before eating or packing in airtight containers. Makes 32 pralines.
Puree strawberries and cantaloupe in a blender. Stir in apple juice. Add ice cubes. Serve. Adjust sweetness with additional honey. Makes 1 serving.

Cream together sugar and butter. Add egg and milk. Add raisins. Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, and salt. Add to mixture. Drop by spoonfuls on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease 12-cup muffin pan. Mix together coconut and oats. Set aside. Combine whole wheat and all-purpose flours, baking powder and soda and salt. Set aside. Cream together butter and bananas until smooth. Add egg and vanilla and mix well. Add dry ingredients and mix until just blended. Fold in coconut and oat mixture. Spoon into muffin cups and sprinkle with a few more coconut and oat bits. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.
Steam or boil carrots in water. When done, drain water and place in bowl. Mash with fork to desired consistency. Stir in butter to melt. Sprinkle with nutmeg to taste. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Mix the peach schnapps with the raspberry vodka in a shot glass. Add 3 ounces of diet sprite. Drop in the lime wedge. Pour into a chilled shot glass. Garnish with gummy bears.
Cocktails - All information about Cocktails - The Cocktail Cocktails is a mixed drink which is usually made from alcoholic spirits. Some cocktails are mixed in the glass in which they will be served. A cocktail is usually served with an accompanying garnish. Cocktails can be classified as either long drinks or short drinks. Long drinks are usually served in a tall glass, while short drinks are usually served in a short glass. The most common types of alcoholic beverages used to make cocktails are: gin, rum, vodka, tequila, whisky, brandy, Cognac and Triple Sec. A lot of cocktails are named after their creator. These include: The Bloody Mary, The Margarita, The Martini, The Manhattan, The Old Fashioned. C

Add broccoli to pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and boil 2-4 minutes (or until tender crisp). Drain in a colander. Put broccoli in a bowl and toss with the melted butter. Add the garlic and the juice from the half lemon. Add the zest and the chopped almonds. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
I am so excited about all the recipes you have listed! I am a broccoli lover and am always looking for new ways to eat it. I've actually never tried it with almonds or lemon...yum!
I love this vegetable too. You have given me some ideas for a new way to enjoy it!
I love to eat broccoli too! Thanks for the recipes.
I'm not a big fan of broccoli. Maybe I should give it another chance.
These recipes sound so good. Thanks for sharing them.
Thanks for all the recipes. I love broccoli and can't wait to try these recipes.
Thank you so much for sharing these. I'm going to try them

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add oil and garlic to skillet. Saute garlic until golden. Add chili. Saute and stir 1 minute. Add crabmeat and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Toss pasta with crabmeat mixture. Sprinkle with black pepper and salt.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). In a large bowl, combine the margarine and cake mix. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 10x15 inch pan. Beat the eggs in a small bowl until foamy and well blended. Add the cream cheese and vanilla. Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until blended. Spread over the crust. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with walnuts and the coconut. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

In medium bowl combine all crust ingredients. Put cutlets in a single layer in shallow dish. Lightly coat with canola oil. Dip in egg and then coat with crust mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. Turn and bake another 10 minutes. Sprinkle cutlets with lemon juice. Serve warm.

Combine chicken, yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Cut vegetables into 1/2-inch cubesadd to the chicken mixture along with the beans. Cover the vegetables with the chicken mixture and refrigerate for several hours. Stir before serving.

Cook pasta according to directions. Meanwhile, brown pork in oil in skillet. Add onion and garlic. Stir in tomatoes and chili. Stir in pasta. Top with cheese. Cook over low heat until cheese is melted. Serve.

Heat the oil in a large wok or skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute until the garlic is golden. Add the cube steaks and cook until browned. Stir in the broccoli florets and cook until tender-crisp. Whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar and sesame oilpour over the meat and vegetables and mix well. Cook until heated through. Serves 4 to 6

Drain pineapple and reserve juice. In a medium saucepan, combine eggs, flour, salt, and sugaradd 1 cup of water and cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Add pineapple juice gradually to make a thick sauce, stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute over low heat or until sauce boils and thickens. Remove from heatcool completely. Combine pineapple, cooled sauce and remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Chill overnight.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease and flour a tube pan. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar. Beat in vanilla and eggs until smooth. In another bowl, sift together flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt. Stir into creamed mixture alternately with milk. Fold in pecans. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

In blender or food processor add yogurt, milk and banana until it is the consistency of a smoothie. If you have a blender that has a frozen setting you could add the yogurt and banana frozen and make it a smoother consistency. Once you get the desired consistency add the chai tea mix and blend for a few minutes until fully incorporated. Add the caramel ice cream topping and blend for about 10 seconds more. Pour into 2 glasses and garnish with mint and whipped topping.

Mix the dry ingredients together. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add the cream cheese and mix with a fork until just combined. Stir in the milk. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth. Roll dough out about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into rounds with a biscuit cutter or knife. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until just golden. Serve warm.

In a medium saucepan combine the margarine, sugar and real butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the egg and continue cooking until the mixture reaches 236 degrees on a candy thermometer. Add the vanilla. Remove from heat. Cool until the mixture reaches room temperature. Stir in the flour. Drop by teaspoon fulls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for about 12 minutes. Do not over bake. Cool. Store in a closed container. Makes 6 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a pie dish. In a large bowl combine Bisquick and milk until smooth. Spread 1/2 of the batter into the pie dish and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and spread the spinach and other vegetables over the top of the batter. Sprinkle the cheese over the spinach. Pour the remaining batter over the cheese. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and serve.

Slice onion thinly. Saute onion with vegetable oil until limp. Cut out cores of cabbage and discard. Cut remainder into shreds. Cut celery and green peppers into thin strips. Mix all vegetables and salt and pepper to taste. Heat to boiling point. Cover tightly and simmer until tender about 15 minutes.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook sausage for 5-6 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Stir in the brown sugar, ground cinnamon, and watercook for 2-3 minutes or until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in pineapple and cook for 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Slice the banana. Fill each tortilla with hot fruit mixture. Fold over the tortilla ends, then roll up each tortilla tightly. Slice each tortilla in half lengthwisearrange on a serving platter. If desired, drizzle with melted butter or margarine. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings (2 tortillas each).

Cut the wings into 2cm cubes and place in a bowl with milk and the sesame seeds. Leave to marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight. When ready to cook, drain off the milk and pat the chicken dry with kitchen paper. Heat the oil to 150c and fry the cubes in small batches until they are golden and cooked through. Serve hot as a starter or with rice as a main meal.
Heat chili in a skillet and add the eggs. Serve with warm tortillas and the cheese and onions. Roll them up and enjoy.

In a heavy saucepan over low heat, combine chips, butter and condensed milk. Stirring frequently, cook until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in liqueur. Pour into 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Cool to room temperature. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Refrigerate until firm. Using a sharp knife, cut into 1x1-in. squares. Dip bottom of each square into toasted coconut. Roll in toasted almonds. Refrigerate.
In a food processor or blender add all of the above and process until smooth and creamy. Store in an airtight container.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic and saute till fragrant. Add pine nuts and almonds. Stir fry for 2 minutes. Add spinach. Stir fry for 2 minutes or until just wilted. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with ham. Serve.

In a saucepan melt the butter and saute the leek until soft. Add curry powder, salt, and pepper and saute for a minute or two. Add frozen peas and carrot, celery. Stir over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the milk and simmer for 5 minutes. Puree the mixture until smooth. Garnish with curly parsley if desired.

Toss cherry tomatoes, green onions, and garlic in a large bowl. Add vinegar and 1/4 cup of the oil and toss gently to coat. Arrange the mixture in a lightly greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Sprinkle with basil and oregano. Bake at 450 degrees F. for 20 minutes or until slightly browned. Sprinkle with feta and olives. Drizzle with remaining 2 Tbsp of oil. Yield : 6-8 servings.

Peel and slice the potatoes. Put the oil and butter in a large skillet and heat over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes and a sprinkling of salt and pepper. Sear the potatoes for about 5 minutes. Add the stock, cover the skillet and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Stuff the potatoes with the fillings and roll them up. Brown the Potaddies in a skillet with a little oil. Serve with a salad or vegetable.

In large skillet, cook pepper strip and onion in butter until tender. Add remaining ingredients, except hot dogs. Heat to boilingreduce heat. Simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add hot dogscook 3 minutes or until heated through. To serve, spoon hot dog mixture over chips.

Combine milk and peanut butter in a 9 x 13-inch baking panmix well. Add pudding mix and mix well. Refrigerate for one hour or until set. Spread graham cracker on top and refrigerate overnight before cutting into squares.

Combine dry ingredients, except peanuts. Add honey to combine. Beat in butter and mix well. Press into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until set. Cool slightly. Mix peanuts into cooled mixture, then cut into 3x5 bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Rinse the cauliflower heads and cut them into florets. In a large bowl combine the cauliflower florets with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Sprinkle the florets with salt and pepper and toss thoroughly to coat. Spread the cauliflower evenly on a baking sheet. Roast the cauliflower for approximately 20 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a knife. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually stir in the milk until the sauce is smooth. Continue to cook the sauce until it thickens slightly. Sprinkle the sauce over the roasted cauliflower. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly and the florets are lightly browned on the edges. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the gruyere cheese. Return the baking sheet to the oven for an additional 5 minutes or until

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake biscuits as directed on package. Cool in refrigerator 5 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in medium bowl stir together butter and sugars until creamy. Beat in 1 1/2 cups cool whip. Spread on top of cooled biscuits. Top with strawberries and blueberries. Spread remaining cool whip on top. Roll in crushed cookie. Garnish with berry.

Cut the carrots into 2-inch pieces. In a 6-quart stockpot, heat the butter over moderate heat until it foams. Add the carrots and saute them until they are lightly browned and tender, about 10 minutes. Season with the sugar and the salt. Deglaze the pan with the marsala, scraping the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon and stirring the mixture until the sugar dissolves. Simmer over moderate heat until the liquid is reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Serve the carrots warm or at room temperature.
Soften cheddar cheese. Mix with onion. Blend in mango chutney. Add ground ginger. Stir in softened cream cheese. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in skillet. Add beef and cook until no longer pink. Stir in onion and pepper and cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add rice and stir until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into 2-quart casserole. In a small bowl, combine soup and milk. Spoon over beef mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.

In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, light maple syrup, sesame oil, ginger and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Heat broiler. Arrange fish on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray and brush both sides with marinade. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with scallions.

Mix wontons, ginger, mushrooms, and water in a bowl. Bring to boil and simmer for 3 minutes. Add broccoli stem, cover, and simmer for 3 minutes or until broccoli stem is crisp. Add broth and cook until wontons are tender. Serve with chopped green onions.
I was reading your web site and noticed that you have a page for your children. I have a child with autism that I am very proud of. I was just wondering if you had any tips for parents that have children with this disability. I have found that the web has been very helpful in finding tips. I was just wondering if you had any you would like to share.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Heat skillet over medium heat. Coat each chop with flour. Heat butter until melted. Cook each side of chops until browned. In the skillet with the butter, whisk together the honey and soy saucestir to blend. Pour mixture over the chops and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with pecans and serve.

Prepare yellow cake mix according to the directions on the package. Instead of using water, substitute with 1 cup of sour cream. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Sour Cream Pound Cake
Sour Cream Yellow Cake
Sour Cream And Blueberry Coffee Cake
Sour Cream Pound Cake Recipes
Chocolate Sour Cream Coffee Cake
Fat Free Sour Cream Pound Cake
Sour Cream Coffee Cake With Pecans
Sour Cream Coffee Cake Mix Recipe

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12x8x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spread out the asparagus spears in the prepared dish. In a small bowl mix together shallots, butter, and 1/4 cup of the balsamic vinegarspread over the asparagus spears. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss gently to coat the vegetables with the shallot mixture. Return to the oven for an additional 3 to 5 minutes or until the spears are crisp-tender. Serve warm.
Such a delicious way to eat your veggies!
I love the idea of the tarragon butter. I have a bunch of tarragon growing that I haven't used yet. This is perfect for it!
I like the sound of the lemon browned butter sauce best!!
The balsamic butter sounds great!
I love asparagus and

Beat eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper until very lightly frothed. Add the oil and the frozen hash brown potatoes. Mix until evenly combined. Heat a nonstick frying pan over medium heat until hot. Pour in the mixture and spread it out evenly over the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle the top with green onions. Sprinkle the Boursin cheese over the top and cook until set. Cut into wedges and serve hot.
I just came across your blog & it is a nice one! Keep up the good work!
Hi! Thanks for visiting my blog! I like your recipe for Boursin Mashed Potatoes!

Stir boiling water into sugar-free jello for at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Mix cold water and ice together. Add to dissolved jello and stir until ice melts. Stir in fat-free cool whip with wire whisk until smooth. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Scoop the avocados into a bowl. Remove the seeds from both halves of each avocado. Mash with a fork until chunky. Add the onion, cilantro, garlic cloves, lime juice, mayonnaise, hot sauce, and tomatoes. Stir together until well blended. Season with salt.

Soak lentils in water overnight or at least six hours. Drain lentils into colander set over a bowl to catch the water. Rinse lentils under cold water for a few seconds to remove any grit. In a saucepan bring water to boil with a pinch of salt and the lentils. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until lentils are soft and mushy but not mushy, about 30 to 40 minutes, adding more water if necessary to keep them from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Mince fresh hot red chili pepper or use crushed red pepper flakesit should be hot enough to make you sneeze. Mince ginger. Combine ginger, coriander, lime juice, salt, pepper, lentils, and red pepper in blender or food processorpuree until smooth and season with salt, pepper, and lime juice to taste. Heat oil in skillet or saucepan over medium heatstir in spinachcovercook until just wiltedstir to combine with lent

Place 1 cup of dry navy beans in a bowl. Add 2 quarts of water to the bowl. Soak the beans for 6 hours. Drain the soaking water. Place the beans in a large pot. Add 2 quarts of fresh water. Add 2 bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 1 hour. Drain the soaking water. Add the remaining 4 quarts of fresh water. Add 2 bay leaves. Bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer the beans until tender. Drain the soaking water. Combine the cooked beans with the tomatoes, cucumbers and onion. Drizzle with the olive oil. Add the oregano. Toss well. Season with the vinegar. Place the salad in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Serve cold. Top each serving with 1 slice of hard-boiled egg.

Brown 1 pound of ground beef in skillet. Drain and mix in 2/3 cup of cooked rice krispies catsup, brown sugar and 1/4 cup vinegar and 1/4 cup tomato soup. Cool and mix in 1 egg and 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard. Form into balls and bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with ketchup or catsup and mustard.

Cut the stems of the bok choy into 1 inch pieces. Rinse the leaves thoroughly. Toss the stems with the salt in a bowl. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the stems well. Heat the oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add the ginger and stir-fry for 10 seconds. Add the red pepper and stir-fry until the pepper is soft, 20-30 seconds. Add the garlic and stir-fry until golden brown, about 1 minute. Add the stems and cook until crisp-tender. Add the leaves and cook until tender but still green. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry until the leaves are dry. Stir in the fish sauce. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cut the tomatoes in half. Place on a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the basil and garlic. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with the basil and garlic. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the salt substitute and black pepper. Let cool. Serve alone or with a salad.

Prepare the marinade by combining the yogurt with the garlic. Place the chicken in a bowl and pour over the marinade. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare the relish by mixing the remaining ingredients. Drain and pat the chicken dry. Grill the chicken over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Serve the chicken with the relish.
name: grilled chicken and vegetablesingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halveslemons, juice ofdried oreganogarlic saltolive oilfeta cheesetzatzikikalamata olivespreparation:combine lemon juice, oregano, garlic salt in shallow dish. whisk to combine. while wisking stir in olive oil. add chicken turning once. marinate 30-60 minutes turning half-way. grill to your liking. discard marinade. top chicken with feta cheese, tzatziki sauce, and olives

In a large mixing bowl beat together butter and brown sugar until creamy. Beat in cocoa. Beat in egg whites. Stir in dry ingredients until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoons onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes.

Put all the ingredients in a bowl and stir until the salt is dissolved. Add the steaks to the bowl, turning them to coat both sides with the marinade. Refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Remove the steaks and discard the marinade. Grill the steaks for 4 to 5 minutes on each side for medium doneness. Remove the steaks to a cutting board and cut into thin strips. Serve on warm flour tortillas topped with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, sour cream, guacamole and shredded cheese.

Heat the mixed fruit and the tea in a large pan for 2 minutes then set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4 and grease and line a 2lb loaf tin. Melt the brandy in a small pan and allow to cool. In a large bowl beat the eggs and then add the mixed fruit and tea mixture, the brandy and 6 tablespoons of the dark brown sugar. Sift over the flour and the mixed spice and beat until well mixed. Pour into the loaf tin and sprinkle with the remaining dark brown sugar. Bake for 60-70 minutes until well risen and golden brown. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the beans and cook for about 6 minutes or until the beans are crisp-tender. Drain the water, run the beans under cold water, drain again, place them back into the pot, cover the pot with a lid and set aside.In a skillet, over medium heat, add the butter. Once the butter has melted add the shallots and garlic powder and saute until the onions are translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the bell peppers and the cooked beans, stir to combine and remove from heat. Stir in the salt and pepper, taste, then add more if necessary. Serve immediately.

In a large pot over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, rosemary and bay leaves and cook for 30 seconds. Add the wine and scrape the bottom of the pot to incorporate the fond. Add the broth, mushrooms, lentils, carrot and celery. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover partially and simmer until the lentils are tender and the mushrooms are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve in bowls with grated cheese.

Heat water in saucepan until it boils. Add in the rest of the ingredients. Cook until the water is gone. Stir continuously. Cook for about 15 minutes. Stir in the flour until the mixture thickens. Turn off the heat. Let it cool. Put it in a jar.

Saute garlic and olive oil in large skillet until fragrant and lightly browned. Add tomatoes and spinach and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until spinach wilts. Stir in pastatoss gently to coat. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Divide pasta among four platessprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Slice the tomato into halves lengthwise. Set aside. In a bowl mix together the tuna, capers, celery, parsley, basil, mayonnaise, lemon juice and salt & pepper. Fill the halved tomato with the tuna mixture. Garnish with a sprig of parsley before serving.

Combine apples and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add lemon zest and maple syrup. Mix until well combined. Place in fridge for 30 minutes. Combine dates and lemon balm in a small bowl. Divide apples and lemon juice mixture evenly between 2 bowls. Top each with 2 teaspoons of date mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
Susan, I just found your blog and am so glad that I did. I love your recipes and will definitely try some of them. I also love your photography.
Mix together the onions, peppers and celery seed. Add the beans and garlic. Mix together the oil and vinegar and pour over the mixture. Mix well and refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Beat egg whites in a medium bowl at medium speed of an electric mixer until foamy. Add cream of tartar, beat on high speed for 5 minutes. Gradually add 1/4 cup of the powdered sugar. Beat on medium speed for 5 minutes. Gradually add remaining powdered sugar. Beat on high speed for 5 minutes longer. Increase speed to high. Add vanilla. Beat 10 minutes longer. Add vinegar. Beat on high speed for 10 minutes longer or until mixture forms stiff peaks. Pipe mixture onto prepared baking sheets in 2 inch circles. Bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes. Cool. Garnish with lemon and orange slices.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Brown the chicken in the pan. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add wine. Continue cooking until the wine is evaporated. Add capers. Serve hot.

Combine granola and brown sugar. Melt butter and pour over the granola and brown sugar mixture. Stir until combined. Fold in tapioca and almond extract. Combine with tart cherries and let stand about 20 minutes. Adjust the top crust and cut steam vents. Bake at 400F for 55 minutes or until the topping is bubbling through the slits and the crust is golden brown.
cherry pie recipe by Sharon - 06/18/2003
This is my recipe that I got from my mother in law when I got married about 40 years ago. I have changed it slightly through the years but it is still the best I have ever had.
3 cups of tart cherries (I get them canned)
1 cup of quick cooking tapioca
2 tablespoons of almond extract
Pie crust as follows:
1/2 cup of shortening or lard
Combine all the above together and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until the cherries are bubbling through the slits you cut in

Mix corn with cream-style corn until smooth. Boil pasta in water until al dente and drain. Return pasta to pan and toss with corn mixture until well coated and hot. Add butter and cheese to the pan and stir until melted. Serve immediately.

In a 2 quart sauce pan combine 2 cups sugar with 1 cup corn syrup and 1/2 cup water. Stir over medium heat until bubbly. Boil for 2 minutes then remove from heat and add 1/4 cup butter 1/2 tsp salt 3/4 cup cocoa 1 tsp baking soda 3/4 cup water 1 1/2 cups milk 1/2 tsp vanilla. Beat with mixer until frothy then spread on cakes or cookies.

In a large pot over medium heat, cook onion and garlic until softened. Add jalapeno pepper and cook for an additional minute. Add pinto beans and brothbring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until beans are tender, about 1 hour. Stir in fresh tomatoes and simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Season with cumin and oregano. Ladle into bowls and top with cheese.

Cook meat and drain fat. Mix in the salsa and taco seasoning. Layer meat into shells. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees until heated through and the cheese melts. Serve with tomato, onion, lettuce and black olives.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Sautee bread crumbs until golden brown. Remove from heat and cool for a few minutes. Mix together beaten eggs with italian cheese (about half of the cheese). Divide this mixture into four equal parts. Place one fourth of the mixture in each of four small bowls. Divide the bread crumbs among the bowls and stir to combine. Pour about a cup of chicken stock in each bowl. Cook in a microwave for about three minutes, stirring each bowl once or twice during the cooking time. Serve hot in bowls or cups with additional cheese to sprinkle over the top if desired.
Combine cheese and butter. Melt in microwave. Stir in other ingredients. Spread on french bread. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes. Serves 6.

In a large skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add scallions and chile and saut for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Stir in thyme and broth. Cover and cook 5 to 6 minutes or until shrimp are done. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice.

Boil potatoes until soft but not mushy. Drain potatoes and set aside. Meanwhile, chop kale into small pieces and sautee in olive oil until tender. Add in ricotta cheese and let simmer for about 1 minute. Stir the cheese mixture into the potatoes and mash until smooth. Add more butter if desired. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour and whisk constantly for 1 minute. Gradually add milkwhisk constantly until smooth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in Gouda, paprika and nutmeg. Stir over low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Serve with freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9 inch springform pan combine 1 package of spice cake mix (from box), 1 can of crushed pineapple in its own juice, 4 eggs and 2 teaspoons of orange extract. Pour into pan and bake 30 minutes or until done. While it is cooling prepare the glaze. Combine 1/4 cup of powdered sugar and 1/4 cup water. Pour glaze over top of the warm spice cake.
I think this is an easy recipe to use and it is very tasty.
I've made this recipe many times. It's easy and delicious.
I can't wait to try this recipe. I love all the reviews that were given.
I made this recipe once and it was delicious. I used a 9x13 pan and it was perfect. I will make it again.
This recipe is so easy and tastes great! It's a keeper.
This recipe is so easy and delicious. The only problem I have had is that the glaze has

Place all the ingredients in the order listed in the pan. Set crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. When the baking cycle ends, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing.

Rub the inside of the roasting tin with butter. Mix together the flour and the soy sauce and sprinkle evenly over the tin. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in the pan and cook the chicken on all sides. Pour in the lemon juice and the liqueur, then put the tin into the preheated oven. Roast for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and add the honey and the orange zest. Cook for a further 10 minutes. Serve hot with vegetables.

Place the broccoli in a skillet with the water. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the onions, butter, salt, and pepper. Cover. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat. In a bowl, mix the egg yolks, sour cream, thyme and worcestershire sauce. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff. Fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture. Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the crumbled bacon. Stir until cooked. Pour the egg mixture into the pie crust. Sprinkle with the cheese. Cover with the broccoli mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes.

In a small bowl combine apricot preserves, ketchup, vinegar and tabasco. Season with salt and pepper. Place chicken on rack in shallow roasting pan and spray with cooking spray. Sprinkle with thyme. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes. Turn chicken and spray top. Bake 30 minutes longer. Remove from oven. Pour preserves mixture evenly onto chicken and bake 10 minutes more. Turn chicken and bake 10 minutes more. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a large bowl, beat eggs until light and frothy. Beat in sugar and vegetable oil until smooth and creamy. Stir in apple, carrots and vanilla extractset aside. In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder and saltstir well with a whisk. Stir in the egg mixture just until combineddo not over-mix. Fill the prepared muffin cups about 3/4 full. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch pie pan. Spread the apples in the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and old-fashioned oats. In a bowl combine the filling, 1/2 cup of the flour, and the 1/4 cup of the apple sauce. Spread this mixture over the top of the apple and oat mixture. Place the second pie crust on top of the filling. Flute the edges of the top crust. With a sharp knife cut several slits in the top. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes. Allow the pie to cool. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Brown ground beef, onion and mushroom soup in medium skillet until thoroughly cooked. Drain off grease. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Bake in unbaked pie shells at 425 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool and serve with bread. Makes about 3 dozen little appetizer meat pies.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally until tender about 20 minutes. Add lemon juice and zest to the hot skillet with the potatoesseason with salt. Add cilantro and scallionstoss to combine. Serve warm or room temperature.

Beat 3 eggs with a wire whisk or fork. Beat in 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pour into unbaked crust. Beat 1/2 cup sour cream with 1/4 teaspoon almond extract and spread over filling. Top with blueberries. Bake at 350f for 1 hour or until filling is set. Makes 8 servings.

Cook potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Stir in milk. Add bacon. Cook and stir kielbasa in skillet until cooked. Drain and stir in potato mixture. Add broccoli and remaining vegetables. Mix lightly. Spoon into 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until heated through. Serves 4.

Place egg yolks, water, 1/4 tsp cayenne, 1/4 tsp white pepper in top of double boiler. Cook over simmering water until thick. Add 1 tbs butter and cook 30 seconds. Remove from heat. Whisking constantly, add remaining butter 1 tbs at a time until smooth. Add fresh lemon juice. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

In large skillet cook onion in butter over moderate heat until golden brown, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes. Add vinegar and thymecook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Boil potatoes until tenderdrain and place in large bowl. Mash until smoothadd onion mixture, Dijon mustard, horseradish, 1/4 cup of the half-and-half, and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepperbeat until smooth. If necessary, add more of the half-and-half to obtain desired consistency. Transfer to shallow 2-quart baking dishspread evenly. Sprinkle evenly with remaining 2 teaspoons of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of peppersprinkle with 1/4 cup of the Parmesan cheesecover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake covered 30 minutesuncover and bake until light golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes more. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Par

Wash and boil the cabbage and carrots for 10 minutes. Cool and cut. Boil the scallions for 1 minute and then add to the vegetables. Mix the rest of the ingredients and add to the vegetables. Allow to marinate for at least one hour.
Preheat grill to medium heat. In a bowl combine soy sauce, mustard, honey and salt and pepper. Brush onion slices with the sauce mixture and grill, turning once, until tender and lightly charred.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8" square baking dish. In large bowl mix dry ingredients together. In a medium bowl mix together egg whites, buttermilk and butterstir into dry ingredients just until dry ingredients are moisteneddo not over-mix. Stir in corn kernels, cheese and jalapeno pepperstir just until well mixed. Pour batter into prepared baking dishbake 40 to 45 minutes or until top springs back when touched lightly with fingercool slightly before cutting.

Mix mustard with water. Spread mustard mixture on 4 slices of italian bread. Top with 2 slices of ham and 1 slice of swiss cheese on each slice. Spread remaining mustard mixture on 4 slices of bread. Top with remaining ham and cheese. Butter one side of 4 slices of bread. Place sandwiches into skillet or electric skillet. Cook until brown, 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and sprinkle top with green onions. Cut in half on the diagonal.

Pour the vegetable oil into a large non-stick skillet and heat over medium heat until it is hot but not smoking. Add the pork and sear on all sides until it is nicely browned and crisp. Add the onions and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the white wine and bring to a boil, scraping up any bits stuck to the bottom of the pan. Cover and cook for about 2 minutes, until the onions are soft and the alcohol has cooked off the wine. Stir in the lemon juice and season with the garlic, salt and pepper. Cover and cook for an additional 3 minutes. Stir in the paprika and cook for an additional minute or two. Remove from the heat and stir in the bay leaves. Allow the mixture to cool completely before dividing it between two 2-cup ramekins and covering with plastic wrap. Place the ramekins in the refrigerator for at least 2 days and up to one week, turning the ramekins once a day. Remove the ramekins from the refrigerator and allow them to come back up to room temperature before baking.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse chicken inside and out, pat dry. Cut onion in half and rub all over chicken. Place in roasting pan and pour onion over chicken. Add 1/2 inch of water to bottom of pan. Cover pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven and turn off oven. Pour lemon juice over chicken and let stand in oven for 30 minutes. Combine parsley, thyme, paprika, salt in small bowl. Remove chicken from oven. Remove foil cover. Rub mixture over all sides of chicken. Return to oven, uncovered. Bake 45 minutes longer. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef. Add onions and saute. Drain and return to pan. Add tortillas and stir until crumbled. Add soup and milk. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add chillies, mozzarella and half of the cheddar and stir. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes.

Cream together oil and sugars. Add vanilla and beat for 1 minute. Add beaten eggs and beat until combined. Beat in peanut butter. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Chill dough for 1 hour. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Roll in confectioners' sugar and store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Place salmon on a plate with 1 tsp soy sauce and gingerroot. Grill salmon for 2-3 minutes per side. Mix remaining soy sauce with 1 tbsp sweet chili sauce. Cut salmon into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Arrange rice in a bowl and place a portion on each of 4 plates. Top with salmon and a drizzle of sauce. Garnish with spring onions and serve with steamed rice.
Take a small piece of fruitcake. Put into a cupcake baking tin. Drizzle with brandy. Sprinkle with the chocolate, then decorate with the decorative candies. Refrigerate until set. Serve and enjoy.

Prepare the dressing by combining all the dressing ingredients in a bowl. Place the prepared vegetables in a large bowl. Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Toss well. Garnish with green onion tops.
