Grease 13x9 baking pan. Combine sugar and butter, mix well. Add flour and rice flour and mix well. Press evenly into the pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 375f. Cool completely. Spread with butter cream icing. Cut into squares. Icing: Beat together butter and icing sugar until smooth. Add a little milk and beat until spreadable.

Rub tuna with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tuna, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until desired doneness. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Combine remaining ingredients. Slice tuna and serve with sauce.

Prepare the brewed coffee as directed by the coffeemaker manufacturer. Cool slightly. Add the sugar, chocolate syrup, milk, half-and-half, and ice cubes. Blend in a blender or food processor until smooth. Serve in tall glasses.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix all ingredients together except for the panko crumbs and the fish. Brush the fish with the mixture and sprinkle with the bread crumbs. Place the fish on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes until the fish flakes with a fork and the crumbs are golden brown.

Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. Add chicken breast halvesreduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 15 minutes or until cooked through. Drain. Shred chicken. In a large bowl combine cooked macaroni with the shredded chicken. In a medium saucepan combine the chicken broth with the velveeta and milk. Heat until melted. Add broccoli. Pour over macaroni mixture. Toss well to coat. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Combine all crusting ingredients together. Place cracker crumbs in a shallow bowl. Dip scallops into mustard and then into crumb mixture to coat. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add scallops to skillet and saute until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving plate. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons oil and serve immediately with a side of spicy remoulade.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a shallow baking dish. Place the fresh and dried cranberries in the baking dish. Toss gently to combine. Sprinkle the cinnamon on top. Cover and bake for 1 hour, stirring the mixture after about 30 minutes of baking time. After 1 hour remove from oven and stir in lemon juice and marmalade. Return to oven and bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Store any leftover conserve covered in the fridge. Can be made 3 days ahead.

Pour 1 inch of cold water into a large bowl. Rinse the clams and add to bowl of water. Soak for 10 minutes. Remove clams from bowl. Discard any that have not opened. Rinse the clams under cold water. Drain. In a large heavy skillet cook onions in olive oil until translucent. Add jalapeno pepper, red pepper flakes, and clams. Cook until clams open. Add tomatoes and their juice, fresh garlic, lemon juice. Add 1/2 cup of water. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add scallions. Cook for another 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Remove stems from mushrooms and chop finely. Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add chopped garlic, green onion, chopped mushroom stems, salt and pepper to taste. Sauté until the mixture is well blended. Combine the mixture with the milk in a large bowl. Beat the eggs in another large bowl until they are lightly whisked and well blended. Stir the mushroom mixture into the egg mixture, folding gently until the mixture is thoroughly combined. Stir in 1/4 cup cheese. Grease an 8 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish with butter. Pour the egg mixture into the prepared dish. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of cheese over the top of the mixture and bake until the center is set and the top is lightly browned, about 30 to 35 minutes. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it sit for 15 minutes before cutting into 9 squares to serve.

Combine rice vinegar, soy sauce, ginger and 1 tsp coarse salt. Whisk until ginger is well incorporated. Pat cod dry and add to a greased baking pan or shallow casserole. Pour marinade over fish. Cover tightly with foil. Refrigerate at least 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through. Garnish with scallions and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Rinse and pat dry the chickens. Place garlic cloves and lemon inside the cavity of each chicken. Sprinkle with smoked paprika. Tie legs together. Heat olive oil and butter in ovenproof skillet over medium-low heat. Place the chickens in the skillet. Roast 30 minutes then reduce oven to 350 degrees. Continue cooking 1 hour to 1 1/4 hours or until the juices run clear when the thigh is pierced with a fork. Remove the chickens to a serving platter and drizzle with the pan juices. Garnish with thyme.

Cook the bacon in a large pan until crispy. Remove and set aside. In the same pan melt the butter and add the onion. Cook for 10 minutes until soft and translucent. Add the lentils and cook for 2 minutes. Add the vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend the soup in a liquidizer until smooth. Stir in the double cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with the crispy bacon and serve.

Combine all the ingredients except the meatloaf, making sure they are all well blended together. Add the lean ground beef (1200g) to the mixture, using your hands to make sure it is well combined with the sauce. Pour the mixture into a loaf pan and bake for 1 hour at 180 degrees celsius or until cooked through.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place hash browns into a 13x9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with the onion flakes, dill and seasoning salt and pepper. Dot with butter and pour the milk over the top. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and add the fish sticks. Return to oven and bake for 10 more minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve with ketchup and tartar sauce.

In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and shortening together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. In a seperate bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add to the sugar mixture and mix well. Stir in the pecans and the chocolate chips. Spread into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 325 for approximately one hour. Cool before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Crush candy bars in a plastic bag. Crumble cake in large dish and sprinkle with crushed candy bars. Pour milk over and let stand for 5 minutes. Mix pudding and milk. Pour over crumbs and let stand for 5 more minutes. Fold in cool whip. Refrigerate and serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Combine spelt flour, baking powder, salt, and milk in a large bowl, and stir to combine. Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or fork until the mixture looks like coarse crumbs.Stir in honey, then knead gently until mixture forms a ball of dough. Turn out onto lightly floured surfaceknead 10 times. Roll dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut dough into circles using a cookie cutter or drinking glass.Place cookies on an ungreased baking sheet, spacing them 1 inch apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned around the edges. Remove cookies from oven, and allow them to cool on wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen 3-inch cookies.

Cook broth and macaroni in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook ground round in oil until browned. Stir in kidney beans. Add spaghetti sauce, tomato paste and water. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve with macaroni.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook ground cayenne pepper in vegetable oil until fragrant about 1 minute. Add lean ground beef. Cook until meat is browned and crumbles easily with a fork about 10 minutes. Stir in kielbasa and cook until browned about 3 minutes more. Stir in tomato sauce, green pepper, and celery. Cook 1 minute. Stir in onion. Cook until crisp-tender about 3 minutes. Stir in garlic. Cook until fragrant about 30 seconds. Add beans and their liquid. Stir in tomato paste and broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add rice, stirring well. Bring back to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until rice is tender about 45 minutes.

Mix together chile and garlic in a small bowl. Add lemon juice. Combine well. Set aside for 30 minutes. In another bowl combine the chile mixture with the peanut oil. Add the lemon slices. Mix well. Marinate the shrimp for at least one hour, turning several times to ensure all sides are marinated. Thread the marinated shrimp onto skewers. Place the skewers on the barbecue. Cook for 4 minutes on each side or until the shrimp are opaque. Serve warm with the lemon wedges to squeeze over the top.

In a small bowl combine ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, and soy sauce. Stir to combine. Add water and cornstarch and stir until the mixture thickens. In a large bowl combine the ketchup mixture and chicken, tossing to coat. In a large skillet over medium-high heat heat oil and saute red pepper flakes until oil is sizzling and the flakes are fragrant. Add chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through and golden brown. Serve with rice and sesame oil if desired.
I am sorry to say that this recipe is not worth the effort involved in making it. I do not like the taste of this dish and do not recommend it to anyone that does not like the taste.
I will be making this recipe again and again! It is so easy to make and the flavor is wonderful!
I've been making this recipe for a long time and it is one that I use time and time again!
I love this recipe and I am sure that anyone else that tries it will love it also!
I have made this recipe several times and

Preheat oven to 375F. Heat oven to 375F. Toss together the shallot and oil in a bowlseason with salt and pepper. Spread on a rimmed baking sheet and bake until golden brown and tender, 35-40 minutes. Discard thyme sprigs and season to taste. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled.

Cream shortening with the sugar. Beat in the eggs one at a time then add the bananas and beat well. Sift together the dry ingredients and add to the creamed mixture alternating with the buttermilk, starting with the dry ingredients and ending with the dry ingredients. Fold in the pecans. Pour into a greased loaf pan or two 8 inch square pans that have been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine cayenne, cumin, and paprika in small bowl and mix well. Cut each sweet potato in half lengthwise and place cut side down on a baking sheet. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan and whisk in honey and 2 tablespoons orange juice. Sprinkle spice mixture over potatoes and toss to coat. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until tender and beginning to caramelize. Remove from oven and drizzle with remaining orange juice and remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper.

Combine eggnog and milk in large bowl. Stir in 1 tablespoon of chocolate syrupset aside. In small bowl, beat 1 egg with 1 tablespoon milk until blendedadd to eggnog mixture. Beat at medium speed until frothy. Pour into 4 mugssprinkle with nutmeg and garnish with marshmallows. Makes 4 servings.
Today was my day off from work so I spent it in the kitchen creating recipes for Hot Chocolate.
I have been looking for a good Hot Chocolate recipe for years and I think I have finally found it.
I made a Hot Chocolate Sauce that is amazing! I made it from a recipe I found on a package of powdered milk, but it was very good!
I also made 3 other Hot Chocolate Recipes that I found on this website!
I loved them all! I will definitely be making Hot Chocolate again soon!
You can use any type of milk you want to make this drink. I used 2% milk for my Hot Chocolate Sauce but you can

Combine coconut, sesame seeds and dry breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Beat egg whites until foamy. Dip turkey in egg whites. Cover with crumb mixture. Spray skillet with cooking spray. Cook in skillet over medium heat until golden. Serve with rice.

In a large mixing bowl combine rice and chicken broth. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 10 minutes. Stir in celery and continue to cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in walnuts and cranberries. Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Wash the fish and pat it dry with absorbent kitchen paper. Season the fish with salt and pepper. In a large bowl mix together the cornmeal, flour and seasoning. Add the fish and toss to coat well. Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Carefully add fish to oil and fry for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown and crispy. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and grate sweet potatoes into a mixing bowl. Add beaten egg and soy sauce and mix well. Form into 1 1/2-inch balls. In a small bowl combine honey and butter. Dip sweet potato balls into honey mixture and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 30 minutes until brown and crisp.
Combine all of the ingredients and stir until smooth. Top with whipped cream and a drizzle of white chocolate.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a blender or food processor and blend well. Pour into a nonreactive container and allow to sit at room temperature for 1 to 2 hours before using. Remove the lamb from the marinade and pat dry. Preheat a grill or broiler and cook the lamb to desired doneness. For medium rare lamb, cook for about 5 minutes per side and serve immediately. If desired, re-warm the marinade and brush over the chops just before serving. Serve the lamb with baked potatoes and steamed vegetables.

Sift together dry ingredients. Add milk, egg and vanilla. Mix well. Pour batter into two greased and floured loaf pans and bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Mix together the sugar and coconut and sprinkle on top of each loaf. Bake for an additional five minutes.

Brown the beef in a large frying pan until it is no longer pink and drain off the fat. Add the diced onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the green pepper and cook until the pepper is tender about 5 minutes longer. In a large bowl combine the beef mixture with the mashed potatoes and seasonings until blended well. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until the topping is lightly browned. Cut the crescent rolls into 1 inch pieces. Mix with the melted real butter. Spread over the top of the casserole and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the topping is lightly browned. Serves 4.

Cream the peanut butter with the brown sugar until well combined. Add the egg and beat until combined. Stir in the vanilla. In a small bowl mix together the baking soda and the flour. Add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and stir until combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are just firm. Remove the cookies to wire racks to cool.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain. In a large bowl, mix together pasta, chicken, milk, tomatoes, and green onions until well blended. Add salsa con queso and mix well. Serve immediately in individual bowls, sprinkled with cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 400F. Toss the potatoes with the salt and pepper and arrange on a baking sheet in a single layer. Bake until lightly browned and tender when pierced with a fork, about 20-25 minutes. While the potatoes are roasting, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside. Add the onion and garlic to the bacon grease and cook until the onion is tender. Add the milk and cheddar and continue cooking until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through. Add the bacon back in and stir until well combined. Remove the potatoes from the oven and top with the bacon mixture and scallions. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 2-4 minutes until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow bowl, blend together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. In a small saucepan, heat butter and garlic over very low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Place in oven and bake 1 hour.
This is a simple recipe that I have used for years and everyone loves it! I usually get the frozen chicken tenders and the cook time is just about right as stated above. This is a great recipe to take to a party and is so easy!
This recipe was given to me by a friend. It is one of our family's favorites!
I found this recipe in Cooking Light magazine and it was delicious!
This recipe was given to me by my grandmother and has always been a favorite of our family.

Put the caster sugar, golden syrup, sweetened condensed milk, unsalted butter and water in a saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent the mixture from catching on the bottom of the pan. Allow the mixture to boil for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Grease an 8x8x2-inch pan with some of the mixture and spread over the bottom of the pan. Cool to room temperature, then cut into squares. Store the tablet in an air-tight container.
Cook the potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and mash with the sour cream and season with the mix. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add corn. Return to boiling. Boil 5 minutes. Drain. Let stand 2 minutes. Cut kernels from cobs. In a large bowl, toss together the corn, tomatoes, onion, basil, and vinegar. Drizzle with the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. In a bowl, combine cream of chicken soup, sour cream and the next 5 ingredients. Spoon over the chicken. Cover and bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Sprinkle cheese over the top and broil 1-2 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve over frito corn chips.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Meanwhile, mince onion and garlic. Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until soft. Add cooked pasta to pan. Add grated parmesan cheese. Stir. Add sliced radish.

Soak fish in buttermilk for 10 minutes. Remove fish from buttermilk and pat dry. Lightly dust each piece of fish with flour and shake off excess flour. Dip into egg and coat well. Place in a skillet and saute until golden brown. Add chili sauce and simmer for a few minutes. Remove from heat and serve with lemon wedges.

Crumble sausage into a hot nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Cook and stir sausage until no longer pink, about 3 minutes. Add onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Whisk together eggs, milk, pepper, and salt in a medium bowl until well combined. Pour into the hot pan and stir gently until eggs begin to set around the edges of the pan. Sprinkle with cheese and cook until eggs are set but still slightly wet. Remove pan from the heat and fold the eggs over so that they are evenly distributed throughout the pan. Top with hot pepper sauce and salsa. Serve with warm tortillas.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Sauté the onions, green pepper, & garlic in the hot butter until tender. Stir in the pearl barley & chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Cover & simmer for 25 to 30 minutes or until the barley is tender. Stir in the salt & pepper to taste. Serve in individual bowls. Serve with ½ cup of shredded cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Brown hamburger. Drain. Add water and contents of seasoning pack. Bring to a boil. Stir in mixed vegetables. Cover. Reduce heat to medium and cook 5 to 8 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Break up the noodles and add to the skillet. Cover and cook 5 to 8 minutes or until sauce is as thick as you like it. Stir occasionally separating noodles. Serve.

Cut the cauliflower into small pieces. Boil in salt water till tender. Drain thoroughly. Make a sauce by melting the butter in a skillet. Add the bread crumbs. Stir until well blended. Add the milk. Cook over low heat until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Add the swiss cheese. Pour this mixture over the drained cauliflower. Mix well. Put in a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in a 400 oven until top is browned and crisp. Serve at once.

In small fry pan over medium heat cook serrano ham until it is crisp. Remove from pan, drain well and cool. Trim ends off asparagus and snap off tough ends. Boil in small amount of water until tender-crisp, about 4 minutes. Drain and plunge into ice water for 1 minute. Drain and cool. In small bowl combine olive oil and pepper and stir well. Toss asparagus in oil mixture and serve topped with serrano ham.

Cream together butter and brown sugar until well blended. Add eggs and beat well. Add hot water and mix well. Add flour, baking powder and baking soda and mix well. Add salt and mix well. Add chocolate chips and stir well. Drop by teaspoons onto cookie sheets and bake in preheated 400f oven for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper muffin cups. Sift together the first six ingredientsset aside. Beat the remaining ingredients together in a large bowl. Add the dry mixture and stir just until moistened. Fold in the marshmallows. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool the muffins in the pan for 5 minutes before removing. Makes 12 muffins.
I have a 12 cup muffin tin. I make muffins using a box of Betty Crocker muffin mix. I just add 1/2 cup of skim milk (or 1/2 cup of water) and 3/4 cup of apple sauce. It's so much better than using the box mix. I use less sugar and fat and I don't feel guilty about eating them.
Mix together and spoon into 12 greased miniature muffin cups. Bake at

Rinse the chicken and pat dry with paper towels. In a shallow bowl, combine hot sauce, vinegar and margarinemix well. Add celery seeds and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Dip each chicken piece in mixtureplace on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes. Serve with blue cheese dressing.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place a vanilla wafer in the bottom of each 4 oz. Coffee mug and set aside. Beat together the cream cheese and the 1/2 cup plus 3 tablespoons of sugar at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Add the egg white and beat at high speed until light and fluffy. Add the coffee liqueur and vanilla. Beat until just combined. Spoon the filling over the vanilla wafers. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until set. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.
Combine garlic, basil leaves and almonds in food processor. Pulse until well chopped. With machine running add olive oil and process until smooth. Add lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat oil over medium heat and saute the onion and carrots until tender. Add the turnips and celery and saute until tender. Add the potatoes and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in the honey and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the chopped garlic and cook for a minute or two. Serve with a sprinkling of fresh chopped parsley.
In a large pot add the uncooked rice, Wesson Oil. Cook the onion, celery and green pepper in the oil until tender. Add the ham, canned tomatoes and seasonings. Cook until done.

Cook turkey bacon until crisp. Crumble and set aside. Cut bread in half. Spread mayo on the inside of the bread. Layer with turkey bacon, lettuce and tomatoes. Sandwich together. Cut sandwich into wedges.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown meat and sausage until no longer pinkdrain fat. Add seasonings and water. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. In a small bowl, combine cheese and water. Add cheese mixturecook and stir until melted. Serve over bread.
name: cinnamon rollsingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, active dry yeast, evaporated milk, warm water, cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, flourpreparation:In a small bowl combine brown sugar and cinnamon. In large bowl combine yeast, warm water and sugar. Let set for about 10 minutes or until mixture starts bubbling and foaming. In another small bowl combine evaporated milk and vanilla extract, set aside. In a large bowl combine 3 cups of the flour and salt. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Add the yeast mixture and the evaporated milk mixturebeat until well combined. Turn out dough onto lightly fl

Place a steamer basket in a large pot. Add the zucchini and carrots. Add 1 inch of water to the bottom of the pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and steam until just tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain the vegetables and cool slightly. Transfer to a serving bowl. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, water, garlic, salt and pepper. Whisk to blend. Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Garnish with the scallions, lemon juice and chives.

Preheat oven to 180 C (350 F). Lay fish on a baking tray or a lightly oiled baking sheet. Sprinkle with pepper and salt and roast for 15 minutes. Mix tomato slices with onion, orange rind, garlic, chillies, thyme leaves and oil in a bowl. Roast for another 15 minutes or till the tomato slices are golden brown. Garnish with basil leaves.

Place sliced apples in crock pot with brown sugar and water. Cover and cook on low for one hour, then stir in sauerkraut, sausage and caraway seeds. Cook another hour or more until apples are tender and sauerkraut is softened. Add apple juice and salt to taste. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Combine sugar, cocoa, and milk in microwaveable bowl and heat on high for 1 minute. Add peanut butter and butter and stir until smooth. Add old fashioned oats and stir until well blended. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper and allow to cool before removing from wax paper.

Peel cloves and cut into 1/2 inch pieces and place in an airtight container with vinegar and water and let marinate overnight. Drain and rinse and place in an airtight container with honey and oil and let marinate for another 24 hours. Drain and rinse and let dry on paper towels for 2 hours. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Toss with salt and pink peppercorns and place on cookie sheet and bake for 1 hour until cloves are browned and crisp and carmelized. Store in an airtight container and use within one week.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the light karo syrup and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the sugar and salt. Add the eggs, one at a time and beat well after each addition. Return the mixture to the heat and bring to a full boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice and the vanilla. Pour into the prepared pie shells and bake for 50-60 minutes or until the centers are set. Cool on a wire rack for 1-2 hours. Serve warm or cold with ice cream or whipped topping.

Dry the shrimp with paper towels and then dredge them in the flour. Heat the oil in a pan and saute the shrimp until they just turn pink and then remove them and put them aside. Add the white wine to the pan and reduce by half. Add the butter and the lemon juice and reduce to a sauce consistency. Stir in the heavy cream and bring to a boil. Add the shrimp back to the pan and garnish with the parsley. Serve with rice.

Measure all ingredients into bread machine pan, in order that they are listed. Set machine for dough cycle and start. At end of dough cycle, remove dough to lightly floured surface and shape into loaf. Place in greased loaf pan, cover and let rise until bread is 1 to 2 inches above edges of pan. Be patient, sourdough without the addition of commercial yeast can take up to several hours to rise. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 to 50 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Top can be brushed with butter for a soft crust, if desired. This is what develops the characteristic sour flavor and the longer the proof, the sourer it will be. If you start with 1 cup of starter and feed it 1 cup each of water and flour, you should have enough to make your bread and save the rest to start your next batch.

Line bottom of 9x13 inch pan with wax paper. Grease sides of panset aside. In large bowl, beat ricotta cheese with electric mixer on medium speed until smoothadd sugar gradually until well blendedbeat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Stir in pudding mix. Pour mixture into prepared panspread to evenly distribute in panrefrigerate 1 hour or until set. Remove from refrigeratorloosen sides of cake from pan by lifting pan edgeinvert onto serving plateremove wax paperspread top of cake with non-dairy whipped toppingsprinkle with chocolate chipsdrizzle with chocolate syrupgarnish with chocolate shavingsserve immediately. Makes 20 servings.

Place mashed potatoes in a large bowl. Mix in ricotta cheese, chives and garlic powder until combined. Wrap 1 tablespoon mashed potato mixture in each egg roll wrapper. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat until hot. Add egg rolls and cook about 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Serve with a dipping sauce or on their own.

Sift cornflour with 1 tablespoon dark soya sauce and 1 tablespoon sweet chili sauce. Place steak in a non-stick frying pan with 3 tablespoons of stock and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and cover, then cook for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, wash and shake dry bok choy leaves. Cut off stems and discard or reserve for another use. Set aside. Pour off excess stock and wipe pan clean. Add remaining stock and cornflour mixture. Heat for 1 minute until sauce thickens. Add beef and bok choy and stir for 1 minute until well coated. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Combine spices in small bowl. Toss together spices and butter until blended. Shuck corn and brush lightly with spiced butter. Place ears on grid over medium-high heat for 15-20 minutes, or until tender and lightly charred, turning occasionally.
Mix all the above ingredients. Use a zip-lock bag. Put chicken in bag. Close bag. Mix up all the above again and squeeze in bag. Leave in fridge for at least 3 hrs. or over night. Grill. YUMMY!

Combine the peas with the cornstarch to form a thick paste, stirring well. Add the flour, baking powder, milk, eggs and halloumi to the mixture, stirring well. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 cm of oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Spoon the mixture into the oil in heaped tablespoons to form patties. Cook for 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towel and keep warm. To make the dressing combine the mint with the mayonnaise and lemon juice in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the fritters drizzled with the dressing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Roll out the dough into a large circle on a floured surface. Spread the light cream cheese on the dough, leaving a small border around the edges. Sprinkle the nonfat sour cream and the minced garlic on top of the cream cheese. Sprinkle the chicken and red onion evenly over the cream cheese layer, and top with mushrooms and tomatoes. Sprinkle mozzarella over the top of the dish, and cover with the parmesan. Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 12 minutes. Cut the pie into wedges and serve hot.

In a large saucepan combine lemon juice, oranges and sugar. Simmer for 5 minutes, until oranges are tender and liquid is reduced to about 1/3 cup. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 day to allow flavors to blend. When ready to serve, strain liquid through cheesecloth or a fine mesh strainer to remove seeds and pulp. Add ice and water to taste and serve over ice cubes garnished with a lemon slice. May substitute fresh juices for bottled juices for a fresher taste.

Remove stems and trim ends of sprouts, then halve them lengthwise. In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat oil until hot. Add garam masala powder and stir to mix well. Add half of the brussels sprouts to skillet and cook until sprouts are barely tender, about 5 minutes. Add remaining brussels sprouts to skillet along with 1/4 cup water. Cook until sprouts are tender but still a little firm, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients together except oil and peppers. Toss with chicken and refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat oil in skillet. Saute chicken 5 minutes per side or until cooked through- but still moist. Sprinkle with black pepper and cayenne. Spoon salsa over each serving and serve immediately. If you prefer, you may instead grill chicken.

Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix together the cumin, chili powder, and seasoning. Rub the seasoning onto the chicken legs, and place them in a baking dish. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear. In the meantime, mix together the ranch dressing and salsa. Drain the grease from the bacon, and chop it into small pieces. Mix the bacon into the dressing mixture. Serve the chicken topped with the dressing mixture. This recipe yields 4 servings.

Spread pumpernickel bread with chambord raspberry liquor. Dot with chocolate. Press raspberries onto bread. Drizzle with cherry juice. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with yoghurt & sugar sprinkled with vanilla.

Prepare the beans according to package directions. In a small bowl mix together the orange rind, cranberries, and honey. Toss together. Add the bacon bits. Serve hot.
I’ll be making the green bean with pepitas and mushrooms with cream.
The mushrooms are in the fridge….
And I have pepitas in my cupboard…..
I’ll let you know how I get on…..
I love green beans so I’m sure I’ll enjoy them!
Thanks for the recipes – I’m going to try the cranberries one. I’ve never made anything with cranberries before.
I’ve always loved green bean casserole, but I never knew that the mushroom soup was not the original recipe. I’ll have to try some of these new recipes. Thanks for sharing them!
The cranberry ones look yum!

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute 3 minutes or until tender. Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in corn and next 4 ingredients. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 12 muffin cups with liners. In a medium bowl, stir together the cake mix, pumpkin puree, egg beaters, agave nectar, cinnamon, salt and water. Using a handheld electric mixer or a whisk, stir for 2 minutes until smooth. Divide the batter among the muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Frost with the canned whipped cream.
Prepare peppers and set aside. Boil vinegar and sugar. Add prepared peppers. Boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cayenne pepper and Certo. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.
Drain and rinse the shrimp. Combine all ingredients and toss. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve as desired.

In small bowl combine cornstarch and 1/2 cup water. In large bowl, combine all ingredients except Cool Whip and cornstarch mixture. Combine cornstarch mixture and pour over mixture in bowlstir to combine. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Top with Cool Whip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9x13 inch baking pan combine the first 5 ingredients. Spread half of the mixture over the bottom of the pan. On each corn tortilla spread a small amount of the half-and-half. Fold in half, then place in the pan. Repeat layering until all of the mixture and the tortillas are used up. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the mixture is bubbly. Sprinkle the tops with the remaining half-and-half and serve. 2 servings.

Grease 4 individual 6-oz ramekins or bowls with margarine or butter. In microwave-safe dish, combine 1/2 cup chocolate chips with 1/2 teaspoon margarinemicrowave on high 1 1/2 minutes. Stir until melted. Place 1 marshmallow in each dish. Drizzle with melted chocolate and spread over marshmallow. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon cereal. Repeat layering. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl toss the shrimp with the soy sauce, honey and lemon juice until well combined. Remove from bowl and set aside. In a small bowl toss the chili and garlic together. Set aside. Heat the wok over medium heat until hot. Add the garlic and chili and saute until the garlic begins to brown. Add the shrimp and toss well. Add the hot chili oil and toss to combine. Cook 2-3 minutes or until the shrimp are done. Stir in the cilantro and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cook sausage according to package directions. Remove sausage from pan and drain. Add onions to sausage drippings. Cook 3-4 minutes. Add milk and eggs. Beat well. Return sausage to pan. Pour into greased 8" pie pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Top with sour cream and cheese. Bake 5 minutes more.

Combine the first four ingredients in a heavy bottomed pot over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Lower the heat to medium low and cook for 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add the vanilla and butter. Beat vigorously with an electric mixer until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease a 9 inch pie plate. Beat egg whites and cream of tarter until soft peaks form. Add sugar gradually while beating until stiff peaks form. Add vanilla and vinegar. Fold in flour. Spread into pie plate. Bake for 35 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool. Prepare pudding with 2 cups milk. Cut cake into 1/4 inch slices. Layer 2 slices cake and 2 Tbs pudding in each of 6 glasses. Top with a few sliced strawberries and a dollop of whipped cream. Drizzle each with red food coloring.

Brown the hamburger in a skillet. Add the minced onions to the skillet and cook until the meat is no longer pink. Add the egg noodles to the skillet and stir in the gravy mix and seasonings to taste. Cook until the noodles are tender. Stir in the margarine or butter and serve immediately.

Drain the apricots and rinse them under cold water. Place them in a small pan and cover with the water. Bring to a boil and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain them and set aside. In a small saucepan, combine the sherry wine, water, and sugar and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the honey and stir until the honey dissolves. Add the apricots and the cranberries and bring the mixture to a boil again. Cook until thickened and the mixture is a saucy consistency, about 15 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and cool the mixture to room temperature. Serve the cranberry-apricot mixture at room temperature or refrigerate until chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mash the bananas. In a large bowl combine the brown sugar, margarine and vanilla essence. Beat well. Beat in the skim milk. Add the egg and beat until smooth. In a small bowl combine the self-rising flours and bicarbonate of soda. Add to the margarine mixture. Stir just until blended. Divide the batter equally among 12 greased muffin cups. Sprinkle each muffin with 1 tablespoon of chopped walnuts. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease a baking dish. Arrange tomatoes in a single layer in the baking dish. Sprinkle with half the salt and pepper. Lay fish on top of tomatoes. Sprinkle with remaining salt and pepper. Top with green onion. Drizzle with olive oil. Top with basil and cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish is cooked through.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook until golden, about 5 minutes. Add gingerroot and cook another minute. Stir in broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until slightly thickened, about 5 more minutes. Add carrots and cook until tender, about 8 more minutes. Season with pepper and serve with peanuts sprinkled on top. Makes 4 servings.

Add yeast to milk and water and let set for 5 minutes or until yeast has risen. Combine flour with salt and 1/2 cup sugar. Add milk mixture and eggs. Knead well for 5 minutes. Add raisins and apple. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead until dough is soft, 10-12 minutes. Shape into a ball and place in a greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead for 1-2 minutes. Divide in half, roll each half into a 12"x14" rectangle. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar. Roll up jellyroll style. Place in a greased 12"x14"x1" pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 350. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

In 9x13 casserole dish, combine baby spinach and broth. Add chicken and 1/4 cup of the Creole seasoning. Cover and marinate 20-30 minutes. Remove chicken from marinade and discard. Drain spinach well. Grease casserole with butter. Spread 1 1/2 cups of the spinach evenly over bottom of casserole. Lay half of the chicken over the spinach. Top with tomato and green onion slices. Spread 1 1/2 cups of the remaining spinach over the top. Layer remaining chicken over the top. Combine remaining Creole seasoning and 1/2 cup water. Spoon over the top of the casserole. Cover and bake 45-50 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Let stand 5 minutes. Remove cover and sprinkle with green onions.

Cook and drain ground beef. Add onions and seasonings and cook until meat is brown. Drain fat. Combine soup and corn. Add meat mixture and stir until combined. Spread into a 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with 1 can cheese and 1 can olives. Top with egg noodles. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining can of cheese. Bake an additional 15 minutes.

Melt butter and saute onion until soft. In a saucepan combine soup, milk and velveeta cheese. Cook over low heat until cheese is melted. Add cooked rice. Mix well. Add cooked broccoli. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes.

In a bowl, mix flour and milk until smooth. In a wok, heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil and stir-fry the cabbage until crisp. Add onions and stir-fry until tender. Add the egg and continue stir-frying until the eggs are firm. Add the flour mixture and stir until the sauce thickens. Add the oysters and stir-fry until heated through. Serve with steamed rice.
In a sauce pan add all ingredients together and boil for about 5 minutes. Cool slightly and serve over chicken.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine dates, brown sugar and vanilla in a small saucepan and cook over low heat until dates are softened. Cool slightly. In a large bowl combine cooled date mixture with eggs, beating well. Stir in walnuts and cherries. In a small bowl combine cereal, coconut and cinnamonstir into cookie mixture. Drop rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheetsbake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat oil in saucepan. Add shallots and saute until soft. Add rice and cook until lightly toasted. Add spices and mix well. Add coconut milk and bring to the boil. Stir in lime leaves. Add lime juice and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat and add lime rind. Serve.
name: basmati rice pilaf with cuminpreparation: In a large pot cook the rice in the vegetable broth with the bay leaf and 1 teaspoon of the salt until almost tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and fluff the rice with a fork. Add the remaining 1/4 cup vegetable broth and let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet over moderately high heat. Add the garlic and cook until it is golden, 2 minutes. Add the chickpeas and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt and cook until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the lemon juice and

Season the chicken breasts with salt. Coat a wok or large saute pan with the oil. Heat over medium-high heat until hot. Add the chicken breasts in a single layer and cook without moving until browned on the bottom. Flip the breasts and sprinkle evenly with the flour. Toss the flour over the chicken, then pour in the vinegar and the chicken broth. Bring the broth to a simmer, cover the pan and cook for about 5 minutes. Uncover the pan and add the lemon curd and the scallions. Stir gently and cook until the sauce thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the hot water. Taste and adjust the seasonings if necessary. Divide the chicken and sauce among individual plates, and serve immediately.

Wash and drain barley. Bring 4 cups of water to boil. Add 1 tsp olive oil and barley. Bring water to boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and add lime juice. Season to taste. Serve warm.

In small saucepan, melt the butter and the cheese over low heat, stirring until melted and well blended. Stir in the flour and salt. Cook over low heat for one minute, stirring constantly, until the mixture is thick and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in the Rice Krispies until well coated. Drop the mixture by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper covered cookie sheets, pressing the mixture flat with the back of the spoon or the bottom of a measuring cup to form rounds about 1/2-inch thick and 2 inches wide. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Remove from the oven and place the pecan halves on top of the rounds. Cool completely on the cookie sheets. Store the rounds at room temperature for up to one week in an airtight container. Makes about 7 dozen rounds.

In a bowl, mix together ground beef and egg. Add chili sauce, salt and pepper. Form into 4 patties. Combine the remaining ingredients and spread over patties. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until no longer pink.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or other favorite dippers.

Layer 1: spread cream cheese. Layer 2: add jalapeno pepper. Layer 3: add chili. Layer 4: add green onions. Layer 5: add green chilies. Layer 6: add cheddar cheese. Layer 7: add remaining green chilies. Bake in 350f oven for 30 minutes.

Cook potatoes in boiling water 20 to 30 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine Italian dressing, paprika, ground red pepper, celery and celery seed, bacon, red peppers and onionblend well. Stir in potatoes. Serve at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the raw peanuts and spices. Stir until the spices are incorporated and the nuts are lightly coated and start to brown slightly. Cook until the nuts are crisp and brown--about 12 minutes, stirring frequently and adding the cherries for the last minute or so of cooking time. Turn off the heat and add the oregano and cayenne. Mix gently and let cool completely before serving. Store the nuts in an airtight container for up to three weeks.

Combine sugar, cornstarch, water and lemon juice in saucepan. Stir until smooth. Cook over low heat until thick. Stir in butter and bananas. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat. Add raisins. Serve over ice cream.

Peel bananas, orange and grapefruit. Cut into bite sized pieces. Slice strawberries and cut grapes in half. In a large bowl combine all fruits with sour cream, honey and orange juice. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and refridgerate.

In a large bowl, beat the butter until light and fluffy. Beat in powdered sugar and vanillagradually add the flour and salt. Cover and chill for 2 hours or overnight. Roll the dough into 1-inch ballsplace on wax paper-lined baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until slightly browned. Cool on wire racks.In a small bowl, microwave the chocolate kisses for 30 seconds on high power, stirring after 15 secondsstir until smooth. Dip the balls in the chocolate. Place the balls on wax paper to set. Yield: about 4 dozen.
These look so easy to make and I love the way they look, I am going to make these for my family.
These sound very interesting. I am not a huge fan of nuts but I am going to make these to give to friends for Christmas.
I love all kinds of chocolate. I am going to make some of these for my family to try out at Christmas.
These look very good. I love nuts and

Beat cream cheese with electric mixture until smooth. Add in sugar and milkbeat until smooth. Fold in cool whip. Spread over bottom crust and refrigerate while you prepare the pudding. For the Pudding combine all pudding ingredients and mix well. Spread over cream cheese mixture. Top with whipped cream and refrigerate before serving. Serve cold.
This is my favorite pumpkin pie recipe of all time. I have been making it since 1971. My mother-in-law gave me the recipe when I got married in 1971. She was a great cook and I still miss her today.
Prepare a deep dish pie crust according to package directions. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Combine the pumpkin puree, condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg in a large bowl. Mix well. Pour into the prepared crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to

Heat oil in pan and cook chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Add onion and garlic and saute until tender. Add the cumin and stir. Add the orange juice, lemon juice and capers and stir well. Return the chicken to the pan and continue cooking for another 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine horseradish, soy sauce and garlic. Brush all over the salmon. Marinate 15 minutes. Grill over medium heat 5 minutes per side. To serve, spread each piece of salmon with a little sour cream mixed with mayonnaise. Garnish with basil and lemon juice.

Brown bacondrain fatadd onion, green peppersaute until tenderadd cooked ricemix lightlyadd tomatoesadd salt, peppersimmer 20 minutes. Serves 6-8.
name: betty crocker 1950s spanish rice ingredients: bacon onion green pepper cooked rice canned tomatoes salt pepper preparation:brown bacon drain fat add onion green pepper saute until tender add cooked rice mix lightly add tomatoes add salt pepper simmer 20 minutes serves 6-8.
name: the lazy cook s spanish rice ingredients: white rice garlic water salsa preparation:combine the rice with the garlic in a large saucepan pour water and salsa into the rice mixture bring the water to a full boil and then reduce the temperature to simmer simmer for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender fluff the rice when finished.
name: restaurant spanish rice ingredients: olive oil butter sweet onion rice water chicken bouillon cube kosher salt enchil

To make the cheese cutouts, heat oven to 400 degrees. Spray or grease a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Place American cheese on cookie sheet and spray again with cooking spray. Top with Swiss cheese and place in oven until melted and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Cut with pizza cutter into squares about 2 inches on each side. Spread butter on one slice of white bread. Top with ham and the American and Swiss cheese cutout squares. Spread remaining butter on second slice and place on top of sandwich. Slice and serve.

In small bowl combine sour cream and cottage cheese. Stir in parsley, Tabasco and lemon juiceset aside. In large bowl, toss carrots with baby spinach. Pour cream mixture over carrotstoss to coat. Sprinkle with almonds. Garnish with tomatoes.

Carefully trim off the bottom 1/4 inch of the stem of the broccolini, so that it is flat. Rinse and dry thoroughly, cut into 3 inch pieces. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the oil and the broccolini and saute until crisp-tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside. Make the balsamic dressing: In a small bowl combine the oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon, garlic, sugar and lemon juice. Season to taste with the pepper and salt. Arrange the broccolini in a serving bowl and drizzle the dressing over the top, toss to coat. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve immediately.

In a small heavy skillet combine butter and shallots over medium heat. Stir occasionally until shallots are golden. Remove from heat. Whisk in beer until smooth and all of the liquid is incorporated. Add vinegar, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce and stir until combined. Add cayenne and salt and pepper to taste. Reserve 1/2 cup of this sauce. Heat remaining sauce in a small saucepan until very hot. Serve over seafood. Garnish each serving with 1 Tbs. of reserved sauce and some fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut the eggplants into thin slices and then coat with marinara sauce. Place on a greased cookie sheet and sprinkle with basil and fat free mozzarella cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, mushrooms, onion, butter, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Transfer the mixture into a greased shallow 3-quart baking dish. Top the filling with the sour cream. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve.

Separate crescent roll triangles. Place about one heaping tablespoon of sauce in center of each triangle. Place a meatball in center of sauce. Fold up triangles to form a neatly wrapped meatball. Place in an ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with additional pasta sauce. Serves 6.

Here you will find a list of delicious recipes for dinner.

Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the peanut oil and heat for 1 minute. Add the bay leaves and cumin seeds and cook for 1 minute. Add the cabbage and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Season with the salt and sugar and cook for another 1 minute. Stir in the coconut and serve at once.

Mix lemon juice with 1 tablespoon olive oil, garlic cloves and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper in small bowl. Thread lamb pieces onto skewers. Place in shallow baking pan. Brush with remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until meat is tender when pierced with fork. Garnish with lemon slices and parsley if desired. Serve with pita bread for dipping. Womans day home cooking around the world.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together the peanut butter, sugar, brown sugar, egg and vanilla until well blended. Beat in the dry ingredients. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from pan to cool.
Peanut Butter Chip Chocolate Cookies was published at April 16, 2015. Hundreds of our reader has already save this stock stock photo to their computer.
