In small dish, blend the salsa, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and the black pepper. Rub the mixture on both sides of each breast half. In large skillet over medium heat, cook the chilies in the oil for about 4 min. Stir in the corn, onions, peppers, beans, and the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Add the chicken. Cover the skillet and simmer for 10 min or until the juices are clear when the center of the thickest portion of the breast is cut. Stir in the sour cream. Serve the chilies over the rice.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch square baking dish. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat until melted, then set aside to cool slightly. Whisk together the eggs, lemon juice, and zest in a large bowl., then add in the granulated sugar, vanilla extract, sea salt, and melted butter, whisking until thoroughly blended. Sift together the cocoa powder, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt into a separate bowl., then stir into the wet mixture until just combined. Spread the batter into the prepared baking dish, then bake for about 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares., then dust the brownies with the powdered sugar.

Combine all spices in small bowl. Cut chicken into 4 pieces. Place in resealable plastic bag and add spices. Turn bag to coat. Let stand 15 minutes. Grill chicken over medium heat 5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Heat tortillas according to package directions. Top each with 1/3 cup chopped olives, 1/2 teaspoon oregano and 1/4 teaspoon parsley. Serve with lime wedges.
Today I made a batch of these tacos and my son asked for more. My son is 10 and he is very picky. He loves them. I made them with regular ground beef and a little taco seasoning.

In small saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in honey and cook until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat. Add frozen baby sweet peas and toss to combine. Garnish with chopped toasted nuts and serve.

Unroll one pie shell. Crimp edges as desired. Spread bottom of shell with onion and cheeses. Top with pizza topping of choice. Beat together milk and eggs in small bowl and pour over pizza mixture. Sprinkle with oregano and garlic powder. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in a pan over medium high heat. Saute squash for 4 minutes. Add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes longer. Stir in jalapeno and tomatoes and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in corn and cook for 3 minutes longer or until heated through. Stir in the chili powder and salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with the cheese.

Mix dry ingredients together first (flour, salt, baking powder). Then mix wet ingredients together (butter, milk, egg, vanilla). Stir dry ingredients into wet ingredients to create a pancake batter consistency. Lastly add the applesauce and stir until all is incorporated. Heat up skillet with a little oil and spoon batter onto it. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Serve with real maple syrup for an extra special breakfast treat.

Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the green beans and cook until tender-crisp, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the broth and set aside. Heat the sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the sesame seeds and cook until toasted, stirring constantly. Pour the sesame oil and toasted sesame seeds over the green beans. Season with the salt and black pepper and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sunflower oil. Add the carrots and leeks. Cook until the carrots are just tender. Add the oranges, ketchup, brown sugar and soy sauce. Cook another minute or two. Add the peanuts and cook for one more minute. Serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In large skillet, brown pork chops in oil. Remove pork from skillet. In same skillet, saute onion and celery in oil until tender. Stir in soup, egg and pepper. Spread over pork chops. Bake, uncovered, for 30-35 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Top with poultry seasoning. Separate the biscuit dough into 4 pieces. Roll out each piece to about 7-8 inches in diameter. Cut each circle into 4 wedges. Place 1 wedge on top of each pork chop. Bake an additional 5-8 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

In a heavy bottomed saucepan saute onion, celery and carrot in olive oil until soft. Add rice and toast lightly stirring frequently. Stir in pecans. Add broths and bring to a boil. Cover tightly and reduce heat to simmer for 25 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Cover again and simmer an additional 5 minutes. Season to taste. Fluff with fork before serving.
I had some wild rice left over from last weekend’s cooking and I wanted to make something a little different. I found a recipe for wild rice with mushrooms at All Recipes. I made a few changes to it. I used long grain brown rice instead of white because I prefer brown rice. I used fresh parsley instead of dried because I had a lot of it left over from a dish I made earlier in the week. I used two different kinds of mushrooms instead of only shiitake. I used pecans instead of almonds because that is what I had on hand. I also used a little bit less of everything. I made it for dinner tonight. The whole family loved it! I

Put flour in mixing bowl. Stir in cinnamon. Add eggs and mix thoroughly. Add milk and stir until smooth. Heat griddle or skillet over medium heat. Add 1/4 cup of batter to skillet. Cook until bubbles appear on top. Turn pancake over. Cook until other side is brown. Serve hot with jam and syrup.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Wash the chicken and pat dry. In the bottom of an 8-inch square or rectangular baking dish combine the potatoes, cherry tomatoes and garlic cloves. Sprinkle the oregano and rosemary evenly over the vegetables. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and arrange the pieces on top of the vegetables. Drizzle with the lemon juice and drizzle with the olive oil. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover the chicken and continue to bake until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender, 20 to 30 minutes more.

In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, parsley and tomatoes. Combine the lemon juice and oil in a jug, pour over the salad. Toss well. Sprinkle with mint. Season with salt and pepper and serve scattered with rocket and sumac.

Rub the pork ribs with the prepared mustard. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Put in a greased pressure cooker. Add the onion to the bottom of the cooker. Cover with the lid. Bring to high pressure. Cook for 1 hour. Serve with potatoes, bread and fresh vegetables.

Cut the zucchini and the green pepper in 1 cm dice. Mince the garlic and the shallots. Heat the oil in a skillet and add the shallots and the garlic. Cook for a minute or two and add the zucchini and the green pepper. Cook for another minute or two. Season with salt and pepper and add the tomatoes. Cover and cook over a low heat for 15 minutes. Stir in the parsley and serve with the parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionssaute for about 4 minutes. Stir in bell peppercook for 4 minutes more. Stir in tomatoescook until mixture is thickened slightly, about 5 minutes more. Make 4 indents in tomato mixturecrack 1 egg into each indentation. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon thyme. Cook without stirring for 5 minutes or until whites are set but yolks are still soft. Serve with bread.

In a bowl combine beef, feta cheese, olives, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Form into 4 patties. Heat oil in skillet and cook patties for 4-5 minutes each side or until done to taste. Top with tzatziki sauce. Serve on pita bread rounds.

To make the crust, combine cracker crumbs with sugar. Melt margarine and add to mixture. Press into 9-inch pie plate and refrigerate for 30 minutes. To make the filling, combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and pour into pie crust. Refrigerate for 1 hour or more.
name: Hawaiian marshmallow dessertingredients: Grahame cracker crumbs, Sugar, Margarine, Mini Marshmallows, Crushed Pineapples, Pineapple Juice, Dream Whippreparation:To make the crust combine crumbs with sugar. Melt margarine and add to mixture. Press into 9-inch pie plate and refrigerate for 30 minutes. To make the filling combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and pour into pie crust. Refrigerate for 1 hour or more.
name: haupia lilikoi pie hawaiian coconut and passion fruit pie

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1/2 cup white wine and waterbring to a boil. Add 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce. Add 1/2 cup chopped parsley and 1 cup sliced clams. Cover skilletcook 3 minutes. Add 1/2 cup chopped clams. Cook 2 minutes more. Transfer to a serving platesprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Place the baked potato chunks into the skillet to brown on all sides. You will need to do this in several batches if your skillet is not large enough to hold all of them at once. Add the onion and bell pepper to the skillet and saute until the vegetables are tender. Stir together the garlic powder, paprika, salt and black pepper. Sprinkle over the potato mixture and serve hot.

Place all the dry ingredients (dates, cocoa powder, salt) in the blender. Add 1/2 cup of the hot water. Blend well. Add the remaining water 1 Tablespoon at a time until it is the consistency of thick soup. Pour into dessert dishes. Chill. To serve, scoop out of the dish with a spoon. Or serve in the dish with the spoon on top.

Combine milk, peanut butter and milk chocolate chips in medium saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in marshmallow creme. Stir in graham cracker crumbs until well blended. Serve with apple slices, strawberries and mini marshmallows. Serve in fondue pot.

Combine dry ingredients. In another bowl combine wet ingredients. Fold into dry ingredients. Add apple and pear. Spray 12 cavities of a nonstick muffin pan with cooking spray. Place batter into cavities. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray. Heat a medium skillet over medium heatadd the oil. Add the mushroomscook until they start to brown. Add the eggscook until they are set on the outside but still moist in the middleabout 2 minutes. Place the eggs in the prepared casserole dish. In a large bowl combine the stuffing mix, mayonnaise, milk, tomatoes, green onion and cheese. Spread the mixture over the eggs. Bake for about 25 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with more green onion if desired.

Preheat oven to 425. Wash and scrub potatoes. Cut into wedges. Toss with oil and spread onto baking sheet. Roast for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool. In a large saucepan, combine the sweet potatoes and 2 cups of milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook for 20-25 minutes or until tender. Drain liquid from potatoes and return to saucepan. Mash with a potato masher. Add brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla. Continue to mash until smooth. Add butter and cream and continue to mash until smooth. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream on top.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Wash the peppers. Cut the top off each one. Remove the seeds and membranes. Cut the peppers into strips. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic. Saute until the onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add the bay leaves. Add the peppers. Saute for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes with the juices. Stir gently. Add the salt and pepper. Lower the heat to medium. Cover the skillet. Cook for 30 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Serve warm.

Peel potatoes. Cut them into a large dice. Boil them in a large pot of water until tender. Drain potatoes. Set aside to cool. Cut the eggs in half lengthwise. Scoop out the yolks. Place in a mixing bowl. Add the potato cubes. Add the sour cream, lemon juice, red onion, dill, mustard and smoked salmon. Mash together well with a fork or potato masher. Season with more lemon juice or salmon as desired. Spoon the filling back into the egg white halves. Garnish with a dollop of caviar.

Heat oil in a kadai. Add chicken and saute well. Add yogurt and mix well. Add ginger paste, garlic paste and tomato puree. Mix well. Add red chili powder and black pepper powder. Mix well. Add water as required and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add a pinch of salt. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. combine crumbs and potato starch and set aside. beat eggs and sugar together until pale yellow and thick. beat in orange juice, zest of orange and lemon and beat well. stir in walnuts and fold in dry ingredients. place in greased tube pan and bake for 1 hour or until done. let cool for about 10 minutes.

Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Cut the bread slices in half lengthwise with a sharp knife. Spread butter onto the cut side of the bread. Place the slices open-side down onto a baking sheet. Arrange the turkey slices evenly over the slices of bread, dividing it evenly among the slices. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon shredded cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted. Serve warm.

Wash wild rice. Add 3 cups water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer until tender. Drain. Stir in butter. Toss together until well coated. Spread in a 9x13 inch dish. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Combine remaining 1/2 cup water with mushrooms, onions, cheese and tomatoes. Spread over rice. Bake for 10 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets. Cream together margarine and brown sugar in a large bowl. Add the peanut butter and honey. Beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Add the rice flour, quinoa, baking soda and salt. Stir well. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Peel the shrimp and cut them in half lengthwise. Set aside. In a skillet melt the butter over medium-low heat. Stir in the oregano and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the lemon juice and the cream and bring to a boil. Add the shrimp and the green onions. Cook until the shrimp are opaque and firm. In a small saucepan combine the feta and milk over medium heat and melt the feta cheese while stirring. Pour the mixture over the shrimp and cook for one minute. Remove from the heat and transfer to a serving plate.

Sweat onions in a heavy saucepan with a bit of water until they are soft. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add remaining water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add butter. When melted, stir in heavy cream. Add cilantro at end. Serve with bread.
Cut chicken breasts into small pieces. Mix together the chicken, catalina dressing, and bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve on a bed of lettuce with the cheese and green onions on top.

Prepare the dressing: In a blender combine the poppy seeds, sugar, vinegar, oil and salt. Blend until smooth, about 15 seconds. Add the strawberries and blend until they are evenly coated with the dressing, about 10 seconds more. In a large serving bowl combine the spinach, strawberries and almonds. Pour the dressing over the top and toss gently to coat evenly. Serves 6.

Combine brown sugar, white sugar and shortening. Add flour, graham flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Mix to form dough. Chill for 30 minutes. Roll into a log and slice into 1/4 inch slices. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool on rack and store in air tight container.

In a medium sized bowl, combine the condensed milk and lemon juice. Beat well until mixed well. Mixture should thicken. Add cool whip, pecans and pineapple. Fold mixture together. Pour into pie shells. Top with maraschino cherries before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange the wings in a single layer on a shallow baking pan. Place the pan in the oven and cook for 40 minutes. In a small bowl whisk together the salad dressing, mustard and Worcestershire. Turn the wings once during cooking and baste with the mixture. Baste and turn the wings every 10 minutes. When the wings are done remove them from the oven and baste again. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breast halves in a 9x13x2-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine crushed pineapple, brown sugar and lime juice. Pour over the chicken. Sprinkle evenly with the mustard and soy sauce. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink inside.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add garlic cloves and saute 30 seconds. Add green bell pepper and saute 2 minutes. Add sausage and saute until browned. Add chicken and saute 1-2 minutes. Add diced tomatoes. Sprinkle with seasoning and celery salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Cut the chicken into small bite sized pieces. Place the pieces in the bowl and coat well. Place onto skewers. Heat the grill to medium high. Grill the skewers for about 8 minutes per side until the chicken is fully cooked. Serve with extra lemon wedges.
You can also check out some of our other recipes like Chicken Kababs and Chicken Kababs.
Chicken Kabob recipes are some of my favorite easy dinners. The simple addition of spices and sauces can make a simple grilled meal into an exotic dinner!
There are so many different versions of the classic recipe. The most popular recipe is made with chicken, but it can also be made with beef, shrimp or even veggies.
Chicken Kabob Recipe With Breadcrumbs is a delicious and healthy dish that can be served as a main course or as a side dish.
This recipe is very simple to make and requires only a few ingredients. It takes about 20 minutes to cook and can be made ahead of

Combine frying chickens, chicken broth, kahlua, red wine vinegar, heinz ketchup, soy sauce and corn starch in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 5 hours. Meanwhile, combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl and set aside. After 5 hours, remove the cooked chickens and place in a bowl. Add the remaining mixture and toss to coat. Serve over rice.

Peel and mash the bananas with the egg in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the buttermilk and olive oil and set aside. Sift together the self-raising and plain flours with the baking powder and cinnamon and set aside in another bowl. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix together until well combined. Add the mashed banana and mix again. Spoon the mixture into a well-greased loaf tin and level out the mixture so that the sides are even. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 160C (320F) for about one hour. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the tin then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Spread the jam over the top of the cooled bread and serve with butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat an 8x11 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Combine the milk, brown sugar and margarine in a large saucepan. Stir in the oats and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and becomes creamy. Remove from heat and stir in the apples. Spread the mixture in the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle the walnuts and the cranberries over the top. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Place the unpeeled potatoes in a saucepan of cold waterbring to a boil and cook until tender, 20-25 minutes. Drain wellreturn to the saucepan and mash until smooth. Stir in the cream, butter and roasted garlic cloves and season generously with the salt and pepper. Transfer the mash to a serving dishsprinkle evenly with the lavender flowers and drizzle with the oil. Makes 4 servings.

In a large pot, add butter and flour and make a roux. Add milk and stir until well combined. Add chicken broth and season with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and add chicken and green chili peppers. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add more seasonings if necessary and serve immediately.

Mix together the lean ground beef, onion soup mix, egg and cracker crumbs. Shape into meatballs and brown in a skillet with a little olive oil. Place meatballs into slow cooker. Mix together the last 4 ingredients and pour over meatballs. Cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Serve with crackers and/or celery.

Mix flour and muesli. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and honey. Blend in dry ingredients. Stir in sultana and oats. Drop onto greased baking tray. Flatten slightly with a fork. Bake at 350f for 12-15 minutes.

Combine first three ingredients in small bowl and set aside. In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth and spreadable. Place a layer of the ham slices on a plate or platter and spread with a thin layer of the mayonnaise mixture. Top with a layer of the cheese mixture, then a layer of the mustard mixture and so on until all the ingredients have been used. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve immediately with rye bread or crackers.

Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Grease 13x9x2 pan and pour half of the batter in the bottom of the pan. Set aside the remaining batter. Chop the rhubarb up and combine with the sugar and heavy cream until mixture resembles a sauce. Pour the rhubarb mixture over the prepared cake batter and top with remaining batter. Bake as directed on box. Serves 12.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Cream the margarine, sugars and vanilla until well mixed. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Combine the dry ingredients and beat into the creamed mixture until well blended. Stir in the pudding. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls about two inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until browned. Cool for a few minutes before removing to a wire rack. Makes about 48 small cookies.

melt butter in panadd onions and mushroomssaute until tenderadd noodles and cook 2-3 minutesadd tomatoes and basilpour in watercover and simmer about 10 minutes or until noodles are tenderadd parmesan cheeseserve with croutons and more cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt vegan margarine in a saucepan. Stir in brown sugar until melted. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Add milk and cook about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the natural-style pb. Stir until smooth. Add the vanilla extract and pour mixture into a 9x13 pan. Sprinkle icing sugar on top. Let cool and cut into squares. To make this gluten free, use your favorite gf flour blend in place of the all purpose flour in the crust.
These are delicious, quick to make, and you can customize them to your preferences!
My daughter, who has been diagnosed with celiac disease since last summer, has been eating these all week. She loves them! They are very yummy. Thank you!
I was very excited to find this recipe as a GF option for my niece who is celiac. She absolutely loved these. I made them twice in one week. I used my own homemade granola for the base. I also used a mix of 1/4 cup

Cook asparagus in boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain. Cut into small pieces. Cook onion in butter until tender. Add ham and cook until heated through. Stir in drained asparagus. In a bowl beat together milk and eggs. Add swiss cheese, baking mix, vegetables flakes, and pepper. Pour over ham mixture. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes.

Place chicken in a ziplock bag with the seasoning. Seal and refrigerate for 1 hour. In a non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove from skillet and crumble. Remove chicken from bag and cook 4-5 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Layer each bottom bun with bacon, chicken and cheese. Top with lettuce and tomato. Add a pickle slice if desired and top with other half of bun.

Heat the oven to 350f degrees. Cut the squash in halves with the stem side down and the flat side up. Remove the seeds with a spoon or spoonfuls of water, then place the halves face up on a baking sheet. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until the flesh is tender when pierced with a sharp knife. Remove the squash from the oven and allow to cool enough to handle. Scoop the flesh from the squash and place it in a large bowl. Add the butter and the water and mash with a potato masher until smooth. Add the syrup, salt, and pepper to taste and mix well. The puree can be frozen for later use. Thaw before using.
Cut the stem end off of the winter squash with a sharp knife. Holding the knife at a slight angle to the fruit, make a cut along the side about an inch below the stem end. Continue cutting down the sides of the winter squash with the knife at a slight angle until the squash can be separated into two halves. Remove the seeds from the center
Combine first four ingredients in a bowl until well-blended. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. When ready to serve, stir in salsa. Serve with tortilla chips.

Add the lentils to a saucepan with the cold water and the bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Add the onion, carrot, mushroom, potato and stock cube. Continue to cook until the potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the corned beef in a saucepan with just enough boiling water to cover. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain the corned beef. Stir the corned beef into the lentil mixture. Simmer for another 10 minutes.

Put cream cheese and milk in blender jar. Blend. Cut cherry peppers in half and remove seeds. Cut jalapenos in half and remove seeds. Add to blender jar. Blend and serve with favorite crackers. Use as a sandwich spread or as a topping for grilled meats.

In a large saucepan combine the chicken broth, apple juice concentrate, apple sauce, carrots and granny smith apples. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and cook 40 minutes or until apples are tender. Stir in nutmeg. Blend 1/2 of the mixture until smooth in a blender or food processor, then return to the pan along with the evaporated milk. Heat through, then serve warm in bowls topped with sour cream or yogurt.

Combine Rice Krispies cereal in large bowl. Set aside. In large saucepan over low heat stir together marshmallows and canola oil. Cook over low heat until marshmallows are melted, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in Rice Krispies cereal. Stir until well coated. Add peanut butter and mix well. Add miniature semisweet chocolate chips and mix well. Press mixture into an 8-inch square pan. Cool completely. Cut into 24 squares. Melt Chocolate-covered English toffee bars according to package directions. Dip squares into toffee. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate until toffee is set. Store in airtight container.
Cook the turkey with water and seasoning until it is cooked. Make gravy and add mushroom pieces.

Slice baguette in half. Top with radishes and goat cheese. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Cut in half.
Name: Goats Cheese Melts Ingredients: Crusty bread rolls Oil Chutney Goat cheese Fresh thyme Preparation: Heat oven to 190C. Take each roll and hollow out a space just big enough for the goats cheese. Brush the insides with the oil and bake for 5 mins until crispy. Spoon the chutney into the rolls and place the cheese on top. Depending on the cheese you use you may have to remove the top and bottom rind. Decorate each roll with a sprig of thyme and cover to roll in foil leaving the cheese exposed. Cook for 15 mins removing the foil for the last 5.
Name: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese and Walnuts Ingredients: Beets Fresh basil Ground black pepper Vinaigrette dressing Mixed baby greens Walnuts Semi-soft goat cheese Preparation: D

Place raspberries in blender. Add cornstarch, granulated sugar, water, lemon juice, and blend until smooth. Pour into a glass dish. Add strawberries. Sprinkle with slivered almonds. Chill until set. Serve with whipped cream.

Heat oven to 400f. Cut potatoes into 1 inch pieces. Melt margarine in large skillet over medium heat, add onion and saute until tender. Add hash browns and half-and-halfmix well and heat through, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cheeses until meltedadd bacon bits and stir well. Pour mixture into ungreased shallow baking dish and bake uncovered for 20 minutes.

Place the cauliflowers into the bottom of the container and fill with the water and the salt. Leave undisturbed for at least 3 hours and up to overnight. Strain off the water and rinse the vegetables. In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar and mustard seeds and bring to the boil. Add the celery seed and hot pepper and return to the boil. Pour over the vegetables and leave overnight in the refrigerator. The next day strain off the liquid and serve as you would pickled onions. This can be used as a garnish for stews or other dishes or just as a snack.

Pour 2 cups of milk into a medium bowl. Add pudding mix. Beat with an electric mixer 1 minute. Spread mixture evenly into crust. Beat cream cheese, equal substitute, and remaining 1 tablespoon of milk with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in frozen topping on low speed. Spread over chocolate mixture. Sprinkle with candy bar pieces. Cover with dome. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Slice each slice of bread in half horizontally. Spread bottom sides of two halves of each slice with butter. Top each with 1 slice of turkey, 2 slices of ham and 1 slice of provolone cheese. Top with top half of slice. In a small bowl combine remaining 2 slices of turkey, 2 slices of provolone and remaining 2 slices of ham. Divide into 4 equal portions. Place each portion on bottom side of each sandwich. Top with remaining halves of each slice of bread. In a small bowl beat 2 eggs. Spread one side of each sandwich with 1 tablespoon of jam. Brush the jam side of each sandwich with some of the egg. Cook on each side until golden brown and cheese is melted. Cut into 4 wedges. Makes 4 sandwiches.
Mix together in a crock pot. Cook on low for about an hour or until warm. Serve with tortilla chips or bread.

Melt margarine in a heavy 3-quart pan over low heat. Add sugar, gradually blending until smooth. Boil over medium heat to soft ball stage about 6 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add milk & vanilla. Stir until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips & nuts until melted & blended. Pour into pan & chill for several hours.
Combine jam and lime juice. Add vegetable oil and stir to combine. Add garlic and spices, stirring to combine. Serve over salad or on sandwiches.

Cook chicken in broth until done. Cut into bite sized pieces and let cool. Combine mayonnaise and sour cream until blended. Add remaining ingredients and toss well. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over romaine lettuce leaves.

Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl and set aside. In a mixer cream together the butter and egg yolks until smooth. Stir in the vanilla and almond extracts. Alternate the flour mixture and the water with the batter, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour or until a tester inserted into the middle comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 15 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the tapioca flour, eggs, and butter until light and creamy. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the dough to firm up. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface into 12x12 inch square. Cut the dough into 4 squares. Add the cheese to the center of each square. Fold the dough over to form a triangle shape, then pinch the ends together to seal the dough. Place the rolls on a greased baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until lightly browned on top and bottom. Makes 4 rolls.
I made the Quinoa with Spinach and Feta Cheese recipe today and it was wonderful! It is very easy to make and was great for lunch. I would recommend it to anyone who likes this kind of food!

Blend fresh orange juice and lime juice. Add fresh cilantro and minced garlic. Add red snapper fillets and allow marinade at least 1 hour in refrigerator. When ready to cook, brush fish with marinade and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Bake in a preheated 425 f oven for about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve on bed of rice.

In a large bowl combine 1 cup unbleached all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup sugar, 2 tsp baking powder and 1/2 tsp salt. Mix well. In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup of milk with 1 tbsp vanilla extract and 1 egg. Add this wet mixture into the dry mixture and combine well. In a small bowl combine 2 cups of milk with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 cup of cold butter. Incorporate this mixture into the dry mixture and combine well. Divide the dough into 20 equal portions. Form each portion into an oval and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes until the dough is set. In a small bowl combine 1 cup of milk with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 cup of cold butter. Incorporate this mixture into the dry mixture and combine well. In the last 5 minutes of baking pour the sauce over the dumplings. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first six ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in oats. Spread on two large baking sheets. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until lightly golden. Cool. Add raisins. Store in airtight container.

Cut avocados in half and remove seeds. Scoop flesh into large mixing bowl. Add lime, salt, cumin and cayenne. Mash with fork or potato masher until desired consistency. Stir in onions and tomatoes. Fold in cilantro.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds stirring constantly until lightly browned. Add the beans and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring constantly until crisp-tender. Add the wine and cook until evaporated stirring occasionally. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Serve immediately.

In a 4 quart crock pot combine cream of celery soup, chicken gravy, brown gravy mix, lipton onion soup mix, ranch dressing mix and water. Cut boneless pork roast into 1 inch cubes and place in the liquid. Cook on low for 8 to 12 hours. Cook the mushrooms until they are tender in a little butter or margarine. Remove the mushrooms from the pan and set aside to cool slightly. Chop the mushrooms to the desired size. In a small bowl combine the chopped mushrooms and flour. In a small pan brown the chopped mushrooms in the flour mixture. Stir in the liquid from the mushrooms to make a gravy consistency. Serve the meat over mashed potatoes or rice. Pour the gravy over the meat.
In large bowl combine the frozen green beans and the olive oil. Toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle the vegetable mixture with the garlic and cilantro. Serve at room temperature.

Split the bagels lengthwise. Layer with ham, tomatoes, and onions. Top with mozzarella cheese. Broil just until the cheese is melted. Sprinkle with basil before serving.
I've been trying to get my kids to eat more breakfast in the mornings, so I've been looking for more easy things that we can all eat together. I've been making them sandwiches for lunches sometimes so I thought I would try doing it for breakfast too.
This is one of my favorite things to eat for lunch, so why not for breakfast? I really like the idea of doing it with cream cheese too.
I love the idea of being able to get the whole family to eat together by having quick and easy things to eat for breakfast too!
These all look so great. I love how you used the avocado and sun-dried tomatoes together.
I am going to have to try these out asap!
I love the idea of quick & easy things for the kids to eat for breakfast! I'm going to have to try these!
I love the idea of making the kids something

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut green chilies into 1/2-inch thick rounds and set aside. Heat 1/2 tablespoon of oil in a heavy skillet over medium high heat. Cook sausage until browned and crumbled. Remove sausage from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. In same pan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour and cook until brown and bubbly, about 1 minute. Stir milk into pan. Stir constantly until thickened and bubbly and cheese is melted. Remove from heat and stir in eggs and green chilies until well mixed. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Lay out 8 biscuits and cut into quarters. Arrange over egg mixture to cover completely. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and sausage. Bake uncovered until biscuit topping is golden brown and center is set, about 30 minutes. Serve hot with hot salsa.

Add mint leaves and tea bags to a heat-proof bowl or pitcher and pour over the boiling water. Allow to steep for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool for at least five minutes. Remove the tea bags and add the lemon juice and apple juice. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Chill for one hour before serving. Garnish with lemon slices and fresh mint sprigs if desired.
The mint leaves are very good for digestion. The spicy mint tea is my favorite one of these recipes. I would like to try the ice tea because it is very refreshing and healthy as well.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the green beans. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain the beans and place into a large bowl. In a small bowl combine the grainy mustard with the balsamic vinegar. Whisk in the fine sea salt until dissolved. Add the extra virgin olive oil. Whisk to emulsify. Pour over the green beans. Add the hazelnuts, flax seed oil and hazelnut oil. Toss to combine. Add the red onion. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Cut beef into 2-inch cubes. Place all cubes into a 5-qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle with preserves. Stir in next 5 ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or until meat is tender. Serve on kaiser rolls.
In small bowl, combine 1/2 cup horseradish, mustard and cheesespread on tortilla. Top with spinach and roast beef. Roll up and secure with toothpicks. Serve with spinach salad.

Put the lemongrass stalk in the teapot and then pour in the hot water. Add the gingerroot slices. Cover the teapot and let it steep for 10 minutes. Pour the lemongrass-gingerroot brew through a strainer and then pour the brew back into the teapot. Add the herbal tea bags. Cover the teapot again and steep for another 10 minutes. Remove the tea bags from the teapot and discard them. Add the honey and lemon slices to the teapot. Stir well and serve.

Heat butter in large pot over medium heat. Add onions and cook 10 minutes or until they are soft and beginning to brown. Add squash to the pot and cook until just tender. Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer 15 minutes or until squash is very soft. Using an immersion blender or food processor blend until smooth. Stir in the spinach. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with green onions. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the olives and peppercorns in a large glass bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and toss gently. Cover and let marinate at room temperature for at least 1 hour and up to 3 days. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
In a large skillet brown the onion and tuna in 2 tablespoons of oil. Add the spaghetti and the rest of the oil. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add the sauce and the olives. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender, drain, add the sliced onion to the potatoes and toss together. Salt & Pepper the potatoes & onions. Put the potatoes & onions in a 9x13 baking dish. Brown the pork chops. Place the pork chops over the potatoes & onions. In a bowl combine the soup, milk & cheese. Pour over the top of the potatoes & pork chops. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

In a medium bowl, combine the oats, flour, brown sugar, and salt. Add the butter and toss until well coated. Add the apples and toss again until evenly coated. On a lightly greased cookie sheet, place the mixture in 6 equal portions and pat into 6-inch circles about 1/2-inch thick. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown on the bottom and set. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream or frozen yogurt.

In a small bowl mix together cream cheese and dill pickle slices. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Cut each tortilla into 3 long strips. Spoon cream cheese mixture onto each strip. Roll up like a jellyroll, sealing the edges. Place seam side down in a greased 9-in square pan. Bake 15 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting into slices. Yield: 8 servings.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar, then salt and vanilla. Fold in chocolate wafer crumbs and pecans. Spread into 9-inch pie plate. Chill 4 hours or overnight. Spread topping over the top of the pie and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. In a large bowl cream butter and vanilla until light and smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the mashed banana and buttermilk. Add the dry ingredients alternately with the buttermilk in three additions beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Pour into two greased loaf pans or a bundt pan and bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until done. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes then turn out onto wire racks and cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

Cook rice and sausage together in large nonstick skillet on medium heat 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in salsa and 1/4 cup water, and simmer 3 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat, and pour into 13x9x2-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Beat together eggs and sour creampour over rice mixture, and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes more or until set.
Boil water with butter, sugar and vanilla until butter melts. Add nutella and stir until melted. Add salt to taste. Serve over ice cream or cake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Stir in basil, oregano, ricotta cheese, tomatoes, onion, and mushrooms. Pour mixture into baking dash. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Broil for 1 minute. Cut into squares. Serve warm.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned, about 30 seconds. Add the noodles and toss to coat. Cook until the noodles are lightly browned and crispy on the edges. Remove from heat. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the butter. Pour the mixture into a large bowl and season with the garlic powder and chicken bouillon powder. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and toss again.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel, core and thinly slice apples. In a bowl, combine apples with granulated sugar, passionfruit pulp, and 2 teaspoons vanilla. Toss gently to combine. Transfer to a greased baking dish. In a small bowl, combine butter with remaining vanilla. In a separate bowl, combine biscuit crumbs with melted butter mixture. Spread mixture evenly over apples. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 35-45 minutes or until apples are tender. Top with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place potato slices in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes. Add onion slices to pan. Bake for an additional 30 minutes. Serve.

Place hash browns in slow-cooker and sprinkle with water. Add ham, onions and peppers and sprinkle with water. Beat eggs with milk and salt and pepper and pour over all. Cover and cook for 4 hours. Serve with toast and fruit.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large skillet, cook the chicken and the vegetables in the oil until the chicken is no longer pink. Stir in the egg substitute and milk. Heat until the egg mixture begins to set. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheese and onion. Bake for 15 minutes or until center is set. Serve warm.

Mix milk with honey and lemon rind and add the cinnamon and a pinch of salt. Beat the eggs and brush the bread with the egg mixture. Place in a pan with the vegetable oil and fry for a few minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towel and sprinkle with cinnamon and lemon juice and drizzle with the clear honey and a sprig of rosemary.

In a medium sized sauce pan melt margarine over low heat. Add flour and stir until smooth. Slowly stir in chicken broth. Let come to a boil and stir in milk. Add the lump crabmeat and heat through. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

In a 2 quart saucepan bring chicken broth to boiling. Add couscous and cook over low heat about 10 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Stir occasionally. In a small skillet sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add the soy sauce, ginger and lemon juice. When couscous is done, fold it into the mixture. Sprinkle with parsley flakes. Serve hot.

Mix together sugar and butter until smooth. Add evaporated milk, then pumpkin. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until it reaches soft ball stage (234 degrees F. on a candy thermometer). Remove from heat, add spices, stirring constantly until blended. Add marshmallow creme and vanilla extract. Stir until well mixed. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips. Beat until well mixed. Pour into buttered pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

Place roast in a large casserole dish. Mix up the other ingredients and pour over the roast. Bake for about 2 hours at 275 degrees. I like to shred the roast after it cooks for about 15 minutes. Then i use it in tacos.

Slice the top off the tomatoes leaving the bottoms intact. Scoop out the seeds and pulp from the inside. Place the onions in a blender or food processor. Pulse until onions are finely chopped but not pureed. In a large bowl combine the onions, tuna, cream cheese, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Stir until well blended. Spoon the mixture into the tomato shells.

In medium bowl, combine the fat-free refried beans and ranch style beansspoon onto center of tortilla chips. Sprinkle evenly with sharp cheddar cheese. Microwave uncovered on high 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Spoon light sour cream evenly over the top. Garnish with pickled jalapeno peppers, if desired. Serve warm.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Crack 2 eggs into the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Cover, cook until the white is set but the yolk is still runny (about 3 minutes), then turn the egg over with a spatula. Cook until the egg is cooked through (another 1 to 2 minutes). Repeat for remaining 2 eggs. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil in the same skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add chile and garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Break bread into small pieces (croutons) and add to skillet along with vinegar and water (if using). Cook until bread is toasted (about 2 minutes). Top toast with fried egg and crouton toppings. Sprinkle with cumin, coriander, and sea salt.
The first egg is believed to have been laid in 2018 by Sally, who has been at The British International School of Budapest since 201

Sift flour, baking powder and salt into a mixing bowl. Add milk and mix till smooth and combined. Bring 4 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar to a boil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium low and stir in lemon zest. Add peaches and blueberries and continue stirring occasionally for about 12 minutes. Divide batter into 12 mounds and place over peaches and blueberries in pan. Cover and cook about 10 minutes until golden brown and set in center. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.
The dumpling is a traditional food in many cultures around the world. They are usually made from potatoes or some kind of flour, and they can be fried or boiled. Dumplings can be made in many different shapes and sizes, and they can be filled with various things like meat, cheese, or vegetables. They are usually served as an appetizer or as a side dish.
dumpling is a type of food that is made from a variety of different ingredients. The most common ingredient is flour,

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Remove all but 1 Tbs. fat from pan. Add onion. Cook, stirring frequently, until soft. Add broth. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Add potatoes. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 15 min. or until tender. Add half-and-half. Heat until hot. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in frozen whole kernel corn. Heat until hot. Sprinkle with bacon. Serve with butter.

Sprinkle roast with salt and pepper. Add to crockpot. Add water and stir to combine. Cover and cook on high for 4-5 hours or on low for 8-9 hours. Add carrots and potatoes halfway through cooking. Stir in cream of mushroom soup, worcestershire sauce and basil. Cover and continue cooking for another hour or two.

Mix lemonade drink mix and pudding mix together in a medium bowl. Whisk together skim milk and lemonade drink mix. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Meanwhile, combine fresh lemon rind and lemon juice in a small bowl. Gently stir together lemon rind and lemon juice with cool whip. Fold in lemonade pudding mix and chill for one hour. Pour lemonade mixture into graham cracker crust and chill overnight. Garnish with lemon rind and cool whip mixture.

Add all ingredients to the pan according to the order in the manufacturers directions. Set crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. When the baking cycle ends, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing.

In a small bowl, combine ground beef with garlic powder and ginger powder. Divide into 36 balls. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute bell peppers in oil until soft and juices evaporate. Add meatballs and stir-fry until no longer pink. Add Catalina dressing and soy sauce. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in apricot jam and red pepper flakes. Serve over hot rice.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil and cook the haricots verts until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Drain well and place on paper towels to drain further. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until softened and translucent. Add the haricots verts, tossing to coat evenly with the oil. Add the vinegar and salt to taste, and toss again to combine. Divide the haricots verts among four plates, garnish with parsley and crumbled bacon, and drizzle with additional vinaigrette if desired.

In a small bowl combine cream cheese and 1/2 cup of the milk until smooth. Stir in the bacon and the parmesan cheese until blended. In a large bowl combine the onion and remaining 1 1/2 cups milk. Stir in the fresh parsley. Unroll the crescent dough onto a lightly floured surfaceseperate each triangle into 2 long strips. Place 1/4 cup of the filling along the 5-inch side of 1 striptop with another strip. Press edges together to seal. Repeat for remaining dough strips. Cut each triangle in half on the diagonal to make 4 triangles per strip. Place the triangles 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 13 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook livers in the hot skillet until browned on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a platekeep warm. Add onions and cook until golden and tender, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes with their juices. Cook until slightly thickened. Add green peas. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the livers to the skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the basil. Spoon over linguine or your favorite pasta. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell peppers. Cook and stir until onion is tender. Add garlic. Cook 2 more minutes. Add tomatoes. Cover skillet. Simmer 10 minutes. Add scallops. Cover skillet. Cook until scallops are opaque in the center. Stir in oregano. Serve over hot cooked pasta. Toss. Top with parmesan cheese.

Rub rim of chilled cocktail glass with lemon peel. Dip into salt to coat rim. Place blue cheese and green olive in cocktail shaker. Add gin and dry vermouth. Fill with ice and shake well for 30 seconds. Strain into glass and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan. Mix together the graham cracker crumbs, cocoa powder and 2 tablespoons of the granulated sugar in a medium bowl. Stir in the melted butter and milk until crumbs are moistened. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom and sides of each muffin cup. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes or until firm. Cool on a wire rack. Beat together the fat free cream cheese, remaining 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, cocoa powder and vanilla until smooth. Beat in the sweetened condensed milk. Beat in the eggs one at a time until smooth. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spoon the filling into the muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until set. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Remove from the pan. Garnish with whipped topping and a raspberry or strawberry.

Place the water in a small saucepan over medium heat, add the cinnamon sticks and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and steep for 5 minutes, then remove cinnamon sticks with a slotted spoon and discard. In a large bowl, whisk the corn until smooth, then add the coconut milk and 1 cup water, then whisk again. Whisk in the cinnamon, sugar, and vanilla, then season with salt to taste. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1-quart baking dish. Pour the pudding into the dish, sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup water, then cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove foil and bake for another 10 minutes, until set. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream.

Place milk in a saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add cream and white sugarwhisk until smooth. Remove from heat. Add white chocolate and stir until smoothreturn to heat for 3 minutes. Remove from heatstir in vanilla and brandy. Pour into mugssprinkle with cinnamon.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil along with the pork. Cook until browned on both sides. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil to the skillet. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the apple, maple syrup, vinegar, mustard and water. Cook until the mixture is reduced by half and thickened. Return the pork to the pan. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the lid, sprinkle the pork with the parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Toss vegetables in a large bowl. Drizzle with 1 Tablespoon of olive oil. Season to taste with sea salt. Add a few turns of fresh ground pepper. Lay out vegetables in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle bay leaves evenly over vegetables. Place garlic cloves evenly over vegetables. Drizzle with remaining 2 Tablespoons olive oil. Roast uncovered for 1 hour. Stirring once or twice to turn vegetables. Remove from oven. Sprinkle rosemary evenly over vegetables. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes. Serves 6.

Combine the quinoa with the water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 12 to 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Transfer the quinoa to a large bowl. Add the apple, raisins, cinnamon and vanilla. Mix well. Divide evenly among 4 serving bowls. Top each serving with 1/2 cup yogurt. Add the almonds to each serving. Serves 4.
Brown beef. Add seasoning mixes. Add water. Simmer. Stir in tomato sauce. Add pasta. Stir until pasta is done. Add cheese. Sprinkle with sour cream. Serves 6 to 8.

In a bowl combine all the dry ingredients and mix well. In a mixing bowl, beat the banana and peanut butter with the egg until creamy. Beat in the sugars and melted syrup. Add the dry mixture and beat on low speed just until combined. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill for at least 1 hour. Pre heat the oven to 180c / 360f / gas mark 4. Scoop out the dough with a teaspoon onto baking trays lined with parchment paper, leaving enough space between the cookies for them to spread. Bake in the centre of the oven for about 10 minutes until the bottoms are golden brown. Cool on the tray for a few minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Place frozen hash browns in a crock pot or slow cooker and add enough milk for them to float in the bottom of the pot. Cook on high for 1 hour. Drain potatoes and set aside. Cook and crumble bacon and drain fat off bacon drippings. Chop onion and bell peppers into the drippings and saute for 5 minutes. Remove from pot and set aside. Beat 6 eggs with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Spray the bottom of a 10 inch pie pan with cooking spray and pour in the egg mixture. Sprinkle the cooked potatoes on top of the egg mixture and top with the sauteed onion and bell peppers and crumbled bacon. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and bake in a 350 degree preheated oven until the egg mixture is set and the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Serve with toast and salsa or sour cream if desired.

To make the dressing, combine all the dressing ingredients except the chili pepper and blend well. Pour the dressing over the chicken and toss well to coat. Refrigerate the salad for a few hours so the flavors have time to mingle.

In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil over medium heat. Cook the beef until it is browned on all sides. Remove from the skillet. In a medium bowl whisk together the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil, the soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, sesame oil, cornstarch, and the garlic. Pour the mixture into the skillet. Stir until it comes to a boil. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add the beef. Cook until the beef is heated through. Stir in the broccoli. Cook until the broccoli is heated through. Stir in the green onions. Cook for 1 minute longer. Serve the beef mixture over rice.

Wash grapefruit. Cut off top and bottom and remove white pith. Cut grapefruit into 4 wedges. Broil on a cookie sheet about 3 minutes on each side, basting with butter and sprinkling with sugar and cinnamon. Garnish with a cherry.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter with the shallots. Cook until golden brown. Stir in the cream. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until reduced to about 3/4 cup. Stir in the basil. Season with the lemon juice, vinegar, Tabasco, salt and pepper. Cut the zucchini into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place in a saucepan, cover with water and bring to a boil. Simmer just until tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain. Slice the tomatoes into 1/4-inch thick slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. To serve, arrange the tomatoes on a serving platter. Top with the zucchini. Spoon the sauce over all. Serves 4.

Combine rind and white pepper. Cut a slit in each fish and insert a slice of ham and a slice of swiss cheese. Beat egg with margarine and a little all-purpose flour. Pour over fish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven about 20 minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Boil the beets in water for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain the beets in a colander and immediately place into a bowl of ice water. Cut the beets in half lengthwise and scrape out the seeds with a spoon. Cut the beets into 1/2 inch pieces.In a medium bowl, whisk together the cider vinegar, tarragon vinegar, and 1/4 cup of water until smooth. Season with the salt and pepper.Drain the beets again and place into the bowl of the seasoned vinegar. Toss to coat with the seasoned vinegar, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight.In a bowl, combine the flour with the salt and pepper. In another bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice, and 1/4 cup of the water until smooth. Drain the beets again and add them to the flour mixture. Toss in the flour to coat the beets, then add

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Combine beef with 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon black peppercook until no longer pink. Drain beef mixtureadd to macaroni and mix well. Pour into a 13 x 9 baking dishtop with remaining 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, pepperoni, sauce and cheesebake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Serves 8.

Lightly brush crust with oil. Spread celery on bottom of crust. Layer with chicken. Top with blue cheese dressing. Bake for 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees or until crust is golden. Remove from oven. Top with celery, cheddar cheese. Slice.

Bring 4 quarts of water to boil. Add 1/2 tsp of salt. Add chicken broth and tomatoes. Return to boil. Add garbanzo beans, artichoke hearts and garlic. Bring to boil. Cook covered for 2 minutes. Add basil and oregano. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

In large mixing bowl combine skim milk, granulated sugar and heavy cream. Beat until mixture is smooth. Add pure vanilla extract and beat until well combined. In a separate bowl, combine cake mix and water. Stir well. Add into the skim milk mixture. Mix well. Fold in sprinkles. Pour into a 9x5-inch freezer container. Freeze 4-5 hours. Makes 1 1/2 quarts.

In a large bowl combine Bisquick, eggs and milk. Stir until smooth. Fold in oil and chocolate chips. Spoon into greased or paper-lined 12 regular-size muffin cups. Bake at 400f for 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Serve warm or cool.

In a small saute pan over medium-low heat, combine the butter and garlic and saute until the garlic is golden brown. Add the orzo pasta to the pan. Stir to coat. Pour in the boiling water and return to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the half-and-half and parmesan cheese to the pan. Stir to combine. Add the shrimp to the pan. Cover the pan and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes or until the orzo pasta is tender and the shrimp are cooked. Stir in the fresh basil. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 10-inch tube pan or bundt pan with shortening or cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the cake mix and the poppyseeds. Stir in the water and milk until smooth. In a medium bowl, beat the sugar and egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg white mixture into the batter until smooth. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 20 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar just before serving.

In a large mixing bowl whisk together milk, margarine and egg until creamy and smooth. Mix in cheese and flour. Heat large non stick skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture. Cook until scrambled and firm. Break up into large pieces and transfer to a serving platter. Serve topped with salsa. Wrap flour tortilla around the scrambled egg and salsa and serve.

Trim fennel bulbs leaving some fronds intact. Cut into quarters lengthwise. Trim apple. Remove core and slice. Cut onion into thin wedges. Toss fennel with apple and onion in a large bowl. In a small jar with a tight fitting lid combine lemon juice, 2 teaspoons of the fennel fronds and the sugar and shake well. Pour dressing over apple mixture. Toss well. Sprinkle with remaining fennel fronds and top with corn. Makes 6 servings.
Spread the pumpernickel bread with the softened butter. Spread the cream cheese onto the bread. Top with the cucumbers and smoked salmon. Cut into triangles.

Fry noodles in butter till crisp and brown. Add sour cream and mix well. Sprinkle with pepper.
Bring 2 cups of water to boil in a large saucepan. Add noodles and vegetables. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain. Meanwhile, heat oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook and stir until done, about 8 minutes. Stir in noodles, vegetables, stir-fry sauce and packet of seasoning. Mix well and heat through.
Beat together eggs, water, 2 teaspoons salt, dill weed and pepper. Add enough flour to make stiff dough. Roll dough thin on floured board. Let dry until not sticky to the touch. Cut into thin strips. Add oil and 1 teaspoon of salt to boiling water. Add noodles and cook until tender. Drain thoroughly. Serve immediately.
Boil chicken until tender. Drain a little of the water off. Add noodles and cook til tender. Add can of cream

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add raisins and cook until raisins begin to plump up. Add the onions. Cook, stirring constantly until golden brown. Add the capers, dill and seasonings. Add the hot sauce. Simmer 5 minutes. Brush both sides of the baguette with the oil. Grill over medium heat until golden brown. Spread the raisin mixture evenly over the top. Top with the shrimp. Return to the broiler. Broil for 2 to 3 minutes until the shrimp are warm. Serve immediately.

Cut the french bread into 1/2-inch thick slices and brush with melted butter on both sides of each slice. Combine the garlic and the grated cheese in a small bowl and spread on one side of each slice of bread. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 350 f for 5 to 7 minutes or until the bread is toasted. Serve immediately.

Melt pepper and onions in oil in a skillet. Cook hot dogs until they are done. Place a few pieces of pepper and onions over the hot dog. Place in the bun with the hot dog and a slice of cheese whiz. Enjoy.

Melt margarine in saucepan, add flour. Gradually add skim milk, stirring until smooth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in ham and onion. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until bubbly and potatoes are tender. Stir in potatoes, cheddar cheese and pepper. Bake uncovered for 10 more minutes or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown.
I am an avid fan of the recipes that have been shared on this site for a long time now. I really appreciate the time that has been taken to share this information with all of us. I will continue to visit this site for more great recipes.
I have tried this one several times now and I just love it. The best part about it is that it is very easy to make. I used to make it at home but I now make it at work for my co-workers and they all love it as well.
I love this recipe! It’s easy to make and very

Cook pasta in boiling water for 7 minutes or until tenderdrain. In a large bowl combine vinegar, oil and sugarstir well. Cool to room temperature. Combine with remaining ingredients except pasta and mayonnaisemix well. Add pastatoss well. Cover and chill overnighttoss before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake dough according to package directions for 15 to 18 minutes until edges are golden brown. In medium bowl, beat all remaining ingredients except 1/3 cup powdered sugar until blended. Spread mixture over warm cookie dough. Bake 5 minutes more until set. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons powdered sugar. Cool 15 minutes. Cut into 2-inch squares

Brush one side of each flatbread with olive oil. Place them on a baking sheet. Combine rosemary with bell peppers, cherry tomatoes and orange zest. Toss with olive oil. Broil in oven until peppers are tender. Combine rosemary with bell peppers, cherry tomatoes and orange zest. Toss with olive oil. Broil in oven until peppers are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan. Cut each flatbread into 4 triangles. Top with rosemary mixture.

To prepare the marinade, combine parsley, garlic cloves, shallot, italian seasoning, rosemary, dijon mustard, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper in a bowl. Pour marinade over chicken breasts in a large bowl. Refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours turning occasionally. Remove the chicken from marinade. Discard the marinade. Place the marinated chicken breasts on a broiler pan. Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat for 4 to 6 minutes on each side until the meat is no longer pink. Serve with fresh vegetables.

Into mixing bowl sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add buttermilk and shorteningmix until well blended. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Roll out with lightly floured rolling pin into rectangle about 1/4 inch thick and 12 inches long by 15 inches wide. Place on greased baking sheetbrush with milk and sprinkle with coarse salt and/or sugar and bake at 425 degrees for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Cut into squares and serve hot from the oven.

In a large bowl mix the yellow corn meal and flour. In another bowl mix the sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the wet mixture and the oil to the dry mixture and mix well. Add the milk and sour cream and mix until smooth. Pour into a greased 8-inch square pan and bake at 425 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes and cut into squares. Serve with honey or syrup.

Preheat oven to 350. In medium mixing bowl, combine ground beef, stuffing mix, water and egg. Mix well. Place into greased mini muffin tray. Bake 15-20 minutes. In small bowl, combine barbecue sauce and cheese. Spoon 1-2 tsp over meatloaves. Bake another 5 minutes. Let set 10 minutes before removing.

Heat the condensed milk on low heat for 5 minutes until warm. Add the semi-sweet and milk chocolate. Stir until melted. Add the butter and stir until melted. Add the walnuts and stir until combined. Pour into a greased tin and allow to cool. When cooled cut into squares. Store in the refrigerator.
Dear Frugal, This is the best cake I have ever had. I have tried this recipe twice and it is perfect both times. It tastes like a rich, thick, dark chocolate cake. I am going to try it again with nuts and without. I am sure it will be just as good.
Hi Frugal, I made this cake yesterday for a potluck. I used 1 cup of black beans instead of 1 can of pumpkin. I also used 1 cup of whole wheat flour instead of half whole wheat flour and half white flour. I also used 3/4 cup of brown sugar instead of 3/4 cup of sugar. I also added a teaspoon of cinnamon. I also used

Lay a skinless chicken breast in a skillet & coat lightly w/ olive oil. Add 1 crushed & 1 minced garlic clove, a few flakes of dried crushed chili pepper flakes, & 1/2 tsp. of dried oregano. Sprinkle lightly w/ water & add a splash of lemon juice. Season w/ salt & pepper to taste. Cook until done. Serves 1.

Remove rind from peaches and cut them into bite-sized pieces. Stir together the preserves, ginger and lime peel in a medium bowl and set aside. Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high or preheat a broiler. Grill the peaches until they are well marked and softened. (About 5 minutes per side) Set aside and keep warm. Place the ham steaks on the hot surface of the grill and cook until they are browned and heated through. Remove the ham and brush the surface of the steaks with the mustard. Grill until lightly browned and then brush the glaze evenly over the top of each ham slice. Grill for another minute and serve immediately.

Cut the salmon into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place the slices in a glass baking dish or on the grill. Whisk together the orange juice, ginger, green onion, teriyaki sauce and lime juice. Pour over the fish and sprinkle with the garlic. Bake in the preheated oven or cook on the grill for 10 minutes.

In a small pot combine the water, dark brown sugar, heavy cream, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool. Serve warm or refrigerate. Will last for up to 1 week in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl, combine the flour, cream cheese, baking powder, salt and sugarmix well. Add milkbeat with a mixer on low to medium speed until well mixed (dough will be stiff).Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash potatoes. Cut lengthwise into 3/4-inch pieces. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatadd potatoes in 1 layercook 3-5 minutes until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Season with sea salt to taste. Transfer to 12 muffin tins. Top with 1 teaspoon sour cream and 1 tablespoon blue cheese crumblessprinkle with fresh chives. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve hot.
